review: We visited Athens and stayed 3 nights. We were a party of 2 adults and 3 children. We received 2 lovely large connected rooms. The beds were huge and comfy. The bathroom was beautiful. The hotel seems new and has a modern styling. Everything went well and the staff were very warm, welcoming and helpful. The hotel is located on a main street and there were many coffee shops and bakeries in the area. Across the road there is even a cinema. The hotel is located about a 15-20 minute walk to the Acropolis. We enjoyed our stay a lot and will recommend it to others.
title: Lovely hotel

review: We booked this hotel on short notice as it came up first on hotels.com. We thought it would be close to town and we could walk to the main attractions as we only had a short stay in Athens. This was not the case and it was very complicated to get anywhere without a taxi, and most of the drivers do not understand English. The hotel is situated near a ´red-light´ district so that should be taken into consideration. Very difficult to cross the road as it is a four lane highway out the front with a fence in the midway. The hotel is very new but very badly designed and finished off. Very small lifts to take you to the rooms, so it takes two trips if you have a lot of luggage. We ordered some food from the restaurant and bought it up to the room. Unfortunately my food had an eye lash in it. Generally the staff was very friendly, though check in did take some time which I do not really appreciate. The hotel finishes and location, lets it down. I would not recommend or stay here again.
title: New but disappointing...

review: The hotel is brand new but it looks like it was adapted from a business building and they missed some details. The staff was very friendly but I believe they need more experience. The Wi-Fi was free and good but a bit annoying to setup every time you return to the room. I found the location OK. Just a few minutes walk to some busy areas with restaurants and bars, and near business and metro stations.
title: Brand new, still lacks experience

review: Just recently visited city and I stayed here for 5N with my mom and my two kids for my 50th birthday and I was amazed with this hotel it's great service. As soon as we walked in the hotel, we were welcomed by the staff who were super polite and friendly. They took really good care of us and were really proactive. The interior decor is top quality with well furnished marble floors. My daughters absolutely loved the place and My mum was glad how the beds were set up granted here age she was happy with the comfy bed and how spacious the rooms were.The location is decent and local shops are easy to access. Good cafes just around the corner. wish I stayed
title: Brand spanking new!

review: This was definitely not Grand! Looks nice on the outside but very dirty on the inside. This has to be the worst service I have received in Greece. Breakfast was the worst and even when I've stayed in cheaper hotels the breakfast was better. Cutlery and cups were also dirty. Got abused by the night manager that stunk and needed discinfectant and a bath. The managers didn't care as he is so busy anyway. Avoid this place!
title: Worst place in Athens!

review: We had the displeasure of staying at his hot...er... "place" you could call it while on a transfer from Athens to Beirut. We had to walk up several flights of stairs and wake the reception guy up so he could check us in. He checked us in topless which wasn't in our early expectations of the place. The room was cheap and big. However the next day we discovered several cockroaches were on the ground beside us when we woke up. We had a fan to help air the room but to be honest we were happy to leave the room at any chance we got. We were planning to stay there again on our return transfer back to Dublin but we cancelled and booked another "place" which was a lot better. Avoid if you can unless you are happy sharing with uninvited cockroaches. Otherwise you'll love it!
title: Terrible - With a Side of Uninvited Guests!

review: Just like the title, the hotel is horrible, nothing of hotel would be much more a pension. Dirty sheets and torn, floor full of hair, employee who does not speak English, inserted in street also very dirty.
title: Horrible

review: Was shocked at the state of the hotel compared to photos on site. All furnishings are run down and broken, elevator scary and not worth the wait, was happy to climb the stairs. There's no bed spreads, just one thin sheet and a paper thin mattress, with a one inch pillow. Toilet disgusting, hasn't seen bleach in what looks like years! Shower basin too small for my partner to fit in, water goes everywhere. We where VERY rudely informed to pay an extra 3€ per night for air conditioning (which is so loud it sounds like a helicopter landing all night long) the cafe is permanently closed, no fridge or toiletries, no phone or kettle or ANY ammenities whatsoever in room. When I politely asked if there was a share fridge to put drinks (because it's stinking hot) was rudely told no. I couldn't sleep due to the noise outside, very unsavoury area, lots of homeless people and beggars outside all night long. It's also right next door to a betting venue, for more noise. In our room there are bed bugs and our view is of a burnt out building next door. Under no circumstances stay here!
title: Warning!!! Falsely advertised!!!

review: The hotel building looks very nice from outside but not comfortable from inside.The floor (parket) inside the rooms need to be changed every step you make has a different sound.The bathrooms are very small, Their is no air conditioning in the corrdidors, it was like a sawna when you walk to reach your room.Very old elevators, it takes to much time until you catch one.We used too use the stairs instead of waiting for the elevators.Very rude receptionists.
title: This is not a five star hotel for sure.

review: Welcoming staff, good location, pool was a very nice addition since it was 44 degrees in July 2017. Rooms a bit tired but otherwise all good.There are few good restaurants near by and lovely shopping street. Breakfast was superb.Will return again.
title: Quick visit

review: I had the pleasure of staying here for a weekend at the beginning of July. The hotel staff were very helpful, great breakfast, amazing bar, decor, clean and fully stocked rooms with everything you can possibly need for a great time. The swimming pool and gym area is out of this world. The hotel location is in a beautiful setting with close by bars, quality shops and a 10 min walk to the metro. I’m looking forward to going back and staying at this hotel. Luxury doesn’t even begin to describe how wonderful it is to stay here.
title: Great Hotel, Excellent service

review: Perfect location for business area in the telecom industry but so far away from business world class standards to host important guest for meeting room, high standard gourmet meals and on. The "palace" is not so clean and quite for business travelers that regular to 5* hotels.
title: Low value for money

review: Beautifully located building with restaurants, shops and a park close by. The rooms remind me of old Italian hotels in Bologna or Parma: rooms are spacious, airco works well but furniture is somewhat old-fashioned. Breakfast is basic and smiles are hard to come by.
title: Could be better with a smile

hotelLocation: 75 King's George Avenue (Poseidonos Av., Glyfada, Athens 166 74, Greece
review: Rooms are old and barely clean, but guess what this is no the problem. I am a very frequent traveler and I have never seen such an impolite staff. I mean all staff from housekeeper till hotel owner manager are way above rude except one guy in the reception. They think they are managing a prison. They shout at guests and lifeguard scare kids. I was booking for 12 nights, but I had to leave on the back of a fight with Super Rude hotel owner. I thought it was better to cancel the vacation and not to live with the stress of a bad room managed by impolite people. BTW, pictures on the rooms on website have nothing to do with reality. Take my word, avoid at all cost.
title: Avoid At All Cost

hotelLocation: 75 King's George Avenue (Poseidonos Av., Glyfada, Athens 166 74, Greece
review: Hotel is very clean I booked in the third floor and room was up to the standard it worth every penny paid for , staff is the Is very helpful from reservation ,reception waiters and housekeeping breakfast was good and pool bar very professional , towels and bed sheet are very clean , free beach towel available also
title: 1 week vacation

hotelLocation: 75 King's George Avenue (Poseidonos Av., Glyfada, Athens 166 74, Greece
review: The hotel was reasonable, the rooms on higher floors have a nice view on the sea. The rooms were shabby but properly cleaned. The breakfast was not wow. A small hotel located at walking distance from Glyfada center.
title: Reasonable for the price with an a view

review: First of all I would not rate this as four star, especially as the pool was closed for alll of our 5 night stay. Hotel is situated overlooking the sea with beautiful view if you can overlook the busy road which separates hotel from beach. Rooms and breakfast were fine and the staff extremely helpful, especially Alexandra on the front desk. The best thing about this hotel is if you use it to stay pre-cruise. It took us just under an hour to get from our room, taxi ride, check in and into our stateroom on board. Maybe we just st had a good run but would definitely recommend it to other cruisers.
title: Tropical Hotel

review: Hotel is in nice neighborhood, clean rooms and comfort beds but rooms are not that specious. Very near to beach club but the noise from that club could keep you up late. Break fast is poor. Staff are mostly friendly. Wifi is okay. For the value it's pretty average place.
title: Average

review: First the positives...very clean hotel and beautifully furnished.Nice reception staff.After that it goes down hill.The worst quality breakfast we have had in an hotel and we travel alot.We only went in there twice during our 7 day stay and the best we could manage was some melon, a toasted croissant with a cup of lukewarm coffee.Grey boiled eggs,some strange mix of egg and tomato that looked terrible,what was described as peach compote was tinned fruit cocktail with a very funny colour .all supervised by the most unfriendly and rude waitress..her attitude was shocking..i could go on and on.our rooms were on the side of a very noisy gentlemans club ."pool"only has 2 sunbeds and when we went at 3 o'clock it was closed off. rooms and balcony very small.definitely WOULD NOT recommend. Glyfada much nicer down the road..try the Palmyra Hotel
title: WOULD NOT RECOMMEND

review: Booked this based on the beautiful Best Western we used in London - nothing like it - don't trust brand name! Terrible area - didn't feel save. Old shabby hotel, no help with luggage up to room. Smallest bathroom I've ever experienced! Only thing that was okay, was the breakfast. Won't be back there!
title: Very Disappointed!

review: I booked six weeks ahead. Made sure that I communicate our needs by email (twin beds - two single) and good view, non smoking room.I arrived late in the evening checked in but was shocked with the room: so smelly, double bed, no view. the street was so dirty. With the same price rate you can rent better rooms in the same area (omonia square) such as Chic Hotel, Dorian Inn Hotel.
title: Reality has nothing to do with the photos

review: The hotel and its staff were fine. The room was clean and bed comfortable. The bathroom was tiny but clean as were the towels. The soundproofing is not the best and the lift isa bit slow. The view from the room revealed a wall of another building. It was fine as it was the cheapest room. There is breakfast available for 6 euros, which I did not use. The reason why I gave 3 stars is the area. It seemed really dodgy and I was afraid to come back too late. There were people sleeping on the streets, drug users around and I did not feel comfortable walking alone. I don't think I will stay again - just because of the area.
title: The area is dodgy

review: My mother and I chose this hotel for the end of our Athens trip due to the price. The hotel itself was fine. Very courteous and helpful staff. Moderately comfortable mattresses, clean room. The room was very much "no frills" with tile floor throughout and a miniature bathroom. This being said....The location of this hotel is in a VERY UNSAFE block of town. It is fairly close to a main street, but I would never walk down those streets in the night and was uncomfortable in the day. The closest underground metro station (Omonia) is the most dangerous in Athens. We didn't know this about the area - talking to many locals (in restaurants and Uber drivers) confirmed how unsafe this area is. If this hotel were transplanted to a safer street it would be the perfect basic, affordable hotel, however based on the location we DO NOT RECOMMEND.
title: Won't be back

hotelLocation: 39 Posidonos Ave. & Kalamakiou, Alimos, Athens 174 55, Greece
review: This is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at! From entering the lobby the first thing that hots you is the horrific smell. The entire hotel smells like sewage and mold. If you have the "fortune" to be in a room with an ocean view you will not be able to sleep because of the noise from the street below. We had to by earplugs to be able to get at least a bit of sleep. It is very dirty in the rooms. The last day the cleaning lady didn't bother to enter out room. In order to take a shower you have to enter the bathroom without inhaling thought the nose. The toilet seat was broken.For the price of 70€ a night we didn't want you go into the hotel. If there were any free rooms anywhere else we would have changed the hotel but unfortunately in July everything in Athens is booked.
title: Horrible hotel! Never ever stay there!

hotelLocation: 39 Posidonos Ave. & Kalamakiou, Alimos, Athens 174 55, Greece
review: No real selection at breakfast, just scrambled eggs, sausages(looked like they were from a can), fried bread and cereals. The coffee was terrible, juice was concentrate. More effort should be put into the breakfast. All night cars beeping their horns(aggressively). hear them clearly with all windows closed. I requested a quiet room.Nice view from the breakfast room.
title: Very Basic for this price,

review: Location was kind of bad. The area around the hotel was not good, a lot of homeless people, guys taking drugs. I didn't feel safe. Metro was near by. Room was bit noisy. In the shower you got only super hot water when it was hot outside and super cold when it was bit cold outside. So it was inpossible to take shower. Service was good.
title: Bad location

review: The Odeon is a small, but nice hotel. My room was small, but clean. The hotel has a good buffet breakfast (included) and a reasonably priced bar on the ground floor. I stayed for 2 nights. My room was very quiet - except for a 1:00 am fire alarm, which was evidently a false alarm and only stayed on for a minute or so. Despite the fact that the neighborhood is festooned with graffiti, I never felt uncomfortable on the streets. The hotel is close to Omonia Square, a short walk from excellent dining and the ancient agora of Athens, and a medium walk to the Archeological Museum. Staff is friendly and rates are reasonable.
title: Nice Hotel, Interesting Neighborhood

review: Hotel was cheap and it showed in the breakfast, a 10 minute walk from metro station.However, when arriving at the hotel at about 10pm we were told to not leave the hotel at all due to "scary black men". Not what you want to hear so would recommend staying in a nicer area of Athens.
title: Don't leave the hotel at night!

review: Stayed overnight in this wee hotel in Athens. Is in the Omonia area of Athens. Convenient for the subway, and a short walk to the famous Omonia Square. One part was a bit shady, but the rest of the area was fine. Like any huge city- just be sensible. Don't be out and about late at night. Perfectly fine during the day .The hotel itself was brilliant value. We had a room and breakfast for €30. Okay- breakfast was a bit Spartan, (continental) , but was ok.The rooms are painted in weird colours, but are lovely and clean, and the bathroom is tiny but really well thought out, with everything you need. We loved the quirkiness of this little place. You couldn't stay more than a couple of days there, I think, or the lack of space might get to you. But brilliant for an overnight.Really liked this wee place, and the reception staff were just lovely.Don't expect beautiful views from your room- it's in the middle of Athens, and not very pretty- but within walking distance to the Acropolis etc.
title: Basic, quirky, clean, and cheerful.

review: The highlight of this place was to stay on the top floor and when we looked out of the window we saw the Acropolis. Fantastic experience. I loved the location as it was very near the centre. The price was reasonable. I would pay more attention to the quality of breakfast if I were them.
title: great location

review: Thank you very much for accommodating us and for providing my baby a place to sleep! Very nice staff, unique hotel with beautiful decor, good food and very clean! ❤️With love from America and fellow Greeks from Ellada,Panawiota Stavros (baby) StavrosChristina And Dimitrios
title: Very nice!

review: Staff speak good English and Spanish. They are nice. There´s a lift in case you are on the 7th+ floor. A/C in the room (set up for 19C always but that´s good). Cleaning every day (such a helpful and caring cleaning lady) Good value for money. It´s perfect for backpackers and travelers on budget. We felt comfortable and safe. Good breakfast (without fruits). Quiet hotel. Omonia is said to be dangerous, but it´s not. It looks less cared for but there are some amazing cafés and pastry shops.
title: Value for money

review: basic rooms , poor bathroom , poor air conditioning , very nice terrace , very nice and helpful staff , very good breakfast , not very well located, but as conclusion for a city break is ok , try to get rooms with balcony
title: basic hotel , with very nice view of the Aropolis

review: The guy that runs reception at night is incredibly rude for no reason. The rooms are pokey, and the bathrooms tiny. The WiFi does not work, at all. They told me you can't connect if too many people try to access it at one time, but there's a separate router on each floor servicing about 5 rooms each, so that's nonsense.
title: Rude

review: Great place, helpful and friendly staff especially at the reception. The lady at the rooftop bar was amazing and helpful and you could clearly see she enjoyed her job. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Pool was small. Recommend this especially for the young travellers as the rooftop was buzzing till early morning.Great variety for breakfast. Would definitely recommend to travellers and especially young travellers who would like to meet other young travellers from around the world. Thank you for our comfortable stay.
title: Great especially for young travellers

review: Stayed here many times and was more than happy, until latest stay. Made a friendly advice to staff that the toaster didn't work and was asked 'so'. Standards are slipping. I will stay elsewhere. There a many hotels in this price range with good srvice.
title: Time to find another hotel in Athens

review: I would not choose this hotel if you are traveling for leisure. It is a great student traveler hub. When we arrived there where hundreds of high school students staying there. The location was great, a few blocks from the subway.
title: School tour-served its purpose

review: Stayed for 3 nights. Seems to be the hub for young travellers. Not a great part of town but easy access to metro. Lovedddd the rooftop bar and the bar lady was amazing and really passionate about her job and country. The pool was freezing but the view was incredible! Breakfast wasn't too bad. Staff were friendly despite limited English. Enjoyed our stay and interactions.
title: Amazing rooftop but not great part of town

review: The staff were extremely warm and friendly.The room was pleasant and clean and was also cleaned daily.The free continental breakfast was simple but filling.The hotel is located just off of omonia square which seems to attract a rough and seedy element.I wouldnt recommend going out late at night. There are plenty of eateries located near by which served nice food thats also cheap. The metro is located two minutes away with easy access to the acropolis and other sites.
title: Very nice hotel

review: Booked this place on HostelWorld so I was expecting it too be more like a hostel than a hotel. There was so social area to get to meet people and half the time my room was empty. The shower was really temperamental temperature wise and the water ended up flooding the bathroom floor. The light is so dim you practically have to shower in the dark. Two bunks crammed into the tiniest room and the wifi didn't work at the very top floor which was where I was. Also didn't feel safe walking through the square and outside the hotel. There were so many men just lurking around cat calling me, I felt very uncomfortable.
title: Not a fan

review: Well...The rooms are superb and the air con is awesome for Athens' Hot and Dry Summer...also the staff in reception is very helpful...but all these became a distant memory very soon after I've entered my room...I only stopped for 4 hours to get some rest from a long ferry journey, as i was catching a flight to Holland and within 20 minutes of settling into my room,the lady cleaner did her best (and all sorts) to keep me (and am sure other hotel guests) awake...!Don't know where to start from...but here as some of the noise some events that I've heard from outside my room: Vacuuming next to my room and above me,Buckets loads of water being dropped for mopping,cleaning cupboards being opened up and closed at least 20 times...The lift (which is not the quietest to put it mildly) must have been used for the cleaner at least 20--25 times going up and down...Plastic Bags being shuffled ,dropped/closed...Doors opening and closing for several times,toilet seats being rigorously hit against the toilet base,..cleaning objects being dropped without care who sleeps in the Hotel...Iam sure I was not the only one that was kept awake...Its only a small hotel for Gods Sake with probably around 10-12 so why the F....! all this noise in the middle of the night...Will the Queen of Sheba arrive by any chance....I want a FULL REFUND and an APOLOGY for the inconvenience caused!
title: Noise from Cleaning was for 3-4 hours constantly during the night,so AVOID!

review: Felt very comfortable and the staff are perfect. Thank you all for a great stay. Walking distance to most destinations. Friendly encounters at almost every location. Neighborhood looks scary but is quite nice around Lycabettus. Efcaristo!
title: Wonderful experience

review: We stayed for 4 nights and had a wonderful stay. Serge at reception was very friendly and gave us useful information. The room had a jacuzzi, however the "bubbles" didn't work but it was still romantic. We had the choice to get breakfast at the room or downstairs sharing a table with other guests. We did both options. We also had free WiFi and TV10 to 15 min walk to the station, but the area felt quite safe at all times. Not suitable for kids I would say, mainly as this is more suitable for couples on a romantic break. We didn't hear any dodgy sounds from other rooms!
title: Romantic rooms

review: After traveling around for 10 days, this was very comfortable stay! I slept very well and the rooms were very nice and clean! They have a great breakfast buffet even though it was very crowed. It's few blocks walk to and from the metro, but content location. I was very happy with my stay.
title: Comfortable Stay

review: Breakfast ok however too many guests, which meant that we had to eat it in a conference room on plastic foldable chairs since no tables were available. Pool and rooftop is nice allthough small and over crowded. Restaurant overpriced. The staff in the restaurant and by the pool were the most rude I have ever encountered (apart from a man called Dimitrios that was very service minded). Not interested to take orders, when instead walking to the bar to order I was told to sit down and wait for a colleague (that never came). The last day we were asked to pay 40 € to use the pool since we were not allowed to be in the hotel after our 12 o'clock check out, even though we arrived late and planned to leave late. The hotel in general needs an update and the room was old and smelled like mold.
title: Worst service

review: The hotel was very nice and the staff were helpful and courteous. The rooftop was amazing and spectacular views. The hotel was a little far from the sightseeing places but we took taxi's and were very cheap. The only thing I did not like is that they don't have wifi in the rooms only in designated areas of the hotel which was annoying.
title: Great Place

review: Upon booking at the President Hotel for 5 nights a few months back, I was unaware of the mixed reviews previously posted. After 10 days of island hopping my girlfriend and I were looking for a comfortable room with all the amenities.Our first impression at the front desk was a good one as we were greeted by a friendly receptionist. The lobby mirrored the pictures we had seen online. We made our way to our room and were happy with the size and layout, albeit without a double bed (there were two single beds pushed together.) Okay, no biggie. Breakfast is served until 1030 and on our first morning we were somewhat late and filtered through to a banquet room where there was ample spread. The next morning we were in the main breakfast area where there was a noticeable difference of selection and quantity of food and drinks.We later made our way up to the pool bar where again we were impressed with the facilities and bar. Such as all Greek restaurants, service was slow and we embraced the holiday mentality. It was only the following morning at the pool where we were met with sun-craving guests jostling for a sun bed. Fortunately we were able to secure one while others were left disappointed and frustrated having to sit on the floor.Although comfortable in the rooms, it is not quite 4 star quality. This is not due to not trying but rather assuming that there has been no further investment in renovation and updating.I would stay at the hotel again.
title: An honest and objective review

review: We picked this hotel over another Athens hotel because it had dedicated parking and a pool. We arrive and my husband goes to park only to be informed a car is too big and we are not allowed to park there. I was not happy. However, the front doorman came to the rescue and found us parking garage. He was so nice and had great customer service skills and was the only good thing about our stay.We got up to our rooms (needed to book 2 because of our big family) to find 2 twins bed pushed together in each room. Not the best, but it worked. The furniture is dated, the TVs are ancient, smells like smoke and there is no shower door or curtain. It is just a half glass wall so water goes everywhere. To top it off, they charge 12 euro a day for internet access in the room, and that is only for 2 devices. Probably the worst thing about this hotel is the pool area. They have a beautiful rooftop pool with a bar. However, it is a very small pool area. It is lined with chairs and people sunbathing on the ground, so you can hardly walk around the pool. We arrived at the first day at 18:30, knowing it closes at 19:00. With 3 kids in tow, the lifeguard proceeded to get an attitude and tell me that there are no more towels and we only have 30 mins to swim, so we should come back tomorrow. Well my kids were in their swimsuits at the pool, so there was no way I was not going to let them swim. We swam, had a nice time and my husband brought up our own towels. The next day we came up earlier in the day, found a spot on the ground and went swimming. After about 20 minutes the same lifeguard from the previous day came over and told me my 8 year old is a bad swimmer. I told her he is still learning, and she said she knows these things and he is bad. She came over another 10 minutes later and threw a flotation device at him and said he must wear it. He threw a fit because he did not want to wear it and he could stand fine in the shallow end (Plus my husband and I were right next to him in the pool). The lifeguard then proceeded to speak Greek to another guest and talk about my son and how we should not be letting him swim. Little did she know that my husband can speak Greek and heard every word. We immediately left and my husband went to talk to the manager about her behavior. The manager seemed to take our concerns seriously and encouraged us to go back to the pool, but I did not feel comfortable going back there with her there. Besides with the mob of people lining the pool sunbathing, we felt like the kids needed to be quiet and not be splashing around. It is a very odd setup.Overall, do not stay here, especially with kids!
title: Wished we chose another hotel...

review: I stayed in that appartment because my company sent me there.Location is good because you can take metro M3 and reach city centre and acopoli in less then 15 minutes with 1,40€ for ticket. Employees very kindly and can give give good informations. Internet connection good and air conditioning good.The bad thing is the barely accettable condition of fornitures, carpets, wallpaper, ceiling, kitchen, curtains... The staff do its best to keep at least clean the room but I cannot understand fornitures 30 years old. Price for the room space is good, but I prefer having one fourth of the space in a room of this century.
title: You must have a very good reason to choose it

review: Good basic hotel, smallish room but enough room for my luggage and with an ensuite. Air-conditioning worked well which was needed as the days peaked at 37degC.Location is very good with a short walk to the main attractions including metro station when arriving from the airport.
title: Good basic hotel, central location, reasonable price

review: Everipidou street is located very close to Monastiraki square. The room has all the essencials (including air conditioner!) witch is the more important quality in an Athens's hostel room in the Summer.For what we paid the room was very good and I would rent it again and recomend it to someone else who's planning an affordable central stay in Athens.Reception is very nice and they even carried our bags to our room at 3 a.m when we arrived :) that was very nice of him and very apreciated.
title: Extremely well located place to rest in Athens

review: The hotel is located just 10 minutes from Omonia metro station. Rooms are clean. Elevators are small, can accomodate 1 person with bags. Recommend to stay in top floors to reduce the otherwise noisy neighbourhood.
title: Good Location

review: Very pleasant hotel. Staff are brilliant and extremely helpful. Old hotel but very clean and well maintained. Tram stop opposite to town, and tickets are available from reception. Recommend highly for mid budget travel. Some noise from main road but insulation is good.
title: Very pleasant

review: This hotel is very convenient to explore the center of Athens. Very up to date in its technology. Tablet in the room from which you control everything while you are lying on bed! lights, blinds, temperature etc. and a large screen smart TV. The furniture is brand new and stylish. Staff is friendly and very helpful. for sure I'll visit again!
title: Brand new Hi-Tech Hotel in Athens

review: Highly recommended.Our room was great. Wooden floors so no hotel carpet smell.Fast internet, easy password, no fuss.Desk space for two so both can get online without a tussle.Rainforest and normal shower, excellent for weary travellers.King size bed with headboards against one wall too - a really nice "more than a bedroom" touch. Makes the bed into a leisure area. We didn't watch the TV but there's a huge flatscreen.Floor to ceiling window, the place has a bit of a Japanese feel but in no way pod-like. The windows DO open.You can control mood lights and temp from a tablet if you want (yes, it all works!) or there are switches on the wall.We'll definitely be back, it's a dream to have found this place on a budget.
title: Brand New, Vibey, Intelligent layout, Super-clean, Friendly staff

review: I stayed in hotel moka from june the 13th to june the 20th & its a decent hotel! it has a lift & the reception is open 24 hours, Also theres a small fridge that's sells soda/cans of beer, The staff were ok, & the room itself was big with an ensuite/wide screen tv, I only paid 227 euros for 7 nights so it was ok pricewise, Would i go back? yea i would go back, The area was a little shabby with graffiti/boarded up shops & fly posters but the hotel was alright, & The main square (syntagma) was only around 15 mins walking time from the hotel.
title: A decent stay!

review: Good location and room for the money. If you're expecting something super ritzy, maybe reconsider. It was clean, the air conditioner worked well, I didn't have any issues with noise level, and I found the staff to be very helpful. Well located in proximity to Omonoia station.
title: Nice stay

review: Good location to get to metro and sights. Room was renovated but still basic Hotel has few facilities but won't matter if you're not spending alot of time at hotel. Get a room with balcony for extending the size of the room, not so much for view. Employees very friendly and helpful. Bars and restaurants in area around hotel not so touristy, which was fine. I would stay here again but would like corner room with balcony on 4th floor.
title: Good location to popular metro station and walkable to the sights

review: The staff is professional and nice.It is always a pleasure to stay there.The pool area is truly an Oasis after a long day in Athens! When stopping in Athens we go there.We have been staying from the year 2000.We like the area because we can walk to Glyfada where you can find restaurants and shopping.

Next to the most famous street of glyfada with a nice swimming pool there is the hotel Oasis! You can choose it for couples , families or for a business trip - there is also a conference center !! You will be very satisfied from the service and the nice staff ! Excellent choice ! Nice n clean with a large swimming pool ! Also you can walk 4' and go to the beach but the water there isn't very clean so stay to the pool or take a bus for varkiza beach resort !!
title: Very comfortable hotel @Glyfada

review: My husband and I just returned (July 13/17) from a one month vacation. Our base was Oasis Hotel. The hotel is spotless the rooms very comfortable and clean. The staff from management to waiters and any other position go out of their way to make you feel relaxed and comfortable. Most any request will be met. The food is delicious. Breakfast usually included. Beach across the street, Glyfada square about 10 minute walk where you will find many restaurants and anything else you might require. The tram is across the street and busses at corner. We have stayed at this hotel on previous years and when we go back it will be our base again. All employees treat each other like family and the hotel guests are also treated in the same manner. We would like to thank them all for the hospitality. I'm not going to mention names as they are all fantastic. Ευχαριστούμε!!
title: Fantastic vacation fantastic hotel

review: The night before we were supposed to go to a wedding a large party was happening on the ground floor, we were on floor 2. At midnight the music started. It was so loud our room was vibrating. We called down to reception 4 times but nothing was done. At 3:30 we went down to reception and finally managed to get moved to a higher floor (it didn't help much). When checking out we requested a discount. The reception staff were rude and point blank refused saying it wasn't there fault. They then threatened to call the police if we didn't pay. I don't understand why this hotel thought it would be a good idea to put families and people who had a wedding the next day right above a party that doesn't end until 6am! From the other side of the hotel the party couldn't be heard. The refurbished rooms are grubby at best and most of the hotel has tired carpets, plaster hanging off the walls and looks a bit old and well used. Only saving grace the pool was nice but the chairs are grubby.
title: Unable to sleep and treated horribly by the staff

review: Said it was four star hotel, got given key Went to room wasn't cleaned from previous people beds not made breakfast stuff still there. Went to reception got given another room, sat on bed went through the bottom of it as slat was broken. Went down again to reception got moved again to the most disgusting place I have ever had to sleep. They said they had know other room available. We asked for a double and got twin room Even the first room was a twin. When we got the the 3rd room there wasn't a kettle .the bathroom was dirty the carpets we're dirty and air conditioning didn't work. The male receptionist could not give a hoot and was put out by the fact we had been down 3x.Went down to the pool got lunch at the restaurant by the pool side which was expensive and the very last straw was in the middle of the meal the waiter stopped us eating as he wanted us to pay.Totally unprofessional, hotel. Who doesn't put the well-being of their customers
title: Worst hotel ever

review: A very well kept property, conveniently located in northern athens, super easy access and amazing service! The staff very friendly and courteous as well. I would definitely recommend to all my friends!
title: very happy!!

hotelLocation: 20 Triti Septemvriou & 21 Chalkokondili Str, Athens 104 32, Greece
review: It's a nice hotel with decent and clean rooms. Area isn't the greatest - but I think that's just Athens in general. The staff were really friendly, and the breakfast was really extensive which was nice. Key to the room didn't always work though, which was frustrating but overall not bad!
title: Get what you pay for

review: Although the price of the hotel may seem cheap compared to others in the area, and the pictures and description say it has been renovated, don't be fooled! Arrived at the hotel earlier than the standard check in time and were told that the room was not ready, which was fine as we were early, so went out and returned to the hotel about an hour and half later. Waited for another ten minutes and then received the keys to our room! Well...the supposedly recently renovated rooms, didn't seem to apply to ours! The stench of smoke was disgusting, the carpets were stained, the shower which was supposed to be held over the bath was falling out the wall so you had to hold it and whenever you tried to have a shower the bath leaked all over the floor, the air con may as well have been non existent and not to mention the bedbugs we found within 2 hours of being in the room! Staff were extremely rude whenever asked for help! The only thing half decent was the wifi! A number of doors were left open to other rooms in the hotel, all of which again did not look like they had been renovated at all! How on earth other people have rated this hotel above a 1 is beyond me! I would avoid at all costs, certainly do not recommend!!
title: AVOID at all costs!!

review: Exarchia is a trendy/alternative area (and a bit rough) in central Athens. The hotel is situated close to Exarchia square where you can some fast food joints, restaurants and bars. Rooms a simple but clean. In total it's a rally good budget alternative.
title: Good budget choice in Exarchia

review: As a global traveler it was a good job the earplugs were packed when staying here. The double glazing did not keep the highway noise at bay and coupled with the loud air conditioning sleep was at a premium!Breakfast was fine, bar service was friendly, wifi worked well and the reception team were helpful and efficient.Premium room was ok and bed was comfortable if only I could have stopped the constant road noise.Will not be staying here on next visit to Athens.
title: Don't forget your ear plugs!

review: Photos on booking sites are misleading.I thought it will be a good deal given the price but then I understood why upon arrival. Furniture and all decor needs to be changed if it is to be called 3*. Staff was very polite and helpful though. Position is quite good too.
title: Needs urgent refurbishment

review: I checked-in alone late one evening for a 3 night stay and was pleasantly surprised by staff bringing up a fruit plate and wine with the pot of tea that I ordered. The rooms are standard size and clean; linen and surfaces were clean and well put away and there is a safe and wifi. The included breakfast was ok - self serve and basic. The beach is just a block away and there is a tram stop nearby. It's a safe area to walk around and transportation via uber or taxi is easily available. I had a restful stay.
title: Very friendly and accommodating staff and great seaside location

review: Stayed for 3 nights on business. Very basic hotel located half an hour from the airport and half an hour from the centre of Athens. Didn't have time to go to the beach there but supposedly it's a walking distance from the hotel and is quite nice. Breakfast hall is large and the breakfast itself is not bad. There is also a bar serving drinks and snacks all day. The room is also very basic but major faults for me were the bad mattress which was way too stiff and poor wifi connection. Better to use wifi in the hotel lobby. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Although they weren't able to change a 500 EURO bill on a couple of occasions.
title: Pleasant Stay!

review: The room I got had a beautiful view of the Acropolis, but the air conditioner did not work, and it was a very hot night. Luckily I only needed one night because I was leaving to the islands the next day. The hotel is outdated, and the towels looked old and overused. Like everything else, you get what you pay for. The location of this place is a plus thought. It's close to Plaka and Monastiraki. The area is safe and it has a lot of restaurants at walking distance.
title: Not a very good experience

review: At the beginning I hated the hotel and I was planning to look for another place closer to the center to crash in but than I got used to it and on the third day I even started to like it :))The hotel is outdated and needs heavy restorations. The pool area is small and not very well equipped but who needs a pool when the Mediterranean sea is just a few walking steps from the hotel. Rooms: Relatively small and outdated. Not very clean. No complimentary water bottles available. Bathroom needs heavy restorations.Location: It is like 20 minutes walk to the center and there is nothing to do around the area of the hotel. However, there is a tram station just across the street and the one of the main Glyfada ports is also a few minutes walking.Breakfast: Better than what I expected but still a very limited selection and un-tasty foodService: The staff is friendly but far from being professional… you just get the feeling that it is a small family-run-businessValue for money: the hotel is relatively a quite good value for moneyInternet: Free, fast internet in the rooms and receptionAvoid having a room next to the elevator because it is too noisy.Would I stay there again? Big NOWould I recommend it to others? Definitely NO
title: A three stars hotel with a huge lack of taste

review: I checked in my first day in Athens before leaving on a week long drive through Northern Greece and booked a room for July 24th and was assigned room 308 a "premium room". It was mediocre at best but for one night did not mind it. Upon my return I had also booked a night August 1 for one night also a premium room and was given room 421. I had booked both nights before leaving on the trip. Room 421 was substandard to say the least. Dirty and frayed curtains, bad causing around sink, old shower head was probably from the original construction, low water pressure. When I checked out and printed these out to the desk clerk he shrugged his shoulders and ignored me. I'm surprised this hotel still has it's Best Western affiliation. If it does I bet that room 421 was not inspected.
title: Tired and worn out.

review: Arrived at the hotel at 11pm only to be told that our room was not booked even though we had received a confirmation email and phone call. Our room was clearly given to someone else. Do not stay here. I would also like to mention that the photos are deceiving.
title: Disappointed

review: +: location right in the center of Athens, staff is nice, rooms are nice in size, breakfast is small but there's a little of everything. -: a little noisy inside the hotel as I have been woke up a few times, beds a little hard and would be nice to have at least two pillows instead of one, wifi is very unstable, rooms wold deserve a little refresh. A good value for money hotel.
title: Nice little hotel

review: Although we had booked a room for 3 nights through email and a phone call to confirm our booking, we arrived and to our disappointment there were no rooms available because clearly they had overbooked the hotel. They blamed one of their employees who apparently was fired but somehow had managed to book us a room AND confirm it. Excuses... Let me mention that the room was somehow booked for the next 2 nights after our arrival whereas by email we had agreed other dates.
title: Never Again

review: The best thing about Hotel Niki is it's location to tour ancient Athens. It is more than adequate. It did have some repairs that cropped up, but handled well. It's very good that they have capable and patient front desk staff and a maintenance guy on call day and night to deal with things. We had to move to another room but Effie was extremely helpful, as was the maintenance man and the cleaning staff person. All that made it very tolerable to stay there. The cleaning staff keeps things nice and clean. The breakfast is a full buffet of choices, with the traditional fresh tomatoes, feta and black olives and Greek pastries. Anastasia, the lady tending the breakfast, was fun to talk to! Tip her, she works hard! Effie at reception desk really went above and beyond to help us with changing reservations, giving us two favorite places to eat, helping us get our room problems solved and arranging coffee and early breakfast item to-go when we had to catch a very early flight. I recommend this place for all of these reasons.
title: Effie @ front desk is AWESOMELY helpful!!

review: Awesome location next to Omania Square where you can get in all the tourist buses. The staff are so lovely and provide you with great restaurant recommendations. The rooms are clean and spacious. One downside is the size of the bathroom/ shower. I made the mistake of turning around to wash my hair and knocked the tap to hot! There's also a lift for those staying on higher floors. Would definitely come back!
title: A fantastic hideaway

review: We booked this hotel based on proximity to metro station. Although it looks close on the map it is actually not that easy to walk to with suitcases. The room was terrible - dingy, curtains half falling off the tracks, outlook onto dusty abandoned building. The bed was hard, the pillows flat. Worst of all though was the fact that the walls are paper thin & we could hear every word from next door - especially when they broke into a fight!!! Care factor zero from night manager!It is in a really dodgy area - with lots of homeless people in the street. On the positive side the bathroom was clean. Way over priced for the standard of the room. Would recommend not staying at this hotel.
title: Absolutely dreadful

review: Location is very good and easy to visit interesting spots on food. Entrance of hotel is very nice and staff is super friendly and helpful. Rooms are basic but all clean and in good state. For sure a hotel where I will be back as I travel several times a year to Athens for business.
title: surprised and budget traveling can be very comfortable

review: I originally booked here for 2 nights because of the reasonable price. I ended up staying for a week. The staff were all very friendly and efficient. It's nice to come back to your hotel and be greeted with a friendly smile and recognition. Rooms are simple, clean and comfortable. I wasn't too keen on the breakfast but, it was still ok. Neighbourhood is a little rundown but, I always felt safe. Close to Omonia Square (Metro, buses etc.) So convenient for getting around.I'd stay at the hotel again - when I return from the islands I plan to stay again.
title: Comfortable and friendly (great value too)

review: I'm actually quite baffled as to why this place is only classed as a two-star hotel. I've stayed in three-star places in the UK which were noticeably inferior to this. The bedrooms are clean and spacious, the breakfasts cater for pretty much all culinary preferences, the bar is dirt-cheap and operates 24/7 whilst the owner, Christos, goes out of his way to be helpful and accommodating to all his guests, including solo travellers like myself. Not only that, £283 for seven nights is far better value than you'd find in most European capital cities (including London). I suppose that if I had to include one criticism, it's that the location is a little far from the city centre, but it's also close to the Port of Piraeus - which makes it ideal for ferry trips to the surrounding islands - and buses to Syntagma Square are frequent and very inexpensive.
title: Deserves more than two stars

hotelLocation: 72 Dimarchou Angelou Metaxa Street & Kritis Square, Glyfada, Athens 166 74, Greece
review: Highly recommend!! Everything is great. It's 10 minute walk from the centre, shops and restaurants and 5 minute from the beach. There is a direct bus from the airport that has a station right infront of the hotel so you don't have to walk a lot. Workers in the hotel are super nice and helpful.
title: Expirience

hotelLocation: 72 Dimarchou Angelou Metaxa Street & Kritis Square, Glyfada, Athens 166 74, Greece
review: Nice and quite comfort place to rest 2-3 days. Ground floor looks a bit old. Staff is not very handy and helpfull. Just what we know.from some old hotels. Swimming pool helps in refreshing. We stayed there 3 nights just to rest a bit between sailing and driving around Greece. Good place for such task.Moreover in a range of short walk there is commercial district with some nice, tasty restaurants, pubs and shops. Nice suburbs with a tram line to heart of Athens.
title: Nice rooms but service needs some tuning

hotelLocation: 72 Dimarchou Angelou Metaxa Street & Kritis Square, Glyfada, Athens 166 74, Greece
review: This hotel should be investigated by the tourist bureau in Athens. If one thing made me rethink my affection for Greece would be this hotel mis-managed by its staff. Anyone that has children should think twice before booking here as you may be find surprises.
title: Golden Scam Hotel

review: Undoubtedly the worst hotel experience I have had. Room 307 first on the left after exiting the lift.I booked, paid for, and had written confirmation, 3N, non-smoking, double room with balcony.The room measured <5M sq (6.5 x 8ft). No balcony of course. Squalid would be the best description.I was provided the accom I had booked for the following 2 nights. No apology and no refund.How can such accomodatiion meet any building rules /regulations?How can the Greek Tourist Regulators tolerate this? When I said I was not accepting it I was told it was all that was available that night and I was given
title: A squalid closet masquerading as a room

review: This is a hotel that meets your needs: it's clean, safe, quiet, and cool. It's simple so don't expect frills but at the price point and location it's totally worth it! The neighborhood is gorgeous and the location is perfect.
title: Great hotel in excellent location!

review: We recently stayed at Hotel Phidias and specifically chose this hotel as it was very close to the Port of Piraeus. We need to catch a ferry to Milos. Upon arrival Katherina, at the from desk, greeted us with extreme friendliness. She struck up conversations with my 12 and 9 year olds immediately. She is was certainly a breath of fresh air after 13+ hours of travel. Our room was very comfortable, but a little small for a family of 4. the bathroom was also small but extremely clean. The hotel offers a free shuttle service around the Piraeus area. They took us to the port. Its a short walk to the main town from the hotel where you will find supermarkets, restaurants, clothing stores etc.
title: Family holiday

review: According to travel blogs and statements Metaxourgio ''is not that safe'' and you have to be careful at night!Well, if you consider couple of Balkanian travel agencies, few abandoned buildings and some closed down stores than yes. But Metaxourgio -in my experience of 5 days and 4 nights- has proven that it is an ok area and actually quiet and calm.Hotel Cosmos is located few hundred meters from the metro station in a tree lined quiet street, across the street is the beautiful but abandoned neo-classical building of Hotel Corfu.Cosmos is a 2 star hotel and provides you exactly what 2 star deserves. Hotel is from the 70's, including the furniture, lighting and fixtures but clean, so are the rooms..There are no frills everything's basic and functional. It is a very cheap hotel and you are 1 metro stop away from the centre or 10 minutes walk.Staff at the reception helpful, there are bars, coffe shops and restaurants nearby.For an excellent price what else do you need?Karaca B. From Constantinople.
title: No problem at Metaxourgio, no problem at Hotel Cosmos..

review: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel. Everything was fine. The quality price ratio is pretty good. The room is big enough and cosy. Air conditioning in the room : perfect. The only thing is that the cleaning staff make some noise in the morning while moving the furnitures. Underground not far from the hotel!
title: Very good

review: Hotel cosmos is a hotel which is located quite central in Athens. The room was basic but clean. Takes you 10-15 minutes walking to many main attractions and the metro is 3 min walking from the hotel. Hotel staff was friendly and welcoming. Despite the central location, the neighborhood of the hotel is not the best. Especially at night you should take care as streets hardly have lights and you meet strange people. Apart from this, recommendable for a short stay ~2 days.
title: Good hotel for short stay

review: Cheap hotel and good location near the metro station. Ok for a short stay. Room was dirty and there were lots of ants. The bathroom had no ventilation at all. Hotel economico vicino alla metro. Ok per un appoggio giusto per un paio di notti. Stanze sporche e con formiche. Bagno cieco pieno di odori.
title: Cheap but not clean

review: Okay, lets start of to address a few things. The neighborhood nearby probably isn't great. It's not far from Ommonia, and that place has greatly deteriorated. However, do understand that you probably will avoid trouble if you use common sense. For instance, the later you stay out in most cities, the more likely you will run into trouble. Yes, I have driven in New York City and Philadelphia with my family at 10 PM in 1989, and it was frightening to say the least. Athens isn't even anywhere as bad as that,so just stay in. Also, common reminder, don't leave your valuables in the car. I have had friends had their shoes stolen in the Rutgers University Parking lot along with their valuables because it was in plain sight of the thieves. The bad things that could happen to you in this neighborhood are avoidable if you just use common sense. I am sure most readers DO HAVE IT. Just remember, not to let your guard down while on vacation. You are in a city where pick pocketing can happen and is currently experiencing an economic recession. Now for the actual hotel. Take your valuables with you because there is no safe in the room. The room itself does the job. You have a clean bed, check. You have sizable bathroom that is clean, check. You have wireless internet, check. You have a television set, check. It's a hotel that does the job it's meant to do. It shields you from the elements. It has air conditioning for a hot summer's day and it's reasonably clean. In addition, it's also convenient. It's not far from a Metro Station and you can access the airport line very easily as well. You are just a few stops away from the Acropolis and Plaka. The location of this hotel is just spot on perfect. This hotel isn't really a place you want to stay for too long though. There are a lot of moral fiber who live around the area and in the hotel. They're not going to hassle you, but BOY are they LOUD at night. I heard an argument next door to my room, and I tell you I could hear it vividly through the walls too. They're not thin walls either. I was able to sleep through it because this was the hotel I stayed on my last night in Greece. Before I stayed here, this was my trip schedule: Athens for 8 hours, 3 AM wake up to go to Zakynthos, Back to Athens then drove to Delphi and Meteora, Drove back to Athens 3 AM flight to Santorini, Ferry to Rhodes, Flight Back to Athens. By the time I rolled into this hotel, I was exhausted and NOTHING was going to wake me up. I needed three Alarm Clock intervals to wake up the next day. However, in a normal state, I know fact the people arguing would have kept me up all night., and I would have woken up irate. So this Hotel is just perfect for your first night here, or your last night. Pretty much it's a hotel to on the first day and your last day of the trip, and it's a good launch pad area for your vacation or your departure.
title: Come here if you're seriously dead tired.

review: We arrived in Athens late but checked in ok. Rooms very basic, but clean, although the bathroom left a lot to be desired. Not very sound proof room, conversations could be heard. Location was good very close to Acropolis. Wifi ok. Breakfast was average but very pleasant up on the roof viewing the city and the Acropolis, certainly made up for the rest of the hotel.
title: Basic but Rooftop restaurant fabulous

review: While the location is good and the staff very accommodating, the hotel definitely needs a face lift and a good cleaning. My room smelled of mildew and the carpeting was old and frayed. One of the great points is the magnificent view of the Acropolis from the rooftop restaurant/bar.
title: A little rough around the edges

review: A nice hotel for a short and cheap stay in Athens. We visited Athens for my nieces wedding and we choose this hotel because it was close to my cousins house. When my cousin brought us an iron machine, the receptionist refused to keep it and give it to us, with the excuse that he does not take responsibility ... So we gave our clothes to the hotel to iron us. We were charged 3 € per piece!
title: Nice Hotel

review: The hotel is a little far from downtown Athens, but it's accessible by public transportation. It's a pretty little hotel, with clean bathrooms and well-maintained facilities, with one exception. They do not maintain their 'free wifi'. When I checked in, they warned me that if I needed to use the wifi in the evening, I could sit in the lobby. The desk attendant wouldn't mind, but there was only one couch. By 7pm, the wifi on every floor was too slow to even check in for my flight, so I had to sit in the lobby. This was not well advertised, and if you travel alone or care about using the internet, I do not recommend it.
title: Good hotel, bad wifi

review: The only good thing about this hotel is its location. Rooms are very small and becomes congested if you have even a little luggage. Very few options for breakfast. Wifi was bad especially in the 4th floor.
title: Average hotel in a great location

review: Bit grungey but great location great price run by great friendly people I would recommend this place for 3 or 4 days stay just around the corner from great bars and restaurants walking distance to main shopping and main museums and attractions.
title: Worth a look

review: We were given a room here after we were unable to stay at another hotel we previously booked at. There were only 2 of us, but we were given a family room for the price of a double room, with breakfast included, for less than what we would have paid at the other hotel. Location is good, only 5 minutes walk to the metro at Monastiraki. The building is rather old but in reasonable condition, the highlight is the old timey elevator. Room was quite good, only downside was that it was not very sound proof. Wifi was very slow, sometimes unusable. One of the guys at the front desk (whose name I can't remember) was very friendly and offered suggestions for things to do around Athens and Greece. The other staff were friendly too, but didn't say much.It's not perfect, but pretty good for the price.
title: Good location, decent value

review: Cecil is a low cost hotel in a very convenient area. Great Location and value for money. Room is good size. Bathroom is compact but functional. The room is very quiet even though we were facing the street and also very clean. Breakfast was very good as wellWe were fortunate to have a view of the Acropolis from the Balcony. And hotel also has a view from the roof top (although no facilities on the roof top.)The staff as also friendly. May not appear that way to start, but they are friendly when engaged. Location -to the right is the Plaka and to the left are the food markets (amazing fresh fruit and olives and cheese) Also "antique" shops overflowing with everything from Chinese bowls to crystal vases to brass statues. A homeware shoppers paradise!!!!
title: Excellent Location & Value for money

hotelLocation: Kodrou & Vouls Streets Chrissostomou (Plaka) 3, Athens 105 58, Greece
review: Terrible - don't know where to start. Cheaply decorated, tiny room and even smaller bathroom! Morning man on reception is by no means friendly- but not rude like the grumpy old man in the afternoon / evening - we've never been spoken to in such a rude, abrasive manner!The only decent thing was the balcony !
title: Dump

hotelLocation: Kodrou & Vouls Streets Chrissostomou (Plaka) 3, Athens 105 58, Greece
review: I agree with most of the previous reviews here in that this isn't an extravagant stay by any sense, but if you are looking for a clean and comfortable home base while you explore the city - it's great bang for your buck. We found staff pleasant and the breakfast with a great view of the acropolis was a real treat in the morning. The location also cant be beat if you want to be near the action.Our only suggestions for improvement (given what it is), is we agree the air conditioning was spotty and there were times we were way too hot. Some more protein choices/meat options at breakfast would be nice also.
title: Good value for location

hotelLocation: Kodrou & Vouls Streets Chrissostomou (Plaka) 3, Athens 105 58, Greece
review: My friends and I stayed at Adonis hotel for 2 nights. The room was clean and fit 3 of us just fine. The staff are all kind and are always attentive. The bar upstairs has good drinks and a nice view of the Acropolis. My only issue there was only one PowerPoint for 3 of us which was hard but that is definitely not a deal breaker. The location is also perfect 10 minute walk to the Acropolis and 3 minutes to heaps of restaurants and market stalls
title: Good hotel, lovely staff

review: My friends and I had the most amazing experience with the lovely owner / manager ? of this hotel. We found out on arrival that our booking had been cancelled because of an expired credit card, and were worried we would be turned away. Not only were we offered 2 rooms instead of 1 at the same price, she was able to provide us with all the information we needed about transport, laundry services, and where to eat and drink. She was able to organise a taxi for us for the following morning and extended check out so we could go straight to the airport. We had such a great experience and she was incredibly warm and genuine with us. The rooms were clean and spacious and the aircon worked well. Not a single complaint for this hotel!
title: Welcoming and wonderful

review: I booked this hotel at 11pm at night and checked in 30 minutes later due to my other hotel being really average. I chose this hotel because of the location. It is a few minutes walk from the main shopping street, buses, train etc.As a girl travelling on her own, it is a great hotel because of it's location. I would stay here again. The staff and cleaning staff are really friendly and very helpful. Breakfast is included which is good. It's nothing special but it's fine! I have been having fruit and yogurt (because it's gluten free) but there's a lot of other options.There is an amazing Absinthe bar across the road down a lane way. Full of locals which is great. The bed in the hotel was not good at all. I could feel every spring. Having a terrible bed in a hotel is the worst because after a long day of walking and sightseeing, you want to have a good sleep. These beds don't allow that. The pillow was fine. Very spacious room with a large window. Bathroom is fine. Everything works. They give you fresh sheets every day and mop the floor so it is very clean. No kettle! I thought that was unusual. I like to make tea in my room.No iron.No full length mirror. Aircon was great. Wifi works best at the door and the window. I'd stay here again but the beds really let this place down. If you love a comfortable bed then you might want to look for another hotel.
title: Great Location

review: The hotel is conveniently located near Syntagma, and very near to the streets where university students and young people gather for pubs, live music and easy going movida greek style.. the Hotel is part of an existing building, the rooms are small but comfortables and they also have small balconies. staff is helpful and prices are convenient. the main advantage it offers is the location and easy fo access to all public transport to and from the airport at any time of the day and or night in syntagma square.
title: Location, location location, Near the Athens movida

review: The hotel is just a few steps away from Monastiraki metro station.The rooms are very basic, small and the bathroom resembles a wardrobe closet. However, they are very functional and clean.The hotel has a 24 reception and very friendly staff.
title: Very simple, friendly, excellent location

review: Achilleas has the perfect location for a tourist exploring Athens. It is just 3 to 4 minute walk from Syntagma square and in walking distance of most of the highlights of the city. We stayed for 3 nights with our 11 year old daughter and grown up daughter and never needed to take public transport. There is a fair bit of graffiti in the area around the hotel and in Athens in general. However this is not gang related and we never felt in any kind of physical danger in the area at all. Our experience was excellent: The hotel is run efficiently and has excellent front desk staff. They give good advice and are helpful. The hotel is clean and well organised. There is a lift - good for heavy suitcases. Breakfast was included in our rate and we found it to be excellent with a pretty good variety. We had no complaints about our room and bathroom. My only complaint was that there was no electric kettle - however one could go to reception with a cup and teabag anytime and get boiling water.
title: Excellent location, efficent, clean, good value and a great breakfast

review: I came to Athens without a hotel reservation. Took a chance on having someone at the airport arrange a stay for me at this place. Very happy I did. The hotel is very clean, very well-maintained (I checked every corner of the room, so did a good look-around from which to base my opinion). You can definitely get a good rest here, hot water, wi-fi AND computer in lobby if you need it. Complimentary breakfast too (which I unfortunately missed). I got what I paid for. If you are not sure where to go, this is an awesome choice to book and you won't have to worry. Staff was also VERY helpful, Very friendly. That was my experience anyway. Glad I wound up here for my short stay in Athens.
title: Clean, worry-free hotel stay at a great location in Athens

review: If your main priorities are getting an excellent location without having to pay much, then this is for you. It's just a short walk away from Monastiraki station and a number of the ancient sites and is surrounded by places to eat. The price was amazing. But the facilities were basic. I had a private room (with shared bathroom) but the walls were paper-thin and didn't block out any street noise. There were some opaque windows for light, but no view to be had. But if all you're after is a place to sleep at night, it does the job and I've no complaints.
title: Basic but cheap and with a good location

review: 3 stars for perfect location 1 for serviceminded staff. For a few days of sightseeing this place is great. Very basic features, good clean rooms with aircondition for warm nights. Location is amazing as you have a central base to explore athens from. Staff is friendly and helpful and available 24/7 something that was very important as we checked in at 4 am. Overall great place to leave your things as you explore athens during the day and to rest during the night. Dont expect a fancy room, youre not meant to relax in your room all day at this hotel.
title: Location, location, location.

review: The staff there are really nice. They helped me to get cash after I lost my wallet. Also, the location is perfect, just three minutes walk to subway station. It's really enjoyable to walk around! Rooms have air conditioners, so the temperature is not a problem for this hotel.
title: Friendly staff and excellent location

review: Very convenient and clean budget hotel in the heart of athens !Stuff is very friendly, room was clean and had very fast Wifi! Had a great stay at tempi hotel, all nice sightseeing spots like the akropolis, plaka and monastiraki are very close to reach by walking
title: Great place to stay in Athens

review: Wagalis was the name of our server. He was quiye friendly and made us feel very comfortable. He suggested us some unique drinks and food.Overall good experience. I will not rate the view so much as the area did not seem to have a pleasant scenario
title: Good food and server

review: Best about this hotel is its rooftop bar and restaurant with a view of the Acropolis. Staff is extremely friendly and service minded. Rooms are small, but hey, who wants to stay in his hotel room in a town like Athens?
title: Nice rooftop bar/restaurant, great people

review: The location was perfect: just between Syntegma square and Plaka. Very easy to walk to everything in central Athens. Room was small but comfortable and clean. Good sleep quality even during the day. Staff were nice: expedited room cleaning so that we could check in early, and loaned us an umbrella for the unseasonable rain. Only potential con to be aware of is that the shower is very small; it was fine for us but my husband is 6'2" and only just managed.
title: Great option for central Athens

review: Was a nice hotel, the breakfast was yummy and our newly renovated room was good! Could use a shower screen because water goes everywhere! Air con was great and the staff were lovely, even arranged breakfast for us at 5:30am on the morning we were leaving! If your coming to Athens great place to stay! Only downfall is the neighbourhood is abit rough!
title: ATHENS

hotelLocation: Kodrou & Vouls Streets Chrissostomou (Plaka) 3, Athens 105 58, Greece
review: The hotel is perfectly located, whether you are a tourist wanting to explore placa and the antiquities of Athens, or a businessman wanting to be in the center of the town. Prices are low and rooms are clean, but they are sloppily refurbished. You will get reworded though once you get on the upper floor for breakfast. The views of the acropolis are amazing, while quality of breakfast is mediocre. Serviced by lovely Mrs. Venetia will give you energy for your long day ahead.
title: Excellent location and vistas

hotelLocation: Kodrou & Vouls Streets Chrissostomou (Plaka) 3, Athens 105 58, Greece
review: Cons : Double bed smaller than 140cm. Bathroom could not literally fit 2 people at the same time. Only two power outlets and shower gel was in individual 10ml paquets. Air conditioning was controlled by the front desk and therefore you cannot chnage the temperature as you wish. Quality of the breakfast is mediocre. The room's soundproofing isn't great. Pros : Great location. 5 minute walk from the nearest metro station which has buses and metros straight to the airport. Ton of restaurants and shops nearby. The view from the breakfast area to the acropolis was great as well.
title: Disappointing

review: This hotel is good and convenient for those taking ferries from the nearby Rafina Port. It is pretty old hotel, surely not a 4-star. They keep it clean and tried to make up with a relatively new furniture. Bathrooms however need some serious fixing. The views are nice but there is no beach and not many dining options around.The staff was very professional and kind. Very standard hotel which served our purpose.
title: For overnight stay only

review: This property is very unassuming. Conservative in decor with very basic furniture but it makes up with a magnificent view and the friendliness of the staff who will do anything to accommodate you.The hotel is located about 20 minutes from the airport. It also offers a breakfast buffet, very basic but serves the purpose. I had a room on the third floor overlooking the water which glimmered with many shades of blue. Although the room has air conditioning if you open the balcony door a subtle breeze comes through with the sound of waves. They also coordinated the shuttle transport from the airport. I will certainly consider this hotel again.
title: Room with a WOW view

review: Although this hotel is a little dated the kindness and generosity of the staff made it one of my favorite hotel stopovers ever. On the edge of the sea, fabulous view, lovely clean salt water swimming pool, spacious rooms.Great value for money..will be back again.
title: Fabulous service

review: This is the worst hotel I have stayed in all my life. We got a room in the basement, without any windows. Is that even legal?It SAS incredibly small, dirty and had a shady look all over. Stay clear of this hotel if you're going to Athens, this experience was embarrasing.
title: Dreadful

review: A small hotel located in a quiet and safe neighbourhood. Very good staff, friendly and professional, with perfect English. We felt very welcome here. We were lucky to get a comfortable triple room with a very spacious and nice balcony. Air con was ice cold and room had a fridge too. Walking distance to all the sites and 24 hour reception to welcome you back at the end of a long day's sight seeing. A fantastic cafe called Kekkos just round the corner. I would be back to this hotel in a flash if returning to Athens.
title: A gem

review: This is a lovely, small hotel in an out of the way place for Athens or airport transport. As is typical in European/Greek hotels, there are two twin beds put together. My friend and I would have preferred two separate beds, but that's not how they do it here. When we booked it we thought it was nearer to the airport, but it took a long taxi ride to the airport. If you need a taxi, call My Athens Transport and ask for Spiros. He's the best!The hotel staff was great as was commented on and the oceanside restaurant food and service w're excellent. I gave it three stars only because we could not get decent wifi in our room, even though the wifi icon showed up in full. To get decent wifi I had to stand with my phone or iPad within a few feet of the reception desk. Even after I complained about this to the office staff, there seemed to be nothing they could do.
title: Delightful hotel, terrible Wifi

review: We stayed here 5 nights over two rooms. The rooms were fine although one had a musty smell. That room also had some noise from adjoining rooms. My right I was quiet and clean. It is very close to the parliament building so we easily saw the changing of the guards, and it is a short walk to the plaka area. It is an easy walk to the acropolis too as long as you don't get lost in the winding streets. The top floors have a good view of the acropolis. Breakfast is up there on the 10th floor. I would say suggest booking the floors 7 to 9. If you want a room view. The lower floors have terrible views. Fortunately for me I do not travel to sit in a room and look outside. I am only there at night and do mot care.
title: Worth considering

review: Hubby and l stayed here 3 nights pre-cruise. Location is superb! Staff were friendly and quite helpful dealing with our missed baggage. Breakfast is on the rooftop with views of The Acropolis. Decent selection of food choices .. cereals, cold cuts, fruit, yoghurt, eggs, bacon and potatoes and sweet pastry. Good enough for us. Had the rooms been modernised we would have rated it higher but l know other cruise travellers stayed at much higher rated hotels and were not in such a great location and felt less inclined to wander out at night. We hsd no problem with that being so central. A short 5min walk to hop on/off bus, shopping, cafes and restaurants, the Plaka district etc.
title: Great location with rooftop views to match

review: We stayed for 4 nights and from the moment we arrived we felt at home staff were wonderful rooms were comfortable yes it's a bit dated but for the price you pay and for city hotel you vast complain location next to plaka and in walking distance to the Acropolis and museums what more can you ask for will definitely be returning we stayed on the 8th floor with views of the Acropolis from our balcony
title: Fantastic location and view

review: A comfortable hotel with good facilities - clean and accommodating. The area surrounding the hotel was alive with restaurants, cafes, shops, transport and attractions. The double bed was actually 2 single beds put together and was a little hard. The restaurant area had great views of the Acropolis. Breakfast was OK.
title: Close to Shopping and Tourist Attractions

review: Spent 6 nights at the Astor, which is located in the historic area. For us just perfect as we like to walk and explore and we certainly did close to everything and offers guests breathtaking views of the Parthenon and Acropolis Hill from its rooftop open area. The rooms are modest, very clean and quiet.Staff are wonderful and helpful and speak perfect English.Breakfast is on the rooftop, menu is simple, fresh food, in the panoramic restaurant.
