You can enjoy drinks and a bite to eat in the panoramic rooftop restaurant and open area for lunch and dinner, great place to unwind after a hard day exploring and shopping!Mihali (Michael) will look after your drink order and also guide you to what to see whilst in Athens!
title: It may be modest but we love it

review: Most welcoming and helpful staff. Lovely room, stylishly designed. Varied breakfast buffet, but food cold.Close to transport hub. Many restaurants in the neighbouring streets.Free wifi. Safe in room.
title: Recommended

review: I agree with all the positive reviews. This hotel has the following positives: great location - easy walking distance to all the main attractions of Athens central city which is handy for a short stay. Great value for money - normally accommodation in such a good location would cost 3 or 4 times as much. Great staff who are helpful and friendly and professional. Good adequate breakfast. Property may be a bit old, but is very clean, comfortable and well maintained with basic inclusions in good working order (mini fridge, TV, air-conditioning, free WiFi). Negatives: room is small for more than 3 people. We are a family of 4 and once the 4th bed is out, not much room for suitcases, but this wasn't a problem for us as we were only staying for 1 night. If staying for a longer period, I would book 2 rooms next time for a family of 4 and it would be perfect (and still affordable). I would stay here again if I return to Athens and I will be recommending this place to others.
title: Great value, great location

review: Was attending a Art Symposium here and I must say the hotel was very less than average.To begin with the rooms were super small. And the service was less than what you would expect from a 4 star. We were there for a week and none of the staff ever smiled. They did what you asked or inquired about but there was no warmth.The breakfast was basic and the same menu for a complete week.On the positives:The pool area was actually quite nice.The views of the beach were lovely and right across the streetThe tram station is just outside the hotelThe price was quite affordable.It was 1.5 hours by train to get to Athens Parliament in center of town near plaka.The hotel transport to the airport is the most advisable for a fee of 55 Euros - because its a challenge for Taxis & to get to from public transport.
title: Not Impressed with Service & Staff

review: My wife and me have spent our honeymoon at this hotel.we were happy that the hotel looks great, the staff was very friendly and helpful from the first moment.every room has view to the sea.the room was nice,there waited us as present a bottle of wine and some fruits.the air conditioner was useful.they cleaned the room every day.the breakfast was swedish buffet with plenty of food,some items/foods were changed every morning.we ate dinner once from buffet with 12€, once from the menu, both were delicious and plenty aswell,and good cocktails.beach, bus stop, tram stop are at 2 min walk,the centre of athens is at 30 min with tram.and across the road there is shell gas station where you can buy something if you need.the beach is public and it was clean and not aglomerated.the single minus is the many cars that are going by on the main road whole day...but that is not the hotels fault
title: We will go back

review: We were in Athens for a few days and spend our stay at this hotel, it was very clean and comfortable. Staff very helpful and friendly. Breakfast included and had a good choice, help yourself buffet and plenty of food. Orange juice and coffee very disappointing, Both from machines and orange was not fresh juice more like squash. coffee dreadful. Good buffet for evening meals 12 euros good value, but we ate out as there was so much choice. Took the tram five stops to Glyfada and lots of lovely restaurants there, five stops towards Athens (Syntagma) a lovely beach restaurant there are two there we went to the first one on left looking at the beach it was FAB food delicious value very good, lovely setting. Overall would really recommend the hotel the pool is very nice really good, and the beach is across the road from the hotel. The bus from the airport stops right outside the hotel Although there is a very busy and dangerous road to cross when arriving, We did it with three children and lots of luggage. Bus stops on the same side of the road when leaving and runs 24 hours every 20 mins, 45 mins journey for a few euros. tram stops outside hotel easy to get to Athens and the opposite way also.
title: A lovely break in a lovely relaxing hotel

review: We stayed for 3 nights end June/beginning July and would recommend the hotel highly. The hotel is very central and a few minutes walk from the Ambelokipi Metro station on the blue line. Syntagma Square and Monastraki are a couple of stops along the blue line and also the airport is on the same line which is very convenient. Also it is important to say that the hotel is in an area which is extremely safe. We were given room number 73 which is on the top floor and was a lovely large room with a very comfortable double bed and two sets of French doors leading out on to a shared balcony. A couple of things about the facility's in the room - the bath towels were beautifully thick and large and the hair dryer in the bathroom was extremely efficient unlike other hotels where you often get a pathetic air flow. The French doors have silky net curtains which looked lovely and clean so I couldn't resist smelling them and they were absolutely clean and fresh which is something that is always, and I mean always, overlooked in every hotel I've stayed in. The staff were lovely and friendly and very helpful with queries and booking of taxi's. The breakfast is continental style but does have hot food if you'd like it i.e scrambled eggs, slices of omelette and bacon and sausage. The waiter in the restaurant was lovely and very friendly and efficient. All in all we could not fault the hotel and would definitely stay there if we came to Athens again.
title: Recommend the hotel highly

review: I was there for two nights before exploring other parts of Greece. In those two nights the staff really made my stay comfortable and enjoyable. The hotel is located about 10 mins from the parliament. There are plenty of restaurants and bars around the hotel to relax after a full days of sight seeing.
title: Very friendly staff and a comfortable place to stay

review: Best western embassy hotel is a nice decent hotel very well located in the quiet heart of Athens. It's very close to all important areas of the city including the acropolis and plaka district. It's a few hundred yards from the train stations also. The one thing that I think needs to be reviewed is the number of stars. The hotel is sold as a 4 star hotel but I don't think it's. the hotel is old and maintenance is not adequate. I had an issue with the A/C and requested the reception to call maintenance which she did and they claimed fixing it which was not true.Staff are wonderful, friendly, and try their best to help.
title: Good value for money

review: Let me start by reflecting on some of the reviews I read about this hotel before booking....This is a nice quiet hotel that is situated close to the Metro which makes it good for exploring the city. Rooms are a good size and have all the necessary amenities you would look for in a hotel like this, however the a/c temp can not be regulated which is frustrating in high heat and wifi in rooms is poor.We checked into the hotel late in the night following a trip to the islands. We had previously dropped some bags at the hotel before we left for our trip to the islands and found the reception staff to be rude.Check in was fairly straightforward however it took a few attempts for them to understand we had bags left in the storage room.We went up to our room (4th floor) and were instantly hit by the smell of stale smoke. We had requested a non smoking room and there was a sign stating non smoking but on the other hand there was a ash try on the table? The smell was really bad and when I called down to reception to complain and I was told the room was non smoking and that the hotel was fully booked and nothing else was available. I was not happy and asked for someone to come up to the room. The male receptionist was not the most helpful but I understood he had nothing else available and accepted that we were stuck with the room. I thanked him for his help and asked him to leave a message for the hotel manager to contact me in the morning as I was not happy with then room and wanted him to see me to discuss further.I then proceeded to unpack, 10 minutes passed and the receptionist appeared with a new room key saying he had another room for us which smelled much better. I was surprised but grateful for his help and proceeded to move rooms.In our new room we got ready for bed and switched on the a/c, this is when we started to smell cigarette smoke. The smell was coming from the vent. We ended up just going to bed with no a/c.The next morning we reported this to reception and yet again was dealt with in a rude manor. She said we had already been moved once but she will ask maintenance to take a look. We later discovered the 5th floor is smoking and so I believe this is why we could smell smoke coming through the air vents.So my tip if you decide to stay in this hotel is to avoid 4th floor rooms and be prepared for rude staff.Breakfast was average with limited choice and the wifi throughout the hotel was poor.I won't be staying here again and wish I had taken more note from previous reviews before booking.
title: Good Value! Average stay! I won't be back!

review: The hotel was very basic with only few amenities being provided. They didn't keep any bottle of water and no dental kits were provided. Since plug points are different as compared to india, we had asked for an adaptor to which the reception asked to come down and collect ourselves. There was no hospitality in this hotel. Since we only needed to sleep for one night we adjusted through. Not at all recommending this hotel to anyone. Instead there are very good budget hotels in the main city which should be explored. The area in which the hotel is situated is also not convenient.
title: Wrong decision

review: We had three nights here as part of a group tour. The rooms were very outdated with lots of stains and the hotel often smelled like cigarette smoke. The A/C in the rooms worked just enough to allow you to sleep, but they were not great. It actually stopped working in the middle of the night one night, but seemed to fix itself. We had our breakfasts and dinners here and the food lacked imagination and flavor. Especially the dinners were very basic and did not stand up to what is available in Greece.
title: Very run down, bad location, basic food

review: The building and staff were great. The location, and neighborhood is poor. The rooms were clean and updated. The staff members at the desk and bar/restaurant were very attentive an helpful at all times. They took good care of us. The rooftop garden was a wonderful place to relax and enjoy some down time gazing at the Acropolis. However, the locations had nothing going for it. The streets were littered with trash and graffiti, there were several sketchy looking transients around, and it wasn't convenient to get to public transportation hubs. Staying in Athens for 3 days, I did notice a disturbing amount of graffiti and run-down areas. It was pretty sad. Overall, I really like the building, amenities and staff, but would try to find a better located hotel, if I were to go to Athens again.
title: Nice hotel. Lousy location.

review: This hotel was close to Omonia metro. The area isn't that great but the hotel was a little jewel in this area. Lovely clean rooms, a/c, tea/coffee, hairdryer, flat TV, toiletries, free wifi. Beautifully decorated. Breakfast was basic, self serve but adequate and I don't think you can do better for the price. The staff were very approachable, friendly and helpful when I had a problem with a refund.
title: A little jewel

review: We booking this hotel for 9 nights because it had a great star rating and it was well priced. Once we arrived we realised how bad of a mistake we made! The hotel is rundown for the outside but the lobby makes it looking like it could be great. Lady at the counter was abrupt and rude. The lady with the glasses is the nicest one of them all. The bedroom had stains all over the floor and curtains. Smelt really bad and the bathroom had pubic hair on the floor, which was so gross. We decided to eat at the rooftop bar because we just flew in and didn't feel like walking to get food, only to wait and how and no one shows up. We ended up walking into the city and eating at one of our favourite restaurants. We can back and though we would just watch the sun set with the acropolis. We were there for two hours then a lady turns up and asks if we want to order. We say no because we went out to eat and she said if we didn't order anything we would have to leave as it's only for paying customers... umm what! We paid to stay at the hotel!! My boyfriend decided to just get a beer and she looked at me and when I said I still didn't want anything she gave me a death stare and snobed me off. Never seen someone so rude!The first 4 nights we were there, there were kids running up and down the hallways at 12am slamming doors and screaming. DID NOT SLEEP PROPERLY FOR 4 DAYS! Even when they weren't making noise the air conditioning was so loud you couldn't hold a conversation. We had people banging on our door at early hours of the morning and even one morning someone tried to get in at 6am. That same day house keeping came in at 7:30am when we were still sleeping. We told the front desk but they said it couldn't of been house keeping as they start at 8am. So if not them, then who had a keycard???Okay now for the most important part, THEY'RE NOT 4 STAR! That's right, we though they must have been a 2 star because of how bad everything was. So after some research and finding they are actually considered 3 star, not 4 in Greece. All in all, I would suggest to stay away from this place.
title: Would not recommend

review: We booked this hotel on our last night in Athens. It's a bit out of the way, but only a 20ish minute walk to the Acropolis Museum from here. We were upgraded to a suite, which was a nice touch. The carpet in the room was a bit outdated, but the bed was comfortable. We had a nice big balcony with a view of the Acropolis. Breakfast in the morning was decent.
title: Good for a Night

review: I stayed at the Epidavros as a one night stopover on the way to Patras. It is well located with nice clean rooms. The price included breakfast which is always most welcome! No roof terrace but this is definitely a good hotel to stay in for a short trip.The bus stop to Kiffisos Bus Station is just around the corner from the hotel which was perfect.
title: Good basic Athens Hotel

review: The breakfast was simple but good (good bread and croissants). The staff was nice and helpful.There was just one plug on the bedroom. This hotel was close to Omonia metro. The area isn't that great but the hotel was good.
title: Simple but good

review: The breakfast was ok and the man from reception. They can clean your room, but the smell by old furniture and the view, the location and people around you can't change that! Immigrants everywhere. You don't feel safe when you look at them! I'm sorry but this is the true! It was ok to be near to metro station, that's it!
title: Not a 3*** hotel!

review: If youre looking for luxury or a romantic break this hotel is absolutely not for you! It was very Spartan but clean and the staff (especially the older man on reception) were pleasant and helpful. The area however was terrible and felt very unsafe. We ended up having taxis as we felt nervous walking around by the hotel. Our balcony rail was very loose and really unsafe and on arriving home this morning found I have been bitten to death by bed bugs I assume!
title: Weekend away

review: I absolutely loved it! It's not a luxury place, but atmosphere was just amazing! Normally I go for more fancy hotels, but non of them had such a lovely stuff! Reception was super helpful, kind and friendly!they even didn't charge me for extra water I was ordering...Great location, everything around the corner (supermarket, beauty salon, tram, beach, very good night clubs. Also I would very recommend restaurant The president) Beds was are super comfy! pillows... I wish to take them home! Yes, bathrooms needs to be fixed, but still, I didn't expect perfection! For much better place you'll pay double money.
title: Love it!

review: We did enjoyed the stay and we felt as home. The staf is indeed first class. They are worm and nice people and make you feel good and welkomed. The hotel is indeed 4 stars but only the bathrooms need an update. In the 6 days we stayed at Blue Sea Hotel we started to love it and feel the pleasure of being well treated. The site is good and quiet and away from noisy trafic. The naiborhood is nice and cleen. It has the beach close...Bolivar beach is amazing...a must see. I would have wanted more traditional products on breacfast..like feta cheez or original sweets or patiserie products. I definetly recomend this place and for shure our next vacation will be at Blue Sea Alimos.
title: Best vacation in Athens.

review: Very good service, clean hotel, new things, good offer for that price, nice breakfast, near the beach and the clubs. They even offer more than mentioned (mineral water, coffee and tea in the room). Everything works (tv, telephone, air condition...). Recomended!
title: Great neighboorhood

review: Cozy small hotel in a nice, quiet part of Athens. Rooms with new furniture and a nice comfortable bed. There is English-speaking staff, service numbers, if needed, contact them immediately. It is not in the historical center of the city, but in the beach area. 5-10 minutes walk to the clean beach. Since the area is not a tourist, all shops, pharmacies, cafes and restaurants are focused on local residents, but there is no need for communication difficulties. Accordingly, taverns, cafes with good food, not to sell, high prices, because the area thriving, not far from the fashionable beaches of Athens. The historic center is about half a hour by public transport: tram, bus. Same number to go to the airport. Bus stops of public transport and bus eksperes to the airport five minutes on foot.
title: Good staff

review: My Family and I stayed here for 12 nightsThe staff were extremely friendly and welcoming. The rooms neat and tidy.Great location within walking distance to beaches, restaurants and public transport. Overall an amazing experience and would strongly recommend to all.
title: Outstanding Hotel and Service

review: We arrived in Athens on the way to Naxos, booked this hotel last minute based on trip advisors rating. I must say, Wow, this place is worth all its 5 stars. They are experienced in the hospitality industry. The front desk, Danae , Katerina and manager Dominik and the rest of the staff are wonder and paid a lot of attention to detail.The rooms, grounds and pool 5 stars. We then tried their restaurant which was also fantastic. Its 20 minutes from downtown Athens by cab. In a very upscale neighborhood . As i travel to my next island( Naxos) i have already booked my next stay here . As i consider myself a very hard to please , and demanding guest , but they came thru in such a Grand way.. I highly recommend this Hotel to all.
title: Stop over

review: I went with my friends on a quiet, warm weekday morning in July to have a swim. Even under heatwave tempeatures, the water is chilly making the swim unpleasant. The service is slow, unfriendly, and cold like the water. Never again- sorry.
title: Pool use

review: Perfectly adequate hotel. Rooms were clean and a reasonable size, all with balconies.Has a rooftop pool and bar area, but the pool is small and basic.Breakfast was the same every day, bacon, sausage, cheese, salad etc. Eggs always available but over-cooked. Tinned fruit rather than fresh was disappointing.Had one meal at the rooftop bar which was OK - nothing outstanding, although the moussaka was poor and microwaved.Location is great, 5 minutes to beach and tram to Athens, Restaurants and bars within a 10 minute walk along with shops.Staff helpful.
title: Great location, but not luxurious

review: Hotel is in a good location, close to Glyfada and not far from downtown Athens. Sufficient activities close to the location. Prices are fair; rooms on the 4th floor are the nicest; hotel and rooms were clean. Roof Garden (rooftop pool/bar) was the best feature with live music once a week and quality food/drink choices. Bartenders and senior staff were friendly and outgoing...they are the best.
title: Great Staff, Location, Roof Garden

review: I've stayed at this hotel everytime I've traveled to Greece. It feels like home. From the friendly staff that welcome you upon arrival to the cleaning staff that always say good morning and take time to ask how your day was. You can't ask for anything more. The rooms are very clean. Beautiful roof garden with a pool. Witch you can enjoy a nice meal a drink or a great coffee.We always chose this hotel year after year because makes it feel like home. Thanks to this great staff for making our stay once again pleasant.
title: Home away from home

review: We chose to visit Athens as it offered the best of both worlds - a historic city close to the sea - and the Emmantina is the perfect place to stay to enjoy both. Located centrally between the airport (a bus ride away with a stop outside the hotel) and central Athens (a tram stop 5 minutes walk away from the hotel) you can either explore the city or stay closer to the hotel and relax on the wonderful rooftop terrace or the local beaches. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Glyfada which boasts a wide range of shops and restaurants to suit all tastes. Rooms were basic but functional, and the breakfast good. The staff were friendly and (mostly) helpful - particularly Julie who was always able to offer advice and answer our many questions. Only one issue was the busy road in front of the hotel. The noise was loud and pretty constant which did restrict our use of the balcony - however, the glazing shut out most of the noise at night. Would definitely stay here again if we come back to Athens...
title: Great base for Athens break

hotelLocation: 385 Syngrou Avenue, Paleo Faliro, Athens 175 64, Greece
review: A clean and comfortable hotel. Maybe a little bit out of the heart of Athens but in the evening It took half an hour to arrive from the airport and all around there are some taverna and restaurants with some typical Greek food with convenient priceDefinitely I would advise this hotel to people traveling for business
title: One Night in Athens

review: Let's start with the positives:Friendly, helpful staff - great welcome Cloud 33 pool bar/restaurant - good food, lovely place to chill out in the evening and barman Chris was fabulous Pool good tooLocation - 10 mins from Alimos Marina so handy if you're hiring a yachtThe TV worksSo, the negatives:We booked a family room and got two rooms (not interconnecting) - ok for us as we have teens but not great for younger families.The rooms were functional at best. Decor dated (patched up in places) and they reeked of cigarette smoke. Shower woefully inadequate (fell out of its holder several times). Bulbs missing. It's on a VERY noisy main road (despite double glazed doors) and seemingly some rooms have thick blackout curtains and others not! Breakfast ... basic. Meat, cheese, bread, yoghurt etc all ok but overcooked cooked breakfast - fried eggs like rocks.We booked through BA and the reviews were ok but seriously this is a very basic hotel. We were here less than 24 hours and that was 12 hours too many.
title: Could do better

hotelLocation: 385 Syngrou Avenue, Paleo Faliro, Athens 175 64, Greece
review: The staff is very unhelpful, also there is a construction on going and even though I made reservation a month ahead they put us in the room next to the construction. The hotel is nice and the food is good
title: Unhelpful staff

hotelLocation: 385 Syngrou Avenue, Paleo Faliro, Athens 175 64, Greece
review: Absolutely loved this location. They had a bus to the city every day through out the day. The room needed a little updating. Besides that everything was perfect. Staff was super friendly. Great breakfast. Nice area it was located in we walked to a restaurant called Koytoyki and had the best dinner ever and for 5 people it was only $70.00. Great experience we wish we stayed here after our cruise. Also the lady who did my husbands hair gave him the best haircut he has ever gotten. She is so talented. Very good customer service also... we loved her! Please recognize her. Also management was great also. When I thought I left my passport they searched the room and was there for me. Great Customer service on the managers part also. Thank you all for a great stay. Can't wait to see the updates and to come back in the future with our family!!!!
title: Great Stay Great Location great staff!

hotelLocation: 385 Syngrou Avenue, Paleo Faliro, Athens 175 64, Greece
review: Fabulous hotel, breakfast buffet absolutely amazing, clean very fresh. Would give it a rating of 9 out of 10, travelled the world and I am extremely fussy. Staff friendly, free shuttle service available drop off to Acropolis, museum Marina and many more, driver very helpful.
title: Holiday

review: the staff is extremely helpful. Rooms were spacious. Air conditioning worked great. Great experience. Totally recommend to anyone Had lots of space for whole family. Kitchen facilities if we had chosen. Very nice
title: Excellent service!

hotelLocation: 385 Syngrou Avenue, Paleo Faliro, Athens 175 64, Greece
review: We stayed for 5 nights at Metropolitan Hotel in July 17.The hotel is undergoing renovation - and that is needed!!It old, dirty and not in a good condition. Right now if I had no other information I would rate it a 2 Star hotel. One time when I tried to open the door to our room from the inside, the door handle fell off!The renovation was noisy, the eggs in the morning buffet were rotten and the dinner on the roof top restaurant made my boyfriend and one of his kids ill.We complained about the noise and they moved is to a room a couple of floors up (so they did try to help) but it was still the same.With this description you might wonder why we gave it two stars. They are for the well equipt gym and the nice lifeguard by the pool. One of the kids forgot her Go Pro camera by the pool and he saved it for her for the next day.
title: 5 Star hotel?

review: Excellent cost satisfaction ratio. Personnel friendly, breakfast sufficient. Some rooms are noisyPosition is perfect, walking distance to syntagma, next to metro station along line to the airport.To be recommended.
title: Excellent location

review: Fabulous safe location, 5 minutes walk to the Metro with easy access to Plaka, the Acropolis etc. Staff were very helpful and friendly. The rooms were comfortable and spacious. Extra dining area and separate kitchen is ideal for anyone who might be eating in the apartment. The fridge/freezer was a great benefit especially in the heat.Plenty of restaurants/bars in the immediate area with a small kiosk outside the hotel also.Room for improvement:Breakfast (larger breakfast area and more food selection). Internet was OK. Hit and Miss at times, gone completely on occasions. Lift was out on service on a few days which makes it difficult when you're on the 4th floor and/or have mobility issues.
title: Fabulous location for City Break

review: My wife and teenage son and daughter stayed here while on holidays in Athens. It is the perfect place for a family to stay. The family apartment was generous in size with high ceilings good air conditioning and spotlessly clean! The staff at the reception were so friendly and helpful. The location is excellent with lots of restaurants nearby and it is a walk or short taxi to all the main attractions. Great value for money as well. Everything a family needs for a stay in Athens!!
title: Excellent venue for families

review: The Delice and its staff are wonderful and it was a great five week stay for our course. The breakfast is varied and healthy and the rooms are clean and have great facilities and social spaces. Excellent location
title: Wonderful long term stay!

review: Everything was better than expected; nice surroundings, nice pool, good breakfast and nice rooms. The beaches are nearby. Glyfada center with nice shopping, good restaurants and cafees are five minutes away. The tram takes you to downtown Aten.
title: Above expectation

review: This hotel is made for little people! And one person per room. I am little and I literally was banging into everything the rooms are so tiny the walls are paper thin. Thank god we were here for just two nights! Bring earplugs or you will be up all night. Only good thing, is this hotel is walking distance to a bunch of restaurants and shops on the strip,
title: Claustrophobic rooms

review: Rooms are clean,small but all you need. Some small maintenance jobs required but the hotel is still worth going to. The location is perfect, the staff are very friendly and helpful and cleanliness impeccable. The decor is very modern and nice. Close to a the beach, restaurants and shopping, all walking distance.
title: Service, cleanliness, staff, location perfect

review: Had a great stay. Hotel was nice clean and modern. Staff were helpful. Was across the street from great paid beach and tavern. Balux. Hotel had cozy pool and outdoor lounge area. Only prob was safe not working but we didn't ask to fix it. We would stay again.
title: Great hotel

review: The Athens Mirabello hotel is a nice choice for a cozy stay. The air conditioned rooms are very clean and wide with a balcony. The breakfast does not have a large variety but the food is of high quality. The hotel is very easily reachable from the famous Omonia square and its metro station. The hotel is overall a good choice.
title: Small hotel with nice rooms

review: Hotel Mirabello is located at Omonoia square which is the city center of Athens and nicely accessible to Metro and bus routes. The hotel is in a small building but the rooms are of decent size and was very clean and well-furnished. The breakfast was of good quality but the space was quite small and at certain times, it could be difficult to find an empty table. Overall, I was happy with my stay.The only downside was the method of payment. I booked from booking.com and I chose to pay at the property but the property had charged the first night without my consent. It had not been indicated that the first night is charged in the booking and I was a bit upset about this confusion.
title: Great location, nice rooms

review: Well! I had a very average stay here. All in all, the hotel is fine. Helpful and friendly staff etc.I was woken up by a large group of French students at 2am. This isn't the fault of the hotel but these people made it really hard to sleep. The plug in the bath was jammed shut and the water took all night to drain out which left soapy residue in the bath. I had a shower again the next morning and slipped in the bath because it wouldn't drain and the soapy water went above my ankles. I went to grab the shower screen as I fell (which moves about 180°) and it made the fall a lot worse. The staff member I spoke to didn't seem overly concerned. Thankfully I didn't injure myself too badly but I could have been a lot worse. The bed was comfortable. The room was spacious and well lit.The wifi was great.
title: Ok but not satisfied

review: This is very much a budget hotel. We had the smallest twin with tiny shower room. Paid £70 per night in July. However we had a view of the Acropolis from our bedroom and the rooftop terrace is amazing. If , like us you will use the terrace to rest after a days sightseeing , or sit and have drinks watching the sun set , this is a great place for you. However , if not then perhaps not! We found the hotel clean, in a great position and most of the staff were friendly and helpful.
title: Budget but great views

review: We stayed here in room #101 for 2 days and enjoyed the convenient location of the property. Very friendly staff always trying to help.Small room, even smaller elevator, but that is typical of any big european city.Rooftop terrace is a great place to relax in the afternoon and evening.Room is clean with decent size bathroom and functional AC with view of church.Alpha bank ATM and stores are next to the property.
title: Great location and friendly staff

review: Well situated in Plaka, 5mins from Acropolis, close to many restaurants and shops. Great views from rooftop terrace. Friendly staff, good for budget traveller. Stayed in room on third floor bathroom included - clean and tidy, good wifi, cheap basic breakfast.
title: Great location, perfect for budget travel

review: During our visit to Greece in June, 2017, we stayed at the Phaedra Hotel for a total of five nights and six days and we are glad that we did. Mr. Kostas, and especially Ms. Marianna Manolatou (the Business Manager), and Mr George, and the rest of the staff were individually and collectively accommodating, kind, generous with their advice, and helpful. (Language was never a problem.) Also, the reception desk personnel would call a taxi for us Ms. Marianna put in touch with a local travel agency to arrange for our road trips to various archeological sites in the Peloponnese. (The agency, whose services were good, is down the street from the hotel.) Our room on the third floor had a small but cozy balcony with a lovely view of the Acroplois and the Parthenon. (The hotel's roof-top also offers a similar view, only better! We made two late night sojurns there to enjoy the absorbing beauty of the famed Acropolis-Parthenon skyline all lit up and looking beautiful.) As for the amenities, the room had two twin beds, a perfectly working air-conditioning system, a clean bathroom, and wi-fi. The bed linens were fresh and spotlessly clean--every night we returned to the hotel to sleep. The hotel has an elevator---and it works, always!Situated in the heart of the Plaka and a stone's throw from the Arch of Hadrian, we could not have asked for a better location--the Acropolis (and the museum) was less than a five-minute walk; the Plaka Flea Market took us about ten minutes to get to, and the Syntagma Square with the Parliament Building, the National Botanical Gardens, and the eatreries and shopping centers was no more than a leisurely ten to twelve-minutes stroll. Cafes and restuarants, and shops line the immediate vicinity of the hotel and yet the premise itself is remarkably quiet. We are already making plans to return to Greece (and Athens) and when we do, we will definitely stay at the Phaedra again, no questions asked. And we have recommended the hotel to our family and friends as well.
title: A Great Stay!

review: This hotel is lacking in atmosphere, basic facilities, rooms and especially bathrooms in poor condition. It's an overpriced coach trip stopover in the middle of nowhere. I didn't enjoy my stay here at all.
title: Overnight stay

review: My family had a lengthy stay at this hotel, July 2017. It was my third time to stay here, and the rest of my family's second time. The staff, from Front Desk to Housekeeping, is extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast is great, and open from 6:30 to 10:00, and if they know you'll be a little later, they'll leave offerings out for you. The rooms are clean and tidy, and have most of what you'll need. We missed having a box of Kleenex tissue available in the room (perhaps that's a western thing?), and the bathrooms although clean and functional, could use larger shower areas. There's a small refrigerator and a safe in the room, and staff leaves a large bottle of water in it for you, as needed. It is a non-smoking hotel, but on our last 2 days/nights there, it was obvious someone was smoking on the 2nd floor. I brought it to the attention of the Front Desk. Lots of shops and restaurants a stone's throw away, a large park, churches, art galleries, and train to take you into Athens. Overall.... good experience, and would certainly use Hotel des Roses, again.
title: Great experience at Hotel des Roses!

review: The hotel has renovated and older rooms. The renovated ones are on the top floor. Family rooms (suites) have space but no balconies. Guadruple rooms have big balconies facing the street, but there are only two good beds. The rooftop pool, bar and view are spectacular. The area around the hotel is not so nice but there are small grocery stores and metro near. You can walk to Plaka and other more touristic places (taxi fare is less than 5 euros if you are too tired to walk back). Breakfast is good.
title: Hotel with a pool and spectacular view

review: Cons: The location of the hotel is seedy and horrible... as we walked from the metro stop to the hotel, men were breaking areas of the sidewalks to fill bottles with water from the underground pipes, litter was everywhere, and the area is severely run-down. I was embarrassed to bring my family and international guest to this hotel and neighborhood.Upon arrival, we were informed our Family room was on the 3rd floor. Once entered, it was clear it was a double room in which they tried to squeeze in a single bed and a rollaway. Chairs from the desk were moved to the foot of our double bed and crammed against the rollaway.Per my discussion with the check-in staff, we were moved to a family room on the 9th floor facing the back streets of Athens. We were informed that the room on the 3rd floor was indeed a family room (which I know it was not). Here's the description copied from their official website. "Dorian Inn Hotel offers a great variety of Standard Single, Double and Triple rooms and from the 9th to the 10th floor we offer Superior Double and Family rooms for an unforgetable* stay in Athens!"*original spelling from hotel websiteUpon departure at 1:00 p.m., we saw a man sitting on a doorstep, sniffing white substance and a woman sitting on the sidewalk with 1 adult dog and 2 puppies who appeared to be malnourished... so very sad. For all these reasons, I will not stay at Dorian Inn Hotel in the future.Pros: The breakfast was very good and the support staff was professional and accommodating. The rooftop pool and bar were very nice and offered fantastic views of the Acropolis and Athens. The pool was medium size and well maintained, but more sunbathing chairs should be provided.The family room was spacious and had central AC, minibar, small dining area, and a separating privacy screen. The bathroom was large and amenities were plentiful.
title: Run-Down Hotel and Seemingly Deceitful Booking Practices in a Neglected Inner City Area

review: Rooms were basic, good value and fitted our needs during our 3 night stay in Athens. The pool was refreshing after a day of sightseeing in hot temperatures. We enjoyed the rooftop bar and the lovely view from it. Location was good.
title: Hotel with a pool and nice view of Athens

review: First of all location is horrible, rooms are old, dark, dirty, and bathroom smells of urine. Breakfast selection was limited, and even the coffee was not appealing. We stayed at Dorian for 5 nights because we couldn't get a refund, they never cleaned our room. Don't stay at Dorian it's not worth it.
title: Horrible hotel

review: We had a good stay at this hotel. The lobby is very impressive. The staff weren't overly friendly but still professional. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The buffet breakfast that was included was good too.
title: Very Nice Hotel

review: Nice new renovated rooms. Corridors and cleaning service excellent! Nice breakfast good value for money. Nice helpfull staff. Nice location walking distance from plaka and ancient athens. The hotel is recomdnded
title: Nice hotel

review: Pros:1. close to metro, shops, and restaurants2. breakfast is pretty good3. decent priceCons:1. They allow smoking in the rooms and there is no such thing as smoking/non smoking rooms. Our room smelled like cigarette was burning, all day.2. The ac doesn't work well. It was 100+ degrees during our visit and the rooms were not cool enough.
title: Average hotel

review: The hotel was well priced and conveniently located in between two metro stations. The room was clean and all the amenities promised were in working order. The reception was very helpful and made our early check out a breeze. The room was fairly small and the view wasn't great but other than that it's a perfect choice for someone who just needs a place to sleep.
title: Everything I needed

review: The hotel lobby is beautiful. You have several areas to sit and relax. There is a little area for coffee and doughnuts, bagels etc. The staff is very nice, friendly and helpful. The room size was not bad for Europe. There is a fitness center, however, it is only open from 8-2. I was gone before 8 and did not return until after 2 so I was disappointed because I love to workout daily. The rooftop restaurant was awesome. The views are breathtaking! You can see The Acropolis and at night it lights up. The sunset views are amazing. Also, there is a buffet restaurant, the food is good but a lot of the same foods daily. Within walking distance to shopping district of Plaka.
title: Loving Greece

review: We enjoyed our stay at Titania Hotel. The staff were pleasant and helpful. It was on the main "hop on hop off" bus route. Also not too far from the Plaka by taxi. The rooms were good and clean, bathroom small but adequate. Delicious breakfasts.
title: July 2017

review: Titania Hotel is ideally situated in the heart of Athens and is only a short walk away from Syntagma Square and the shopping centre. My husband and I only stayed for two nights – before and after our trip to Syros – but we’ll definitely choose Titania for a longer stay next time we visit Athens.The rooms are spacious, functional and beautifully decorated. Cleanliness is impeccably meticulous and excellent sound insulation shuts out all the noise of the busy city. We were also pleasantly surprised to see that on our last night we were upgraded to a luxurious suite on the ninth floor with a breathtaking view to the Parthenon. As we had to catch the ferry to Syros very early in the morning, we greatly appreciated the early morning breakfast buffet consisting of a wide variety of jams, bread, rolls, croissants, cheeses, delicatessen, fruit, cereals and sweets. Normal breakfast includes hot dishes as well, such as eggs, omelette, bacon, baked beans.You should not leave Titania Hotel without having a drink or dinner at Olive Graden situated on the 11th floor and offering a superb view to the Pathenon by night. Although the restaurant is a bit pricey, it’s well worth the experience. The food is excellent and the service is impeccable. All the staff are very polite and helpful. For all these reasons, I strongly recommend Titania Hotel for couples, families or business.
title: A Great City Hotel

review: Larissa metro train station is 100 metres away. The room was clean & the pool on the top deck is a bonus. Only negative is that breakfast is basic and the bread on both mornings was stale. Reasonable value so no real complaints.
title: Good location with views

review: Right at the metrostation Larissa and therefore are almost all the attractions in Athens reachable within a few minutes. Friendly staff and nice pool With view over the city. The room was large, With airco, fridge and bath and balcony. A basis but nice hotel and very good value for money.
title: Right at the metro station and very good value

review: Third visit to the hotel oscar in the last three years and still as good as ever! You won't be able to beat this hotel for value and it's facilities are great! We all love the rooftop pool and the district in which it is set is friendly and great for an evening meal! Very handy for the underground as well! We will be back again!
title: Third visit

review: I have stayed at the hotel for three nights. My rating for the hotel is average. The building is old, the furniture as well and the breakfast is very poor. You can find a supermarket opposite the hotel. Therefore, the hotel has a great location (metro station next to the hotel) and is value for money. The staff is friendly and helpful. The only unpleasant incident that happened during our stay was that we had the do not disturb sign on the door and the housekeeper woke us up as she was trying to enter the room. I recommend it for people that are looking for a cheap getaway.
title: Great Location

review: I honestly wasn’t expecting too much before I arrived here, but was really happy when I did. The room was spacious with a comfortable bed and really nice bathroom. The aircon worked great and having the balcony with a really nice view made it even better.The rooftop bar and pool was amazing, offering stunning views of the city and and a secluded way to relax. Even though the pool is fairly small, it is normally quiet and so wasn’t much of an issue.The breakfast buffet was simple but nice and there was a decent selection of hot and cold food.
title: Extremely impressed

review: Granted the hotel has great location especially if your are in Athens for business and it's in walking distance from downtown Chalandri but you probably need to catch a ride with a taxi for the Metro or the Railway system. The lobby is well organized and you can toatally enjoy a quiet meeting. Breakfast at €20 per person is a ripoff, I can get a steak next door with the same money. The room had a great view on the Kifissias avenue but some towels had dirt marks, the paint from the ceiling was ffaaling due to humidity, some accessories from the hotel kits were missing (!) and there were no screens on the door to avoid mosquitos get in. Overall a God experience but overpriced for the level of service we got.
title: Overpriced for what

review: A very nice hotel in the Plaka district. Perfect for spending some days in Athens. Walking distance to the Acropolis, and to nice restaurants and bars. The staff was very helpful and gave us great advices for visiting the city. The hotel is kind of "old-stylish", very charming.
title: Great hotel in Plaka

review: This was our least favorite hotel in Greece. It was clean but lacked much real charm. We were in a family room and the arrangement was very awkward. I hadn't thought that stairs were going to be a problem but climbing the 62 steps up to our room after long hot afternoons out exploring the city was not fun. Breakfast was good but I never got my coffee until we were finished eating and the others in the family were anxious to get on with the day while I was still waiting for it to cool enough to drink. So, nothing really bad but just not as good compared to our other hotel experiences.
title: OK but not great

review: This hotel is in a great location. An easy walk to Syntagma Square, the Plaka, the subway and the Acropolis. It was a wonderful surprise, the first night, when I went out on the little balcony and I could see the Acropolis lite up on the hill. We were there during a terrible heat wave. One day when we returned our air conditioning was not working. Panic. The person at the front desk got us help immediately and we had a comfortable room with an hour. The breakfast was quite good as well.
title: Great Location-Attentive Services

review: Dimitri is very helpful host , he takecare of me and my twin sister with all advices regarding Athens and all cafes where we can stay include our future visit to his country. Nikolas the morning host give us a free map and pin the imp locations for sightseeing, as well as, help us with the taxi service to go to the airport and our safe box when it was blocked.The hotel location is very good, the hotel is clean and amazing value for money, the hosts are really friendly and attentive to the hotel customers. They give great service all the best and success to that hotel and people working in it makes it successful
title: Amazing host& attentive to customers

review: My wife and I stayed here on the tail end of our honeymoon before heading back home. We really enjoyed our stay at the Stanley. It's an old and historic hotel that has been well maintained and updated through the years. We felt it was very well located with respect to the main touristic highlights, and the view of the Acropolis from our room was amazing. It's very well priced, and I'd highly recommend it to someone looking to experience Athens.
title: Athens Hotel

review: We were a group of friends (mid 40's) staying here for a long weekend and we loved it. Price-quality is top! Nice modernised room with a small balcony facing a quiet street. The staff at reception and at breakfast very polite and helpful. The receptionist going out of his way to recommend places to eat and calling them to reserve for us. Breakfast is at the roof top terrace with a view of Athens and Acropolis. Beautiful! Good breakfast selection with greek yoghurt, fruit, bread, eggs, cheeses etc. The area Exarchia is really cool with a very anarchist vibe, lots of bars playing alternative rock, restaurants with good and very cheap local food, felt very safe, hardly any tourists. We loved it.
title: Nice quiet hotel in lively area

review: This hotel is used for student travel groups and, this , can be noisy. Lower cost rooms are not very clean . It is also in an iffy part of town. However, staff are helpful and breakfast has a lot of choices. It is very close to the metro , so within a few minutes you can be in the main tourist area.
title: Close to metro, nice pool area,

review: Whilst not in the most salubrious of locations, The Stanley is right for the price. Our spacious room was one of the refurbished rooms and it was very clean, comfortable and quiet. The front desk staff are efficient and very welcoming, providing top notch personal service to all guests despite how many check ins they were dealing with. Commendable. Unfortunately, I didn't really get the same vibe from the roof top bar staff.Plenty of variety and choices in the buffet breakfast served in the sun filled Livingston room. And there seemed to be a Greek barista on hand to personalise your coffee order. So great start to the day.It's handy to the metro and there's a 24/7 bakery conveniently located on the corner downstairs. If you're looking for a clean, economical hotel and not too fussed with location, you can't go wrong with The Stanley.
title: Right for the price

review: When I first arrived at this hotel I was pleased with the look of it, it was clean and well presented. The streets around the hotel are not very nice but exploring the area further many streets in the Athens area seem run down. But once you are in the hotel you feel far away from it all. The hotel is located right near the metro station so you don't have far at all to go if you want to catch the train.I stayed in a room on floor 6 - the room was a nice size and very clean. The only let down was the balcony view, it was overlooking other hotels and a dirty street. But this didn't really bother me too much as I didn't spend much time in the room as I was out exploring Athens. The bed was very loud and creaky, any movement in the bed made a loud sound - sounded like it was going to collapse. In the mornings from half 6 to half 10 is the breakfast buffet. There is lots to choose from whether you want cereal to a fry up. One night at the hotel I decided to have dinner at the hotel restaurant which is located on the 9th floor (top of the hotel) it had a great view of the Acropolis - you can choose to sit inside or outside to eat. The menu didn't have much food choice. I went for the burger, it looked great but came out cold so I had to ask them to warm it up. The waiters were polite and apologetic. The afters were lovely. Next to the restaurant is a little bar area that you can sit at and watch the telly. After having a dinner here which was a let down I decided to try the room service as it looked cheap and had a lot more choice then the hotel restaurant. The food from room service was tasty - so would recommend using this rather than going to the hotel restaurant. The pool is also on the ninth floor, it has a few sunbeds and seats around it. The pool isn't huge but it is long enough to have a little swim. On the 4th floor is they gym- but I never visited this.Overall I would recommend this hotel as it's good value for money. The staff are polite and helpful. The hotel is clean and well looked after. It is opposite the metro so makes it easy to travel to places.
title: Pleased

review: Probably the worst hotel we stayed at during our trip around Greece. Not only was the entrance of the hotel hard to find, but the rooms shown in the pictures look absolutely nothing like what a standard room at The Stanley looks like. The management informed us that those are only the specialty suites. It was outdated, small, and not renovated but thankfully after enough complaining, we were "upgraded" to a bigger room but with the same outdated features. The pool and rooftop bar are also highly exaggerated based on the photos and even with a 50% discount card for your first drinks everyone gets as a guest, you are paying more for beers than at any of the surrounding restaurants. The bed was pleasant and it was convenient to get to the city center with a metro station out front. Avoid the taxis if you can, they are quite expensive and the drivers are very rude. The 4 star rating is not justified with this hotel, it is closer to a 2-star hotel.
title: What to Know About The Stanley.

review: I stayed there for few days of a business meeting. All in all I can say that I had a really good time in the Hilton hotel Athens. I liked the pool area and the amazing view of the rooftop bar. The price for a drink are not acceptable in my point of view. Rooms and floors are clean and quiet. Breakfast for an international hotel: very good!
title: Good from the inside

review: This stay was just one day/night but was during one of the hottest days in recent years and I was extremely comfortable during the entire stay! Beautifully air conditioned rooms, pool to refresh and relax and the pool side restaurant so I didn't need to leave the property. Honestly, I can't say anything bad about this property. Have been a customer for business & leisure for 20 years and have never been disappointed. Thank you for making my "short" stay perfect!!!
title: Another happy customer

review: The Hilton is a nice hotel. It is one of the taller buildings around the area and I had a direct view of the Acropolis from the balcony. There are many restaurants around the area and it's under 2 miles to the Acropolis and less to Mount Lycabettus/Church. If you walk to Lycabettus, watch out for a road about 2 blocks just before getting to the tram station. It has numerous restaurants which I recommend you try.Staff was efficient and courteous. Room was clean. There was a nice concierge lounge with great views. No negatives that I can think of other than it could be a little closer to the tourist attractions but don't think its fair to ding Hilton too much for that and anyone should be able to walk 2 miles as a tourist.I did not try the hotel restaurants as I wanted to try the local cuisine. For transportation, Uber works great but don't think they have spread out beyond Athens yet. There are yellow cab taxi's but I prefer Uber because they speak English, pre-arranged fares, overall nicer cars, and more professional.Would I come back? Yes for business and with family
title: A very nice hotel

review: Key points: The hotel is one block from Evangelismos subway. We were able to easily take the subway and walk to all the major sites and museums from this hotel. We enjoyed the outstanding breakfast buffet each morning. We did not use, but were impressed by the quality of the hotel fitness facilities and indoor and outdoor pools. We encountered a problem with our first room, and were offered another room immediately. Both first and second rooms were clean and well-appointed. Rooftop bar overlooking the Acropolis was a lovely capstone to an evening of touring. Front desk and business centre staff were all very helpful. Lastly, we also very much appreciated how quiet our room was - the windows are very well insulated - like what we've experienced in places with hurricane glass. Between that and being on an upper flooor, we were not conscious of traffic noise at all. There was minor noise transfer from the adjacent room through the wall. Hallways were thickly carpeted and sound was quite muted.
title: Light and open conference hotel with great amenities and service

review: Staying here at the moment been here 3 nights. Regularly stay in Hilton hotels and various other 5 stars around the world . Booked the Hilton as one of higher rated hotels in Athens and thought it was a good bet, that it would be a good hotel with excellent Hilton service . Unfortunately it is VERY disappointing. The building doesn't look great from the outside and the lobby area is average at best. It was my wife's birthday and emailed ahead to see if they could do anything to make our stay more special and asked if it would be possible to get a nice room with a view . Unfortunately the room is on 3rd floor right outside the noisy ice machine dispenser. Asked to be moved but rooms offered had no view and were very dark. They said they had arranged a cake for her birthday when I flagged that I was hoping for something in the room - but I wasn't sure if they were just saying they had arranged something when I asked about it. I asked for it to be in The room at 7 as we had to go for a mealAt 730. Nothing turned up. When we returned from our meal the cakes were in the room, but after a 5 course meal we couldn't eat them . We asked for the cakes to be taken away the next day as they had been there over night and it took over an hour to come and collect. The room is ok apart from the noisy ice machine , but not up to usual Hilton standards . There is no complimentary water offered which is probably the first hotel we have stayed in where we have not been offered this. There is also no room in the fridge to store anything i.e. The cakes that were sent to the room. Also the bathroom and Shower are average with no wow factor. Also no turn down service - which was abit of a disappointment. Service overall I would say is below average - ladies in entrance to the fitness centre /spa had bad attitude and looked like I was annoying them when wanted access to the gym. Also when I asked for a towel for the pool for me and my wife they were reluctant to give me one as is only one towel per person - I must look like I was going to steal the towels ! In terms of prices for food and drinks I expect to pay more in hotels but 20 euros for 2 beers and 30 euros for 2 cocktails is slightly ridiculous. Also 21 euros for a sandwich is abit of a joke. Service by the pool also poor , on the first day we had to keep going to the bar to get drink as not enough waiting staff. Today I asked a waiter to get me a drink but he said it wasn't his job, despite being in a blue shirt carrying glasses of water . After some negotiation he agreed to get my drink though it took 20 mins to arrive. If you are thirsty be prepared to wait! Our flight leaves early evening tomorrow I'm hoping they will allow us to leave luggage somewhere so we can sit by the pool for the afternoon and hopefully they will provide somewhere to shower, but i don't hold much hope and I'm sure if there is a way they can charge me they will! Oh on a positive the reception staff are pleasant. Over and out
title: Not quite a hilton

review: This hotel really gets service and perfectly looked after me and my family in Athens. They could not have done more to ensure a difficult situation was handled with real care, understanding and empathy. Couldn't ask for more and would never stay anywhere else in Athens.
title: Best of the best

review: I started here prior to a cruise of the Mediterranean and it was great. A free shuttle to the plaka and a great view on the top floor of the acropolis. The breakfast buffet was delicious with fresh food and delicious Greek yogurt.The room was nice too and staff was friendly and accommodating. Got there at 9:00 am they were able to get us a room. I'd recommend this hotel, they even recommended a great restaurant near by with good Greek food.
title: Great hotel with great view of Acropolis

review: Although the hotel is about a 20- 30 minute walk from the Plaka area, it is one of the nicest hotels in Athens. Beds are very comfortable and rooms are large with good air conditioning which is hard to find in Athens. Spend the extra money and get a club level room. The club level has breakfast every day which is very good along with snacks, canapes, drinks and desserts throughout the day. Sandwiches and wraps at lunch and free drinks in the evening. This made it very nice to wind down after a long day of sightseeing in Athens. Service was also very good and the club lounge had excellent views of the Acropolis and out door dining.
title: Splurge for the Club Level

review: I stayed here for 6 nights with my two kids, and we had fun. The hotel rooms and facilities are great. However, I did find that the service was sub par. Often the reception desk was under staffed to handle the load, the concierge failed us twice when we wanted help. The first was when we wanted help with setting up our prepaid sim card, the concierge told us they didn't know how and referred us to the business center, where the staff there also said she didn't know how to do it. The second time was when I called the service desk and asked the staff to help me in calling for delivery from a nearby restaurant. He told me he was too busy to help as he was dealing with many other people at his desk. He could've have declined in a nicer way.The food was average as well.The room was good, but I had a terrible view on the first floor, try to get a higher floor for a better view.
title: Great Hotel, average service

review: We stayed at this hotel for two nights with only one day to explore Athens.Firstly, the hotel. It was, on first appearances, very large and quite impersonal. However, the staff are very friendly and professional and the room was exceptionally well equipped, large and cool. We were on the first floor and a little disappointed not to have a view of the Acropolis but to be honest we were rarely in the room. You quickly negotiate the hotel and breakfast provided a very good choice of food and not just the usual; smoked salmon, freshly cooked eggs or omelettes and very well stocked fruit and cereals. If you want a traditional English breakfast, the options are there but we found the continental options much better as the bacon etc was not the warmest.Secondly, where to eat at night. If you turn right out of the hotel and then immediately right again, you will see a sign for Vassilios Taverna. It is worth a visit. Don't be put off by the area. The food there was very good and very reasonable. Rest on your first night if you are not sure where to go.Finally, exploring from the hotel. We had a taxi to the Acropolis at 8am and it cost €5. If you hold a student discount card (NUS Extra) - use it! Most of the tourist attractions are free for students and we worked out that we saved about €60, which was some saving. We also used the tram back to the hotel and then back into Athens in the evening for about €1.40 each per journey.
title: A great base to explore from and a very comfortable hotel

review: We arrived in Athens on one of the hottest days. Our room was on the 3rd floor. There is no lift but the walk was worth it as our room was a cool oasis. A door by our room lead to the roof terrace with a view of the acropolis. The air conditioning worked brilliantly and enabled perfect sleep. The hotel is a short walk from a variety of places to eat and within walking distance of the major sites. The room was spacious and clean and the staff friendly.
title: Perfect stopover

review: I would highly recommend this hotel. It was clean, had a very comfortable bed, was only a short distance to the Acropolis, had a spacious balcony with fantastic views (especially at night) and the customer service was outstanding. The staff went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable and I am only sorry that I didn't get the name of the man on reception who did everything to ensure I found some taramasalata so that I could thank him by name. At such a great price there are no bad words to say about this hotel and we will be returning!
title: Incredible customer service!

review: We stayed at this hotel for one night before heading to the Greek islands. This hotel was a good price and very well located for seeing everything we needed to see for one day in Athens, such as the Acropolis, Acropolis museum and the Plaka neighbourhood. The entrance area is nicely decorated and our room was a reasonable size and air conditioned. There was free wifi. However there is no lift so you must carry your bags up a spiral staircase! A great stay.
title: Affordable hotel in Plaka

review: The room was clean and the decor was very nice and fitting to Athens.The staff were very helpful and went out of their way to ensure a pleasant trip and the hotel itself was in a good location. Overall, wonderful accommodation.
title: 'Wonderful hotel'

review: Great location and price. Easy to get to from Syntagma Square metro station (re for airport). Small compact room and bathroom, (in case that is a concern?). I was travelling alone so all fine for me. Boutique hotel and decor, lovely entrance to reception. Great for Plaka, for restaurants, wandering around and shops. Reception staff friendly and great for any information. Fantastic restaurant about 5 mins walk away called "Athinaikon" 34, Mitropoleos Street (road parallel with the road the hotel is on. Recommend you go to the top (3rd floor) and see the some of the Acropolis from the roof top at night and in the day time ( I have added some photos from the roof top area). They don't serve breakfast but lots of places available within walking distance. Would stay here again.There is NO LIFT. Please be warned. Fortunately a lovely American guy came in just after me and very kindly offered to take my heavy suitcase up the 2 flights of stairs to my room. Thanks again, if you read this! I managed to slowly carry my suitcase down and the young lady assisted me when she saw me descending once near the reception. Otherwise bring a strong man with you!! My room initially smelt of stale smoke.
title: Lovley boutique hotel in great location in Plaka

review: We're not picky and not spoiled, but we didn't like the room. The beds are very hard and there are no extra pillows or blankets. TV has only two English language channels. Everything else is in Greek. The bathroom is tiny, the shower super-tiny, and the water kept flooding the entire floor. Everything is less than average. On a positive note, the staff is super friendly and helpful. Breakfast was ordinary but nice. Bottom line: it was a good deal budget wise, but would have paid a bit more for a nicer stay.
title: Great staff, uncomfortable room

review: The bedroom was ok, but the bathroom the worst one I've ever used in a hotel. The location is ok, next to tube stations and 15 min walking to the acropolis, but the streets around were just ugly and I didn't feel safe. The staff was nice and helpful. I don't recommend for people in holidays, just for fast business trips.
title: Nice staff and breakfast... that's it!

review: When the best thing you can say about the hotel is that you liked the front desk staff.....you know it's not great. Truly, the guys at the front desk were very helpful and professional. We booked an eight day Greek vacation after backpacking and self guiding ourselves through Italy for 4 weeks through an Aegean travel agency. We had two nights in Athens before heading to Sifnos and Serifos islands and then one night in Athens again, before ending our trip. We were picked up at the airport and transferred to Hotel Economy by a great taxi driver. I guess, we should have known by the Hotel name what kind of place it would be. First of all. It's basically in the "Red Light District" as I would call it. There are Therese's shops/theaters two minutes in any direction. The hotel is very dated. The beds are hard, and the pillows are harder. The bathroom is barely big enough to change your mind. They could use plastic shower curtains, you flood the bathroom when you shower. Thank goodness for drains in the floor. You have to sit on the toilet to shave your legs, actually...sort of handy. The refrigerator doesn't work when you leave the room (it's connected to the key) so there's no chance to have cold water when you return from your shopping or tour. It's very noisy outside as well as above you. The continental breakfast starts ta 8:30, that's late if you're from the US. It's a pretty typical Greek/Italian spread. We had to leave early two of the three mornings we were there and one morning they opened early, that was really nice. The other morning we had to leave at 5:00am so they packed us a breakfast for the road, that was much appreciated. Again, the guys at the front were great, the hotel is just lacking. I would not stay here again.
title: Nice front desk staff

review: I stayed at Economy for two days before meeting a friend in the Cyclades. The room was nice with a small balcony. Staff were helpful- loaning me a charger for my computer when I forgot my converter, providing directions etc. Breakfast is a very simple buffet but fine. The location is great and I would stay there again.
title: Nice simple hotel

hotelLocation: 48 Charilaou Trikoupi Str., Kifisia, Athens 145 62, Greece
review: We have returned to the Hotel since we have an outstanding stay the first time around. I say outstanding, as we believed small improvements could be made. Well, we were in fact, pleasantly surprised. This Hotel is really at the pinnacle of excellence. Decor, service, professionalism.We ordered Room Service which arrived on time and very well presented. The front office staff is efficient and very helpful.Semiramis has earned its place among the greatest and we look forward to returning!
title: It has now reached perfection

hotelLocation: 48 Charilaou Trikoupi Str., Kifisia, Athens 145 62, Greece
review: Stayed there in June 2017. Was fully booked so booked the standard room. Comfortable beds and clean and would stay again. My only issue which very annoying is Seminaris blocked the room fee on my credit card at time of booking which somewhat aggressive but can understand but did not unblock the amount nearly one month after our stay despite having been paid in full on my card on checkout. Called twice and got all sorts of excuses why not unblocked including "contact your bank" which obviously nonsense as Seminaris are the only ones that can unblock it. Hopefully sorted soon but its the first time this has happened in Greece.
title: Good hotel in Kifisia but credit card issue

hotelLocation: 48 Charilaou Trikoupi Str., Kifisia, Athens 145 62, Greece
review: We wrapped up our long trip to Greece with a very relaxing, yet inspirational (in terms of architecture and design) two-night stay here and loved it. The hotel was a bit of a "scene," with trendy people and such, but still felt comfortable for our family. The kids absolutely loved the pool and simply seeing the pop art decor. We loved it all.
title: Cool vibe. Great location.

hotelLocation: 48 Charilaou Trikoupi Str., Kifisia, Athens 145 62, Greece
review: When I saw the photos of the hotel I didn't know what to expect. In real life it's not as over the top as you might think.The superior room was spacious with a balcony and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful.The hotel is located in a nice area with a short walk to shops and restaurants.I would stay here again.
title: Great location and good stay

review: It was our 3rd visit in Athens, and also 3rd - in Adrian hotel. It was renovated since our previous visit in 2015, and all the facilities in the room were modern and clean. We admire breakfasts on the terrase with Acropolis view. The best location - close to the city centre, we've never use transport visiting different sites... Quiet place, even the window is on the Adrianou street. A lot of restaurants and shops nearby. We will stay again in Adrian Hotel next time.
title: Our choice in Athens

review: If you want a well priced hotel to explore the city then the Adrian is perfect. Located on a bustling street in the centre of plaka within easy reach of all attractions. Lovely roof terrace for breakfast too.
title: Top location

review: For our week in Athens we stayed at the Adrian Hotel, on one of the main streets of Plaka and just around the corner from Monastiraki (square, markets and metro). The neighbourhood is full of taverns, shops and sites. It was the ideal location, a short distance away is the Roman and Ancient Agora plus if you look up you'll catch glimpses of the Acropolis. The hotel is small but very comfortable. Our room had a balcony overlooking the main street but was quiet. Breakfast is served on the rooftop with a great view of the Acropolis. What a great way to wake up in the morning.The staff were always helpful with suggestions for tours and sightseeing. The Air con was a lifesaver during the heatwave too.I would definitely return to this hotel, it's location and facilities are a winner for me.
title: Little Hotel between Plaka and Monastiraki

hotelLocation: Eleftheriou Venizelou 154, Nea Erithraia, Athens 146 71, Greece
review: The location is nice, the room confortable, the staff kind. The breakfast could be more various but it's ok. The courtesy set is very good, I' got also a gift of small lavander powder. But I wonder why out of Italy only in few hotels the bidet is available, it's so useful! I don't like the wc-bidet all in one as they have
title: Nice and confortable

hotelLocation: Eleftheriou Venizelou 154, Nea Erithraia, Athens 146 71, Greece
review: The hotel is located a bit north of Athens in a nice residential area. You are located far away of the touristic center, so you get more i touch with `real`Athens. The area seemed us very safe. In the center of Nea Erithtrea - some 10-15 min. by feet - you find both local taverns and sophisticated restaurants. By taxi, it takes about 10 min./5 € to go to Metro-Station Kifissià. About 30 min. later you are downtown Athens. The advantage staying a bit outside is, that the place is located a bit higher and so it is much fresher than in the lower centre.If you are sensitive to noise, you should consider that the hotel is near to a street with plenty of traffic, so you cannot sleep with open windows. But the noise is drasticly reduced with closed windows.
title: Nice place out of town, very nice and helpfull staff

hotelLocation: 35 Leoforos Possidonos, Paleo Faliro, Athens 175 61, Greece
review: I stayed at the hotel for 6 days, the rooms where clean, along with basic toiletries provided. However I would not class the hotel as a four star. The breakfast was mediocre, but the scenery of the coastline was a magnificent treat. The street noise, with the addition of cars driving past could heard at night. As i am not a light sleeper it wasn't much of an issue. But you can request a room away from the main road. Tea/ coffee making facilities were provided as part of the stay. One certain element which I wasn't very impressed with was, no clean tea drinking cups had been provided on two separate occasions. I was left with dirty cups. The main guest elevator broke down a few days into our stay. Noise can be heard from nearby rooms e.g.: loud talking, doors shutting, and people pacing up and down the corridor. On one occasion the kitchen associated with the hotel ran out of energy, to supply the kitchen. The cook was tad rude when explaining this. The reception are happy to help with any queries, our taxi requests were dealt with efficiently. Spare ice was provided for each floor, as it was a warm week.Overall it's a clean hotel, with a beautiful view. Hotel provides you with all the basic requirement to ironing, fridge etch, printing with no additional chargers. You can access the nearby tram stop to make your way into the city centre. The hotel is approx 45mins away from syntagma square on a tram. If you looking for something closer to the city centre then this may not be the ideal location.
title: Great stay, requires a few improvements

hotelLocation: 35 Leoforos Possidonos, Paleo Faliro, Athens 175 61, Greece
review: I have stay many times in this hotel and always was clean it is in a very nice place close to nice shops and restaurants . if you will have sea view room will be great . do not forget to taste the food at the rastaurant it is perfect
title: very GOOD HOTEL and food

hotelLocation: 35 Leoforos Possidonos, Paleo Faliro, Athens 175 61, Greece
review: Very good place in a great location.Across the street from a beach, 5 min walk to a beach with chairs etc. Many tavernas and bars around.Tram just outside connects with all public transport within Athens, loved it.Breakfast was decent, and is served in a room with amazing view over the sea.
title: Great location, neat and clean

hotelLocation: 35 Leoforos Possidonos, Paleo Faliro, Athens 175 61, Greece
review: Ok this was our first hotel we stayed at once touching down in a very hot Athens, was a little hard to locate but that was the fault of google maps so buy a gps with Athens maps and you will find it without an issue, the staff are great with there customer service and extremely helpful, we had a room viewing the bay and it was A1 along with the big balcony and comfy outdoor setting. Beds were very comfy as i find it hard to fall asleep in certain beds i / we all fell asleep come night very quickly and woke up refreshed. Breakfast was part of our stay and boy oh boy it was tasty hot and fit for a king and you can help yourself as many times as you please, coffee was real as to was juices and if you have a sweet tooth then you will love there Greek cakes, also they cater for the kids as well and plenty of fresh fruit, cereals all you can imagine. The pool was tops, its built around of an accent setting along with modern and comfy sun lounges and sofas also very shady areas if you don't want to tan,oh and before i forget every room has a split system air con which will keep you nice and cool during this heat wave that's sweeping Greece. Only downside is the restaurant, chef really go back and learn the basics of a good old fashioned Greek meal and the amount you serve up, If the dishes were tastier and larger for what you charge then you would get tipped more often rather than been offended when your only given 1.00 eu tip which you should be happy with. i believe the chef that does breakfast runs circles around you 10 times over and he has a hell of a lot more customers to deal with yet he doesn't get to interact with them nor can you physically tip him so suck it up and deal with it.
