As for the management well done on listening to your customers and refreshing and updating your decor, in all 4.8 stars and would recommend anyone as you will not be disappointed.. see ya next year Coral
title: Terrific hotel, comfy beds, great views, and breakfast fit for a king, plus very helpful staff

review: Location is fantastic, the staff are so friendly and helpful, the overall appearance and cleanliness of the hotel is very good. Felt very welcome and safe here. Our room was cleaned and towels changed daily. Honestly can't fault Palmyra Beach, thank you so much for a wonderful 4 night stay :)
title: Absolutely fantastic!!

review: Currently staying in one of the the 'new' rooms and very impressed. Excellent value. Pool is just right and bar food and drinks are good standard. Staff are all very good and professional and friendly too. Beach is literally two mins away, 30 seconds if you run. 10 min walk to the town with some really nice places to eat. Tram is about 5 min away which is great although the buses seem quicker (Greek driving I think!). Breakfast is really very good value. Good selection of hot and cold and all sorts. Cleanest hotel I've been to for a while and I've been to a few with work. There's a bus stop outside the front of the hotel - worth looking into for the airport run otherwise expect to pay over €45 for a taxi. We did. Felt robbed. Although on a main road the hotel is accessed via a quiet side road and the beach is out the back over another not too busy road. Really it's fine. Out of town - about 45 min on a tram but if you want out of town then book it.
title: Family holiday. Happy times

review: Me and my girlfriend stayed there for about a week, hotell was really nice and clean, we got an economic room which was amazing tbh, it was better than what we expected. The staff are really nice, friendly and helpful, cleaning ladies are really good at their job. It is very close to the beach, like 3min walk to glyfada beach, buss amd tram stops are very close, and it was really quite room tbh. We get free coffee and tea, and they were good. Service is 24/7.
title: Friendly and nice staff

review: I am writing this review to inform people of this very beautiful Hotel my 3 friends and I stayed on the top floor room 201 it was outstanding all newly renovated and soooo spotless every day cleaned with lively fresh towels and linens a lovely friendly cleaning lady also a wonderful air conditioning room to come back to in to every day the room was stunning amazing facilities in it and a balcony view to die for. A gorgeous American breakfast awaited us every morning and once again so clean with lovely staff to greet us. On arrival the reception staff were incrediably friendly and welcoming and nothing was to much trouble for them at all. The pool bar restaurant was gorgeous opened daily serving lovely delicious food and drinks amazing coctails. The life guard George was one of the loveliest people we met on the holiday just a pure gentlemen. He had fresh pool towels for us and anything we wanted he hit amazing service from all of them. I would recommend Panorama resturant (I will do a seperate review later) about 15 minutes away in taxi the most amazing seafood resturant on our trip) Also Athens Sailing tours amazing!!! This Hotel in offers everything yes it is 1 hour by tram or €20 daytime by taxi to Plaka wonderful area but you have the beach and beautiful area of Gylfada as well I cannot wait to vusit thus beautiful country and Hotel again tgank yiu to all at Palmyra Beach Hotel for looking after us so well.
title: Amazing Stay!!!!

hotelLocation: 35 Leoforos Possidonos, Paleo Faliro, Athens 175 61, Greece
review: Coral Hotel is a nice hotel with a great location. This is not a resort hotel but a friendly local establishment that we would stay at again. We stayed at the hotel because of a recommendation of one of our sailing coaches who lives in the area. It's walking distance to all the marinas in Paleo Faliro and there are a lot of restaurants both inland of the hotel and on the beach. The rooms are a little small, we had the family suite as we traveled with a friend of ours. It comprised of two double rooms with bathrooms and a living room. Both rooms had balconies and the noise from the busy street in front was almost completely negated by the two layers of patio doors. The only down point was one of the rooms had an older AC unit and it barely kept up with the heat in July. Maid service was good and overall the rooms were comfortable. Views were very good but only enjoyable after 7pm due to the heat. The highlight of the Hotel are their restaurants. The breakfast room is on the 7th floor and does a very nice job with full service. Its extra for the latte's but go ahead and order one, they were inexpensive and good. Breakfast is usually included but ask anyway when you reserve. The Breakfast Manager was very helpful, unfortunately we didn't get his name but he ran a tight ship and no need to go to Starbucks 3 blocks down the street. The main restaurant was excellent. The food was simple Greek and Italian cuisine and the Manager, Vasilis, was very friendly and introduced us to a wide selection of Greek Wines. If you're a wine person you can trust him with the selection. The other staff were great too but we didn't get their names. The beer is cold.Other comments on the hotel:Ask the front desk for local restaurants as they gave us some great recommendationsATM is around the corner Walk along the seawall north and visit the big marina for a dock walk at night. We felt safe and there are some nice restaurants in the marina too.Grocery is also around the corner. no need to go to the bigger one about 15 blocks away. Go down to the Poseidon for a beach dinner one night. very charming.Taxi to the attractions in Athens about 12 EUR. Pool is nice but too hot during the day. Go for a swim across the road at the beach.
title: 12 days @ the Coral Hotel for the 420 Europeans (sailing).

review: I stayed in this hotel with my disabled daughter. What can I say? Excellent!! From the receptionists to the cleaners to the pool man (George and lefteris). Helpful nothing is too much trouble. Rooms are spacious with a small fridge and safe. A tv is also in the room but maimly greek channels. Room cleaned everyday if needed. Towels supplied around the pool by the lifeguard who also supplied gallons of water if and when needed. Food was excellent and reasonably priced. There's no real downside to this hotel. The beach is two minutes from the hotel with their own umbrellas. Plenty of transport to visit Athens or down the coast to Sounion....This hotel I will definitely visit again! Well done the Palmyra Beach hotel.
title: Fantastic!

review: My family and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, every thing is new, in high standard.It is very easy to reach from airport to the hotel, and to the main attractions, as the metro station is only 3 minutes by foot.Very nice, professional and very helpful staff - thak you!I recommend this hotel!
title: very nice hotel

review: My daughter and I just spent 11 days at Holiday Suites and we had a great time. The rooms are really large and well equiped and the staff is very pleasant and helpful. We had most of our breakfasts at the nearby Crowne Placa as the selection is a little bit larger there and the view is magnificent, but the breakfast at Holiday Suites is quite good also. Going to the city centre is very easy, only two metro stops to Syntagma and three to Monisteraki. The best way to get to the hotel from the airport is also by metro. Go off at Megarou Mousikis, take the escalator to the left when leaving the station. Then you walk around the corner by the cafeteria, go down the street two blocks, then you see a blue sign saying "Holiday Suites 30 m.". Prices are 10 euros for a single ticket, but there are discounts for return tickets and for groups starting already at two persons. Although bus X95 is cheaper, I recommend the metro.My only complain would be the Wi-Fi. That was cumbersome, and we constantly had to log in with a quite long and complicated username and password instead of being automatically connected.
title: Great place to stay

review: Greece was the first stop for my family vacation and this hotel was just what we expected. It's a little jewel in an area that reminded me of Brooklyn, NY in the 1980's. We loved the staff and the rooms are completely as pictured! I would stay here again!
title: It was just what we expected.

review: Can't say enough great things about this hotel. It is located on a quiet residential walk street with plenty of greenery in a great part of town. Easy access to nearby metro and public transportation. The rooms are first rate....beds super comfy and great spacious bathrooms. The breakfast buffet that came with our room rate was delicious. Service impeccable. We are very picky travelers and we were so happy with our stay.
title: Wonderful find! A gem!

review: Amazing personel. Manue and Constantine took the time to make sure we were totally satisfied with our room. The room was large and private. They took there time to recommend places to visit. Train location and how to get acquainted with Athens .Thank you so much for our memories of Athens. Mr and Mrs Ziad Jawda
title: Friendly staff

review: Hotel is very clean. ATM in lobby. Reception not always smiling and welcoming. Porterers, bar, and restaurant staff are very friendly. Little far to walk to town's center if it is very hot. About 20 minutes on foot to the national Archaeological museum, otherwise taxi is five euros. You can pick up the hop on hop off red bus tour from outside the museum. Small grocery store near hotel is very convenient for water, toiletries. Some cafe style restaurants near hotel as well. Continental breakfast is excellent, great variety. Rooftop pool is a nice size. Small fitness area, sauna, and massage chairs where you pay with euro coin to use.
title: Nice hotel, but bit far to walk to town center

review: The hotel is located in one of the busiest streets in Athens. On the top of the hotel the pool overlooks the entire city with all the mountains around.There is a nice bar on the roof and in the lobby with food options ( good prices) also the breakfast is amazing with fresh baked goods and good variety of food.
title: Clean and great hotel

review: We arrived at Zafolia after a 14 day cruise. We chose this hotel as we wanted room space and a pool. The room did not disappoint, it actually was more roomier than we expected. It was clean and stocked with toiletries. The roof top pool could do with some upgrading. There were never enough pool lounges and we had to make do with the chairs by the food area. We ate by the pool and the food was basic, but yummy. The kids weren't happy with the breakfast buffet however we needed to keep in mind we had just come off a cruise! I was disappointing that the cold food was not kept cold enough for our preference. Otherwise for a basic buffet it was fine.To get to the hop on/hop off bus, expect to walk 25 minutes. This wasn't perfect however we got used to the walk in the heat and decided that the room was worth the walk. Restaurants near by were a little bit of a challenge however we looked up Trip advisor and navigated ourselves around the streets and eventually found the ones recommended. These were great. Overall a pleasant experience.
title: Great room for family of five

review: We stayed here as we wanted somewhere with a swimming pool because the weather would be so hot in Athens. The hotel was every and more we needed. The pool is fantastic and our room was huge. The hotel is very well maintained and the staff are all very helpful. The hotel is a little out the city, but Uber's are very cheap so we didn't mind getting Uber's and getting out of the heat. Would recommend to anyone going to Athens.
title: Fantastic hofel

review: I had the pleasure of spending a night at Athens Zafolia Hotel for a quick business trip and I experienced a long lasting memory of which I urge to share.This Hotel is conveniently located for business purposes and has a relaxing pool on the roof top with extremely friendly staff. Reasonable breakfast and nice rooms and the reception personnel are very caring and helpful. But why such an outstanding memory?! Well I for personal reasons chose to change my room and mistakenly forgot about my belongings in the safe box. Half an hour later I was relaxing watching this beautiful Traditional Greek Band playing Bouzouki that someone knocks on my door telling me to go to my recent room immediately where I found, my Gold chain, Passport, Credit Card and few thousands of cash Euro left behind, Now I know they were suppose to do that but still this is not something to forget so I deeply appreciate such honesty by the Zafolia staff from the manager whom chose and trained these personnel and also this lovely Russian guy whom was so honest and friendly. Athens Zafolia! You represented the very rich Greek culture again by such tremendous act. Thank you Zafolia and Thank you Beautiful Athens.
title: Honesty Stands Out

review: The hotel was great and staff very friendly and helpful but ubication of hotel is horrible. There is a lot of Pakistan and afganistan Imigrants they are all night screaming like fighting so I felt not secure and comfortable there.
title: Good hotel and nice atention but bad ubication

review: Hotel is situated in center and metro is not far away (3-5 minutes). But neighborhood is big problem. Drug edicts, pickpockets, jobless etc. At evening armed security in front of hotel. So recommend to order taxi to leave and return to hotel. We were warned each tome from taxi drivers to be careful in that part of city.Breakfast is OK, but not enough tables for all guests. Cue for elevator as it is small and there is only one.Rooms are old, dusty and carpets are full of stains. Beds are comfortable. Air-condition units are silent so it is possible to sleep if you leave them switched on.Bathroom is ok, with hairdryer, but we were missing liquid soap. Dispenser was empty for all 5 days.No safety deposit box in all rooms, some have some not. That was a problem.
title: Poor neighborhood

review: The place it self is good also old fashioned but the out side view is horrible.being near to omania sq. Metro helps alot. The printer thing was useful for printing your boarding passes. The overall is ok.
title: Good

review: Antonias is the man to look out for. He will help you with absolutely anything you need and be dead cheeky about it. Breakfast is huge, delicious, and free... try the tomatoes. Air conditioner works like a charm, when you can figure out how to turn it on. It's just a wonderful place to stay at a wonderful price. And, honestly, if you're really afraid of the neighborhood, as some reviews have suggested, don't go to Athens. Neighborhood is fine and close to nightlife without it being a noisy distraction.
title: Great spot at a great price with great staff

review: Very dodgy area and hard to find... the pictures online make the rooms out to be much nicer than what they actually were. Yet staff was great help with everything we needed especially giving advice on tourist attractions and how to get there!!
title: Friendly and helpful staff. Not great room and location

review: This restaurant sits atop this boutique styled hotel. It has an unencumbered view of the acropolis and serves elegant Greek dishes with a twist. The service was outstanding and we had the most romantic evening drinking wine and enjoying the view. I highly recommend getting a reservation, however, as this has become the hot spot in Athens for even the Athenians. Well worth stopping by!
title: Stunning view of the Acropolis with Great Food!

review: First time in Athens and picked this hotel due to location and great reviews. It sure didn't disappoint. Breakfast was included and the food was wonderful with great selections and a great view of acropolis. When we arrived we got upgraded to a Junior suites (extra small lounge area to put your luggage). I guess if it was a normal size, luggages can be difficult to find its space in the room. Hotel staffs were lovely and helpful. Location was central. Very close to Syntagma square and Monstraki square. Very close to eating places and shops. It is also close to airport bus in Syntagma square. When I go back next time, I will definitely go back to this hotel. Value for money.
title: a perfect boutique hotel in central Athens

review: The staff in the hotel are extremely helpful.Great location in walking distance of sights and neighbourhoods.Gorgeous building with stylish modern additions such as the roof top restaurant and barBreakfast is fantastic The rooms are very nicely furnished with high quality beddingStunning bathroomsHowever if you have a room that includes a window into the central space at night when people leave the restaurant and bar which is open to non residents you can hear them very clearly walking down the stairs and out through reception making sleeping difficult.
title: Excellent in all aspects except for sleeping

review: This was the first of several hotels we stayed at during our two-week trip to Greece. And it was the perfect way to kick things off! The room was so quaint and cozy, and there is an amazing view of the Acropolis from the room (definitely book a room with an Acropolis view, if possible). The rooftop garden restaurant is amazing for breakfast and dinner/drinks. And the location is perfect -- the Acropolis is only a short walk. I highly recommend this hotel!
title: Perfect way to start our vacation!

review: During our Euro trip we stayed in 5 different countries and hotels - thankfully this was our final stop as it could not have been beaten!We were greeted by Roberta who was extremely professional and helpful. She gave us a tour and took us to the rooftop terrace for a welcome drink. Excellent touch! She then took us to our rooms where our bags were waiting for us. The room was beautiful and clean. It was a little small - but we could have paid more for a bigger room in our booking. The highlight of the hotel is the rooftop terrace and food in general. We ate at the restaurant twice because the food was sublime! Expensive but fabulous! If anything, there could be more cocktail options on the drink menu - but that's if I'm being really picky! The view is amazing and many of the locals came to eat there to take it in also.I loved the breakfast menu and the fact you could order the day before. This is a 'full breakfast' - not a 'continental' style breakfast. The service was good and the food was fantastic. Great start to the day! If anything, the air conditioning unit could be situated in a better place in the room in order for it to work properly. It was located under the desk and didn't get the air throughout the room fully - but we were able to sleep. Overall, the whole experience was fantastic! If we visit again we will definitely book here and would highly recommend it to anyone! Fabulous!
title: Made you feel right at home with the added bonus of the stunning view!

review: Stayed 4 nights in July, 2017. Room on 5th floor (502?) was fairly quiet and clean and had a partial view of Acropolis which was a special surprise us as we did not pay for a room with view. Breakfast buffet was above average but breakfast room was a little hot once the sun was up. At night, the rooftop terrace had breathtaking views of the Parthenon. Staff members were pleasant and smiled at lot. Bathroom kind of had an odor at first coming from the drain. It went away after opening the window and airing it out. Air conditioning worked well. Wi fi was not great but OK.Just a couple of notes: The elevator was the size of a phonebooth but did work well. The hotel is located up a steep hill. We did not mind, but I would think it would be inconvenient if you were not used it. Our 5th floor room you could hear footsteps of the workers in the breakfast area (6th floor) very early in the morning. If you are a light sleeper, you may want to get a room below the 5th floor.It was a 7 or 8 minute walk to the Plaka district (lots of shops and restaurants) and Acropoiis Museum... a little farther to get to Acropolis itself. The metro was nearby and it was how we got to/from the airport as I heard taxi cabs were expensive.Overall, very pleased with this hotel and it was a good value to boot!
title: Great Value for our Modest Budget and Close to Attractions

review: The hotel is literally a block away from the last stop of the airport express bus, which makes it ideal for such travel. The room is quiet and kind of good size for european standard. The breakfast is adequate. Although apart from that, everything else is just very basic. The worst part of the room is its shower facility. It is very difficult to operate and figure out the knobs. Also the receptionist is not very helpful. When asked about restaurant recommendation, she would answer "anything is good". When asked about airport shuttle pickup point, she actually gave the wrong information out of carelessness. I also found out that its viewing deck was under construction. That aside, due to the price, maybe it is ok to stay there, if you are only after a short stop in Athens.
title: excellent location for airport commute

review: Very close to very thing rooms are ok bathroom a little small ,breakfast was better than i though , i would stay there again Loved Athens service was good and very freindly and helpful .close to good restaurants and shops
title: Arethusa Hotel

review: I stayed at this hotel twice: two days in June at the start of my travel in Greece, and two days in July before I returned home. I was very pleased with both stays, although my rooms were very different. This is a bright, well-decorated hotel with a lot of unexpected touches: my favorite was the lobby chairs with outlets for convenient charging of cell phones, laptops, etc., while you wait for friends or taxis. Breakfast was included in my price, and you can get made to order omelets and fresh-squeezed orange juice! The staff is the real star of this hotel: they are friendly, professional and superbly attentive. During my first stay, I stayed in a junior suite which was nice and roomy with a super clean bathroom and included great amenities such as a room safe, flat screen tv, hot water pot and a mini bar that leaves room for your personal food items. Free Wi-Fi is included. They also have an in-house restaurant where you can get anything from a burger and fries to Greek salad. On my second stay, I was given one of the newly renovated rooms on the 5th floor, and while they were ultra-modern and absolutely stunning, it just wasn't my style, and so I asked for, and received, a no-hassle room change. They were even kind enough to have one of the bellmen take me around and show me other available rooms so I could choose what I wanted. Now, that is service! The room I have now is one of the older rooms, but that is by my choice; it is very comfortable, and still has the flat screen, water pot, mini bar and room safe, along with a super clean, separate bathroom. The hotel is within walking distance of eateries, restaurants, cafes, bars, and even a small supermarket. It is also just a few easy blocks from the Megaro Mousikis metro stop that will take you to downtown Athens to see the sights and do shopping. The hotel also offers very reasonably priced laundry service. I highly recommend, and plan to stay again on future trips to Athens!
title: Terrific service and great unexpected touches!

review: Amazing lobby with free billiards table for guests.Elevators are not fast and big, semms remaind from old building.Bery helpful staffs. Rooms are nice and clean, they have shortage of the SHARGING connections. Also they dont have it in the Bath roln for shaver!!!Try to ask for upper floor rooms cause thise are better and new style.Close to metro aroind 5 minutes.You will enjoy it.Ciao!ImanTour leader
title: budget hotel, great breakfast, kind staffs

review: Excellent choice of hotel if you want to be in midtown Athens. Located two metro stations to Syntagma Square (main city center). You can also walk the 25 min. distance if it is not too hot.Our room (#506) lacked space to hang clothes. Rooms in 5th and 6th floors have been recently renewed. Air condition worked perfectly.Staff and front desk excellent people.Breakfast more than adequate: eggs, cheeses, cold cuts, salads, bread, coffee, etc.Must book long in advance to get the lowest rate.
title: Airotel Alexandros Athens

review: We stayed here for one night - the hotel is nice, and room was nice and clean, including bathroom. They offer rooms for 3 ppl which was perfect for us. It's very central, within walking distance are many restaurants, the acropolis, and direct bus service to airport that runs every 15mins and through the night. Price is also good with tasty breakfast included. After check-out it's possible to leave luggage in a large locker downstairs for 2e for as long as you like. There's air conditioning. Even though it's on a busy street our room was quiet when we kept the window closed (we were on 6th floor). Go to the 9th floor to admire a view to the acropolis! Would definitely go again next time.
title: Great place to stay in Athens

review: We had 2 nights here. The lobby area is welcoming with a nice little bar and sitting area with pool table and games consoles. The bedrooms could do with an upgrade and were a bit dark and felt like they needed a good airing but we didnt expect luxury and werent in them that much. Good location near some nice little cafes and also near the underground stations. Staff seemed friendly.
title: Pretty good location, good breakfast

review: Easy hotel to just sleep in. Breakfast is nothing to rave about. The location though is perfect! Walkimg distance to everything you meed to see and eat in Athens. Small rooms. Good a.c. but can be loud at times. Friendly staff.
title: Good location

review: We only stayed here for a night. The hotel is quite old but then so does the whole street of Athens I think. The room is pretty good in the sense that it is fairly spacious, bed is comfortable & the shower area is bigger than our 2 previous hotels in Santorini/Naxos (ie. 5 x 3 big tiles vs 3 x 3 square tiles).The location is the best imo. It is less than 5 minute walk from Syntagma metro or the X95 bus stop. There are a lot of choices of restaurants around & you can walk to nearly attractions easily. We came in the summer so the weather is too hot for us to walk too far even though we are used to humid weather in Singapore. It might not be a good idea to return late to the hotel because Athens can be dangerous with so many beggars, thieves & robberies. Breakfast is served from 6:30am onwards & it was fairly decent ie. typical bread/sausage/salad/coffee etc. The lifts are really cramp…only 2 lifts are available, it is very slow with a max of 4 person capacity & everytime you must pull/push the door to open. This has to be the oldest/weirdest ever lift I've seen in my lifetime thus far.
title: Not bad at all

review: We loved our 4 nights in Athens at Airotel Alexandros! The room was comfortable (AC worked very well unlike some European hotels), breakfast was amazing, walking distance to Metro. We felt like we were coming home to our "Athens family" each night: the front desk/bar staff in the lobby/lounge were not only accommodating but so fun to chat with. If we are ever fortunate enough to come to Athens again, we will be staying here!!
title: Awesome hotel in Athens!!

review: Stayed here for 5 days, the staff speaks perfect english and is always kind. The rooms are very clean for a hotel of this price, the rooms are big and confortable. Breakfast was also good and abundant, the only shame is that the neighborhood is full of not-so-recommended people, just at the corner with Menandrou street. For the rest the hotel is perfect and near to the Omonoia station.
title: Clean and comfortable

review: I think Americans need to temper their expectations when they travel to Europe. Was the room small? Absolutely. Athens is a city that is literally thousands of years old and this hotel is in the heart of it. We walked through the Plaka and had a fabulous dinner. There's a rooftop hot tub and restaurant at the hotel too. The breakfast was amazing. It had anything you could think of. The staff spoke English.Pros: You can basically walk anywhere from here. We took the subway from the airport and walked from Sygmata square here. Maybe 10 minutes? We had giant luggage and managed just fine. The hotel is air and that worked really well.Cons: Yes. It is a small room.
title: Can't beat the location, Staff was friendly, breakfast was great

review: We stayed here on our last night before we flew back home from vacation and honestly weren't expecting much. This is a very average hotel - nothing special. It's located between Monistiraki Square and Syntagma Square. The room is average but it's important to note that the bed is absolutely horrendous..probably the most uncomfortable bed we've been in throughout greece. It was two twin beds put together. The wifi at the hotel is pitiful. Shows full strength but will take forever, if at all, to bring up a single webpage or anything else. The breakfast is ok but shouldn't really expect much wherever you are in Greece unless you go out. The rooftop terrace is amazing. Perfect view of the Acropolis and has a very nice feel up there. If you're looking for a hotel with this type of rooftop then maybe stay here. If you're looking for the whole package then probably look elsewhere.
title: Beautiful rooftop patio

review: We booked 7 nights at this hotel as my '70th birthday treat'. We booked an executive room and I emailed the hotel to see if we could be upgraded as it was a special occasion. I received a response to say the reception staff had the authority to do this. On arrival the hotel was "full". This was the least of our problems!The hotel website advises on the ways of getting from the airport to the hotel:Taxi at 60 euros (On our return to the airport we were quoted 40 euros by hotel staff which we booked).MetroBusWe decided to take the Metro as we thought 60 euros rather expensive. The Metro was crowded and our travel paperwork and my husband's passport were stolen from my handbag. This resulted in a dash to the police station followed by a visit to the British Embassy the following morning to report it and a return later to collect an emergency replacement. Day 1 ruined and a nasty taste in the mouth regarding the city. Apparently this is a very regular occurrence and the passports are sold on to immigrants within hours.Our executive room was nothing like executive. The bath was very narrow and if you turned the bath tap fully on the overhead shower came on as well. Therefore the taps had to be turned only slightly on to fill the bath. I reported this but the engineer could make no difference.Toiletries were replaced each day although the quality was not great.It is unusual not to have tea/coffee facilities in a 5* hotel room these days. I was also surprised that irons and ironing boards are not supplied.The restaurant was lovely but the evening meal prices extremely high so we ate out. We had breakfast at the hotel as part of our package. It was adequate but the same every day. I only had the cooked option once and the eggs were swimming in fat and cold. The swimming pool was small with no room for enough chairs and loungers round it. The main issue for me as a 5 ft non swimmer was the depth. 1.5m to 3.5m in a very short distance. Therefore I could not go further into the pool than the first 3 steps. I realise there is nothing to be done about this but some floatation aids would help. The hotel is immaculately kept in the public areas and the staff were very pleasant and friendly. Athens is sadly showing its economic situation and graffiti is absolutely everywhere. It is a very different city to the one we last visited in 1971.The hotel is extremely well situated within easy walking distance of the Plaka area with Restaurants and tourist shops and the Archeological sites. Try the Arcadia restaurant - lovely food and Management.
title: Very Good but some drawbacks

review: The Royal Olympic is a lovely, comfortable hotel that is located in easy walking distance to the many of the major sites in Athens. Its most outstanding features include an excellent rooftop restaurant, which I shall review separately, with breathtaking panoramic views that include the Acropolis and the Lycabettus Hill. The rooms were comfortable, good-sized, and well maintained, although not ultra-luxurious. We stayed at the hotel and both the beginning and the end of our trip. Both rooms had a small balcony that looked upon the inner courtyard and pool, although our second room had only a stall shower, but no bathtub as had been in the first. The swimming pool was another welcome feature. Though not very large, it was clean, temperate and enough for swimming short laps. There were sunbeds (which were apparently not there when another recent reviewer stayed at the hotel) as well at patio chairs and tables. The staff was uniformly courteous and helpful. And finally, the price which included a sumptuous breakfast buffet at the rooftop restaurant was quite reasonable. Though perhaps not the five-star institution that it purports to be, the Royal Olympic is certainly a comfortable place to stay when visiting Athens.
title: A Lovely Hotel in the Heart of Athens

review: My family stayed at the Royal Olympic Hotel for 5 nights during our vacation. The hotel is beautiful and walking distance to many sights, attractions and restaurants. We had a suite which was nice at the end of the day to have space for the family to hang out. After sight seeing in the morning we loved returning to the hotel and enjoying the pool in the afternoon. The pool serves food and drinks, and was very relaxing. The food we had pool side was very good. We ate several evening dinners at the Roof Garden Restaurant, which has an amazing view of the Parthenon and Athens. The food was delicious. The morning breakfast was also delicious. Staff was very professional, nice and helpful.
title: Beautiful Hotel, Great Location

review: For our second family one-night stay at the Royal Olympic, the impressions were the same and have even worsened. This hotel is a bit deceiving for a 5-stars, but with a perfect location in the city center of Athens.The rooms are comfortable, clean, quiet and spacious. The wifi is working correctly. Only our air conditioning was too cold and difficult to understand, despite the easy in-wall control system. This wasn't much of a problem for one night, but it would have become unpleasant should we have stayed longer.My main criticism concerns the overall service impressions in the hotel, beginning with the reception hall. Arriving at the Royal Olympic doesn't feel like arriving at a 5-stars. We arrived an hour early so we were asked to wait for our room to be ready. Nobody offered us any welcome drinks nor suggested any waiting options such as the lounge of the hotel or the pool during the waiting time. Similarly, the staff at the bar was not cheerful neither and we waited one hour for our in-room snacks to come a bit later on. I also want to mention that one of the two rooms we were assigned to was not the booked suite we expected. This was corrected only after we noticed it.It is a very good thing indeed that the hotel has a pool, but it is too small for summer holiday when there is a lot of clients staying in.What saves this hotel is definitely its perfect location near the Acropolis and the city center. There is plenty of bars and restaurants nearby, you just have to walk 5 minutes to reach the athenian-style summer atmosphere, a beautiful experience especially at night.I would suggest staying at the Royal Olympic for one night before heading to the beautiful paradise of the greek islands.
title: One night for the location

review: This is a basic budget friendly hotel that was adequate for our needs. What it lacked in accommodations was made up for by the wonderful staff that offered assistance, directions, etc. The only problem was that we were offered only 1 key card which wa a little inconvenient. We were concerned about the area initially because of the graffiti on the nearby buildings, but didn't encounter any problems. It was located right across from the Archaeological Museum which to me was the best museum. Also was close to good restaurants. Roof top area has distant view of the Acropolis.
title: Amazing Staff!

review: Great customer service. No the best location . Breakfast is ok bottom line nice people works for the hotel Room , Bed and Bathroom little but It is ok to stay or to sleep only. Around 5 block of the Metro Station.
title: DECENT HOTEL

review: We stayed in Greece 2 weeks. Our first stop was Athens - Royal Olympic. We were given a beautiful room!!! We weee very happy. We stayed 2 days then left for Santorini and Mykonos. We returned to Athens to the RoyalOlympic to finish our trip. We were exhausted. We expected the same beautiful accommodations. No. This room had FLIES AND A STINK like something died in it. I checked the bathroom,garbage nothing. I called the desk. They said I must have opened the window No! Ok They'll send someone to spray. I went downstairs to the desk. The concierge came up with me. I said I want another room. He understood. He said he would call if they had a room and if I wanted to move. Of course! He called we went to the lobby. HE went up to get us... the other manager CLAPPED and shooed us away. Go back up he said he's waiting with the key to the new room. The bell hop said to me "are you getting your bags?" No!!! I just left a stinky room with flies. And was clapped at! The other mgr gave me a key to the new room. Our luggage was in the stinky one. We had the keys. We went back to the old room gave the concierge the key he said do you want your luggage? No! Have it sent to my new room and the bell hop wanted to get tipped again!!! We had been travelling 8 hrs at this point and hadn't sat down. And then they charged us 2.90 Eurostar for the bottle of water we drank in the room. Their people skills suck except for maybe 1 behind the desk with the glasses and the doorman outside. Proximity is their plus. The restaurant is way overpriced.
title: From Beautiful to Stinky literally

review: We arrived late with a transprtation arrenged for us through the reservation center. We were very wolcome to a spacious room. Very clean and great a.c and a nice balcony. The staff was very nice. Location is good. Close to nice area with cafes open till late night hours and very early morning.
title: Great hotel, wonderful service

review: If my room at this hotel was larger, I would give it five stars. Service was highly professional, yet friendly and warm. Breakfast was plentiful, with warm and cold options.I did not find the location to be a disadvantage: it is walking distance from the Exarheia neighborhood known for its artists, bohemians and great restaurants at affordable prices.It is about ten minutes walk from the metro/subway/train stations, and near a beautiful museum. On my last visit to Athens, I stayed at the posh and expensive Hotel Grande Bretagne as it was a business trip payed by my employer; sure this was better but it was not any better in terms of access to the Acropolis and other tourist destinations. The Best Western Museum Hotel offers very good value for money.
title: Great service and value for money.

review: I stayed here solo during a one day layover in Athens and wanted inexpensive but clean accommodations before a long flight home the next day. The hotel was decent - room was clean, staff very professional, air conditioner worked well. I had a door where my room could have been adjoining to the next room, and I could hear my neighbors very clearly. Fortunately they weren't noisy.To get to the hotel via metro took over an hour from the airport with a cost of 10 euro for the one way ticket via the direct line to Syntagma station, then a change to the red line to Omonia. From there it was a 15 minute walk to the hotel. I was there on a Sunday, so almost all of the businesses along the way we're closed. The area is a bit run down, a lot of graffiti for sure, but overall felt safe.I walked from the hotel to the Monastzraki area for dinner and it took 25 minutes or so, with very little to see along the way - not sure if this was just because it was a Sunday.The National Archaeology Museum was directly across the street, so that is very convenient.The stay was decent for the price.
title: Decent Hotel, Not in Main Tourist Area

review: Visited Athens to catch up with relatives from the other side of the globe. We could have picked a better Hotel to start our journey around Greece and Italy. The Hotel, staff and rooms were great. The staff were so friendly and could not do enough for you. They joined us when we laughed and ensured our family and friends were looked after. It was like a 5 Star establishment. Highly recommended and thanks to the staff and particular the evening shift in the dining room and bar. We had a ball.Thank you and all the best you were fabulous.
title: What a great stay

review: we tried this restaurant during our walk downtown Athens . We were surprised by the variety of the menu for a light dinner. The salad with prosciutto was amazing . We also tried the Greek cheeses dish and it was also good. The chef with the eyeglasses was very helpful and he was explaining with politeness and professionnalisme all the details of the dishes . Best choice for a light dinner -lunch downtown !!!
title: Very good restaurant at the basement of the hotel

review: This hotel in Athens is about a 30 minute walk from the Plaka area or a 20 minute Uber/cab. We stayed here one night prior to a cruise. The rooms are acceptable but the bathroom has little privacy. The bathroom has a glass frosted door that is more like a saloon door so you have very little bathroom privacy. The best part of the hotel is the rooftop bar, pool and restaurant. We had a very nice dinner overlooking the Parthenon and enjoyed the views, the food and the drinks. Service was also very good. If you desire a luxury hotel this is not the place but it is a reasonable one night stay for travelors through Athens.
title: Moderately priced & moderatley nice!

review: It was not too difficult to find with GPS. While the indoor parking is a test of the driver's skill esp we had a big car, there are plenty of outdoor parking around the hotel. Room is quite the bare minimum. Novotel is a usual 4-star in Asia, but this one would be our 2/3-star. Amenities are at just minimum, towels were very "thin". The room wasn't that comfortable overall to make me stay in longer. Lots of choices at breakfast with both hot and cold dishes. Staff looked very grumpy though. Hotel souvenir shop got some interesting stuff. I like that the hotel installed a kinnect at the lobby, this keeps the older kids entertained.
title: An okay choice in Athens

review: This hotel just gets it right. Their most important assets are their employees. People who stood out for us were the Front Desk, especially Maria and Dieu who went above and beyond the call of duty whilst we had to spend 3 extra days in Athens as we became ill after having consumed tainted food on a cruise ship. The location is excellent and close to almost everything. The area seems a little dodgy at night however, it never felt unsafe and it is like any other city in the world, perhaps safer than most. There are many restaurants and coffee shops surrounding the hotel, with an excellent dessert shop right next door. The rooms are spacious, the public areas well laid out, the food really good (especially the breakfast and room service) and the decor is modern yet functional. This is a design hotel and a lot of thought went into the refurbishment. I especially like the interactive smart TV's in the rooms which are able to be mirrored to a personal mobile device. The wifi is free and fast. The beds and pillows (they have pillow menus) are extremely comfortable and all areas, including the rooms are immaculately clean and well looked after. They have plugs next to the beds and also a USB charging cable for telephones or iPads. The AC worked well, especially during the 38 Celsius heat whilst we were there. The rooms have fully stocked minibars and a highly quality brand of soap, body lotion and shampoo is provided in large pump action bottles. We were very happy with our stay here and are already planning our next visit to Athens in December. We shall certainly again stay at Athens Tiare Hotel. The only feedback I would give the management is to provide drinking glasses in the bathrooms, even if they are plastic disposable ones. The towels are not the best quality and should perhaps be changed for something slightly better. Other than this, everything was near perfect. Thanks again to Maria and Dieu for your amazing efficiency and making our stay extra special.
title: Other city hotels should learn from Athens Tiare

review: We had an adjoining room - king bed and bath in one room, king and pullout and bath in the other - fantastic rooms, great breakfast in the morning and extremely helpful hotel staff. Hop on / hop off bus has stop right at square. Very near flea market and many other fun parts of Athens.
title: Excellent hotel - especially for family of 5.

review: The location of the hotel could not have been more perfect. It's just a short drive from the airport and the hotel is centrally located in Athens city center. Great design and a short walk to all the chicest restaurants and shops!
title: Chic Boutique Hotel in City Center

review: With good access to Metro and easy walking distance to lots of sights and restaurants this was a perfect place to stay in the city. Good cool room to escape to when the heat of the day became too much.
title: Great place to stay

review: We stayed here for two nights although the second night we have to leave at 3:00 in the morning for a flight . It was clean, comfortable , and walking distance to the old town area and Acropolis . Breakfast was simple but ok. The only negative is the desk controls the air conditioning and will only turn down to a certain level not to your comfort level. This part was not comfortable. We had a view of an abandoned building but weren't in the room much anyway. Easy to find your way around from here.
title: Convenient location

review: We stayed here for 5 nights as a family of 4 (children 8/12). Room was spacious. Kids slept on the sofa bed. A/C is very good and effective. 2 Flat screen televisions on the wall infront of each bed. Mini bar available. Coffee machine only makes coffee. No kettle or tea making facilities available. Several sockets available for charging devices - though no USB sockets... Bathroom has excellent lighting and storage for many toiletry bags. Jacuzzi jets in bath was an absolute treat! Shower & bath is a 2 in 1. Only received toiletries on arrival - not again. Towels good quality. Face cloths not available in room. Bathroom drainage didn't work so well but maintenance took care of that. Very impressed with the safe where electrical devices can be locked up while charging - a very well thought through idea! Breakfast was a 6/10. Same same every single day. Not even the slightest variation in dishes being served. Dissapointment with the two Greek pastry dishes - very basic and really didn't impress us at all. Basic juice, filter coffee and tea available. Any other beverages to be charged accordingly- though no signs mentioning this anywhere. We loved walking in to his hotel after a long day and it always smelled so fresh and clean! Cleanliness is 10/10!! Staff are well trained, professional and all so friendly except for one terribly rude young waitress who screamed at me and made a big scene at breakfast about me politely questioning why I wasn't charged for my cappuccino the previous morning. A friendly explanation would have done. I felt very embarrassed to say the least. The manager on duty during breakfast was extremely kind and was aware of every move in his breakfast room, unfortunately he wasn't around during this particular incident.Right outside the hotel is a fabulous bakery, oh the Baklava!!! and also a drinks kiosk. The hop-on-hop-off bus also stops right outside. Entrance to the Omonia Metro station is 10 meters away. At night a wee bit dodgy - felt unsafe and threatened - though no one said or did anything to us , maybe human nature when people that seems to look like a thread are hanging around and police often comes out and round them all up. Many taxis also always available. Would stay here again and recommend this for first time visitors of Athens.
title: Uncomplicated

review: Reasonably priced hotel in a great location just off Ermou near SintagmaMany options on the nice breakfast buffet but they don't start until 7 am which is a problem when you have early flightsStaff are all pleasantMany options for dining within a short walkThe rooms here are small and could do with some modernisation and revamped bathroomsIn house caffe has reasonable meals at good prices tooIn room mini bar and safe were handyWalls are very thin and neighbours were making a porno with a goat I think?Overall would I stay here again? YESWOULD I RECOMMEND TO MY PARENTS AND FRIENDS?YesNot quite the 4 star I'm used to but it served the purpose
title: Great central Athens location

review: We stayed at Athens Cypria Hotel three nights in late June (23.6.17 to 26.6.17).We booked several months in advance rooms for two families: a family unit for four people that included two double rooms with a connecting door and a superior triple room for three adults that included one king bed and one single bed separated by a partition (also had a Jacuzzi).Both rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable.The hotel's location is excellent! In a small and quiet alley that starts from the famous Ermou Street. Within walking distance to all major sights in the city, 3 minutes' walk from Syntagmatos Square.The hotel has been recently renovated, which is a big plus. Its design is modern and pleasant. The breakfast was excellent; it included everything needed to open the day with.The staff was friendly and courteous. A very good choice to explore the city by foot.
title: Athens Cypria Hotel - A nice hotel in a fantastic location!

review: Got to the hotel for the over night stay and expected a small room it's Europe after all. The front desk clerk said the rooms are recently renovated and you can tell that there was new furniture and new laminate flooring in the room. The washroom is still a 1990s style and that wasn't a problem either. But a 2" gap at the bottom of the door to the hallway and into the washroom was a little concerning especially when you can hear everything down the hall.But the hotel was definitely ideally located centrally to the shopping district and was a 15 minute walk to the acropolis. Have to say the I was not impressed with the front desk staff. The night we arrived we asked if they would change the arrival of our airport shuttle by 30 mins. No problem she says. We asked the young lady at the desk 3 times and asked if she was certain she made the call and she assured us she did. "No Problem" Needless to say she didn't and we had to run since there was a delay at check in.
title: I can hear you

review: Nice clean hotel. Staff always smiling and ready to help any time of the day or night. I had a problem operating the air con controls however the reception send someone who replaced the controls and everything was ok. We had a kettle on the room to boil water for coffee and tea. I would have preferred the room service staff to have given us more tea bags than the customary ration of 2 bags a day although this was not a problem as we could always get extra supply from coffee shop located on the ground floor. The Breakfast at this hotel is excellent. They cater for all tastes.This hotel is very centrally located within easy reach of all the archaeological sites, restaurants and shopping area.The hotel also gave us packed lunch for our early 7 am departure for Mykonos.We will be using the same hotel on return from Mykonos.
title: Two nights stay

review: The location of the hotel is probably the best one in Athens, as from the rooms you have a great overview over the entire citiy, to the Akropolis and behind to the harbour and the sea (if weather is clear). You can reach all museums and sights be feet, have good restaurants in the near and an open air cinema with good films in the evening directly in front of the hotel. In the morning you can swimm in the pool on the roof or walk up the hill to the very top to have a marvelous 360o view.
title: Balcony

review: First stayed here in 2012. Returned again for one night before joining a cruise. Same high standard of service, lovely breakfast on a high floor to overlook the Acropolis. Fab rooftop pool with bar and sun loungers to enjoy the magnificent view. Thank you to the lovely staff on reception who booked us a meal at Kuzina to return where we had eaten a memorable meal on their roof top in 2012. It was just as good this time! I would highly recommend this hotel for any stay in Athens.
title: Another lovely stay here

review: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights after sailing from Venice. The hotel was well staffed, the room was fine on the lower ground floor with what is described as a courtyard view and had a nice balcony with 2 chairs and table on it. It looked out to some trees and a close up view of the next door building.The bathroom was well equipped and quite well maintained. We had a very comfortable bed made up of two singles booted together. The pool area was quite well shaded but sun beds were at a premium. The pool itself was very clean and a nice temperature. The hotel is in an up market area of Athens with some very nice eateries and cafes close by down the hill a bit.
title: Lovely and relaxing stay during a hot July 2017

review: Fantastic view from the balcony, excellent service!! Good location. We stayd one night can recommend this hotel egen you stay in athens!!!! We hasa Nice stay and will probably book this hotel again if we travel to athens!
title: Nice Hotel

review: We stayed here two nights: the first night after arriving in Athens for our honeymoon, and the last night before we left anthens at the end of our honeymoon.The first night we stayed in the "acropolis view" room on the 5th floor. This room was the worst room we stayed in during our honeymoon. It was very very small, a/c didn't work, no hot water, and old bathroom. Not what you would expect from a 5 star hotel.The last night we stayed in a standard room on the 4th fourth floor. The room and bathroom were much more modern and updated.The front desk service was good however they obviously push restaurants they work with. They charged us 7 euros for a miniature Pringles chip...absurd. We stayed in hotels in mykonos, santorini, crete and this hotel was disappointing compared to the others.The breakfast offered was very limited, and again the worst breakfast at a hotel we had while in Greece.For the price: I would recommend trying to a find a better hotel, as in my opinion, this hotel is not a 5 star hotel.
title: Not that good

review: This hotel is next to Platia Mavili. Easy access to metro. Very clean and safe hotel. Great coffee shop for snacks or meals. The service is outstanding! Good breakfast provided daily. Rooms with king beds only have shower in bathroom while rooms with twin beds have tub.
title: Great hotel in Platia Mavili

review: I stayed for one night during this trip, and was very pleased. For the low price I paid, I got a clean room, very clean bathroom and breakfast and free secure Wi-Fi was included. It has a lovely little café attached, where you can get a coffee or sandwich without having to brave the heat if you don't want to! If you are so inclined, though, the hotel is only steps from eateries, bars, and even a few small supermarkets, which is convenience personified when you are traveling. The hotel is also within easy walking distance of the Megaro Mousikis metro stop, which will take you straight into downtown Athens to see sights like the Acropolis and to shop at Monastirakis and the Plaka. For myself personally, the beds are very firm, but other than that, this hotel is perfect for the budget-conscious traveler! Highly recommend!
title: Great value for the money, highly recommend

review: I and other friends from the Uk who have been with me think that the location is excellent and the airport bus stops very close to the hotel. Despite the busy road the rooms are quiet and only once have other guests created noise at night. The hotel is very clean, the staff are friendly, the restaurant is attractive with a very good buffet breakfast. After a busy day its nice to be able to get back to a very comfortable bed and a better mattress than is usual in Greece! The rooms are always very clean. My last visit prompted me to write a review at last. Excellent value for the price. I did manage to speak to the Manager on my last visit and told her that I always found the staff and facilities very good.
title: I have stayed in this hotel about 10 times when visiting friends in Greece.

review: We stayed at the Divani Palace in early july 2017. The room was clean ,not that large for two and a kid and a bit outdated. The staff was helpful and friendly but very little English. The rooftop restaurant was OK, but street restaurant there much better . A very short walk to the Acropolis and the Plaka. The area seemed very safe and friendly. Overall, we really liked the Divani Palace and would definitely stay there again.
title: Good hotel ,great location close to everything

review: We stayed at this hotel two years ago when visiting Athens and recently spent a night there again. This hotel is great value for a hotel in Athens. It's just two train stops away from Syntagma Square and the bus X95 from the airport basically stops a half block away from the hotel. The lobby and rooms are spotless and they provide a very good complimentary breakfast and are also open for lunch and dinner. There are restaurants and pubs within walking distance. i would definitely stay here again and highly recommend for an affordable hotel in good location.
title: GREAT LOCATION AND VALUE

review: As others have noted, the best part of this hotel is the location. You can easily walk to all of the major tourist destinations. We had a room on the top floor with a view of the Acropolis from our balcony. Overall, the hotel and the rooms could use a major update. It's clean enough, but very dated. I certainly would not consider it a five star hotel. Breakfast was fine; nothing special but nothing to complain about. We also dined at the rooftop restaurant; the view is fantastic, the food is decent and, as expected, a bit expensive. We were satisfied but not wowed, and would probably look for something a bit more modern during our next trip to Athens.
title: Five Stars in the 1980s

review: Were there from 19th to 21st July and had a great time with the family and especially the dinners at the sky lounge with the scenic view of the Acropolis at night is a sight not to be missed . I've never seen such hospitality of the staff at the Sky Bar/ Lounge .with what love and courtesy they serve is just outstanding.would love to visit Athens again and stay here . Congrats to the team for an outstand No show.
title: Again great property for its location and price

review: Given this is a 5-star hotel, I had rather high expectations coming into the place. The good: I was very impressed by the entrance/lobby of the hotel which is absolutely stunning. I was also very pleased with the hotel staff who helped us with our luggage and allowed us a slightly later checkout because our flight was a bit later. I was also very impressed with their breakfast. They had various options ranging from eggs and bacon to yogurt and dessert and everything in between! I know what authentic Greek food tastes like and am often am disappointed by these Greece hotels food quality, however this hotel had an overall great breakfast and their Bougatsa was one of the best I've ever had! The gift shop, which is located near the breakfast area, was also very large and offered great discounts. The location of this hotel was also perfect!The room itself had its pros and cons. The good: The view, the bathroom and the cleanliness. The view was great! We had a balcony with a side view of the Acropolis which was very nice. The bathroom was also very nice and large with a large tub/shower and a large, bright mirror. This was perfect given we were 3 women who needed the space to put on makeup! The room was also very clean.Now for the bad: Our room smelled very bad 70% of the time. At first it was more so like a sewer smell but we woke up in the morning very early to a horrible fish smell. We had to keep the balcony door open to get some of the smell out which made the room very hot so the whole time we had to choose between hot and fresh smelling room or cold and smelly room. We were at the end of a hallway and when you approached that part of the hallway, you would smell it. With that said, I'm not sure whether it's just our room or the whole place but regardless I would like to see the hotel do something about this. This smell is not a lack of cleaning or anything on the part of the staff, but regardless occurs and should be addressed. Our room also had a problem with the door knob to the bathroom. Every time one of us went in there it would not lock; we knew when someone was in there not to enter but it was still slightly annoying. However even worse: when we were leaving the door randomly locked and one person in our group got stuck in the bathroom. One of the hotel employees came with the key and he still couldn't open it and had to call the technician who finally got it open. They handled this manner in a very attentive and fast way however it is also something that the hotel needs to look into ASAP.
title: Not what I expected, but not horrible either

review: My husband and I stayed at the Divani Acropolis for three nights and enjoyed it very much. We could see the Acropolis from our room, esp. impressive when it is lit at night. It is close to walk to the Acropolis and the Museum. We walked the few blocks from the Metro Station after taking the metro from the airport and had no difficulty finding the hotel. The bed was a king size and comfortable. The bathroom had a large tub with a shower. Our hallway and room was freshly painted--didn't feel "tired" to us. The air conditioner kept the room at a comfortable temp and we didn't hear outside noise. There was an outdoor pool, which we used every afternoon as it was over 100 degrees the week we were in Athens. It is easy to use the metro to get to the other areas of the city. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the lobby is large and impressive. We saw many different restaurants nearby as we were walking around. The staff told us where to catch the XPress 80 bus to take to the port for the cruise we were taking. We would definitely stay there again.
title: Great Location, Enjoyed our Stay

review: It was excellent staff breakfast rooms view location all very good value for money beach very near just walking distance like 5 mins walk same to trams & buses even closer.... It was very clean too I ll surely go there again
title: Excellent all rounder

review: Very nice and confortable place. The food is good and rooms are clean. Not so big but was ok. Personal are kind. Nothing more to write about this place. We stay there from seven days in the summer august of 2017.
title: Very good food

review: We just came back from a family vacation in Glyfada. It was a great vacation and the hotel was on top of the success factors for the vacation. The hotel location is quiet convenient as it is very close to a bus and tram stations and also a 10 min walk to the beach and Glyfada center.It is a very clean and pleasant hotel. The staff are very helpful. They offer beautiful breakfast with a variety of fresh international and national dishes. Our room was spacious, beds and pillows very comfortable and with an extraordinary view of the beach as our room was on the 4th floor. We were offered a fruit basket upon arrival and complementary coffee and tea service. Our housekeepers were great.However, our friends that were spending the vacation with us has booked a family room but not with sea view. They did not receive the same hospitality. They were not offered any welcome fruit basket not tea/coffee service in their rooms. Their housekeeping was also sloppy as their bathroom was not cleaned regularly nor their waste baskets emptied daily.Overall, I would go back to this hotel anytime I am in Glyfada.
title: Very nice hotel, great location

review: This beautiful hotel, in which we stayed for 7 nights, is situated in the heart of Kolonaki, a fascinating neighborhood in central Athens. It is just a 5-minutes' walk from Evangelismos Metro station but we walked always to Syntagma (approximately 15 -20 minutes), it is such a nice walk and you can discover so many shops and nice restaurants doing so. From arrival to departure everything was perfect. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful and we miss the delicious breakfast already so much. (The Greek Caffe Frappe was my personal highlight) This hotel has such a lovely and relaxed atmosphere. We've chosen the Superior Room and it was perfect for us. The room was always perfectly clean. We would highly recommend this hotel and we are already thinking about to come back :)
title: Such a wonderful place to stay

review: We stayed here for our two nights in Athens and it was really a perfect location and the price could not be beat. The boutique feel and breakfast were wonderful and the staff went out of there way to help us when their usual touring company was unavailable for us. In fact, one of their staff members put together a complete day walking tour for us with a map and print outs of information for all the sights. Our room itself was just ok, which is why I'm rating it at a 4. Our shower was draining really slowly the first night and the window shade did not work - both were fixed by the next day. One of the outlets in the bathroom also did not work but I just dried my hair in the bedroom. Definitely recommend them for the price and location. There are also a number of great restaurants right around the corner!
title: Great location and staff

review: Great ac. Comfy bed. Clean. Modern. Not best location as you are 30 min walk from acropolis. Nice upscale part of town. Free refreshments drinks and snacks all day. Will try breakfast in morning. Great water pressure. Best robes I have ever tried in my life. Tiny tv. Fresh fruit waiting in room. Got room with Starwood points. No parking whatsoever.
title: Starwood quality

review: My husband and I spent a couple days in Athens while on our honeymoon. Upon arrival after a very long flight the staff was extremely friendly, offered us local food options and answered every question. They even had a complimentary bottle of wine waiting for us both times. The rooms were clean and modern and the bed was so comfortable after a kong day of travel. The breakfast in the morning was delicious and they had a constant supply of free snacks and drinks. Location was near so many restaurants, shopping and history. Couldn't be happier!
title: Clean and Friendly Athens Hotel

review: Not being an expert in Athens this hotel is located in the richest area of Athens with loads of restaurants nearby and in a peaceful area. The rooms are fresh, the beds are super comfortable and there are housekeeping ladies around everywhere resulting in the cleanest hotel ever. Nice touch is the 24/7 free non-alcoholic drinks and bites section which has wide choice and is completely free, nice lounging area on the ground floor. Everything seems to be brand new and extremely well maintained.
title: Excellent chique neighbourhood, peaceful and modern superclean rooms

review: Excellent hotel, great staff and attentive. We were two nights at different times in different rooms and in both cases was great and cleanWe arrived early and received a room in fifteen minutes in both cases did not let us wait. Call us taxis. 10 minutes drive from all attractionthe RABINOVITS
title: Great hotel

review: That was a Very bad experience!Hotel was ok but the Manager was so roude and unprofessional with clients and stuff.When we arrived we asked him some coffe and water and the answers was "i am not waiter.I am the manager!In the begining we where laughing(how proffecional Management )but after his check in we where angryYou should change him immediately!
title: Bad experience with manager!

review: Adorable hotel. Clean and brand new. 5 minutes away from the city. Missing some extra facilities like pool and spa. Helping staff and good buffet. Great room service food. Only thing I would suggest is for them to warn people from pocket pickers, phone got stolen in a coffee shop in Monastiraki. Ps: Greeks are lovely people, very welcoming
title: Cute little hotel

review: ReviewVery reasonably priced for those on a budget with a great location to the main tourist sites, resturants and shopping. Special thanks to Bill Front Office Manager, who was extremely helpful and accommodating offering useful advice and great recommondations to our group during our 2 day stay.
title: Great Location/Great Experience

review: I was here for 4 nights and I paid nearly 60 Euros a night. At first, I was given a room which was on opposite side of the street. It was very small and it had no window so I asked them to change it. Then, I got a room that has a balcony to the street, but the AC was not working fine and it was hot. I asked them to have a look at it the second day and they fixed it. I was happy with the service. It was a Best Western class so I was not expecting something extra. I heard the street was a place for prostitutes before and the polis cleaned it up, however, locals told me to be sharp when I was going back to the hotel at night. I could see weird and junky people when I walked to a museum close to this hotel, but nothing bad happened.
title: Get a street side room

review: Stayed here for two nights before joining a Princess Cruise on Royal Princess.We took a taxi from the airport to the hotel which took about 30 minutes, taxis have a fixed change from the airport to the city.Check was quick and easy and the staff very helpful with local information.Our room was on the fifth floor and was a good size with very good air conditioning.Breakfast was included in the room booking which was good although a new toaster is required!Hotel is in area with a lot of closed shops and the area looks run down.We read reports on here about people on drugs outside in the evening, we never noticed any in the evenings.Hotel is near two metro stations.Hotel arranged a taxi for us to the port again for a fixed rate.
title: Pre cruise stay

review: The location is good, 5 minutes walking to the closer metro station (Omonia, green Line) and 25 minutes walking to Syntagma Square. Metro Green Line is quite convenient, as it's direct to Piraeus port.Very friendly and helpful staff. Clean room and quite good breakfast.
title: Good location, friendly staff

review: Nice hotel with good location. Only 5 minutes by metro to Plaka and Akropolis. Not very clean room. Very good breakfast. Friendly staff and quiet area. This is a ok hotel to stay in for a few days. The hotel needs some renovation.
title: Very good location

review: We found Hotel staff very friendly. Very comfortable and clean hotel with comfortable beds. Very good location on main road close to city center. Continental breakfast has good variety. Breakfast / Dining room also has several couches and coffee / drinks bar which operates most of the day. We found this room ideal and comfortable for I drink or coffee without having to going out . I booked online and when paying there was no mistake to original to room quote and think room rates are quite good. We would certainly go back.
title: Very Friendly and Comfortable Hotel

review: Clean rooms and very good breakfast.Unfortunately the Internet speed was not good enough and there was no option for premium paid access.If your room is looking to the avenue the noise good be significant.
title: Nice hotel

review: This was my first visit at this hotel as arrive often for business. My usual hotel was duly booked so I chose this one. And it was amazing! Small, very modern and clean. Reception super friendly and helpful. Great alcohol at the bar of the hotel. Room was spacious and clean. Modern and equipped with all that needed including cold drinks, coffee and bottle of wine. Also a large balcony. Breakfast is on the roof and super cool with nice view. Area you can't choose better. In the center city but quiet area. Super chic with lots of high brands store and restaurants. Close to all shopping and tourist attraction. Will definitely return and stay there again.
title: Great!

review: Fantastic friendly and helpful staff, breakfast improved further since last time, rooms very nice and good value. Area superb. A few things to improve would be: easier to use air condition, another lift as waiting times can be high at times, cooler bed linen for the summer as the bed feels a bit too hot in the hot season in my opinion.
title: Great again it was my third stay

review: Athens was our first stop on a 8 day holiday in Greece and i was a bit skeptical about the city (post recession) and the customer service levels. I was pleasantly surprised by the hospitality shown by everyone at this hotel. The receptionist Xristina, was particularly helpful as she helped us making reservations and figure out our itinerary even for our next stop, Mykonos. Furthermore they were very flexible with the checkout time and offered a great breakfast. The hotel is and feels very new and the location is perfect if you don't want to be right in the middle of the action but want to be close enough.
title: Great location and service

review: We have been for 2 nights The welcome has been friendly and warmPeople in this hotel are very professional and they make you feel like at homeIn a pedestrian road so very quietTaxies are just at the cornerMany bars and coffee in the areaStrictly recommended to travelers in Athens also because the old town in just at 10 min walkPerfect See you soon
title: Beautiful and clean. Courtesy and friendly

review: I arrived here yesterday, after canceling three other hotels in the center of Athens. While this cozy, beautiful boutique hotel is centrally located, but it's quiet and away from crowd. Front desk ladies were most friendly and helpful in suggesting several tours. Breakfast is great. The hotel is located in a residential, posh area, surrounded with high end stores, but just 5 minutes walk away from Metro, Parliament, National Garden and many other activities. I am enjoying my stay and will most definitely recommend and will return in future, it feels like home. Thank you
title: Superb Hotel with Friendly faces

review: Hotel and rooms are nice. Not much of a view though. Hotel staff was very courteous and prompt in any requests. Hotel is about 5-10 mins cab ride from main attractions ( approx. 7 to 10 Euros per ride). This hotel has a very unique elevator ..fits 2 persons at a time....minor inconvenience. Breakfast buffet could be better.
title: Nice hotel , courteous staff...

review: I stayed here on 2 occassions. It was perfect on both times. Rooms are spacious and very comfortable. Breakfast wonderful. Location excellent, located within walking distance of the Acropolis. Charming little restaurants nearby. Downside was TV had no English channels.
title: Very good stay

review: Traveling with our 5 children, we needed a nice but affordable hotel in Athens. He hotel was perfect for our needs and we got two rooms. Very nice hotel and the man at the front desk spoke English and was very nice. Breakfast was free and had an excellent variety with something for everyone. Just remember that the key card needs to be in the slot on the wall in order for the lights and AC to work. The hotel is not directly near the main attractions such as the Acropolis, but this is what makes it more affordable and it's only a 5 minute drive from Acropolis area. We highly recommended this hotel for the price.
title: Perfect Athens hotel for what we needed

review: We arrived a bit early but the receptionist was very kind and after a few minutes allowed us early check in and with kids this really helped. Very friendly at check-in no hassle gave us good directions and advice. the room was huge very comfy beds clean. Aircon was working. breakfast was good and freshly prepared people serving were very helpful and kind. My kids enjoyed the Jacuzzi bathroom is huge and the toiletries are fabulous. Nice hotel when travelling with kids. The hotel is not directly near the main attractions such as the Acropolis, but this is what makes it more affordable and it's only a 5 minute drive from Acropolis area. We highly recommended this hotel for the price.5 mins drive to Plaka.
title: Very good hotel for Families

review: We stayed at this hotel as it was packaged with a flight by Expedia on the basis of its TripAdvisor reviews. Overall it is good, although on the outskirts of Athens if you're exploring you need to either commute by bus (about 20 minutes +) or taxi ride which is about €8 to the city centre /Parliament Square or less to the Acropolis. There is also a train which we didn't take. Rooms are a good size and little old and in need of some restoration. Overall we were comfortable. Breakfast is ok and service excellent. There are quite a few restaurants in walking distance and a food court across the square which is cheap and open late.
title: Good value hotel

review: Lovely place to stay. Very nice interior, very central with great breakfasts. Room was a little small, but that is probably typical of Athens. Staff were very friendly and helpful and gave good suggestions as to where to eat.
title: Great place to stay

review: We spent one night in Athens and the hotel location was great. The room was a good size and nicely furnished. The bathroom was not well laid out and difficult to manoeuvre the shower was located in the narrow bath and it was extremely slippery and only had a shower curtain which constantly stuck to you. The room was not very soundproof and every time someone left their room you could hear every noise. Breakfast was pleasant with the usual yoghurt, scrambled eggs, assorted cakes and pastries.The hotel reception smells of cigarette smoke.The view from the rooftop bar is fantastic!
title: Great location

review: Soaking in a jacuzzi with a full view of the Acropolis - unbeatable ! Blissfully quiet, next to the pedestrian alley of the Acropolis area - no car noise. Great breakfast with home baked bread and cakes ...
title: Amazing location

review: Herodion is in a great location, right below the Acropolis, the Acropolis museum and the plaka.
