It has a great view of the Acropolis from some of the hotel rooms as well as the roof-top restaurant. They have a great breakfast buffet that's included in the hotel price. But what made it great is the cleanliness and the great staff. They really make you feel welcome. We stayed here multiple times between July and August, and definitely will return in the future.
title: Great for couples

review: Our family of 8 stayed in four rooms for a couple days before a sailing trip through the Greek Islands. The hotel is ideally located with breath taking views of the Acropolis and an easy stroll to Old Town. I have been there before on business but had to return with my family because dinner on their roof with the views of the Acropolis can't be overstated. Their food and their Greek Salad were among the best we experienced during our 12 days in Greece. The staff is unusually attentive. As an example, my youngest son arrived separately from the airport. As he entered the hotel, one of the staff casually asked how much he paid for his taxi. The staff member said he was overcharged and ran out to the driver and made the driver refund my son the overage! Where else have you ever heard of a hotel staff being so proactive!! There are lots of other examples of how helpful the staff was as well. I would stay there again without question or hesitation!
title: Perfect Location, Even Better Staff!

hotelName: Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
review: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights two weeks ago. The hotel is very nice, the public areas are well maintained and the staff is very helpful. Breakfast was very good. The room was nice and clean but the bathroom was not very clean and needs some improvements. I have to say that we didn't complain,I guess that if we did talk to someonethey would have done something about it.The hotel is not really in the city center if you are a tourist. To get to the main attractions you need a taxi or a train.
title: Good and comfortable hotel, not really city center

hotelName: Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
review: Arrived to a friendly and efficient welcome. Room had two double beds nicely made up. The room wasn't really clean, found a hat under the bed. Room needs a good going over with a vacuum cleaner. Bathroom had mould around the bathroom and it did not smell clean, it had a damp smell. Ok place as a base to explore Athens.
title: Family stay in July, friendly staff

review: Located near the ancient monuments, the outstanding feature of this hotel is the staff. Constandina made our stay special with her recommendations on how to get around the city. With her help, we saw more than we would have thought possible.
title: Nice

review: Rooms are great but the airconditioning never worked properly. The restaurant views are superb and the reception staff were exceptional and extremely helpful. We had dinner one night the food was not great but the fried feta starter was superb.
title: Great location

review: Need a beautiful drink and some lunch or a snack with the acropolis within touching distance? The athens gate is the place, great drinks delicious food great staff and beautiful bathrooms. A must for a well earned tourist break
title: Fantastic view

hotelName: Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
review: We arrived in the evening and welcomed a placed to unwind. Our room was on a quiet side of the hotel and the room was well balanced and spacious. The front desk was accommodating (not friendly but polite) as we had problems with the phone working, we needed towels plus the bathroom floors needed to be cleaned. The main and only reason I am giving this hotel a three rating is because of the bathroom. The bathroom never felt or smelled clean. There was a great amount of the mold in the bath/shower plus the floors always seemed dirty even after housekeeping cleaned it. The hotel is not in the City Centre but close to the metro and walking distance to shopping and good restaurants. City Centre is two stops away by metro.
title: Just Good

review: +: location, the view on the Acropolis, the view on the ancient ruins, the staff is very nice and welcoming, breakfast is nice, the decoration of the rooms is nice. -: rooms are small for the price even though the equipment is nice I think it's a bit overpriced compared to the price in the surroundings. Nice hotel, well located but a bit pricey for the room's size
title: Nice hotel well located

review: This hotel was wonderful. It was very clean with modern amenities and a friendly staff. It was reasonably priced and exceeded our expectations. The location was central to all of the must see attractions of Athens. I would definitely stay here again.
title: Great Hotel

review: We stayed in two hotels while in Athens (we left for Bulgaria and returned). The Amalia is wonderful! Great location, friendly staff, well-appointed rooms, gorgeous bar, and a delicious breakfast. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Athens!
title: Best hotel!

review: As always - the views from the upper floors are magnificent - either towards Acropolis or towards the Arch of Hadrian and Temple of Zeus. But standard of the rooms on top ( "Executive" ) are perhaps not Executive.. The terrace outside the Executive rooms are large but do not compensate for the lack of table inside giving no place to put a PC for some writing...The staff is friendly and the cleaning is excellent - as always...
title: Excellent views and good service ...but "Executive" room?

review: We stayed at the Amalia upon arrival of our journey in the region and loved the hotel.It was my husbands birthday and the hotel staff surprised us with a celebration. The staff was accommodating to every need. The location was fabulous located within walking distance to all the places we wanted to visit. The roof top is a great place to enjoy a private evening and the balcony in our room was a great bonus, The breakfast was wonderful!
title: Fabulous Boutique Hotel!

review: Very nice and comfortable local boutique hotel with great amenities, fabulous breakfast and awesome location. We stayed here for 5 nights total and felt like home. It is a gem in heart of Syntagma square.
title: Fantastic choice

review: A bit tricky if you arrive to the hotel by car, the street outside is a busy road and there are only a very small space to park while you check in. The location is excellent, with views overlooking the park and the parlament, and with walking distance to a lot of the sights in central Athens.The rooms are elegant and normal in size, the bathrooms are quite big and very nicely designed. Breakfast offers a large variation so no matter your diet, you´ll find something on the buffét! The only disappointment was the lobby bar, food was not that good, and expensive and when I ordered champagne I was told it wasn´t cold...So please put the champagne in the fridge, and we´ll come back!Joke aside, I would absolutely come back to this hotel again.
title: Excellent location

hotelName: Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
review: I stayed at Crowne Plaza for 2 nights early July (business travelling) and I have to say the overall experience wasn’t up to the expectations. The hotel is in a good location, common areas are well maintained, the rooms are well sized, modern and soundproof. Some of the stuff was very attentive, breakfast was great. I would like to point out the things that in my opinion really distinguish a good hotel from a great one. As soon as I arrived for my check in around 12pm on a Sunday afternoon, there was only one employee at the reception and was busy with an airlines crew that was checking in before me. I was standing there, waiting for my turn and for approx. 15’ the receptionist didn’t raise her eyes from the computer screen and the documents in front of her. A simple nod of the head or an eye check would have been enough but she didn’t even notice me. The same day I also noticed that some food trays remained outside the rooms in the hotel aisles for quite a few hours. Maybe the hotel was understaffed that day.The thing that really put me off though and made me write this review is the following. A few hours after I checked out, I realized I had forgotten in the mini bar fridge an envelope with my name on it, which contained some medical treatment I was using at the moment. I called the reception and they connected me with the lost and found department. I informed them about this incident and they told me they’d look into it and I should call them back in a while. When I dialed again, I was told that unfortunately the maid had thrown the envelope away. The lady on the phone was very kind and apologetic and she advised me to call the hotel manager to report it, mentioning his name. I called again at the reception, asking to talk to the manager but because he was unavailable at the moment I was transferred to another manager or something (don’t remember names or roles). I was quite upset at the moment but I calmly described to him the incident, which he was already aware of. The purpose of the call was just to report what had happened, so they can try and improve in that area. However, the person on the other side of the phone in an arrogant way replied “what do you want now, we can’t compensate you for this, people leave things back all the time and we throw away a lot of stuff everyday”. I replied that I’m not seeking any compensation, I just deemed necessary to report this to the hotel management so they can train their stuff or do whatever they think is necessary to improve (I work in the customer service industry and feedback is always welcome to me). Quickly he realized that he shouldn’t have responded like that and he apologized for the incident. However, damage had been made. This is something that you don’t expect from a 5 star hotel. Should he had responded with something like “sorry for that, next time you stay with us you will receive a complimentary drink/dinner/night/anything” they would have won me. With this attitude though, I don’t think I’d stay there again.
title: Not up to the expectations

review: We checked in around 9pm after spending 6 hours on the ferry. The lovely lady at the counter welcomed us and gave us our room. It was on the 5th floor, very quiet and nice and cool with the AC. The room was spacious and very clean. We were also stoked to have a queen bed. Hermes is a 10 minute walk from the train station and the square. The included breakfast was very yummy with plenty of options. One of the staff members checked on us at breakfast and helped us with some sightseeing ideas. Very pleased we stayed, we will certainly stay again if we come back to Athens.
title: Great location and very nice staff

review: I stayed at Hermes Hotel for the two nights I was in Athens before heading down to Kefalonia and couldn't have been happier with my choice. Hermes was very modern, updated, and right in the center of plaka. A 10 minute walk from the Acropolis and center city, not to mention the staff was very friendly and accommodating. A wonderful experience all around. I would 100% recommend Hermes to anyone staying in Athens.
title: GREAT Hotel

review: Fantastic location, across from the Parliament building, with an awesome roof-top terrace with a view of Acropolis and the entire city of Athens. Hotel Amalia is one of the nicest and customer friendly hotels I've ever stayed at. It isn't luxury, but everything you need it's there, front desk is souper friendly and helpful. Restaurant is actually very good, we were avoiding dining there because we didn't expect good and reasonably priced food. The last day, waiting for a taxi to bring us to the airport we dined there and were very happy. Also, we ordered a bottle of Amalia house wine, tasty and cheap. Definitely recommended!
title: Fantastic location, great breakfast, very clean rooms and helpful staff

review: The staff at Hermes are some of the friendliest I've ever met in a hotel. They genuinely care about your stay and are very helpful. The room we had was very cozy and spacious, and was clean and well maintained - perfect for getting some good rest after a day in the hot streets of Athens.The included breakfast is amazing, and we loved that the location is within walking distance to everything. We'd definitely stay again.
title: Central, clean, quiet, cozy and comfortable

review: My husband and I recently spent 3 nights at Central Athens Hotel. We are very pleased with our decision to stay in this hotel. The rooms are spacious (by European standards), clean, and modern. The staff is very friendly and were helpful with any of our questions about the city or traveling in the area. The rooftop bar was excellent! We made a point to have at least one drink there every evening of our trip, and we were never disappointed by the drinks or the view. In addition, we very pleased with the complimentary breakfast buffet. You get a wide variety of choices including those that are tourist-friendly and more authentic Greek dishes. Central Athens will even pack you a breakfast if you must depart before the buffet opens, as was the case with our last day.We found the location to be fine. It is an easy walk (5 minutes) from the Syntagma metro station which is a major stop for most modes of transit to and from the airport. It is also less than a 10 minute walk to the major flea market area of Athens, which we loved! The walk to the Acropolis was a bit longer, but it could not have been more than 15 minutes. Evidently Athens is currently (Summer, 2017) experiencing some domestic unrest, but we never felt unsafe during our stay.The only problem that we have with the Central Athens Hotel is the spottiness of their wifi. It is free, but it is also incredibly unreliable. Just be aware.
title: Beautiful Rooftop View & Great Breakfast!

hotelName: Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
review: My wife and I stayed at the Crown Plaza for several nights after a cruise of the Greek Islands. The staff warmly greeted us upon our arrival and provided us with a map of the area and suggestions for shopping and sight seeing. Our room was on the Club level (6th floor that entitled us to extra amenities that included the Club room that was always stocked with a very nice selection of beverages and snack food. This was a very nice extra that we took advantage of on a regular basis. It was also a nice area to socialize with other guests. We also paid extra for the breakfast package that I would highly recommend. A very nice selection of breakfast foods in a very nice dining area. Our room was very nice, with a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was top notch, especially compared to other European bathrooms. Very roomy, clean and nicely decorated. The room also included a stocked refrigerator , safe and plenty of closet space. There were two disappointments with the room that I would not expe
title: Friendly, helpful staff

review: After a month of hotels, eight in all, Hermes might be the very best. In part the staff (Eva & Oana) push my rating over the limit of 5 stars. This will be my first choice for my next trip to Athens. The location is perfect. It is just outside the crazy Plaka and a block away from the main shopping streets. It takes minutes to walk to the acropolis, ancient agora, or the fabulous National Archeological museum. The rooms are solid and silent. I never heard any noise from other rooms or the street. The finishing is beautiful, if you like polished marble bathrooms (floors have roughed marble so they are not slippery when wet). Breakfast food selection is great. Everything from the basic toasts (4 different breads) with jam to eggs and bacon or spinach pie and cheeses with cold meats. There are amazingly good pastry sweets and fresh fruit selections. The finishing touch is the staff who take a real interest in you and what you plan to do with your time. For example, Eva knew after the first day that we had 2 daughters. She readied a large table for us for breakfast as soon as she saw my wife and I look for a table. In none of the other hotels on visit did any staff notice or care that we were a group of four. Lastly, someone on TripAdvisor said the walk to the National museum was best avoided and taxi was the best idea. Oana told us to try the walk and gave us a map of the route. The walk was great. Aolou street was beautiful and full of great restaurants and stores. I am so glad we listened to Oana and I am glad she bothered to ask about our plans for the day. Hermes Hotel should be at the top of your list of places to stay in Athens.
title: Ideal hotel for a stay Athens

review: My daughter and I stayed at The Marble House while vacationing in Athens and it was the perfect location with a cozy, clean, friendly atmosphere. It's close to public transportation and easy walking distance to all the sites and museums. Highly recommended!
title: Cozy, friendly, and clean

review: Hotel is well situated, very clean. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The view is amazing. Pool was very well kept. Water could be a little warmer. Staff at the pool could be a little faster. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. Looking forward to returning.
title: Simply Outstanding

review: My wife and I stated here for two nights. The room was clean and redecorated with a modern standard. The hotel is located in a walking distance to Acropolis, restaurants, shops etc. The staff was very helpful and service minded. They even helped us booking bus and ferry tickets from Athens to one of the islands in Greece. I have no problem staying here again.
title: I would stay here again

review: Don't be fooled by the aging exterior. The rooms are very modern with high quality finishes, several offering magnificent views of the Acropolis. Pluses include amazing pool, phenomenal rooftop bar setting, and first class spa. Despite the amazing setting, however, service at the rooftop bar is nearly abysmal and a negative incentive to go up there. Overall, the service was very good. It's a good mile plus walk to Plaka so plan accordingly, especially in the hot months. I would be happy to stay here again.
title: Excellent choice for room size, quality

review: The hotel located in the quiet area very close to the Acropolis Metro Station, 5-10 mins walking to the Acropolis entrance and the busy Plaka area. The receptionists were friendly and efficient. When checked in, we told them that we needed to depart earlier than their restaurant breakfast opening of 7 am, they sent within an hour prepacked breakfast to our room. When we returned from Mateora, we stayed in Hera Hotel again and enjoyed the buffet breakfast in the restaurant. The breakfast had limited choice but still good quality and with plenty of vegetable & fruits.Their standard rooms we stayed were well equipped but tight in space. Two of us(slim in size) with two pieces of medium size luggage found it uncomfortable to move around. The rooms and bathrooms were tidy. There were no clothes hooks in the tight bathrooms, nowhere we could hanged the wet towel etc. Bedding was comfortable and towel smelled fresh, soft & clean. The sound insulation with the neighboring room was weak. One time we had a noisy neighbor and we could hear her talking whole night long.
title: Nice hotel in good location

review: We stayed at the Hera twice, at the beginning and end of our stay in Greece in June. Initially we were so tired from the long flight it was a wise choice to have allowed an extra day there.The rooms are small, but well furnished. Comfortable clean beds and a nice view on the upper floors facing the street (front). The breakfast buffet included foods we'd have at home with local sausages bread and fresh yogurt and fruit.The staff is friendly and helpful - even after we blew a fuse/circuit breaker with a power strip plugged into an adapter. They also arranged a taxi to the airport both times we had to leave and made sure our second stay was at an upper floor with a balcony street view.The Roof Garden Restaurant was also amazing. See the separate review....
title: Hera's Peacock has reason to be Proud

review: If site-seeing is what you are doing in Athens, then THIS is your place. You can walk out and zip to the Acropolis and the Acropolis Museum in about two seconds. You are nicely set up to walk almost anywhere in Athens. Our room had a nice view of the Acropolis (so pretty at night). There's a cute, little restaurant on the top floor where you can grab a drink or have dinner with great views. The staff at the front desk is SO helpful and can advise you on anything an everything in the city. Love this place!
title: GREAT location, and SUPER staff

review: We enjoyed our stay at this property. Excellent service, great location, comfortable rooms and great views! The Executive Lounge had great options with friendly and helpful staff. All staff spoke English and made sure they offered their help.
title: Excellent value, great service

review: Marble House is really centrally located - easy walking distance to the historical sights and fun shops and restaurants.The hotel itself is very clean and nice. I loved our room - it had a great deck - and the staff were friendly and helpful. At such low prices, I definitely did not expect such high quality service! I recommend this to anyone looking for a good value within walking distance of sites. (It does have a shared bathroom situation, if that bothers you!)
title: Charming hotel for a great value

review: Hotel was situated in a great place near the Acropolis. The daily breakfast was very good. We were able to walk to all major attractions from this location and many restaurants were very close by. Staff was friendly and rooftop bar was cool.
title: Great Location

review: We have just left from a 2 night stay at Hera Hotel. The hotel itself is a lovely boutique hotel in a great location. Walking distance to everything you would need for a stop over in Athens. The rooms are of a 4star hotel standard with a delicous buffet breakfast. What makes this hotel is the staff, the reviews are all true the care and genuine desire the staff have towards making you stay in Athens a wonderful experience is commendable. Thank you Hera Hotel!
title: Lovely Hotel with Amazing Staff

review: Wonderful service, nice breakfast and perfect location to meander around the Acropolis. The front desk staff helped with every question we had. We had a very pleasurable stay. Would recommend if you are looking for 3-4 star hotel.
title: Perfect Acropolis location at decent price

review: We travelled as a family of 4 (2 teenage daughters) and booked a family suite. Upon our arrival at reception we were offered two double rooms instead which was a very welcome surprise. This amazing service continued throughout our 2-day stay. We were just minutes walking distance away from the Acropolis, Acropolis Museum and the Plaka. If you get a chance, book a rooftop table at their sister hotel (Herodion) just around the corner for a spectacular sunset dinner with view of the Acropolis.
title: Great stay

review: The Philippos is always The BEST! We love staying there and enjoying their fantastic hospitality. There is no better location. You can walk everywhere or catch the metro easily. Yet it is just enough in the neighborhoods to be quiet at night when you want it to be. Top rating every time!!!
title: Family celebration

review: Wien you book a Hilton you know you are going to a top hotel. This one has a fantastic pool, a great gym and SPA. Very much appreciated the welcome drink at the roof bar with a fantastic view. Great breakfast buffet and friendly employees. Who could ask for anything more?
title: Excellent: that's all!

review: Booked this place for our trip to Athens. Got it as a steal!! The best & cheapest way to reach from airport will be to take the X95 express bus (right side of departure gate) and get down at Syntagma Square (last stop), this is almost an hour drive and take a taxi (1.8 kms to the hotel) P.S: Not many know this hotel by name due to its location, you need to specify that its on Aristogitonos lane. Alternatively you can take the Airport to Monastiraki by Metro (45 Mins ride) and 15 min walk to hotel, careful if you have lots of luggage as this station is filled with few 'strange' people who bombard tourists!!! Pros of ACS:- Colourful budget rooms with basic amenities, top floor ones offer a good view- Greek breakfast loaded with bread & cheese served from early hours- You can book your hop in hop off bus tickets at counter- Self service Tea & biscuits at the lobby- Great location to access and enjoy local food, street joints & Hard Rock CafeCons of ACS:- Very poor response to emails- They are under staffed (probably offseason may be)- Location does get lonely at night as its in between a market
title: A good hotel in city center

review: I booked this hotel last minute after changing my travel plans and boy did I make the right decision. First of all, this property is minutes from the new beautiful Acropolis Museum, south slope of the Acropolis itself as well as the Plaka. The location seriously couldn't get better! Next, the staff was so friendly and helpful at all times. Their hospitality is some of the best I've ever encountered traveling! The room was comfortable and the breakfast spread was very nice to fuel up with in the morning before adventuring out. Highly recommend this property
title: Perfect stay!

review: The hotel is perfectly located to visit Athen’s main attractions. You can easily walk to Monastiraki or the Acropolis, to the Syntagma Square, but also to the National Archaeological Museum (just to mention a few). The metro stations at Monastiraki and Omonia Square are just a five minutes-walk away. We came back to the hotel for the second time and stayed two nights as the first time. Our room was clean, the staff was very kind and helpful and the roof top terrace with its view to the Acropolis is just great.The door of the bathroom could not be closed well. And during the night from Saturday to Sunday it was quite loud outdoors (music).
title: What a view!

review: Pros: - Close to everything. - Modern, clean rooms. - Two elevators. - A mini fridge. - Eggcellent breakfast . - Great roof bar. - Spectacular view from roof. - Helpful staff. - Adequate wifi. Cons: - Small rooms. - Thin walls.
title: Satisfied

review: We were invited to a wedding in Athens and getting ready for such an event is not easy even in your own home. The Centrotel was a great choice - spacious rooms, clean, comfy beds, a lot of mirrors, big bathroom, surprisingly quiet (I slept better than in any hotel ever!). The air conditioning works very well. There are even small lights like stars on the ceiling that change colour. The staff is extremely nice, quick and helpful, they make you feel comfortable. They gave us a map of the city upon arrival and after that gave us tips on how to get to the places we needed to whenever we left the hotel. We needed an iron - it was brought to our room by the time we took off the elevator from the reception to our floor. They even let us leave our car in the garage for a few hours after we had checked out because we wanted to do the free walking tour in the morning.The hotel is close to Victoria (5-6min) and Larissa (ab. 15min) metro stations, which are just a few stops from the Acropolis and the city centre. But being close to the train station, the neighborhood is a bit unpleasant (not very clean, weird people etc.), although we never had any problems even later at night. The garage is underground and there were enough parking spots, but it is narrow, so if you have a bigger car, you will need to manoeuvre more.Next time we are in Athens we are definitely booking at the Centrotel again.
title: GREAT hotel&staff, dodgy neighborhood

review: My mom and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights prior to boarding our cruise ship in Piraeus. We arrived in the late and the staff was friendly and welcoming, quickly checking us in. The room was a bit small, but clean and was fine for just a couple of nights. There is a rooftop bar where you'd can get some great shots of the acropolis from a distance. Outside of the hotel entrance is a farmer's market when you can buy fresh produce like vegetables, fruits and even some souvenirs. The hotel is located near Monastiraki square, which is a great place to find restaurants/cafes, shops, and even some ancient ruins.
title: Good hotel in great location

review: Don't let the entrance to the hotel worry you - from the outside, set pretty much in a bustling market, the hotel seems like it's 2 star, but once you get to your room, you realise you truly made a great choice by staying here. We first got a room on the 2nd floor and had to ask to change rooms as the window was literally looking out directly onto another building, just a stone throws away. It was so claustrophobic we asked to change rooms and we were given the top floor room. Wow what a difference - we were literally looking at the Acropolis!!! The bed is comfortable, air-conditioning works well. Loved the laundry service where they do a whole bag of your laundry for a very small fee within 24 hours. The breakfast was excellent too, varied on different days with extremely friendly staff. The location is perfect, so close to everything, sensational local eateries right around the corner - wine bars, local shops, coffee shops, no tourists in sight! I would definitely come back if I could be guaranteed a higher floor room. The bar on the rooftop has wonderful views, just feels like it can do with some more decorating.
title: Ask for top floors

review: We stayed here for two nights. We got an upgraded room (that was words of staff but don't know if it was real or just our room). The room was very big. Bathroom too. The room was very well soundproofed. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was just normal (instead of others comments I don't think it is super). Basic plates : orange juice, greek yogourt, croissant, breads, cake, few jams, peach, eggs and bacon, coffee and tea. That's all. I think so the price is a bit expensive, but it is vacation after all ! Anyway, the hotel is at a good location : 5min by feet from victoria station (green line) and 15min by feet from Larissa station (red line or regular trains)
title: Great Hotel, good location

review: This hotel should have at least 3 stars and maybe even four - I could not believe how nice it was for the price. The room is comfortable and well equipped. I loved the tiny lights in the ceiling above the bed that change colours (you can opt not to use them). Best of all you get a hydrobath - basically a spa tub, which is wonderful to relax in at the end of a hard day's touring round Athens. My room had a lovely little balcony as well. The areas downstairs are comfortable. Everything is spotlessly clean. The restaurant offers breakfast for 7 Euro - a buffet where you can stuff yourself with a selection of sweet and savoury foods, cereals, fruit, coffee, juice etc. Staff are friendly and knowledgeable about pretty much everything in Athens. Room service was so quick I barely had time to put the phone down before a lovely member of staff was knocking on my door. They go out of their way to help you with directions, advice on local places to eat. This hotel was recommended to me by a friend who lives in Greece, and when I read the reviews I was a bit concerned about some of the things people said about the area. This is a very well located hotel. It's about 3 minutes walk from the metro (Victoria station) - a lovely square with nice restaurants on it and even more places to eat within a 5-15 minute walk - and all incredibly good and cheap. It takes only a few minutes on the metro - about 15 - to reach the main sights (Acropolis for example) but you will save 50% at least on your accommodation if you stay at Centrotel rather than near Syntagma or in Plaka. I stayed here on my own, and as a woman, I never felt uncomfortable walking back to the hotel at night. There is nothing dodgy about this area - it just isn't touristy. It's a place where ordinary people live and work, and staying here gives you a sense of the real Athens as opposed to the areas designed with tourists in mind.
title: A real gem of a hotel (and yes the area is nice too)!

review: We stayed at Centrotel Hotel for four days and it was fantastic. The hotel interiors are very clean, modern and comfortable. The location was perfect for us, very close to Victoria Metro station which is two stops away from Monastiraki Station Square which is excellent for restaurants, views of the acropolis and the famous flea markets. We were able to get from the airport to the hotel no problems via the metro at the cost of €10. You can also purchase a metro ticket for the city for 5 days at €9 each which was also perfect for us. Due to our early flight home we preferred to book a taxi back to the airport which the hotel was more than happy to arrange for us (taxi was €42 fixed price). They also provide breakfast for €7 euros if you are hungry in the morning. The staff were super helpful recommending local restaurants on the first night as we arrived late, providing us with a map and advice on how to get around the city. I can't fault them.I was a little apprehensive about the reviews regarding the neighbourhood but I would say there is nothing to worry about. Yes there are some migrants walking around but it is like that all over Athens not just at the hotel, even in the main tourist attractions there were migrants walking around and begging. So don't let this stop you booking this gem of a hotel.I definitely would stay again and also try out the jet stream baths in your room they were awesome.
title: Great hotel, great location, great staff and SUPER CLEAN

review: Very nice hotel in Athens. The location around the hotel don't look that great, but I thought it was very safe. Walked around in the night with no problem and people who lived around there were very nice. The hotel is clean and very comfortable and the bathroom was nice too.
title: Nice clean hotel

review: We stayed at the Areos hotel for 5 nights in July. At first sight the area 'seems' a bit intimidating, but actually it's not bad. The hotel is well located and many places of interest are within walking distance.We stayed in a superior room and deliberately requested a room at the back of the hotel away from the main road. It was quiet and very comfy. The bathroom and shower were huge. It was also nice to have a balcony.The staff were all pleasant, friendly and extremely helpful - they booked a couple of tours for us, explained the metro system and how to get to various places. Overall our stay was very pleasant and we'd definitely go back.
title: Great location, friendly staff, perfect stay

review: Great hotel. Great staff. Love my Greek peeps. Harris, British George, frank Lopez, stefania, Dimitri, sweaty hands, Mr George, Vanessa, Calypso, maids amazing, rooms great. Loved my stay there. Thank you
title: Awesome hotel

review: We stayed 3 nights in the upper floor suite. It is a very spacious apartment with a seating area facing Lykabettus Hill. Bedroom is comfortable, very bright and has glass windows-doors on both sides. There are also a large terrace and even additional balcony from bedroom which we did not use due to some chilly weather in April. But we enjoyed our inside seating area with a view while having afternoon tea with sweets from local bakeries. Long corridor leads to a spacious bathroom. Honestly, I think that the spa-bath design is too unnecessary fancy and I did not figure out how to use it except as a shower. It was slightly uncomfortable for me to get it and out because of very high bath tub and narrow glass door access. Nevertheless, shower head was wonderful and water pressure was excellent. Needless to say all was very clean.Hotel personal is young, friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet was good. WiFi worked well. We were not disturbed by street noise to notice it or to comment about it. We found hotel location as totally safe. Walk to metro station was easy and short; and one time we walked down to Monastiraki without transportation. Archaeological museum is really close to the hotel; and it turned a bonus for us as we went to this museum twice during our short stay. Archaeological Museum collection is so marvelous and rich and grand that one visit is not enough.
title: Very comfortable and close to archaeological museum

review: Myself and two friends stayed here for a girlie city break. The hotel as expected is on a hill (clue in the title) and about a 12 minute walk from the entrance to the Acropolis to head up to the parthenon. It is also a 20 min walk to the Panathaneic stadium and about 15 to Monesteraki which has nice restaurants and the markets. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful. Haris was great and as three ladies in Athens told us how to stay safe - even offering to challenge any taxi that tried to over charge us!The room was fine - we had a triple which was two singles and then another bed across the base of them. Bathroom and shower were adequate and there was a little balcony but it overlooked the adjacent property and there were alot of trees so we did not use it. Breakfast was included in our deal and was continental with usual, pastries, yoghurts, cereals, meats etc but also scrambled eggs (very good) plus bacon and the little frankfurter sausages. The hotel does have a small pool to cool off in and a roof terrace with a nice view of the Parthenon. Overall really lovely place and would absolutely recommend it.
title: Great service - little gem of a hotel

review: My boyfriend and I stayed for 4 nights at Acropolis Hill and enjoyed every minute of it! The room was clean and spacious, with a comfy bed and modern decor throughout. The breakfast buffet was lovely, my favourite was the Greek yoghurt with fruit! Our room was on the 5th floor which meant the rooftop terrace was a few seconds away! We made use of this in the mornings and evenings, the view is just too good to miss! The hotel is located very centrally which means you can walk to all the best attractions, we spent the whole holiday on foot! I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an enjoyable stay in Athens!
title: Excellent!

review: We didn’t really know what we were getting when we reserved rooms at this hotel but we were soon to be very happy.The information said the hotel had a view and it sure does.The elevator holds three bags and a thin woman but the stairs are convenient.The rooms are small but nice and the air conditioner works.The workers were helpful and friendly, especially Katarina.The terrace on the 5th floor could use some umbrellas and other items to make it more comfortable, we still enjoyed beer on the terrace with a great view of the Acropolis, met some other travelers from other countries, sat next to the pool, had decent breakfasts, and could walk any and everywhere we needed, including to the Acropolis. There is plenty of shopping, eating and site seeing within walking distance. I would stay at this hotel again without hesitation.
title: A place I will come back to.

review: I stayed at the Acropolis Hill hotel from June 21-24 and it did not disappoint. The rooms are modern and a nice size. The hotel staff were very hospitable and helped get you where you needed to go. The included breakfast was excellent and had many delicious options. The hotel is conveniently located in Athens just a 5-10 minute walk to the Acropolis and a 10-15 minute walk to the Plaka and the metro. There's a rooftop garden with a beautiful view of the Acropolis at night. It's a nice spot to bring a bottle of wine and enjoy the fireworks. I would definitely stay at the Acropolis again.
title: Great accommodation, convenient location!

review: i was lucky they upgrade my room to suite and it was perfect the breakfast was very good . It is a very good hotel clean and near the city center The service also was very good the staff was very polite
title: very GOOD HOTEL

review: We had an amazing experience staying here! The staff was always helpful and the breakfast was delicious. If you ever called up the reception or room service, they would delivery and cutlery you asked for within 5 minutes. It was a very small and cozy hotel with a homely feeling. It also had many grocery stores and restaurants nearby and was not very far from the centre.
title: Stayed here for a school competition!

review: stayed for 6 days July 1st thru 7th 2017 the room was beautiful so was the bathroom the complimentary breakfast was excellent and consistently so every morning.The best thing about this hotel is the front office staff very respecful and helpful and HONEST, my wife forgot her earrings and sunglasses in the room when we got to our next stop in Germany we called the hotel and spoke to Nickos one of the front office mangers and told us that they found them and sure enough he shipped them to Germany the next day.We DEFINITELY recommend this hotel it is a great symbol of the Great Greek Hospitality.
title: Excellent Hotel & Staff

review: Yes location fits around Athens to a t, first class location great service throughout stay, even a complementary hair dressers nicely cutting ones hair to complement an extra good will part of trip, very nicely situated all created by Karen my trip adviser
title: Summer trip 2017

review: Clean rooms and bathroom good. I recommend a room at the back as it's quieter.Check in staff and concierge are very friendly and helpful.Great breakfast with hot and cold options and fresh fruit, eggs can be cooked to order although this is not advertised.There is an onsite hairdresser Eleni who is fabulous she trimmed my fringe and gave me a fantastic blow dry 3 out of 5 days what an amazing service!
title: Great hotel

review: Guest Relations nightmare; two reservations made for the same night, paid for in advance (one through third party agent & other through hotel website).My family is due to arrive into Athens early September. We only require one room, I have asked the hotel if there were interconnecting rooms advised no rooms of that type.I have paid close to $800 AUD for two rooms for one night, I asked if it was possible to remove one of the rooms and perhaps use the cost (in theory) to upgrade to a room facing the acropolis. Request DeniedI was told that I could just cancel the room via the third party agent. Spoke to IHG guest relations explained the situation. The agent was helpful and understanding. At no point did I ever seek a refund knowing that the terms were prepayment and non-refundable. The agent contacted the property directly on my behalf to try and negotiate some sort of upgrade given the cost of the room. Unfortunately the guest relations agent was advised no, I would have to pay for that.I have a young family (two children under 10) they can not utilise the other room. To be honest I am not upset that I booked two rooms I take responsibility for that, however I was hoping the property could see it was a mistake and perhaps compensate us a little. So am I looking forward to my stay, no sure ...All I know I have tried to contact a management and there is no response...I am hoping it will be sorted when we arrive or I will have a spare room !
title: Guest Relations

review: Not near anything famous and soft beds are the minor complaints. Charging guests for Wi-Fi felt really cheap. I expected to be able to stay online during my stay without being charged extra to do it.On the plus side, the breakfast was fascistic and the customer service was impressive. The staff was very polite and helpful when we asked a question or needed some advice.
title: Probably better choices out there

review: This hotel lives up to its brand name , the service is always pleasant the breakfast is great and the rooftop bar has a fabulous view . All this is to be expected from a 4 star establishment , however if you don't get a refurbished room the decoration is passable , the pool is too small , the drinks are expensive in the bar , €16 a mojito .Tip: nice little shop straight on and on corner right . For cheap local food go to Vassilis, right and follow signs .
title: Intercontinental

review: We were two couples in june 2017We wanted to have a hotel in the plaka district, but all the affordable 5 stars hotels were unavailable. So we ended with this lovely hotel . The room is spotless and spacious. The bed which is very important to me when I travel is very comfortable, Also the pillows. The amenities in the bathroom is standard, there is no toothpaste and toothbrush and no shaving kit, but honestly I didn't expect due to its price. There is also a free shuttle to the center, but we didn't use it. The breakfast is okay , there's not much variety but I was pleased with it.I got a massage in the spa which was very very good. The service is very good and very reliable Also the business room is very practical We made a check in to the flight and had them parented without any charge.On the last day when we finished our breakfast and intended to get in a taxi to the airport one employee of the breakfast worker came and gave us an phone which our friend forgot .All in all it's a very good experience.
title: Very good hotel

review: -nice view - the parthenon - from our room-good variety of breakfast -spacious clean room-shuttle bus from hotel to syntagma square is very useful -wi-fi for free since I am an IHG member-overall I had a good stay :)
title: Spacious clean room

review: I was very impressed to take my family to such a nice hotel. We ordered a 2 bedroom apartment which was very clean and modern. Beds were very comfortable, and facilities in great condition. We ordered room service as we had just left a full day tour and were very tired. The meals were very reasonably priced and very tasty. Hotel was also in a quiet location and we all had a good nights rest. Breakfast buffet was included and offered a wealth of options. Thank you for your hospitality!
title: Very pleased!

review: Staff very helpful, serviceminded and polite. Room was nice and clean, bed comfterable. Room cleaned every day as new towels and soap provided. WiFi available . Good breakfest.Just positive experience.
title: Nice hotel

review: After weeks of intense we decided to splurge a little on some comfort and we were not disappointed. Golden Age Hotel had all the necessary amenities. They had great food available through room service. The Greek salad and chicken fillets were oily, but tasty. The hotel wasn't above and beyond but it was very well equipped and staffed and what was needed for rest and comfort. There were some instances that we had issues with the WiFi but the front desk was quick to assist however possible, successfully. The hotel is about a 45 minute walk from all the major attractions such as the Acropolis, museum etc. or a 3euro/10 minute Uber ride away. During the time we were there we found Uber to be much more affordable than the local taxis. Using an Uber to travel to the airport (or just outside -- Uber's "shouldn't" be driving directly into the airport) will save you some cash.In addition, the hotel staff member, Olympia, who came to clean our room was incredibly friendly! She had the most vibrant personality and was always happy to help teach us Greek and make us feel welcomed. Kostas at the front desk was also incredibly kind. Overall, a very positive experience.
title: Nice, Clean, Wonderful Staff!

review: Stayed here as part of a Cosmos group and it was my favourite hotel throughout our tour of Greece.The staff and concierge at reception were so friendly and not the fake friendly it actually felt genuine. They spoke impeccable English and were beyond helpful.Breakfast has a vast array of different meals to suit everyone. Sometimes the waiters are a little slow to offer address you and offer you coffee. But a minor issue.The restaurant also offers lunch and dinner and has quite good food.Rooms are comfortable, spacious, clean and the air conditioning functions well (a must in Greece) Very good location - 2 minute walk to the metro which gets you to the centre in 2 stops and the acropolis in 3 stops with a line change.Will stay here again!
title: Loved this hotel

review: Stayed July 2017 Hotel is located right in the heart of Constitution Square. Rooms are very clean and the staff is EXCEPTIONAL!!! . The breakfast buffet is very good . This hotel is within walking distance from a lot of restaurants , coffee shops, and shopping. there is also high end shopping within walking distance with the road closed off , so you can walk in the streets.
title: Great Location !!!

review: What a great hotel this was. We stayed here for about 6 days, and were amazed and so happy about the hospitality and services at this hotel. Very friendly staff, a big shout out to Nikos who helped me with translating some greek meds. The breakfast is very very good. Filling, hearty and good coffee. We felt weird if our day didn't start with the breakfast. It's better than the Hilton's breakfast. There's a gym, but we didn't use it as we were out a lot. But when we stayed in, Room Service was splendid!!! The restaurant is also fantastic, very good food and quit affordable. There's also a myriad of good restaurants nearby too. Better room service pizza than Italy! (In this reviewer's opinion). Mini bar wasn't stocked though, but we bought our own cheap but delicious greek wine, I called down and they even sent up an opener; other hotels did not do this. We even asked to use an iron and ironing board. Metro is close; walking distance to city squares. Convenience store 5 mins away for snacks and such. And the shampoo/conditioners are amazing! We wish we...collected...some more for the rest of our trip. Without a doubt we would stay here again.
title: Superb...Amazing

review: This hotel was very nice. The rooms were spacious. The staff were friendly. The only drawback was the room stunk of cigarettes even though it was supposed to be a nonsmoking floor. The breakfast was great. It's right on Syntagma, so the location was perfect. There are many nearby shops and restaurants and the area is well lit and safe.
title: Great location

review: Hotel is dated but well maintained. In the center of tourism; just across from Greek Parliament. Good nightly rates. This said, clerk talks of breakfast, at checkin, as though it's included. Likely it's not so ask prior to taking your breakfast otherwise you might get a surprise at the end. All-in-all a good 3 star hotel with character and close to it all.
title: Dated But Nice

review: Sure there may be newer hotelrooms in Athens - but I may not use a calory to find it out. Best location in the city, excellent service, spacious comfortable rooms, very good breakfast buffet and helpful staff. I come back here each time in Athens...
title: Location - Service - Comfort ...and a smile or three

review: My fiancée and I stayed three nights at the Polis Grand in May. The room was fantastic, the staff at the check-in were helpful, and the hotel itself is within a reasonable distance from the major attractions surrounding the Plaka district. Best of all, the outstanding array of cuisine to wake up to in the morning!
title: Excellent value for the money ... make sure to upgrade for the breakfast!

review: Clean hotel with good price-service-value. Central acres to all areas. Friendly staff, excellent breakfast buffet. The roof top bar is one of highlights with view over the city. The room is small, but sufficient for 2 persons.
title: Central hotel

review: Stayed here just one night, hotel room is basic but was all everything I needed for the night. Easy to get to, convenient location, Staff were very friendly and bed was comfy. Only walked around during the day time but area seemed safe enough.
title: One night stay

review: The hotel is a decent size building, very clean and well presented. The staff are unbelievably helpful, nothing was any trouble. All the staff went above and beyond, but Vassilis was a standout for us (there were 11 of us in total) My family from America were unlucky enough to have a suitcase go missing from the airport, but the hotel staff were non stop in trying to locate it for us.The hotel is very well placed for the Acropolis and Syntagma Square etc, and most attractions were within walking distance. The rooftop bar/restaurant has a real wow factor when you first walk in there at night, but the service seemed a bit slow for drinks, As has been mentioned in previous reviews, the breakfast is really good. Lots of variety to cater for all tastes, from fruit, various breads, drinks etc, it was a very nice experience. The bedrooms were a little small, but about right for a city hotel. Why only 4 stars? The lifts were very small, hot and slow, and there were only two in operation. The kids were happy to use the stairs, but it was a little frustrating sometimes waiting for the lifts. All in all, a very easy going and positive experience, which I would recommend to anyone. Next time we are in Athens I will certainly return.Thank you for looking after us
title: Very friendly hotel, well located

review: Our stay here for a total of three nights during our honeymoon recently was great. The people working at the hotel were very kind and their service was amazing. The location was very central to everything we had planned. The Acropolis and many great restaurants and bars were in walking distance. We will definitely be returning here on our next stay!
title: Great service and staff!

review: As a professional hotelier of some 30 years I can say our time at this gem of a hotel was exceptional. We stayed here for four nights from July 20th till the 24th. Andreas and his team are super friendly, professional and bend over backwards to make sure nothing is too much trouble. We are a family of four and did not feel uncomfortable (to the contrary felt very comfortable as some rooms can accommodate four people) as I would say this hotel is more suited for couples - very cool vibe with beautiful bedrooms !The hotel is beautiful with very tasteful decor, quality furnishings, huge bedrooms, gorgeous bathroom with a cast iron tub in the room in addition to a walk-in shower in the bathroom, luxury toiletries, Nescafe coffee machine, plush towels and bathrobes. Andronis is extremely well located in the heart of Athens in a very cool and trendy area of Athens called Psirri - full of restaurants and quirky stores and located near all the major attractions of Athens but did not feel touristy at all. We would definitely stay in this area again.The hidden secret of Andronis has to be the restaurant. It is highly underrated and not much advertised but hands down I have to say, as a massive foodie and a hospitality professional, the food is EXCEPTIONAL ! Although we only had the pleasure of the breakfast, I can safely assume the rest of the menu (which looked very scrumptious indeed) has to be amazing. Overall, I must say with all the years of global travelling and staying in some amazing places, I have to admit Andronis is definitely among the top of the list of places to stay and what makes it even more special is the outstanding team led by Andreas - highly professional, friendly, knowledgeable and extremely service oriented !Well done Andreas and your team and see you again. Yes, WE WILL BE BACK !!!
title: Luxury Gem in the heart of Athens

review: Nothing happens for a reason!We were not even supposed to stay in Athens but after our flight to Milos was cancelled, we had to quickly find an hotel in Athens for the night.How lucky were we to find this gem!!!First, the service was just great. We felt welcomed as we stepped on the restaurant floor (there is no hotel reception). Very friendly, but yet very professional.The room - we had the room on the 4th floor, so we had this huge deck with a nice little place to sit outside with a nice overall view. You can`t ask for a nicer room, the bed was really comfortable, nice bath, little kitchenette....and the room was extra clean.The location - we didn`t stay long enough to experience the city but it is really centrally located. It is located in a little street with some bars and restaurants so it can get a bit noisy but we didn`t mind it and being on the 4th floor kind of cut down the noise.The restaurant - we ate at the restaurant for a late dinner and it was great. We went with recommendations from the waiter and were not disappointed. A lot of items on the menu did look good.The only sad thing is that we were there for only one short night as we needed to leave at 6AM to take the ferry. But they were nice enough to bring us a full cabaret of things (yogourt, fruits, croissants, etc.) for breakfast the night before so we could eat even if the restaurant was not opened! They also arranged a taxi for us.We had a great experience and we certainly hope to be able to come back to Athens one day and come back to stay at this really nice little hotel (only 4 rooms).
title: Simply perfect!

review: ###June 25-26:We arrived at our hotel Polis Grand in Athens, and were completely exhausted from the flight, plus a 7 hour time zone difference. The Hotel is a 3.5/5 in my opinion. The hotel itself is clean, but like many European Hotels – the room is very small, as is the bathroom. However; the daily breakfast on the second floor is very well equipped and well worth it. They put out a lot of hot and cold dishes, plus all the small things you would like to see in a breakfast (too many things to list, including the drinks). Overall, this hotel is nice and the service is friendly, and is good for a quick 2 day stopover, on your way to see other part of Greece (ie…The Greek Isles). While I am here, I will take this opportunity to mention our 2 day stay in Athens…When we got to our hotel at 10:30am from the Airport, they told us that check in time was 3:00pm and after. So we sat around and went for a walk down the streets of Athens and eventually wound up at the Monastiraki square. We had a Gyros, and went back to our hotel to take a nap. We woke up a little later, and went back to eat dinner at Monastiraki in the evening. This is a very lively place, full of lights, music, shops, street vendors, and live bands. It was entertaining. As far as the food goes, it was good, but unfortunately being from Toronto, I cannot in all honesty state the food in some of the Athens places we had; was better than some of the Greek restaurants we have in Toronto. We are truly spoiled in Toronto with the authenticity of the various ethnic foods which are available. That’s not to say the food in Athens is bad; however it is more to commend the authenticity of the food in Toronto. From the Tzatziki to the Souvlaki to the Gyros to the Greek Salad. They all taste just as good in Toronto, if not better. Btw - the feta cheese in these Greek salads are a 3"x4" block of feta they put right on top of the salad (Personally I prefer a lot of Sprinkled Feta in my Greek Salad – but to each his own). The salad is huge, and the tomatoes taste very different from a North American tomato from the grocery store, which tells me the tomatoes in Greece were very fresh organic tomatoes they were using.  ###June 27:This was our second full day in Athens, and we walked around on some of the Athens streets to some highend boutique stores, and found the purses to be better priced in Athens, even with the Conversion Rate: TRAVEL TIP: If you are looking for a high end purse, you should buy it while you are travelling in Europe, because you are refunded the tax (VAT), which ultimately decreases the overall price of the purchase. The only caveat is that you have to mail the proof of purchase to have your CC eventually credited. We also did a sightseeing tour to the Museum, and of course the Acropolis. Since we went at the end of June, it was extremely hot, and furthermore, we were experiencing a Heat wave at that time also. It was Very Very Hot. And since you have to climb up the Hill to get to the Acropolis, it got very hot and very tiring.  TRAVEL TIP: Make sure you have a big Thermos or 2 in your knapsack to keep your water cold, else the water will get warm very quickly. And believe me; you will need the cold water, during the Hot Season. TRAVEL TIP: The Travel company tour for 65 EURO pp from the hotel was way overpriced. Not required. Alternative is to get a taxi and go to the acropolis yourself. This bus tour took you on a sightseeing tour of some of the things to see in Athens, but you remained on the bus until you got to the Acropolis (with one stop in between at a small Soccer stadium). After which, we went to the old Greek Plaka area in the evening, which is a nice long strip of Patios and Restaurants, and had some delicious Eggplant appetizer (sort of like Baba Ghanoush) and some Greek beer on one of the Patios.After 2 days in Athens; we went to the Athens port to board the Jet ferry to Mykonos.....Which is a different post you should read. :-)
title: 2 Stay Stopover @ Polis Grand in Athens, prior to Mykonos....

review: Andronis Athens is not really a hotel per se. It consists of only 4 rooms, which I wasn't completely aware of at the time of booking. We booked an Acropolis view room, which I'm not sure was the best room for us. The Acropolis view suite is on the top floor (4th) and consists of 2 levels with the bedroom being on the top level accessible by a very steep spiral staircase. Even though my husband and I are both very fit and work out all the time, the stairs were a pain, not to mention pretty dangerous if needing to get up in the middle of the night or if one had had one too many cocktails. The top floor location also made cooling it very difficult. Granted the temperatures in Athens were in the 90's, but we had to close the curtains and keep the air on all day to ensure it was cool enough at the end of the day. The staff was wonderful, and the lack of lobby was fine given there was a charming cafe on the ground floor that was open all the time. Breakfast was included and customizable, and was a highlight of our stay!
title: More like a VRBO than Hotel

review: Stayed one night pre cruise. Ideally situated for Acropolis, Parthenon etc. Room clean but bathroom a bit dated. However, it suited our needs. Room overlooked the front Makri Street which is very narrow and one way so traffic didn't bother us. Plenty of choice for breakfast, however, dining room does not have table for 2 only tables for 6 or 8!Didn't have dinner but had a drink in the bar which runs a Happy Hour from 4pm to 8pm - buy one drink get another free. This actually means that as we bought a drink each it would have been our second round which would have been free not a BOGOFF deal whichI thought it would be. Perhaps I was tired having been up since 2am in order to catch an army morning flight from LHR and misunderstood the terms!
title: Good city centre hotel

review: A surprising find in the attractive area of Plaka. The room was plain and a bit disappointing on entry. However, everything else more than compensated . Super friendly greeting on arrival plenty of helpful information , terrific breakfast and the very enjoyable four hour happy hour (buy one get one free at reasonable prices). Easy walking distance to ancient attractions. A handy Super Market at the end of the street. There are plenty of places to eat in the Plaka and we particularly enjoyed the Gyros at the takeaway directly opposite our street. This hotel could make itself even better by paying attention to a few easy to fix details in the room. For example having two coffee mugs when two people are staying, instructions on using the safe, ensuring the TV is tuned and working and extra pillows in the room. These were quickly fixed when raised but I feel I should not have had to ask.
title: Holiday in Athens

review: Stayed just one night in Airotel Parthenon. Hotel room was simple but was clean and had the essentials. However, what stood out was the phenomenal service by the hotel staff from the moment we alighted from the cab. Velisarios and Giota were the most friendly and welcoming hotel staff I've ever met. They did not hesitate to assist us in any queries regarding the hotel amenities, the places of interest to visit whilst in Athens and even recommended food options nearby. As our flight was at midnight, they willingly offered us to place our luggage in the concierge once we checked out so that we could tour the city and come back later in the evening to collect our luggage. They are such an asset to the hotel and I would not have felt more welcomed and enjoyed our stay in this hotel if not for them. The free breakfast provided was great and had a good variety. Would definitely come back to stay at this hotel because of the impeccable service from the hotel staff and the convenient location.
title: Conveniently located and top notch customer service

review: 1 minute walk from the Acropolis and the Parthenon which every one needs to see in Athens. 2 minutes walk from La Plaka which is very worth it, alot of very good restaurants.The rooms are okay and the staff is very friendly!The breakfast was excellent!The hotel doesn't have a pool or a gym.I would still recommend it!
title: Very nicely located hotel

review: Wow. The location couldn't be better. Right near the acropolis. About 200m from the entrance. Lots of restaurants and shops around. The hotel itself is suit old and dated and could do with a refurbish Bieber it is clean and adequate. The staff are what make it. They are so friendly and helpful and nothing is s problem. We also were able to store our luggage there whilst visiting the islands The breakfast was amazing.
title: Location simply Awesome

review: the hotel offers delicious food!!!.....the breakfast was great, huge variety, and the staff was also very helpful too .....on the 8th floor there is also a restaurant with a great view of the acropolis, my wife also agrees with me, our experience in your hotel was great, for sure we'll be back
title: A great Radisson hotel

review: I loved the venue and whole stay thanks to all friendly professional staff. If you book bussines room, you wont regret as the standard rooms would deserve some refurbishment.The buffet breakfast has great selection of food so everyone find the right items to own satisfaction. Meeting rooms and its equipement together with AV, are great and offer variety of options for diffeent event types.St' Astra rooftop bar & restaurant are another great places you shouldnt miss - having nice dinner or just drinks with a breathtaking view of Acropolis is pricelles. And of course, you shouldnt either miss the rooftop swimming pool.
title: The most affectionate hotel ever

review: We loved Evripides for many reasons especially for the family and lovely staff.Incredibly friendly and helpful and full of laughs.The room itself was huge with the very wide opening French doors to a big balcony with beach view.Big comfortable bed and lovely linen. Bathroom roomy and well equipped.We recommend Evripides very highly.
title: Great hotel in beautiful seafront position.

review: This is a clean but basic little hotel that offers excellent value for money given its central location. The highlight is the roof terrace from which to have a spectacular view of the Acropolis. Recommeded.
title: Good value

review: We have just spent a few nights at Radisson Blu Park Hotel and it was an amazing experience.Very helpful staff,informative and friendly.all through our stay,everyone made us feel very special and welcome.Our room was well designed,spacious,with comfortable beds and excellent bathroom facilities.There was great internet covering all over the premices.We enjoyed very much the breakfast buffet,which was generous,with all kinds of options,from light to heavy and everything in between.The best part of the hotel was the pool area,with great drinks and stunning views of the city,where we also had a delicious dinner!the food and the service were both at the highest levels!!Overall,everything was fantastic and we could not have been more pleased with our entire stay!!Thank you Radisson Blu Athens!!!till next time!!!
title: Amazing experience

review: Very nice decoration but expensive food.. and location is not perfect as it is not very close to the shopping centers. We went for shopping by taxi which took 30 min to the center. The weather was bad and we could't benefit from the swimming pool in May.. the nice thing is that there is a view in the roof floor which allow to see a very beautiful view of Athens.
title: Nice experience

review: If you are looking into a good option for hotel while staying in Athens, the Radisson Blue is worth considering. Very good rooms, friendly staff, and a very good A/C system in the summer time (very important in my opinion). Good return from your money. The only issue is that there are not that many restaurants within 5 minutes. Overall, very good experience.
title: Good hotel and friendly staff

review: Friendly and efficient staff. Great breakfast included and magnificent view of the Acropolis from the dining room. Room was clean, simple and comfortable.The neighbourhood is covered by graffiti and a few people hanging out in the streets. Just around the corner, there are amazing lanes and little bars and restaurants. I was able to walk to all the main sights around Athens from here. Glad I stayed and would stay again.
title: A gem in a colourful neighbourhood

review: This is a really great hotel in an awesome location! It is walking distance to several shops, restaurants, and the museum. Worth way more than the price. The rooms are on the small side (as all other European rooms are) but, super clean and the beds are really comfy. The staff is super helpful as well when needing to book taxis or when looking for places to go/eat.
title: Great hotel!

review: I stayed in this hotel from 24/6 until 29/6 and am so happy I did!!! To summarize: rooms are on the small side, but tidy; rooms have a small balcony; breakfast buffet is served on the roof terrace with a great view of the Acropolis; hotel is located near a church that will wake you up between 8 and 9 am; walking distance of all hotspots (restaurants, stores and sightseeing points); great service of personnel; overall great experience! What I loved most about the hotel, next to the location of course, was the personnel. You are required to leave your key when leaving the hotel, so there is always some interaction with the person behind the desk. We met three persons and all of them had such great personalities! They asked what our plans were for the day and gave some advice on where to go (e.g. change of the guards that only happens on Sunday 11am in Syntagma square). I got sick on our last day, the day of checkout, and they arranged for us to stay another two hours in our room and even made us some pineapple, which they said, would help recovering. I am very grateful, as I did not see myself walking around the city with 40 degrees when having the flu. I will definitely stay in this hotel again when traveling to Athens.
title: Wonderful experience!

review: Stayed here for two nights. The location is perfect for sightseeing at the main attractions in Athens. The room is average and also during the evenings you can hear some noise from outside when trying to sleep. Overall, good stay and decent price for the location.
title: Good location

review: We stayed for three nights in this hotel. The best part is probably the location. It is easy to explore many parts of the city by foots. There are also plenty of restaurants and bars nearby. The room was pretty ok in size but the bathroom was quite smelly. The room was cleaned every day. Breakfast was nothing special and the breakfast area was arranged in away that it was quite tricky to try to collect different things especially if there were other people around the "buffet".The roof top terrace was so nice and it was really relaxing to sit there. There were two things which put us quite off. One evening we came from the city and the lady in front desk handed the key to us. When we were in the elevator, we noticed that we got a key to a WRONG ROOM. I completely understand that everyone makes mistakes but this was a pretty scary one. Especially when there is a safety box key attached to the room key. The other was that when we were checking out, there was a 4 euro extra labeled as "BAR", even though we always payed with cash. As we left so early there was not change to solve this at front desk but I contacted the hotel afterwards and it was an error and they solved it smoothly. And it wasn´t that much about the amount but the principle. It is never that nice to have to spend time to solve problems as a customers.
title: Good location, ok standard

review: This is good, basic hotel in a convenient location - just a short walk from the Acropolis with plenty of restaurants and bars in easy reach. The area looks pretty rough with all the graffiti (some of it’s worth a look, though) but we were two female travellers and had no problems at all.Our room was a decent size and clean and quiet. Another plus was sitting in the hotel bar in the evening with its fantastic view up to the Parthenon. Stunning.The only downside was the faint drain smell from the bathroom.Overall - safe, quiet and good value for money.
title: Good location, good value for money

review: We stayed for 2 nights in July. Staff are very helpful, gave great advice about where to eat and allowed us to store our baggage after we had checked out. Easy walking distance of the Acropolis, markets and restaurants. Breakfast served on a rooftop terrace with top views of the Parthenon and you can take food and drink up there during the day. Rooms are small but clean and well appointed. If you are a light sleeper, bring earplugs to block out the local church bells at night. Overall great value.
title: Friendly staff, clean, well located hotel in Athens

review: Very serviceminded personal,good and cheep breakfast with a lovely view at Acropolis and the Athen Cathidral. They send us a taxi to pickup at the airport and orded the return to the airport for free.
title: Staying at Hotel Metropolis

review: - great location- safe neighbourhood - close to museum , acropolis, shops and restaurants- clean and spacious in bedroom - friendly staff - bathroom little small and awkward to shower without wetting everything
title: Thank you AS

review: This hotel was ideally located for venturing out and around Athens. We could get to the Acropolis easily and over to the Plaka district for snooping and dining. The hotel itself was just OK as far as accommodations go. One thing that really bothered me was that our rooms reeked of cigarettes. Clearly they do not have rooms that are designated smoke free. The AC was also struggling to keep things cool (in fairness we were there during a heat wave.) They did provide a really nice plate of fresh fruit (pears, apples, oranges, peaches) and the staff was quite nice. The breakfast was also very good in the mornings. Overall, the rooms were a bit stale and needing an update, which is why I can't rate this with 5 stars. Everything else was great, and they made us wonderful dinner reservations, so if they would give the hotel a refresh, put in stronger AC units and make some rooms designated non-smoking, I would think they'd be a wonderful choice.
title: Great Location, Just OK Hotel

review: The location of this hotel is very convenient. It is a very short walk to the Acropolis and the New Acropolis Museum, as well as the Plaka area. The neighborhood is close to restaurants, including those by the Acropolis. Room was small, but clean with included bath and balcony. A nice touch was a small fruit plate and bottle of water provided. A/C worked fine-and it was needed as the temperature in Athens was close to 100F. Loved the breakfast with a nice selection of food including yogurt etc. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We let the hotel arrange our taxi to and from the airport. Would stay here again if we are able to go back to Athens!
title: Location!

review: This hotel was very welcoming and had nice rooms. It is a short walk from the Acropolis, Temple of Zeus, and Olympic Stadium. It's a good value for the money. The complimentary breakfast was excellent.
title: Nice hotel close to lots of monuments

review: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. Our first night was a quick stay as we were departing for Hydra the next day. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. We were able to leave our larger pieces of luggage there until we returned from the island, which was great! The breakfast space is clean and modern with a good selection of foods to keep you going for the morning. You can get to the Acropolis within 5 minutes. There are also two amazing restaurants within a 5 minute walk - Mahn Mahn and Sfika. You will not be disappointed should you choose to eat at either spot. Overall, the hotel is a great place to stay while in Athens.
title: Great location and helpful staff!

review: We just stayed two nights and found it convenient, as it is close to the under ground Metro Station. The room and bathroom was small modern and clean. Breakfast and facilities were nice, front desk staff was helpful and friendly.
title: Convenient Hotel in the centre of Athens

review: I made the booking at Athens Lotus Hotel and mentioned that we will arrive by 7 am from the airport, however we arrived and they informed us the hotel full and they cannot give us the room until 2 pm, we are honeymooners and didn't sleep since two days, arrived the hotel so tired but unfortunately the receptionist was a bit tough and she couldn't show any kind of helpful, no sofas or any place to have short nap, we were extremely tired so we slept at the chairs at the lobby, few people checked out front of our eyes requested to have their rooms but they refused, the first day in Greece and the first hours in Athens wasn't as expected because of them, were planning to have some rest and go around the city afternoon but they destroyed everything up for us !!!!
title: arrived early

review: We stayed at the Athens Lotus hotel for five nights in July. The accommodations we're clean and everything that should be expected from a hotel in Greece. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful and the price can't be beat. The location is not the most central in Athens, but the hotel is about 300 feet from the Metaxoughio stop on the metro. The Metaxoughio stop is very easy to transfer to other metro lines (all three of the major metro lines are accessable within one or two stops of the one near this hotel). Grab a five day metro pass at any station and getting around in Athens is a snap! We would definitely recommend others to stay here!
title: A great stay!

review: My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night in Athens. It was perfect for that amount of time. The staff were very pleasant and the room was clean. It also had a modern bathroom. It's a good hotel to stay in if you are getting the train to Meteora (which we were doing). Be careful walking around though, we were in a beautiful area drinking wine and turned the corner and were in a very dodgy area!! I wouldn't recommend walking home in the dark. Comfy bed and excellent nights sleep!!
title: Perfect for a few days

review: Great location one block away from the subway which can be taken to the sites and the airport. Spacious clean rooms and on site restaurant.
