The breakfast was fresh and plentiful. front desk Staff was friendly and helpful. Only con is that there are no irons in the rooms or hotel. Only option is to use their pressing service. Note they do not check-in before 2pm but do keep your bags in case you want to start your trip ASAP. It is also about 2 or 3 blocks away from a local delicious svylavki restaurant.
title: Nice

review: The location is great ! A 5 minute walk to the Plaka and within 10 minutes from the acropolis. Getting here from the airport is very easy. Simply take the X95 bus from the airport for a few Euro to Syntagma square and then either walk 800 meters downhill to the hotel or take a taxi for €5.The rooms are quite spacious and very clean. The staff are super friendly. The breakfast is fantastic , from around 6h30 to 10h30am. It also has a gym and a sauna.There is a restaurant on the top level with great views (a little distant) of the acropolis and live music (pianist). The only suggestion I would make is that management relook at the pricing of drinks to attract their clients to stay and dine in the hotel. I read a review prior to arriving commenting on the reasonable drinks prices, you must be kidding ! The cocktails were double the price of those in the Plaka , literally exactly double. This put us off and we ended up dining out every evening.Other than that , a great upmarket hotel. I would stay here again. Hopefully by then we'd have a reason to dine in the restaurant.
title: Great !

review: We were off to a cruise, so this was the hotel booked by the tour. I really can't say too many things about it except that it was adequate and absolutely charmless. The location is okay, but not great. Not far to the Plaka district (can walk) and transportation, but not super convenient. View from the top level bar/restaurant was ok, if you want to eat/drink there. Dreary and a little run-down looking street, especially at night, but safe. The staff is hit or miss, mostly miss. This includes the front desk and breakfast crew. The breakfast was, in a word, a disaster of their own making, including the food, which was also not very good in taste or abundance. The staff was totally non-helpful and lacking in any training or common sense. The rooms are ok by US standards. Basically clean and more or less up to date in decor and amenities. Small balcony but no view, overlooked some graffiti buidings. Absolutely ok for tour groups, but wouldn't recommend it for solo travelers, unless you have to stay somewhere for a night before or after a cruise.
title: Adequate Tour Group Hotel

review: We stayed at this hotel twice and were not disappointed. It is clean. The beds were comfortable. The staff were professional and accommodating. The breakfast buffet that was included was superb. We walked away feeling very full.
title: Very Nice Hotel

review: This hotel is adequate and clean but nothing to write home about. The location was just five minutes from the Plaka and the Acropolis museum. We has two rooms. Both were a little small and drab but clean. Breakfast is not great and while the staff were friendly the breakfast itself was poor. As a hotel it does not have great facilities and I've never been in a hotel before with so few working electrical sockets!
title: OK but would stay somewhere else next time

review: Location - central, about 20 mins from airport and 10 mins to ferry portStaff - extremely friendly and helpfulAppearance - tidy and cleanRoom - comfortable and not too tightServices - amazing restaurant (a must see!)We only stayed here for one night and would recommend the Athenian Callirhoe to anyone traveling to Athens. No complaints about this hotel.
title: Perfect Place To Stay

review: It gives me great pleasure to review the stunning Divani Caravel Hotel, Athens. Last week my family and I had the pleasure to call the property home whilst visiting the beautiful capital city of Greece. Upon our arrival we were professionally and promptly greeted by concierge and reception staff. Our suite was that of above and beyond expectation and quality, that was comfortable, and spacious. We could unwind within the suite with ease; it contained 2 flat screen televisions, a dining and lounge area including a very spacious bathroom. The property is beautifully maintained, spotless throughout- and reception is grand- it's a breathtaking enormous grandeur space with high ceilings and a stunning chandelier that captures your attention upon entry. Kudos to the management and staff in entirety for your hospitality and services offered to us, whilst we stayed with you. Everybody from check in, through to house keeping, food and beverage services were brilliant, and executed excellent and above and beyond customer service. You all made us feel right at home. Our experience was indeed sublime. The roof top pool is very memorable for our family- and the food, cocktails, and stunning uninterrupted view of Athens and the Parthenon unforgettable, breath taking. Breakfast was delicious, and the complimentary bedside slippers for us all, including the chocolates and turning down service every evening was a wonderful addition to our stay. Perfectly located in Athens, lots of cafes and restaurants located right next to the property- but do yourself favor and savor the Divani Caravel's Club Sandwich by the pool- absolutely delicious! Furthermore, the hotel is only minutes walk away to Evangelismos Subway Station- that takes you to the famous Athens Flea Markets (Monastiraki) and Ermou Shopping etc.- only 2 stops away. Excellent link to get you there. Based on our experience and based of the above mentioned qualities, it gives me much pleasure in highly recommending the Divani Caravel Hotel Athens to anybody wishing to appreciate quality accommodation whist visiting Athens. A quintessential property that has class and sophistication- a comfortable destination who's staff provide warm and professional hospitality and services. Congratulations to the Divani Caravel Hotel Athens. We sincerely look forward to coming 'back home' to you when we next travel to Athens. Our sincere thanks and appreciation.
title: A Quintessential Destination

review: We stayed at Divani Caravel during our stay in Athens. This is a 5 star hotel and had all the amenities you would expect from a 5 star hotel. The customer service was great. They helped us with all of our requests. The hotel is a 10 minute walk to metro. Also, there are lots of cabs parked outside the hotel. Mount Lycabetus is an 8 minute drive from the hotel and the Acropolis is 3 metro stops away. We didn't try the food at the restaurants so I can't comment on that.
title: Nice hotel

review: Good location and service, however for the price it was not up to scratch.All services are mentioned ie pool, gym spa etc.However only the pool is free for use. The gymnasium they want Eu15 to use which i thought was very expensive considering what I paid for the room.would avoid in the future.
title: Adequate

review: Stayed here for 2 nights and would definitely recommend it! The staff would really helpful and friendly. Spent a relaxing afternoon sunbathing by the rooftop pool while having drinks served to our sun loungers from the pool bar. The room was spacious and came with bath robes and slippers .... felt quite luxurious! My only negative comment is that breakfast was charged at €29 per person which is crazily expensive and not worth it so we just booked a room without the breakfast included.
title: Good experience!

review: This hotel is very close to everything - metro, shopping, restaurants, sights, you name it. It is a small hotel with no possibility to buy meals or drinks, but you can find anything you need in close proximity.We had booked a room "with city view", and what we got was a room with a small window looking into an ugly backyard/the walls of the neighbouring building. This was a bit disappointing, having read a lot of reviews complimenting the nice view from the rooms. The room was however very quiet, no noise from outside.Our room was quite small, and in the bedroom area, my partner could not stand upright due to the low ceiling. We missed some space to keep our belongings, there was no counter in the bathroom and no desk in the room, so most of your things will have to stay in your suitcase or on the floor.I guess you pay a lot for the location, as I did not find the room itself to be worth the price.
title: Very good location in city centre

review: We were two families of four with some of us staying 4 nights and other 3 nights. Overall we were very happy with the Divani Caravel. The rooms were very good sized, although we had expected that the triple rooms would have had a true bed for the 3rd person, not a sleeper sofa.The breakfast, as mentioned is overpriced for what you get if you pay out of pocket, but was actually very reasonable when you booked the room with it included.The roof-top pool was very nice, although we were a bit surprised at the cooler temperature of the pool (especially given how hot it had been in Athens the two weeks before we arrived).Customer service was excellent and they were very helpful in the one area where we ended up having some disappointment/confusion. Because the people in our party had been in Europe from 1-2 weeks already, we had specifically looked for someplace with laundry. Ultimately this is more of an Expedia issue than a Divani one, but arrival we learned that they have a rather expensive external laundry service, not the self-service laundry facility we were expecting. However, the front desk was very helpful in finding a small local laundry shop that we ended up using and being very happy with.Our first night there we were quite tired and ate dinner at the hotel restaurant. Overall I would say it was good. Nothing special, but it certainly hit the spot and let us get to bed earlier than if we went somewhere else.As for food options there are several very good places literally around the corner from the hotel, several of which we did end up eating at.Overall we had a very nice stay at the Divani Caravel.
title: Very nice hotel

review: We had a great visit at the Emporikon. We requested an Acropolis view and it didn't disappoint. The hotel was easy walking from the train station and very central to many sights. Would stay there again.
title: Holiday

review: We stayed at the Emporikon last year (2016) and LOVED it. We were nervous at first because there is no outside signage. We were so surprised to find this completely renovated, unique, upscale boutique hotel. The rooms we stayed in last year had high ceilings, modern decor, and great A/C. There is no room service/food which is fine and almost preferred as there are restaurants, bakeries, so many options all around the hotel. It is super convenient to the plaka area and the acropolis. We loved it so much we went back this year with another family! This year we stayed in room 202 and 204. 202 had a loft-like look/feel and my kids thought it was the coolest! The other family stayed on the top floor in this super cool family suite. They were so happy and I was happy since I suggested the hotel! This is now our go-to place to stay in Athens.
title: Hidden jewel

review: This is a very quaint hotel perfectly located right in the heart of town. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff was nice and accommodating. The only minor complaint I have is that there is no restaurant to sit and eat breakfast. Instead, you have to order breakfast to be delivered to your room, which we chose not to do. However, there are plenty of places right downstairs to go out to eat, so that was only a minor inconvenience. Otherwise, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay!
title: Perfect location!

review: We found this a bit tricky to find, during a recent weekend heatwave. So you may pass by the front door before realising you're actually in the right place. Look out for the red key sash on the door.Our room was very comfortable, a wonderful oasis of cool from the Athenian heat. It's in a fantastic location, minutes from the Plaka, metro and the eating area of Psiri. The view from our balcony of the Acropolis will not be forgotten. We were not too sure how we felt about the bathroom - it's behind a glass door and the toilet, hand wash basin and rainfall shower are all in one room, so unless you're on intimate terms with your room mate ... not all rooms are the same, so this may have just been our room. It didn't bother me as much as my significant other!Front of house staff are engaging and happy to assist with any of your needs during your stay and are interested to hear of your day when you return from your tours.We enjoy staying in smaller, boutique style hotels where guest service is a core part of the business and this is certainly that.
title: Perfect location, cool relaxing rooms

review: My sister and I had a really nice time staying here. The concierges were all fantastic at helping us figure out our stay. We were amazed at how easy it was to get help arranging a taxi for pick up the next day. They even arranged for us to be able to get an early breakfast, at no extra cost, even though we had to check out an hour before the breakfast opened. The daily breakfast selection was very nice. Food was delicious. Room was a good size and we had a nice time staying there. We were able to walk to many major tourist sites without issue. Also, this hotel is located right by the bus stop from the airport. Was very happy with our stay there.
title: Great service and good location

review: The hotel is located very close to Syntagma Square, which is very convenient for taking the X95 bus to and from the airport. It is also perfectly situated for exploring the Plaka and all of the historical sights on foot. Our room was small, but clean, and the hotel breakfast was good, with a variety of hot and cold items.
title: Great location for a short stay

review: This is a small hotel in a very nice location, just a few steps away from Syntagma Square. The check-in process for our group of ten people was friendly and efficient. The elevator is quite small, holding only four people without luggage or fewer with luggage. As a result, it took a while for our group of ten to get to their rooms after checking in. Our room for four people was reserved as 2-bedroom, but the configuration was a bit of a surprise. There were two twin beds in one bedroom, one twin bed in the other bedroom, and one twin bed in the entrance area near the bathroom. The larger bedroom with two beds had a plug strip with multiple outlets, a stocked mini bar, plenty of storage space, and a small balcony with two chairs. The room areas were clean and comfortable. The bathroom had a tub/shower, small basin, and toilet. When leaving the bathroom there is a small step down just outside the door, and all of us kept tripping when we left the bathroom. We just weren’t expecting a step there. There is no computer available for guest use, but the desk clerk helped print the boarding passes for our group using the staff computer in the lobby. Free WiFi is provided, but the service is spotty—sometimes quite good, sometimes less so.One nice surprise: We were told upon checking that the breakfast buffet starts at 7:00. Our group had reserved airport transportation that was to pick us up at the hotel at 7:00, so I told the check-in clerk that we wouldn’t be able to use the buffet. They said that they would try to set things up by 6:00 because of our early departure, and they did. Very nice. The buffet had cold cuts and cheese, bread and rolls, a toaster, pastries including delicious spinach pie, an egg maker for boiled eggs, and more. We enjoyed it.The people at the hotel are friendly and helpful and we enjoyed our stay at the Pan Hotel.
title: Convenient to Syntagma Square and Plaka

review: We stayed here on two separate occasions in a month. Very close to Plaka, Monastiraki & Syntagma square. Variety of transport options near hotel including trains and airport bus. Shopping districts & restaurants within minutes walk. Hotel is clean, has a good breakfast, good wifi & a lift. The staff are helpful & courteous. Had to leave early for a flight but still arranged for breakfast to be available. Stored luggage for us after checkout time and arranged taxi when requested. I would not hesitate to stay here again as it was great value for money given its proximity to everything & given it met all our requirements.
title: Great value in a fantastic location

review: Stayed here for a first stop on our honeymoon! PERFECT location for foodies, landmark lovers, popular shopping, and nightlife! Our taxi from airport had no trouble getting us here. The front desk is very friendly & helpful! Like Margaretta (sp?) who helped us find concert tickets for an event the same day as our stay!!As far as the room goes, the bed is comfy, the terrace is relaxing, the bathroom is nothing special, and the AC works wonderfully! All and all it was a beautiful stay, and we would love to come back again!
title: First leg of Greek Honeymoon

review: The great thing about this hotel is that it's near... pretty much everything. Plaka, Syntagma Square, Ermou Street, metro station, National Historical Museum, etc. The room is lovely and very clean. The staff was fantastic. They really went out their way to make sure we have a good stay. There was one day when the temperature went up to almost 100F. When we got back that evening, we discovered a key card in the switch. There was a note from one of the staff explaining that s/he used the card to keep the a/c on so that the room would be kept cool. Sometimes it's the little things and details that made all the difference on the hotel and its service quality.
title: Lovely boutique hotel in a convenient location

review: Wonderful staff and convenient hotel on the northern side of La Plaka.You rented the top floor/penthouse loft for less than $250.00.The loft has a jetted Jacuzzi. The room has an entire patio (although to hot to seat and relax). The A/C worked well as it was needed with 100F weather.Some touches need to be updated, like all around the bathroom, and the two people elevator is very slow but overall a very cool and convenient place for a day or two in Athens.
title: Wonderful staff & great location!

review: Well situated near Syntagma Square and the Plaka, the Diamond is a convenient and comfortable place to stay. Rooms are air conditioned, towels and soap provided (no shampoo, so bring your own). I caught the x95 from the airport to the square for 6 Euro, and a 5 minute walk from there had me at the hotel. Staff were courteous and helpful, and the included breakfast provides a variety to suit most tastes. Loads of affordable eateries within the area.
title: The heart of Athens

review: I chose this hotel for location and price (105 euro per room)The room was spacious and clean. Yet in the pictures furnitures look new and modern, some pieces turned out to be a little shabby. Reception hall though is nice and stylish, personnel fantastic and helpful and would go out of the way to make you feel at home. Breakfast abundant. Location perfect- just 3 min away from plans. Thank you for the warm stay - would choose the hotel again, but wouldn't pay more
title: Shabby, but still good parity

review: The hotel wasn't as we expected. The service was slow. The reception wasn't active we should ask many times the same things. The housekeeping wasn't good. The room we booked like city view it was totally something else!
title: Hääpäivä

review: Used to be the Imperial Hotel.The hotel is beautifulAnd serves a wonderful buffet breakfast included with the mail.The rumors are very clean and modern with plenty of room.The roof top bar ,restaurant, swim pool are excellent. Some say the viewI'of the Acropolis from here is unbeatable.The bar and restauraunt are expensive but very nice. The neighborhood is improving but not close to major attractions.
title: Excellent Room. Superb rooftop bar and restauraunt with a killer view!

review: First time staying in a Wyndham, have a generally good stay as expected from its reputation and was particularly impressed by the breakfast choices. However, had trouble with the front desk almost every time I tried to just get a quick information - never got greeted nor the staff initiated or asked, just kept doing their own thing, although I did get the info when asked after waiting for what seemed to be a long while. The location is good, some very good, or so-so, restaurants in the walking distance and subway station right across the roundabout on the other side.
title: Good breakfast but busy front desk

review: It's okay..not great. At first glance the hotel is nice. It's modern and clean...but there are some things that need major improvement. The pool area is way too small -- and there are only about 10 chairs! This is completely inadequate considering the size of the hotel and the number of guests it has on a daily basis. Also, although officially there is "no smoking" allowed - my room smelled like smoke the entire time I was there. And there were times when it was so bad that it smelled like someone was actually blowing smoke into my room. I had read the reviews beforehand and I agree with those who say it isn't the safest area to walk around. I probably wouldn't stay here again--although, this might be more because I wouldn't visit Athens again and not necessarily just because I wouldn't stay in this specific hotel again.
title: It's okay...not great

review: I want to point out and say unequivocally that this is the best massage I have ever had in my life. Perfect pampering for the body A once in a lifetime experience and I want to mention Aspa and Faye. The two girls who do are just perfect
title: A perfect massage

review: We stayed at the Central Athens Hotel for 5 nights at the end of March. The hotel was in a great location, perfect for sightseeing. We booked bed and breakfast and requested a Acropolis view. The room was really nice not huge but perfectly adequate for what we wanted. The room was lovely and clean with clean towels daily. The breakfast was lovely with a really good choice of hot and cold food.The reception desk staff were really helpful and knowledgable.
title: Beautiful Athens

review: We found the Central to be a very pleasant surprise.Well located (walking distance to the Plaka and Monistriaka areas, 5 minutes walk from Syntagma Square where the airport bus operates from) and lots of restaurants nearby.Very clean and modern stylings in the hotel.Our room was compact but comfortable. Bathroom is well done.The big feature that we loved was the rooftop terrace bar/restaurant. The view to the Acropolis is fantastic and a great place to relax at night. Food prices are good for their limited menu, but after each long day's tourist tramping, we loved it. Staff are exceptionally and genuinely friendly.We'd give it a 5-star rating except for one thing.We lodged a minor maintenance request at reception on day one and it still was not attended to when we left three days later!Anyway, we would definitely stay there again if we return to Athens.
title: Central & with a great view

review: As the saying goes , it's all about the location, location, location. This hotel is within walking distance to ALL sites. You can even walk to kolonaki and then head straight up to lycavitos. (wear comfortable shoes). In addition to having a centralized location, it's views of the acropolis ate breathtaking, especially at night. Rooms are small but clean and equipped with wifi and strong air conditioning. Breakfast is always included and the array of Delicious food will leave you amazingly stuffed. Check out my pictures. Front desk always professional, cheerful, and willing to help. ADVICE: Have the front desk call you a taxi any time needed. Never hail a taxi on your own. Most cab drivers are crooks.
title: Perfect Location

review: Very well located in Plaka, this hotel is just very simple, worth the price/quality it provides. We stayed for one night in a 3 bed room with a nice balcomy overviewing the Acropolis. Lots of restaurants, coffee shops, and souvenir shops around. Can walk to Sintagma square. Friendly staff. Clean room
title: Great location

review: Really great hotel, everything that you'd expect from a quality place to be honest. Everything was clean cool and comfortable and the view from the top is just outstanding. Relaxing in the evening with a drink and that view is something I wont forget.The only negative isn't really about the hotel, but more of a warning about the city itself. Parking is extremely tight in Athens and therefore if you have a large car you might get a bit stuck and need some help. Small cars shouldn't be a problem though.
title: Great location - tight parking

review: Our 3 nights stay was very good. A basic hotel, clean and though in the most touristy area (Plaka), located in a small street so you can get a nice and quiet sleep. Our room with 2 bedrooms had a fridge and the air conditioning worked well. We did not pay for the breakfast but know that you get that option. Their elevator is tiny, tiny. There was wifi in our room. Their staff is nice and they ask you to leave the key at the front desk. They booked our taxi when we left without any problems. Plaka is full of shops and restaurants so if you do not like shopping, you will be better off staying in another area, a less touristy one. The hotel is very close the the Acropolis and many other atractions. Overall, a nice stay.
title: Basic and safe hotel at the centre of everything (walking distance)

review: We very much enjoyed to stay in this charming hotel with a perfect location in a quiet, although central area. Thanks to the friendly staff and to the owner!Very short distance to good restaurants, Akropolis and most other interesting parts of Athens.
title: Nice hotel with perfect location

review: Simple hotel but we got the top floors with enormous balcony's with a beautiful view over Acropolis. The receptionist was really friendly as well and even gave us a big discount on beer. Fits both family's and people who wants to party, since it's located in one of Athens best areas. Fresh rooms as well for a cheap price, highly recommended!
title: Simple but amazing!

review: Stayed at Adams Hotel for 3 nights early July .We were a family of 4, 2 adults and 2 teenagers .Didn't really know what to expect as it was a cheaper hotel , but wasn't disappointed!The rooms, though simple and basic were clean and perfectly adequate for our needs .We had a family room (2 bedrooms actually) on the first floor . No views of the Acropolis from our room but we did have a small balcony and the view of Acropolis and surrounding area from the rooftop terrace was fantastic .The location was perfect . Right in the centre of plaka but off the main strip so was very quiet . Easy walking distance to everything. All the sights and great cafes and restaurants almost at your doorstep ! Would stay again and would recommend to anyone looking for a well located budget hotel .
title: Awesome location !

review: Excellent location...5 minute walk to popular metro stop and walkable to all the sights. Room we had was basic and small, but clean. Balcony a plus...extends the size of room and has a view of Acropolis. Rooftop for drinks or a bite very nice. Employees very friendly. Good place to stay to hang your hat...you should be out there seeing Athens anyway, not sitting in your room.
title: Great location

review: We enjoyed our stay at The Attalos Hotel very much. We knew they had a great view of the Acropolis from their rooftop bar but were amazed when we saw the view from our balcony as well!!! Everyone from the staff was friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and clean. We chose not to spend the 9 extra Euros for breakfast but rather chose from the many options very nearby. The location is great, very centrally located near major sites as well as multiple cafes and tavernas.
title: Good Value at Great Location

review: Very close to Monastiraki metro station. Superb view from the roof top bar with the Acropolis in one direction & Lycabettus Hill in the other. Extremely well priced drinks......... less pricey than some bars in town! Small room but very clean with towels changed daily. Air conditioning worked well. We had a balcony room on the top floor, at the front with good sound-proofing double glazing. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice from cereals, fruit, cold meats, cheeses, cooked breakfast or pastries. The only downside was that the juice wasn't juice more like a diluted squash. Staff were very pleasant, knowledgable & helpful. Would definitely stay here again.
title: Excellent value, view & location

review: Second time to stay here in 3 years, we love the bang for your buck and great location. The staff is always friendly and helpful plus the place is clean! Good variety at breakfast and lots of seating. The rooftop bar or lounge has an exceptional view of the acropolis! Right behind the hotel is one of my favourite areas, Psiri which has so many great tavernas and a great area to hang at night and have a drink or coffee. Ermou street which is where most of the name brand stores are is only a few blocks away. Every thing like Monastiraki, Plaka the Metro are so close to get to plus the Athens market to get a few snacks are within a couple of minutes.
title: Great location

review: Arian hotel is a great hotel. Acropolis views, and restaurants right down the street close to Idion square. It may be a little hard to find, but once you do, you are in for a treat. Staff is great and the top floor garden with view to match. Breakfast prided and is also great. You will not be disappointed.
title: Off the beaten path, but worth it

review: This is in the Plaka area which is great if are just into the bar and night club scene. There is A LOT of graffiti everywhere, so much that it is "in your face" everywhere you turn. There are also a lot of gypsies constantly begging and following you around. It is around the corner from a main street where you'd to go go if you want to meet a tour bus. To the left of the Arion you go right into Plaka. On the other side of Plaka are the Zeus and Acropolis ruins (40 minutes away)... so if you are in Athens to enjoy the historical sights, this would not be a convenient location. With that being said, the front staff at the hotel are unhelpful and seem to not care about customer service. The older gentleman (constantly smoking in front of the hotel) is less good than the younger one. He was also housekeeping and you'd call him if you need towels, etc. As we got out of the cab he remained smoking, never said hello and offered no help with our suitcases. We proceeded to the front desk and waited for him as he finished his cigarette (about 3 minutes later - yes I timed him). There was no coffee pot in the room, or a mini bar. They charge for use of the safe. Bathrooms are extremely small and there is no privacy. The view from our 6th floor room was a view to trash. The free wifi never worked properly. Luckily we only booked 2 nights there. A big let down for us. Do not recommend staying there.
title: In an overwhelming graffiti area.

review: If you are a city traveler, what would you expect from your hotel?A great location, close to sightseeing, night life and public transportation, a clean room, good air conditioner, descent bed and a good breakfast and an helpful tips from the staff about what to see and where to go. All of it should of course meet your budget.Well this hotel fulfills most of it:(+) location is within spitting distance from most of what you want to see and do in Athens, the rooms are small but clean, there is a small fridge and the hotel itself is renovated and good maintenance.Price is in good value for money.(-) breakfast was just ok and the Staff at the front desk were a bit apathetic (maybe like in many other over touristic places) and not that useful.At total not a fancy hotel but nice and welcoming small city hotel just for city travelers.P.s : take noticed that all the terrible and poor reviews are quite old - it's seems that at the last few years the hotel changed for the best
title: City travelers will love it

review: This hotel is at an excellent location, both tucked away, and close to Monastiraki and pretty much everything. The staff are also very helpful, the rooms are well maintained, especially with the beautiful Acropolis view. The only reason I went for a 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the beds, they are quite hard to sleep on, and could cause a back ache. If they change their mattresses to softer/better quality, this will be a real 5/5 hotel.
title: Excellent hotel, great location

review: Amazing experience ! Excellent service, very clean, modern decoration, so romantic ! The breakfast had many options, the terrace offered the most amazing view. I would definitely recommend it ! The only problem is that its a little far from the city centre but you can take the metro or a taxi and you get there in 10 mins.
title: Perfect !

review: This hotel is supposed to be a 4 star hotel, but I wouldn't give it more than 2-2.5 stars. It's owned by SPG, but it's worse than any SPG hotel I have ever stayed at. The location is close to the Acropolis and its centrally located, but the area is filled with homeless, drunk people and you wouldn't feel safe walking at night. Couple of the staff were nice and friendly, but some were not. The rooms were really small and there was no space for suitcases. We made a mistake of booking this hotel before going to the islands and after coming back. I wouldn't go back to Athens again, but if I were to go back, I wouldn't stay at this hotel again.
title: Bad area

review: I stayed here 2 years ago and was impressed then by the style and atmosphere of this hotel. Located in the market district means you are away from the tourist hoardes but still close to restaurants and everything. Nice stylish rooms and the pool deck is wonderful for a hot afternoon or sunset drinks.
title: Great location and pool deck

review: We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. The room was clean and comfortable, the breakfast had a good variety, the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. They recommended us the best places to visit in Athens, some amazing restaurants, they ensured we are all comfortable and nothing is missing. Very nice.
title: Very nice

review: The highlight of the Melia is the rooftop swimming pool / restaurant. We ate dinner there overlooking the Acropolis, and went swimming the next morning as well.The room was very well appointed and comfortable. The air conditioning unit made some very loud noises in the middle of the night, but we were given a fan to keep cool.
title: Great hotel with amazing view

review: First time to Athens and chose Melia Athens (Omonia) as my base and shuttle to Santorini, Mykonos, Zakynthos and Kalambaka.Great choice as even though the area is old part of Athens (Omonia was first public square in Athens) but accessible was key with Metro only 3 blocks down. From there everywhere was just so convenient with all the sights and things to do.Service was super friendly and professional in check in, to luggage, directions and arranging transport.
title: Great start to Athens

review: My husband and I loved this hotel. It's modern and attractive with a bar and swimming pool on the roof. Our room was a good size and the service was excellent. We had to leave early in the morning to catch a ferry, and at checkout, without our having requested it, we were handed a breakfast to go (nothing fancy - just a sandwich and an apple - but a thoughtful touch). As for the neighborhood, it certainly isn't a fancy one, but we always felt safe at night and during the day there are some really great discount stores! (I bought a pair of Italian leather sandals for E 10). It's just a fifteen or twenty minute walk in one direction to the Plaka and the Acropolis and the same in the other direction to the National Archeology Museum. I highly recommend it!.
title: Great modern hotel in convenient neighborhood of Athens

review: Bad location, the pool close at 19:00, the area is dead about that time, the check in tooks us too long, our boys were adked to sign the check in document, the receipients were unfriendly the rooms are good
title: Bad location the pool close at 19:00, good rooms

review: After much thought, my daughter and I decided to meet in Athens Greece for our first European vacation . My daughter lives in South Korea and I live in New Jersey. We thought it would be the perfect vacation. We planned it for months, and decided after much investigation to stay in the Melia in Athens, Greece. Our flight, transfers and all of our plans went perfectly. Except for our choice of hotel. There were many issues with this Hotel . The internet did not work well , the room was not very clean, the shower was moldy, the blow dryer didn't work and when it was replaced we couldn't use it in the bathroom, we had to use it over the vanity and it did not have a cord long enough to reach over the vanity to use it. But that was nothing in comparison to the security issue that we experienced. An electrician from the hotel entered our room without any notice to fix the internet (that what the management at the hotel said). This worker proceeded to leave our room with the door propped open, he said he had to check something n the basement, this left our belongings exposed to anyone and everyone who passed by, for more than five minutes. I happened to return to the room to find that situation. When I went to the management at the hotel, they tried to tell me that the room wasn't unattended when clearly it was. The man who left it open came down and apologized for leaving the room open and unattended for that period of time.I was left feeling violated and untrusting of this Hotel. The managements response was to offer us a free drink or a dinner for the troubles! REALLY! I spoke to three different mangers and not one of them felt that this was a real problem , shame on them.I would never stay in this hotel again and I suggest that others think twice before they do.There are many clean and beautiful hotels in Athens that will appreciate your business.
title: TOTALLY DISAPPOINTED!

review: We had three bookings at the Katerina Hotel over a period of 14 days stay in Athens. Good location next to the metro, friendly helpful staff, clean well looked after rooms and amenities. Reasonably priced as well. Close to laundry, bakery with a short walk to the supermarket and a great taverna
title: Excellent staff

review: The Katerina is a very lovely hotel. It has a friendly reception and old fashioned decor. Overall, it exudes a cosy charm. The best thing about it is that our room was really really clean! The downside would be the location/neighborhood can be quite dodgy as many immigrants prowl the area waiting for any opportunity to pick pocket easy targets...
title: Really Clean Rooms

review: the hotel is well linked with metro. The service level is comply with the stars while the menu of the sky loung restaurant could be improved. The panorama on the acropoli is amazing,even if the area is not so attractive i will come back for sure.
title: Nice accomodation

review: Good location near the underground train station.Comfortable room. Good breakfast. Wonderful view from the roof restaurant on Achropolis, Licabetto and Philopappo hills.On the the roof it is available a little swimming pool with a solarium area.
title: A short visit in Athens.

review: The hotel is 'old world' with small modernized bathrooms in a very convenient location near a metro station and a pickup point for bus tours. The staff was always attentive and flexible - allowed me to leave luggage for a few hours after checkout. The breakfast is good, basic, and self service. The rooms though - small, pokey, thin mattresses and sheets, no view or balconies. I inadvertently booked a triple occupancy room for me alone and got a ?12x?12' room with 2 single beds and a bunk bed - effectively no walking space at all. The elevator was 24"x24" and able to transport 2 persons or 1 and a bag. Unless you really like 'old world charm' (see photos of lobby decor) you can get better value at an international hotel nearby for $10 more a day.
title: Convenient location, friendly staff and basic amenities

review: Rooms are a bit small, Staff is friendly and helpful, breakfast is varied but due to limited iT was difficult to keep up with demand, location is perfect for visiting Athens, metro is onlusten Aboutaleb 200 m away.
title: Good location for visite

review: Nice hotel,10 min drive 3-50 euro in a taxi to the centre. Lovely hotel,fab staff,nice pool,good breakfast,would return,rooms are big with a nice bathroom. It's about 40 min from the airport and costs about €40,excellent for a long weekend break!!
title: Weekend break!!

review: Cozy rooms and old world charm. I lovedI the antique decor of the common rooms, breakfast rooms and the bedrooms. Breakfast was excellent. Lots of fresh choices. GREAT SERVICE. The hotel is located near the archeological museum and is worth the trip. It is within walking distance of many great restaurants.
title: Excellent service

review: Location of the hotel is great, a 5 minute walk to the nearest metro station. The hotel is clean and modern, beds very comfy, good shower. The variety of food for breakfast was excellent. Staff friendly and keen to help. We stayed for 5 nights and used the pool most afternoons, it is not a large pool but really great to swim and relax around, towels for the pool available at the rooftop bar, which we used every evening, fantastic views across the city the acropolis is lit up at night so its quite something to watch the sun go down. There is a varied drinks menu and meals available. Also metro ticket for 5 days is 9 euros, very easy to use the metro, gets you everywhere you need to go. Only minus is the wifi (free) isn't great, but that was the same all over Athens. Nice restaurant close by called Alexander the Great. Would definitely recommend this hotel.
title: Perfect!

review: I stayed at the hotel earlier this month as it was in a great location for visiting Athens - it is very close to the train station at Syntagma Square. I realised on train back to the airport that I had left my ring somewhere in the room. I rang the Hotel and the Receptionist (Christina) said she would have House Keeping Check, she called me back within 15 minutes to say they had found it under the bed - they obviously had to have a good look since I wasn't sure where in the room it could have been. The Hotel arranged to have the ring shipped to me providing me with a couple of options on how I wanted it sent - I chose tracked postal option, the ring arrived safely in Dublin yesterday:) Thank you Electra Hotel.
title: Great Service - Lost Ring!

review: The Electra hotel was a well priced and comfortable stay in Athens. The food was very good as well, breakfast was included with the room, close to many of the sights in Athens. The service was really great with the staff taking care of every request we had. To top it off the use of any of the services offered at the other Electra hotels was available to us.
title: Well priced in the city

review: My family stayed at the Novus City Hotel during the last leg of our family Mediterranean Cruise vacation. The hotel is in a great location with a subway stop nearby that takes you anywhere you would want to go in the city within a matter of minutes. The view from the roof top bar and pool is just awesome as you can see a great portion of the city along with the Acropolis. The rooms are quaint and nicely appointed. The hotel staff are friendly and quick to address any need that you may have. There is a bar tender named "Jimmy Hendricks" who was the star of the hotel staff. He made delicious hand crafted cocktails and always served them with a smile and a friendly gesture.
title: A rooftop Acropolis View couple with great service

review: It was our third time in Athens and we needed two nights hotel (our flight arrived late night and we had a ferry in the next day). Becasue we wanted to spend the only day in Athens in shopping, we searched for hotel near Ermou's street. This hotel is right at the beginning of the street (near syntagma square), so for our purpose, the location was great. The hotel is good, Nothing bad to right about it, although we order a room with a baby cot and when we arrived, the room was without baby cot. Maybe a mistake that not connected to the hotel. We ordered from hotels.com. The staff arrange the missing bad very quickly. I think it's good value for money hotel.We stayed in diffrent vactions at two other hotels: New hotel and Electra Palace hotel and if your budget can allow you, consider them insteded.
title: Good location in Ermou, Athen's main shopping street.

review: Great hotel in the heart of Athens, we could see the parliament building from our balcony, hotel was very clean, there is a bar on the ground floor that serves food and drink, breakfast is served on the first floor, there is no formal restaurant, all the staff were lovely, we were allowed to use facilities at the sister hotel round the corner
title: City Break

review: Stayed there for 4 nights , on my second visit , rooms too small , bathroom to small and thought the hotel staff were rude , air conditioner in room didn't work properly. Location was good in the heart of the city , don't expect to get your clothes washed at the hotel , it's very expensive, l will not stay there again . Had a very bad experience this time . 2 to 3 star
title: Second visit and last

hotelLocation: 72 Poseidonos Avenue, Paleo Faliro, Athens 175 62, Greece
review: We visited for 2 days. Perfect location across from beach. Roof top pool and restaurant. Stunning view. Friendly staff and delicious breakfast. Air conditioned rooms made it so comfortable. Must stay.
title: Great hotel

hotelLocation: 72 Poseidonos Avenue, Paleo Faliro, Athens 175 62, Greece
review: I'm a picky Sydney sider on a budget, and was very impressed by the service, view and location of this hotel. Beautiful and friendly staff, beautiful view from our room, and rooftop pool. Delicious and wide variety buffet breakfast.
title: Highly recommend

hotelLocation: 72 Poseidonos Avenue, Paleo Faliro, Athens 175 62, Greece
review: The view to the saronic was amazing the staff very very friendly, kind and helpful, but the best of all was my cocktail!! I had a mai tai then a second one and then a zombie!!! Loved it! Going to visit again for sure
title: Best view and cocktails

hotelLocation: 72 Poseidonos Avenue, Paleo Faliro, Athens 175 62, Greece
review: We are here for 10 nights on our honeymoon, couldn't have picked a better hotel! We didn't really want to stay in the hustle and bustle part of Athens and this hotel worked out perfect for us. We booked a couple tours from the front desk, the staff upfront was so professional and helpful. We spent one day going to the city to see all the historical things, just enough. No need to go back to the city. The beach in front is very nice, umbrellas and lounge chairs available, nice sandy beach, not to many waves. Also very nice to have a roof top pool available. Again, great staff, drinks were made professionally, inexpensive and tasty. We took advantage of the room service quiet a bit. Food was always fresh, very inexpensive. Balcony off our room facing the sea was a nice retreat for us. Like everyone says it is on a busy road, but it didn't really bother us. Part of having a centerally located hotel, with good transportation options. We took the bus from the airport, pretty easy to figure out 6 euros each. We also spent a few days traveling from island to island. Piraeus port is a short 10-15min taxi and from there you can take speed ferries/ferries to various islands for very little money. We went to poros, Egina, hydra and Mykonos all from this port. Great way to see the Greek islands on your own time. Overall an amazing stay. We kept saying what a great choice this hotel was..so we would highly recommend it!
title: Great hotel, perfect location and extremely accommodating & friendly staff!!

review: Staff was very welcoming and friendly, location is the best, near to everything, the breakfast was regular and enough.If you come from the Airport, you can save money if you will take the X95 bus for 6€ and walk 200 meter to the hotel.
title: Best local for 1-3 nights!

hotelLocation: 72 Poseidonos Avenue, Paleo Faliro, Athens 175 62, Greece
review: Stayed one night pre/post a tour. Everything was nice, second time the room was much bigger with a large bathroom. Only complaint is beds are very hard.Lifts are pretty slow and small, there are stairs.Really great rooftop bar and pool area, which is great if the beach isn't your thing. Located about 15-20 mins from the main Plaka area, supermarket next door but this is closed on a Monday. Resturant on site is very good and reasonably priced.
title: Great little hotel

review: This is a nice limited service hotel. Good location near tourist spots. It was clean and comfortable. The service was very pleasant. The beds were soft. Both the AC and WiFi worked well. It fully met our expectations when we booked and was better than most similar hotels we have stayed at in Europe.
title: Perfect for what it is supposed to be

review: Rooms comfortable and clean. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was fine. WiFi worked well.Excellent location, so much within walking distance. And thank goodness for the air conditioning at the end of a long hot day! Perfect for what we needed.
title: Perfect for what we needed!

review: We had a fantastic experience at the Best Western Amazon hotel last week. Our room was spacious and quiet. We noticed that some other rooms were somewhat small. There was construction going on nearby but our room did not face the construction and was quiet. The location was excellent.
title: Excellent location

review: This is a 3 star hotel - and this classification tells you what to expect. It is clean, service is ok, not exceptionnal, comfort is average (single beds). Rooms are larger vs other European hôtels... We had a mezzanine (4 people)- narrow staircase, no lights upthere- so you can't read except if you keep the overall lights open. One particular point: you cannot throw paper in the toilet ! Breakfast is included but standard. A good thing: you can prepare your fresh orange juice. You can make your cappucino. Other good thing: hotel is very well located: walking distance from the Parliament - Acropolis museum- very near Syngrou subway station... One negative element: noisy during the day because of the traffic. Clim is also noisy - it may disturb your sleep hours.Overall This is a very good quality/price ratio.
title: A 3 star hotel well located

review: Loved every moment of our visit to the Acropolis . We enjoyed the view as well as the scenery . I thought the price was high , but if you want to see it , you pay ! It is a very long and steep walk, wear good shoes !
title: Awesome

review: This is so central and easy to get round from. Close to stations and even easy to drive out of Athens from here as it is on the main road down to the motorway. Staff very friendly, breakfast ok but nothing to knock you out. Rooms we had were spacious and comfortable.
title: Unique and Just Right

review: I can literally see the Pantheon from my room. The rooftop is perfection, the view is definitely worth a cheeky wine upstairs at night. Hotel is walking distance to so many attractions, restaurants & shopping. Staff are very helpful & friendly. Spacious room & comfortable bed!
title: Total Bargin!

review: The view of Parthenon was nice, though no one informs the guest that when the cafe at the ground floor is closed there is no way in or out of the hotel !!! During the night I needed to go out of the hotel and I realized that I was LOCKED. Honestly, that wasn't a nice experiences
title: Locked inside the building during the night

review: The location is superb, close walking distance to the Acropolis, Plaka, etc. The view of our room 407/406 was specular with great view towards the Acropolis and the city. The rooms were clean and the beds of good quality. Breakfast average, to serve tinned fruit salad.....these days? Maintenance and upkeep of the property could be better. Margerita at reception was very friendly and gave us some valuable tips for sightseeing and dining, thank you.
title: Excellent Location!

review: We stayed for the second time in six years in this lovley, cozy and comfortable hotel located close to the the Acropolis museum and some lovely restaurants.Room was clean and beautifuly decorated.Breakfast was great. Will definitely be back!
title: Excellent hotel

review: The best of many good things about this hotel was the terrace on the top floor - plenty of chairs and tables from which to survey the spectacular view: the Acropolis to the north, and the city and the mountains beyond it to the east and south. We took our breakfast up there on a tray - no problem going from ground floor to fifth with a lift - every morning, and our coffee or wine every evening: it was a spectacular way to start and end each day.It was also well placed: not only was the next road on the sightseeing tour bus routes, but the junction with that road was opposite a shady little path that led to the main footpath to the Acropolis. So instead of joining the gathering throng in the scorching, crowded and noisy coach park a walk up the road to our left, we padded our way between ancient trees and shrubs, on a path worn by feet ancient and modern over thousands of years, and joined them a little further up (only a little, but it was more magical!). The hotel staff were extremely helpful and pleasant at all times, whether we needed to know about museums, restaurants, bus routes, etc. They telephoned Hertz for us when our lack of Greek and the Hertz office's busy times made it difficult for us to sort out a problem with times for picking up our hire car - and then one of the staff parked it for us when fitting it into a small space outside the hotel proved rather stressful for guests operating a left-hand drive for the very first time!I had wanted to see Greece for over 40 years - especially Athens, Epidaurus and Mycenae - since I fell in love with the ancient Romans and Greeks at school. Sometimes when you go somewhere after all that time it's a disappointment; this was not. That first view from the terrace (we could even see part of the Acropolis from our balcony as well, by the way) was better than I'd dared even dream, and it didn't pall with repeated visits. My husband and I have a game called "Fantasy Squillions", i.e. what would you do if money were no object? On this holiday we chose our fantasy holiday home: mine was a rooftop apartment opposite the Acropolis. But I've just thought: I could stay in the Acropolis View hotel whenever I wanted instead! (And I'm not saying you need squillions to stay there - for a major city with that viewing terrace and an excellent breakfast, the hotel was not expensive - I'm just playing the game!)
title: Worth the 40-year wait!

review: Traveling with two older kids in Europe is a bit of challenge with small beds in regular hotel rooms. Their family room with 4 beds worked out well. Room was clean with a fridge. Location was great for visiting Acropolis and Plaka. Staff was friendly and breakfast decent. So definitely recommended!
title: Great for families visiting Acropolis

review: A fantastic hotel, in the heart of Athens. So close to the Plaka and shopping as well to the museum and the Parthenon. I would highly recommend staying there! The rooms, food and service were all amazing. Must do dinner at the roof top restaurant one night while you are there.
title: Great location with amazing views!

review: In short, the hotel has great position.In the centre of Athens.Close to shops, sightseeing, restaurants,... Rooms are clean, spacious enough, offering room service (extra charge of course) for those who remain hungry :) Very nice breakfast with in my opinion rich choice of meals. Pleasant front desk staff and what is great plus? Free parking! Price for accommodation as well very reasonable I have to say. Would return with pleasure.
title: Trully central

review: Great central location. The hotel is traditional European with small rooms. They are clean but nothing special. Management said they will be redoing rooms fall of 2017. Bathrooms already updated. Do not pay extra for room with a view as you have to be out on balcony and looking left. But the view from the roof top terrace is fantastic with the Acropolis in full view. We spent 3 nights (after very long touring days) on roof terrace with meals delivered to us from a local restaurant the staff recommenced. The food was excellent and cheap! Great pork gyros!Hotel breakfast was good with hard boiled eggs, meats, little hot dogs, breads, fruits and pastries.
title: Unbelivable view of Acropolis from roof top terrace!

review: My sister and I spent just one night at MET34 and had such a wonderful experience. From being prompt and eager to assist us with our travel questions and needs even before we arrived to designing a day itinerary for us to ensure we saw what we needed to during our short stay in Athens before heading to the islands, the service here is truly commendable. Nicos, Cristos, and Catherine were really great. Add to that an impeccably clean (and very new) hotel room perfectly located on a quiet side street just feet away from much more bustle, and you have an ideal place to stay. We will absolutely be back. Thank you!
title: Perfection.

review: Great location, right off Syntagma square. Within walking distance to bus and metro and many attractions. The staff was friendly and personable. Especially appreciated Leonidis and Vasiliki at the front desk. Very helpful with bus and public transportation information. Always a friendly and personable greeting. Very adequate buffet breakfast every morning. Rooms are clean, beds comfortable. Always clean towels. The first impression of the room is that it is sparse, looking like a college dorm room. After getting over that first impression, room was very adequate for our needs as visitors in Athens. Enjoyed the hotel courtyard for food, beverage, and relaxation. Not a super luxury hotel, but for the price a good value and very comfortable location. We would stay here again when visiting Athens. The staff here is great!
title: innAthens

review: The staff where really friendly and helpful. Felt like personalised service. Really comfortable bed and great bathroom. They where good enough to help me with a late check out also. Great location. I'd recommend it.
title: Great hotel and location

review: We were 5 persons and stayed for 3 nights. We had 3 rather small but very nice and quite luxury rooms. All rooms with balcony. Nice and clean all over. The staff were very helpful and supported in taxi and restaurant bookings etc. Very nice breakfast with a number of small delicious courses - all included. The location in perfect if you want to stay in the center of Athens - in walking distance to all the famous attractions. We can highly recommend this hotel -including the well qualified and polite staff.
title: Excellent small hotel with 1st class location

review: We travelled as a family of 4 (2 teenage daughters) and booked a family suite for one night as we were in transit. We were greeted by name at the front desk without presenting ourselves and this level of service continued throughout our stay. The family room was very modern and spacious. Note that the wall and door separating the bathroom from the bedroom was a see-through smoked glass. This made our teenage daughters uncomfortable when using the bathroom. The breakfast was great and the location was adequately close to the Plaka.
title: Beautiful hotel. Great service

review: Had a cancelled flight and wanted to find a hotel in Athens to see the Acropolis. Great find at InnAthens! They were so accommodating and helpful. Also, there's a wine bar right next door. Wonderful way to end to a hectic travel day. They even packed us a nice breakfast for our early flight out the next morning. Great service!
title: Great last minute hotel

review: The room is small, but big enough. It is very clean and the bathroom is superb. the staff is extremley friendly ( like all the greek people) and the location perfect. You can walk everywhere. the breakfast buffet serves anything you need. Next time in Athens we will stay there again !
title: Great staff, great location

review: Best location, Attentive and warm service (we ad to leave very early to the airport so our 3 kids got very nice breakfast boxes for the way), small and personal atmosphere. Beautiful, stylish,very large equipped rooms = excellent and very recommended hotel if you are in Athens.
title: Perfect Hotel

review: As a family of 5 we stayed in a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom apartment at this small hotel and we were thrilled with our stay! What a great little hotel - perfect location, excellent helpful staff, beautifully appointed rooms, faultlessly clean (great bathrooms!), well equipped, modern, cool and comfortable! Cannot rave about this hotel enough! You can walk everywhere from this location yet it is quiet. Small balcony, breakfast hamper with local products served in our room each morning and a welcome drink on our arrival! It really is fabulous and I would recommend it to anyone. Thank you for a wonderful stay.
title: What a gem!

review: The hotel itself is older but very clean and the service can not be beat. In the heart of the action and a short walk to the Acropolis, you can easily and safely roam the streets of Plaka. Great shops and restaurants are to be found. The hotel pool and bar on the rooftop offer a great view of the Acropolis. It's truly amazing at night! We don't regret our choice.
title: Extremely well situated!

review: We are very picky travelers and prior to our arrival to Athens, we were very worry about staying at this hotel since it is not The Peninsula or Mandarin Oriental or Four seasons but we really wanted to go to Athens and we booked the hotel late and did not have many choices. We are so impressed by the outstanding service, cleanness and comfort of this hotel. Great location. I definitely will come back to Athens and to this hotel.
title: Outstanding service!

review: Situated in the heart of Athens, you're close to all that you need. The Parthenon is a convenient 15 minute walk, and the parliamentary building is a short 5 minute walk. Parks and other points of interest are also close by. The room was well appointed and had a nice kitchenette area. We stayed in this room with four people and found it to be comfortable but would be perfect for two. Looks as though the hotel is new. There are many great dining and bar options all within the immediate vicinity, no need to travel if you want to stay local. Lots of shopping can be done close by as well. Would stay here again if we come back to Athens.
title: Nice property- excellent location

review: Stayed 3 nights in July and had a very comfortable stay. The staff were very helpful, rooms were large with a well equipped kitchenette and a nice bathroom.As far as I know, all room have a small balcony with the ones on the front enjoying a view of the Acropolis. Well located a very short stroll from all the restaurants of Plaka.Would definitely stay here again.
title: Greta Hotel and Location

review: Ava Hotel was recommended to us by our friend and trade partner Photis. and it lived up to every expectation. Boutique, fresh, trendy, new rooms, great breakfast (that bread was just yum) close to all the major sightseeing, and the Old city , Acropolis, shopping , everything was either within walking distance or a short bus/metro hop.
title: Small and Personal - just the way i like it

review: We only had one night/day in Athens & wanted to be in walking distance from the historical spots. This hotel was the perfect location...right next to the Temple of Zeus and a short walk from the Acropolis. The hotel staff recommended a great restaurant for lunch & were very sweet when we checked in, bringing us a bottle of champagne. Room was clean & spacious although we didn't even use the living room or tv as we spent our time sight seeing. Having an elevator was great to easily transport our luggage up to our room. If we went back to Athens, we would definitely stay at the AVA Hotel again!
title: Perfect location & very nice staff!

review: Thank you for making my 50th birthday exceptional. Everything at the hotel exceeded our expectations. The communication prior to our visit, the bubbly in honor of my birthday, the cleanliness and comfort of the room, the breakfast and our check out all was a delightful experience. You made us want to return to Athens!!
title: Nailed it!!

review: I stayed in Ava Hotel with a friend and it was a perfect stay. The location obviously is great, laying beside the Akropolis and Plaka old centre, and the rooms are very spacious, clean and comfortable. However, what is way beyond average and stands out most, is the extremely friendly staff of Ava! Always ready to help us, a smile and nice gestures. We felt like a king and queen! Even when i was sick, they cared for me like a family, providing me with anything i needed to get well soon. Thanks a lot for all of your kindness, it was lovely staying again with you!All the best, Mel
title: Great stay and very friendly staff

hotelName: Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review: Food, service, cleanliness is all top shelf. Centrally located it is on the outskirts of Plaka, the Parthenon and just across the street from Parliament. Also near by the National Archaeological Museum which is a must see. As well as the Metro which is across the street,
title: Fabulous Location

hotelName: Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review: We stayed here in late June. It was a family trip. We had two interlocking rooms. It is a beautiful hotel, quite pleasing to the eye. The service was great. And the location is great. There are many shops and restaurants within walking distance or within a short taxi ride. The GB Roof Garden restaurant with a view of the Acropolis was wonderful. A great dinner at that restaurant was a highlight of our trip to Athens. If you are looking for a five star hotel in Athens, I very much recommend this hotel. On the less positive side, the rooms were a bit tight. I could have used more room. And it is not a cheap hotel--one pays for the high quality. So, make sure that it is within your price range.
title: A Beautiful Hotel

review: We got to this hotel very late and were exhausted! We were greeted at this hotel by a very friendly reception, water and snacks! The hotel is very clean and had the best shower of the entire trip! It is also located in a great location - close to all tourist sites.
title: Customer service is unparalleled!

hotelName: Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review: Make sure you also dine on GB Rooftop Garden restaurant with awarded chef(s) en magnificent view. All staff in hotel EXCEPTIONALLY good service, and especially Tzina at breakfast. Rooms comfortable and grand. Will definitely return when in Athens!
title: Only the best: central location, exceptional service, view on Acropolis, exceptional food

hotelName: Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review: One gets the feeling this hotel has existed on the same basis for quite some time. The service is very good and the place generally traditional with traditional facilities for a five star hotel. Rooms and in particular the bathrooms are in need of a face lift and for the price paid one would expect better. The location of the hotel is excellent for exploring central Athens which can be done on foot. The roof top restaurant has spectacular views of the Acropolis and it was a pleasure to enjoy breakfast at this restaurant every morning. Breakfast was the only meal we had at the hotel and it was good, albeit extremely crowded and therefore not remotely peaceful. There is also a small rooftop pool which is lovely to visit after a day's sightseeing - if you are lucky enough to secure a sun lounger (everyone has the same idea about a post-sightseeing dip). Sundowners at this location are good and service exceptional. The only additional factor to consider about this hotel is that it seems to have an arrangement with cruise ships for US tourists and we had a huge influx from one of these ships!
title: Grand old fashioned hotel

hotelName: Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review: Staying at this hotel was an amazing experience. The decors are beautiful and the rooms lovely. It has rooftop bar/restaurant with a fantastic view of the Acropolis. We only stayed one night so we didn't get a chance to check out the facilities. Buffet breakfast was fantastic Probably one of the best range and food freshness we have had.Location is also great, right across the road is the parliament, and the hotel rooms have great vista of Athens. If you are looking for a luxurious stay with the feel of exclusivity and professional service, this is the hotel to choose.
title: A Grand Hotel

review: A very cosy nice hotel. Breakfast nice and satisfying. You can sort get to may of the key sites in Athens from this hotel. The staff were helpful especially helping with how to get around around town and excellent recommendation on local restaurants.
title: Excellent location to stay in Athens - easy to get around to key sites

review: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at the O&B. Because we were planning to take a day trip to Corinth and Mycenae our first full day in Greece, we initially had a rental car. The hotel was a little tricky to find by car (at first), but the location and service were very, very good. The breakfast was excellent as well.
title: Great location, great service

review: We stayed at the O&B Athens Boutique Hotel for 2 nights while seeing the main sights of the city. Everything is walkable from the hotel and the furthest sight (Panathalenic stadium) was maybe 1.4 miles. The front desk is fantastic and helped us set up taxis to pick us up from the airport and also drop us off for an early morning flight - they even packed us a breakfast on the morning we left as we were up before the breakfast buffet opened. The A/C was incredible and we slept great. We highly recommend this hotel and stay here again if in Athens.
title: Great hotel walkable to attractions

review: Not central as its in the northern suburb of Kifisia. Very close to the metro station, handy for the airport and in a very nice, quiet and leafy side street. Very close to the shops in Kifisia, limited parking spaces in front of the hotel but there is a parking garage close by with good prices. Nice boutique decor, modern and tastefully furnished rooms, monsoon shower, good wifi throughout, comfortable bed and very helpful staff. By nice buffet breakfast too. Would happily stay here again for a staycation!
title: Best hotel I've stated at in Athens!

review: We spent two nights at the O&B Athens Boutique Hotel upon arriving in Athens and then one more night before heading back home. Both times we were contacted by email before our arrival asking if they could help organize our transfers from the airport. We said yes and we had a taxi driver waiting for us at the airport with the name of our party on a sign. The hotel also arranged our transfers from the hotel to the airport (note that it's about a 40-45 minutes ride to get to and from the airport). Upon leaving after our second stay, the taxi showed up late and the hotel apologized and said that the 40 euros transfer fee would be on them. This was much appreciated.Upon arrival, staff quickly brought each and everyone of us a large glass of cold water. We also received a plate of hors d'oeuvres and drinks in our room right after our luggage was brought up. The hotel itself is clean, breakfast is tasty, and the rooms are well appointed and comfortable. We had a room for four and it was quite large. The bathroom was also very large and impeccably clean. The hotel is conveniently located. Close enough to the major attractions that you can walk there in 10-20 minutes, depending on where you are going. But at the same time, just far enough to be out of the tourist zone. It's location on the edge of the Psirri neighborhood makes it a perfect place to be within a short walking distance of some of the best restaurants in Athens. The nearest metro station is also less than a 10 minute walk away.Overall, we highly recommend this hotel. If we go back to Athens, this will be our first choice of hotel.
title: Top of the line service

review: I so wanted to give this one 5 stars. The lady on reception was lovely and helped us out at the eleventh hour when the hotel we'd booked around the corner let us down. That's Coco mat - in case you're considering it. So what happened?The air conditioning is next level efficient, which is great. But with no proper blankets in the room, you have two options - freeze or bake. It was a one night stop before an onward flight, and a restful sleep was the primary objective. Fighting with the climate control meant that objective was not achieved.The breakfast was meant to start at 7. I got down at 7.10. It was only half ready. That which had been put out had been left open, there were no serving utensils and the heat underneath the cooked items had not been turned on. So despite the breakfast not being ready, everything was already cold. Such a shame as I'd read some great reviews about the breakfast. On the plus side - the WiFi was cracking and I managed to Facetime back to Jordan. The first time that's happened successfully in 3 weeks of travel. Get the breakfast out on time (and hot!) and some blankets in the room and you've got a 5 star experience!
title: Climate control and breakfast let this one down.

review: The area of Kifisia is one of the most beautiful areas in Greece .. The experience of the Y Hotel was very beautiful ... The hotel is a wonderful place, clean and comfortable security .. Close to the shops and restaurants .. green view from the rooms ..The hotel is new so the staff are happy and enthused with the guests .. I have loved it
title: Nice experience

review: Out of the way of all the history but makes up on everything else. The breakfast was so much and fresh,and they made us a bag of food when we left early for a tour.We were only 15 to 20 minutes away from the Acopolis, but our hotel was walking distance to some great restaurants and awesome deserts. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone
title: Awesome place

review: Brand new bed linen, fluffy pillows, new bathroom appliances, an immaculate room, and a healthy and fresh breakfast. Location is great if you like upscale neighborhoods. Shopping stores, cafes, restaurants all within walking distance.
title: Better than some five star hotels

hotelName: King George, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review: This hotel was perfectly located and very comfortable. Do yourself a favor and use indoor pool and spa next door at the Britagne. It is amazing. And don't be disappointed that you can't use the outdoor pool there. The indoor pool and spa is WONDERFUL. My daughter was upset that she could not use the outdoor pool until we visited the spa. It was one of the highlights of the stay! The service over all was great. The beds are great. Pillows are great. We were very happy.
title: Excellent

hotelName: King George, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review: Wow! We moved here from our bad experience at the Royal Olympic. I recommend everyone stay here. Beautiful hotel, great breakfast buffet, awesome staff who all smile and greet you. The bellman gave us a whole run down of everything in our room from the lights, which have dimmers, how to work the safe, and the tv. Anything we needed, they accommodated. The best turn down service ever! When you come back to room in the evening the bed had been turned down, chocolates on the pillows, a mat and slippers for you feet on each side of the bed, and curtains closed. Loved our stay here, and hope to come back.
title: Beautiful hotel

hotelName: King George, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review: Let's start with the positives: the hotel is beautiful and in a great location. The restaurant on the 7th floor serves a wonderful breakfast and the restaurant itself is impeccably run. I was upgraded to a suite (I have platinum status), and the room was large and very comfortable. Probably one of the most comfortable beds that you'll find. Now to the negative: the hotel itself is portly run. I arrived in Athens close to midnight and had an early morning tour scheduled for the next day. I as staying for 3 nights, but under 2 reservations (part of the nights was being paid for by points). Upon checking in, I was told that I would probably need to switch rooms the next day but they wouldn't know until the morning. I expressed my unhappiness with this potential as I was going to be gone all day and that the very reason why I paid for the first night (instead of using points...the hotel was "sold out" for points that night) was so that I didn't have to worry about changing hotels or rooms. When I came down the next morning to see what decision had been made, I was told that I'd have to wait until after 0900 when the manager got it and that i should pack everything up because I might need to move. As you all are familiar, repacking when you're trying to relax and make a tour departure time is not fun and puts a damper on your day. But I did this. When I arrived back after a long day of touring Delphi, the manager was unapologetic and didn't see why I was annoyed. It took the very nice front desk lady to see my annoyance and offer me an apology (which is really all that I was looking for). In addition to this, there were room attendant carts blocking the hallway at all times of day, a toilet that kept running, a shower drain that wouldn't drain, and a shower head that sprayed all over. For the price of this hotel, I think this is all really unacceptable. If you've read my reviews of places in the past, you know I'm not a negative Nancy, but I don't think I'd stay here again.
title: Beautiful hotel that is poorly run

hotelName: King George, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review: Prior to my stay , I knew I would love this hotel, due to the attention and detail the Concierge Team provided me. They arranged from Airport pick up to Acropolis Private City Tour. As I arrived to the Hotel , the location was amazing across from Parliament House and walking distance to most of the key sites you would want to see in the City.The lobby is a Grand Decor Marble Lobby yet with a cool modern twist. The David Bowie portrait as you walk in , put a smile to my face. The staff is top notch from the doorman, housekeeping and front desk. I booked the Grande Suite category , facing with a view of the Acropolis. The decor is traditional and had all the amenities you need when staying in a luxury hotel .Personally , I loved the deep soaking marble tub, a must after walking all day in the heat of Athens. The sister property next door is wonderful and we had signing privilege. I used the Barber Shop, and ate dinner at the roof top of the GB Hotel.
