King George Hotel you will always be my home away from home when in Athens. The General Manager name is Tim Ananiadis and I must commend him for a fantastic team.
title: ATHENS LUXURY WITH A FANTASTIC LOCATION.

hotelName: King George, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review: I cannot write enough good things about our stay at King George hotel. It was flawless. The location is unbeatable. The front desk and concierge were extremely helpful and courteous. Our 2 rooms were available for early check in as requested. The rooms were quiet, impeccably clean and the beds very comfortable. Highly recommended.
title: Perfection

review: The place is so clean and organized Once u enter the place u will feel that you are in the right place the stuff are very helpful with a beautiful smile the location of the place is too close to the beach and the shopping area also the place surrounded with many great restaurants .
title: The best place in glyfada

review: My family has taken 4 suites and we all agree that this was a great choice of hotel suggested by a cousin who lives nearby.Clean,friendly,good service,nice breaky ,efficient staff....very close to the beach and to dozens of restaurants and shopping malls...
title: A very nice place!

review: We recently lived in the above accommodation for a family celebration.We recommend this small boutique hotel to you most highly.The service was exceptional, the facilities great and the position in Glyfada perfect, with the beach nearby, and a 45 min tram ride to the city centre as well.
title: A great experience!!

review: The hotel is super clean, the breakfast is great but it's near the Glyfada nightclubs. I used to go there when I was younger and I know how noisy the area is. We stayed one night on a Friday night and it felt like the DJ was in our suite. Very loud until 1am. If you do go expect this every night. Also, the elevator is tiny and the stairs spiral and tricky. The hotel is overpriced for the amenities it offers. The breakfast room AC was broken when we visited and there was no glasses left. The nice aspect of the hotel is it's in a neighborhood and it feels like you are part of the neighborhood but for travelers this would not be my choice. We tried the Westin in Vouliagmeni but it was sold out. We had stayed there twice previously and it's the best hotel in Athens and the absolute clear choice for me
title: Good hotel but overpriced and near noisy nightclubs

review: What a wonderful experience. My travels take me to many countries and can say that this hotel is up there. Staff and service is of a high standard. Sundeck view is amazing with a great pool area. Drinks on a summers afternoon overlooking the Acropolis is sensational. Will be back.
title: Wow

review: Best location.Very good rooms.Friendly service.Breakfast is ok. Not more.Served on the roof with great view.Nearby the breakfast an outdoor swimming pool.Nice spa with fair prices .Value for money realy good.Certainly recommended.
title: Exelent

review: Close to Syntagma station and right by lots of shops and restaurants. Got a prepaid SIM card with 200 local minutes and 10gb of data from the cosmote store just next door for 17€ on a summer promo.Room on 3rd floor was modern and clean. Quite a bit of water would leak from shower onto bathroom floor through the shower door. Minor issue, no other complaints.Beautiful pool area on the rooftop but not a lot of seating. View of acropolis is obstructed from pool area but view is excellent throughout most of the restaurant.
title: Modern hotel, good location

review: The hotel itself is great. We had a junior suite, which was quite spacious for European standards. Nice updated bathroom, comfy bed, huge balcony with a wonderful view of the Acropolis. The location is fantastic as well, very central and within close proximity to most main areas of the city. The only downfall was the service. It wasn't terrible, but not what I'm used to. Front desk is just there to give you a room key or take your payment. Waitress at the hotel restaurant upstairs wasn't the friendliest nor very quick to take our order. Calling room service was good, but when we just needed some extra coffee pods, or towels, etc it was forever and we still couldn't get what we needed all of the time. Only one gentleman downstairs (bellman) was extremely helpful throughout the whole trip. It's a shame, because such a good hotel, could be great with just some tweaks to their customer service.
title: Great hotel and location - Service needs some help

review: Great hotel in a very calm and green area in Athens. Really friendly staff, relaxing atmosphere in the entire hotel, very good beds, excellent breakfast, no problem to park your car in the street. The entire hotel including the rooms are completely furnished with nice Cocomat products. The metrostation to the centre of Athens is on 5 minutes walking distance and it takes around 30 minutes to get there. This is a quaint hotel in a very positive way.
title: Overall great hotel.

review: Our cruise started in Athens so we decided to come 2 days before to explore. This hotel is exactly what we were looking for. Great location, beautiful design esthetic, clean and nice rooms. Don't miss the roof top restaurant with views of the acropolis. The food was delicious. Service was way too slow but it's vacation so no real rush...We had a suite and it was the perfect size with a sitting room so if you want a little space I would recommend this type of room.
title: Excellent 2 night stat before cruise

review: Very friendly and helpfull staff that tried to make me feel like at home. The rooms are clean and cozy. The gifts on arriving are very nice touch. The breakfast was ok.One flaw that I noticed - not good sound isolation. Since my room was almost next to the exit, I could hear very well people coming and going all the time.
title: Like at home

review: A lovely hotel find in the northern area of Athens; very near Kifisia. We were very impressed with the service and helpfulness of all the staff. The room we had (r3) was lovely with a very large sitting area outside and lots of space to relax. The spaces in this hotel are amazing from the main dining space and sitting area to the lovely deck outside. The hotel exudes an air of calm and its easy to relax and just watch the world go by. We did venture out to Kifisia which is a lovely little area to explore with great eateries and went into town by the Metro which was very easy. The food here is good but i would also recommend eating locally to make the most of your time here. Thanks very much we will be back.
title: Great Stay

review: Coco-Mat, famous for its mattresses - which are indeed very comfortable and make for a good nights sleep - is a nice 15 minute amble into Kifisia (a leafy, well-heeled town outside Athens) and a perfect base if you want to avoid hectic Athens or just like cafe-culture, good food and excellent shopping!Our room was quite small but you can upgrade to larger. It had everything you need including a balcony, coffee machine, lovely linen slippers and excellent local bathroom products.The hotel operates an honesty bar, which is just perfect after a busy day out, coming back to relax on the sofas with a glass of Greek wine, bubbles or any spirit you can think of and breakfast is just adorable, so many nice touches such as tiny bottles of milk, fresh orange juice, bite-size fresh pastries (less calories surely?!) and eggs cooked to order.A lovely way to start our holiday before setting out to the islands. Thanks Coco-Mat team!
title: Quirky boutique hotel with cute touches (and great mattresses!).

review: An excellent hotel in a quiete suburb of Athens. Excellent beds, clean and carefully furnished rooms. Breakfarst is very good and the restaurant is also recomented if you want to stay in the hotel. The staff is polite and extremely helpful.
title: The best choice if you don't mind staying away from the city center

review: We ended up staying at the New Hotel for one night unexpectedly (some other plans had fallen through) and we'd actually been to the hotel the night before for a drink on their fabulous rooftop bar. It was one of the best decisions we made on our trip. We loved the funky vibe of the place, the staff were so attentive and the room was very well appointed. We have stayed at many large and small luxury hotels over the years and we really enjoyed the slightly hipster feel of this one very much (it made up feel young and trendy!), but in a nice up market setting which is central to all the key attractions in Athens. If you are looking for a somewhat different experience to your traditional big chain hotel setting then we would have no hesitation recommending this to you. Finally you simply have to have a cocktail on the rooftop bar - views of the acropolis/Parthenon on one side and Lycabatus Hill on the others - breathtaking stuff.
title: A unexpected gem

review: The New Hotel is a good choice when you wish to skip the large chain hotels.. Rooms are quite small with trendy furnishings. You can not find a better location for shopping, restaurants and historical sites. Roof top restaurant was lovely and the staff was very friendly!
title: Great location near Plaka

review: We stayed at the New Hotel in Athens and were very pleased with our choice. From the time you enter the hotel the staff was very friendly and accommodating. The location was fantastic it's within walking distance to the National Gardens, the Plaka and Parliament to name a few. The hotel was very clean, the price was reasonable, the room size was larger than I expected and the view of the Acropolis from the rooftop bar/restaurant is fabulous! I highly recommend this hotel.
title: Great location

review: trendy, good food, good team and amazing decoration in the room. you feel good in that place and it s very well located. the brunch is very good. and a rrof terrace is nice for the view. in loved with the bathroom full of day light
title: Athens on a Design and modern way.

review: If you are looking for a clean, safe, modern, charming, and well-staffed hotel in Athens, this is it!!! I come for business and vacation and have stayed here over 10 times. The breakfast is excellent, the staff of amazing, and the location is great.I highly recommend it!!!
title: Excellent hotel!!!

review: The Coco-Mat is a beautiful hotel in Kolonaki, a great neighborhood in Athens away from the congestion of the tourist areas. The rooms are nice sized and have a modern, fun design in addition to being incredibly comfortable.The rooftop is a great escape for a drink before heading out with views of the Acropolis and the sea in the distance.In terms of location, lots of accessible restaurants, bars, and shopping. Getting an Uber to the Acropolis and other historical sites is easy and cheap.I'd recommend this hotel to anyone that wants a simple, comfortable hotel to explore Athens.
title: Simple and Great

review: This hotel was a great find in Athens. It's located in a great area in close proximity to lots of nice bars and restaurants - away from many tourist traps. The room itself is nice, modern and has everything you need in it plus the amazing bed and pillow menu! It's easy to walk to all the main sights from there and then in the evening enjoy the views from there cosy roof terrace which provides a great vantage point to enjoy a few glasses of their own wine. If in Athens again we'd stay here without a doubt.
title: Good boutique hotel in an excellent location

review: This lovely hotel is well worth it's price. They offered amazing breakfast in the morning and even packed us a breakfast box on our last morning as we were too early for the breakfast hours. It is well located near Syntagma Square and about a 20 minute walk from the Acropolis. It is located close to a train station (about a 5-10min uphill walk) and has loads of restaurants and stores in the area.
title: Beautiful and well located hotel

review: Cannot rate this hotel enough - rooms are immaculate, beds are amazing, location is central with trendy restaurants and cafes on your doorstep, service is excellent and breakfast quality and variety is exceptional. Rooftop view whilst enjoying a glass of local wine is spectacular. Have travelled extensively through Europe and this is clearly a top rated hotel - you will not be disappointed!
title: Exceptional hotel in Athens!

review: Warm welcome at reception. Although we arrived early she succeeded in finding us an available room in our booking class "urban room" and at the back as we had requested which are the best and view an inner cort with balcony and no sounds of traffic, etc. The bed, bedding and everything in the room is top-class. We got a voucher at checkin to buy their products for 300euros and only pay 200euros. We bought some nice linnen sets to bring the experience home. Really great stay and the area is the best in Athens with lots of restaurants, very safe, nice shops and multiple museums closeby. Great experience so thank you to the hotel and the store team for making it memorable.
title: Amazing safe location and great room

hotelLocation: 7, Kapnikareas street and corner of Mitropoleos, Athens 105 56, Greece
review: We stayed at Plaka Hotel just for 1 night as we were passing through Athens and getting a flight to Santorini the next day.The hotel is about a 40 minute drive from the airport. Its in such a great location and everything is at your doorstep so if you are in Athens for a short amount of time or a couple of nights, this hotel is perfect. Lots of restaurants close by and little shops. The reception staff were so nice (and funny)! we also got an upgrade to a bigger room which was great!Ladies --- if you are after some amazing (cheap) leather sandals head out of the hotel and turn to your left across the road you'll see a giant sandal shop!!!!! I was in shoe heaven!!!!Also - head up to the roof top bar to get a view of the Acropolis, very nice!!
title: Great for our 1 night stay

hotelLocation: 7, Kapnikareas street and corner of Mitropoleos, Athens 105 56, Greece
review: As billed the hotel is practically at the bottom of the hill, below Acropolis and very close to the metro station and the shopping area around it, with numerous restaurants in one direction and the cathedral and parliament in the other, with ten minutes or so of walk. The hotel breakfast area is open all day long with free lemon and cucumber water in the jar for guests.
title: great location and good service

hotelLocation: 7, Kapnikareas street and corner of Mitropoleos, Athens 105 56, Greece
review: We are staying in the sister hotel "Hermes" but roof top of the Plaka hotel has great view of the acropolis and serves a basic array of drinks. This review is primarily about the roof top, and that is great. Having a quiet drink is a bonus. I will that both hotels are very nice as well. I will review that aspect later.
title: Great evening spot

hotelLocation: 7, Kapnikareas street and corner of Mitropoleos, Athens 105 56, Greece
review: Great staff, good clean room, excellent breakfast buffet.Well located if you want to explore Plaka and Monastiraki areas. Easy walking to restaurants, with a mini mart next door and a large supermarket around the corner.Acropolis is approximately a 20 minute walk from the hotel. Suggest wearing good walking shoes with rubber soles to avoid slipping on granite steps and pathways qheading up to and in the acropolis.The rooftop terrace gives you great views of the Acropolis, especially at night.Would definitely return to this hotel.
title: Great location

hotelLocation: 7, Kapnikareas street and corner of Mitropoleos, Athens 105 56, Greece
review: This hotel is in walking distance of all the archealogical sights and museums in Athens as well as the airport bus. The staff were extremely helpful with information for the side trips we took. Also the breakfast hostess was a mine of information about all things Greek. The breakfast is wonderful and includes Greek specialities. Also free tea/coffee and biscuits are available during the day. The view from the roof is wonderful, especially at night when the Acropolis is illunminated. The room was clean and spacious and the price in Feb/ Mar was very reasonable. That time of year was perfect for weather and less tourists. We also made use of the supermarket next door. We would definitely stay there again!
title: Wish we were there now!

review: The hotel is about a 10-15 min walk to the center of Athens. The hotel is lovely, chic, had beautiful art displayed but what was amazing was the staff. SO beyond helpful! We went to Santorini for 3 days and they let us store our bags there with no charge AND made us to go breakfast packs to take with us on the ferry since we were departing so early. They took so much time to show us where we should go and visit.
title: Amazing service and lovely hotel

review: We stayed here with friends for 4 nights. The rooms were clean, the staff extremely friendly and the breakfast buffet just amazing. A 15 minute walk and you're right at the bottom of the Acropolis. There are a lot of restaurants nearby and the nightlife center is very close as well. We would recommend it!
title: Great hotel

review: Pallas Athena Grecotel Boutique Hotel makes our stay in Greece wonderful. The place is so accommodating, the rooms are decorated beautifully. The price is reasonable and worth it. The breakfast served was delicious. Hotel staff are hospitable and caring, they can be easily asked for favors and make way to give it to us. Recommended!
title: Beautiful and spacious rooms

review: Great central location for exploring, minutes from the Acropolis and loads of local dining options.Clean well served rooms, and the optional Acropolis view is well worth paying the extra for. The roof top restaurant is a great place to spend an evening, watching the city and Acropolis light up at night. Very helpful and attentive staff. Complimentary fruit and wine in room a nice surprise. The Kids loved making their own waffles at breakfast - a hotel first! Petite and bijou rooftop pool - very popular. A great place to immerse yourself in the wonders of Athens!
title: Great location to explore from

review: This hotel was a great surprise, as it was a great value as well as a modern quirky fun hotel in the middle of the city. The hotel was centrally located to walk to the squares and sites. Neighborhood was a bit sketchy at night and would recommend being in a group in the evening, however we had no trouble and enjoyed our stay. Our room was huge with a large terrace and nicely appointed bathroom amenities. The restaurant was lovely and the friendly waiter even taught us some Greek to get us through our visit. All in all the hotel and staff were pleasant and I would recommend this hotel.
title: Great Modern Hotel

review: Lovely hotel in central Athens with really friendly, helpful staff. The breakfast is great but we didn't eat in the restaurant for lunch or dinner. The rooms and bathrooms are big, and most have a balcony (I think). Although if you're looking for a view of the acropolis you'll need to request it - our room was out the back of the hotel and looked onto an old disused building! Didn't bother us, but might some people I guess. There's a stop for the sightseeing bus tour in the square right opposite the hotel, and it's a 10min walk Monastiraki station (where you'll find a good little flea market), and only another 5mins to Plaka from there (lots of lovely cafes and restaurants).There's no pool and the gym is tiny, but overall pretty good value for money and a really handy location.
title: Nice boutique hotel, great location

review: We loved this hotel and location. In Plaka, close to Acropolis and other historical monuments. We walked everywhere. Rooms were very nice, clean with good airconditioning. Roof top pool with view of Acropolis and nice little bar. Breakfast was excellent with lot of choices. Staff very pleasant and happy to help. Would stay again.
title: Lovely hotel in great location

review: It's a below average dingy hotel with better alternatives for the same rates at nearby locations. It's very outdated hotel with outdated furniture that have stood the test time but their time has come. Reception staff were just fine but nothing to write home about. Location was good but I had stayed in a nearby hotel (slightly better location) for the same price but that was very modern and fully refurbished (i think it was called 360). Definitely wouldn't stay here nor recommend. I would highly advise a full refurbishment to the furniture and dirty carpets.
title: I have no clue how this hotel is so highly rated

review: Reception, bar, dining & concierge staff have an air of sufferance. They occasionally make an half-hearted attempt to conceal their arrogance and rudeness towards guests. Unfortunately it's a very weak effort.Good location.Many rooms (including all triple) have poor views and are, consequently, rather dark. Triple rooms are very cramped. Rooms are getting that tired appearance.Good views from rooftop, but the cramped pool area is crowded.
title: Good Location Poor Service

review: My son and I had a wonderful stay. The Attalos Hotel had everything we wanted in a hotel without being overly expensive: warm, inviting, and helpful staff - the manager came right to our aid when we didn't know how to work the A/C, and they were great with suggestions and tour arrangements. Clean rooms - housekeeping did a great job every day. The room was small, but that was perfectly OK with us - we had more than enough space to relax indoors when we wanted, and we had a small balcony with a partial view of the Acropolis. Comfortable beds and pillows, and quiet at night - we slept well even when it was 110 degrees outside. The bathroom was modern and pretty. The free wifi worked well. The breakfast was delicious, with a great variety of food. Convenient location - very close to the shops in Monastiraki and a short walk to the Plaka. Not the fanciest part of Athens (very urban location, lots of graffiti outside and some people on the streets nearby asking for money), but we never felt unsafe. And the rooftop bar is a very lovely place to hang out, with a fantastic view of the Acropolis, nice seating, and a friendly bartender - we stopped by every evening around sunset. I would definitely stay here again!
title: A gem of a small hotel!

review: We stayed in two hotels while in Athens (we left for Bulgaria and returned). The Amalia is wonderful! Great location, friendly staff, well-appointed rooms, gorgeous bar, and a delicious breakfast. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Athens!
title: Best hotel!

review: After reading lots of mixed reviews about hotels in the Athens area, we were apprehensive about finding a good hotel but we got lucky as Philippos Hotel ended up being a good spot. It's in a great location in a cute neighborhood with lots of restaurants and bars that are walking distance. The Acropolis and Metra station are also about a 5 min walk - very convenient. Even though it's near lots of things, the hotel is on a quiet street which is great for sleeping. They have a nice terrace on the top floor with great views of the city - def take the trip up! The hotel was clean and the breakfast was decent. It's a good spot to stay at as you explore Athens.
title: Good location & hotel

review: We stayed at the Amalia upon arrival of our journey in the region and loved the hotel.It was my husbands birthday and the hotel staff surprised us with a celebration. The staff was accommodating to every need. The location was fabulous located within walking distance to all the places we wanted to visit. The roof top is a great place to enjoy a private evening and the balcony in our room was a great bonus, The breakfast was wonderful!
title: Fabulous Boutique Hotel!

review: We didn't to pay € 185 for a room at the Herodion and were very surprised by the standard of the Philippos. Best place near museum, Akropolis and Plaka. We enjoyed our stay very much. Next year we will joice the Philipps again.
title: Nice Hotel.

review: We travelled as a family of 4 (2 teenage daughters) and booked a family suite. Upon our arrival at reception we were offered two double rooms instead which was a very welcome surprise. This amazing service continued throughout our 2-day stay. We were just minutes walking distance away from the Acropolis, Acropolis Museum and the Plaka. If you get a chance, book a rooftop table at their sister hotel (Herodion) just around the corner for a spectacular sunset dinner with view of the Acropolis.
title: Great stay

review: Wonderful service, nice breakfast and perfect location to meander around the Acropolis. The front desk staff helped with every question we had. We had a very pleasurable stay. Would recommend if you are looking for 3-4 star hotel.
title: Perfect Acropolis location at decent price

review: The Philippos is always The BEST! We love staying there and enjoying their fantastic hospitality. There is no better location. You can walk everywhere or catch the metro easily. Yet it is just enough in the neighborhoods to be quiet at night when you want it to be. Top rating every time!!!
title: Family celebration

review: A bit tricky if you arrive to the hotel by car, the street outside is a busy road and there are only a very small space to park while you check in. The location is excellent, with views overlooking the park and the parlament, and with walking distance to a lot of the sights in central Athens.The rooms are elegant and normal in size, the bathrooms are quite big and very nicely designed. Breakfast offers a large variation so no matter your diet, you´ll find something on the buffét! The only disappointment was the lobby bar, food was not that good, and expensive and when I ordered champagne I was told it wasn´t cold...So please put the champagne in the fridge, and we´ll come back!Joke aside, I would absolutely come back to this hotel again.
title: Excellent location

review: Very nice and comfortable local boutique hotel with great amenities, fabulous breakfast and awesome location. We stayed here for 5 nights total and felt like home. It is a gem in heart of Syntagma square.
title: Fantastic choice

review: Fantastic location, across from the Parliament building, with an awesome roof-top terrace with a view of Acropolis and the entire city of Athens. Hotel Amalia is one of the nicest and customer friendly hotels I've ever stayed at. It isn't luxury, but everything you need it's there, front desk is souper friendly and helpful. Restaurant is actually very good, we were avoiding dining there because we didn't expect good and reasonably priced food. The last day, waiting for a taxi to bring us to the airport we dined there and were very happy. Also, we ordered a bottle of Amalia house wine, tasty and cheap. Definitely recommended!
title: Fantastic location, great breakfast, very clean rooms and helpful staff

review: Cleanliness, service and location (close to the metro and Acropolis) all deserve 5 stars in our opinion. The only reason for a little lower rating is because Hotel Attalos could use a little updating in the hallways, but otherwise we enjoyed our stay and even went back for two more days at the end of our trip. Take the blue line from the airport to Montastiraki and you're steps away... Enjoy!
title: Covenant and great service!

review: Excellent location...5 minute walk to popular metro stop and walkable to all the sights. Room we had was basic and small, but clean. Balcony a plus...extends the size of room and has a view of Acropolis. Rooftop for drinks or a bite very nice. Employees very friendly. Good place to stay to hang your hat...you should be out there seeing Athens anyway, not sitting in your room.
title: Great location

review: We enjoyed our stay at The Attalos Hotel very much. We knew they had a great view of the Acropolis from their rooftop bar but were amazed when we saw the view from our balcony as well!!! Everyone from the staff was friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and clean. We chose not to spend the 9 extra Euros for breakfast but rather chose from the many options very nearby. The location is great, very centrally located near major sites as well as multiple cafes and tavernas.
title: Good Value at Great Location

review: We stayed here for one night - the hotel is nice, and room was nice and clean, including bathroom. They offer rooms for 3 ppl which was perfect for us. It's very central, within walking distance are many restaurants, the acropolis, and direct bus service to airport that runs every 15mins and through the night. Price is also good with tasty breakfast included. After check-out it's possible to leave luggage in a large locker downstairs for 2e for as long as you like. There's air conditioning. Even though it's on a busy street our room was quiet when we kept the window closed (we were on 6th floor). Go to the 9th floor to admire a view to the acropolis! Would definitely go again next time.
title: Great place to stay in Athens

review: We stayed here for 10 days, to explore the beaches, the sights in Athens, the Parthenon etc......the flea markets, the food, it was all fantastic, the hotels location is perfect, the tram is literally a 3 min walk away, and takes you to the centre of Athens......the hotel itself, is lovely, spacious rooms, beautiful pool, the food at the pool bar is good, but for us it was the staff, namely, Alex, Marios, Mary, and Giannus, who could not have done more for us, from directions, to beach recommendations, they were so helpful and will definitely be visiting this hotel again
title: Loved it

review: Great, well run hotel in a good location. The hotel and rooms were very clean and comfortable. The hotel was near the water and close to the tram station which takes you directly to Syntagma Square in central Athens (for just over 1 euro). It is a short walk to the Glyfada shops and walking distance to some great Beach Clubs (like the Balux House Project)
title: Great hotel in a good location

review: Location is fantastic, the staff are so friendly and helpful, the overall appearance and cleanliness of the hotel is very good. Felt very welcome and safe here. Our room was cleaned and towels changed daily. Honestly can't fault Palmyra Beach, thank you so much for a wonderful 4 night stay :)
title: Absolutely fantastic!!

review: I am writing this review to inform people of this very beautiful Hotel my 3 friends and I stayed on the top floor room 201 it was outstanding all newly renovated and soooo spotless every day cleaned with lively fresh towels and linens a lovely friendly cleaning lady also a wonderful air conditioning room to come back to in to every day the room was stunning amazing facilities in it and a balcony view to die for. A gorgeous American breakfast awaited us every morning and once again so clean with lovely staff to greet us. On arrival the reception staff were incrediably friendly and welcoming and nothing was to much trouble for them at all. The pool bar restaurant was gorgeous opened daily serving lovely delicious food and drinks amazing coctails. The life guard George was one of the loveliest people we met on the holiday just a pure gentlemen. He had fresh pool towels for us and anything we wanted he hit amazing service from all of them. I would recommend Panorama resturant (I will do a seperate review later) about 15 minutes away in taxi the most amazing seafood resturant on our trip) Also Athens Sailing tours amazing!!! This Hotel in offers everything yes it is 1 hour by tram or €20 daytime by taxi to Plaka wonderful area but you have the beach and beautiful area of Gylfada as well I cannot wait to vusit thus beautiful country and Hotel again tgank yiu to all at Palmyra Beach Hotel for looking after us so well.
title: Amazing Stay!!!!

review: We stayed here to use the metro to the airport. The metro is two blocks away and goes to the airport with no changes. The hotel was good. Well appointed room with a nice bathroom. Great water pressure and hot water. Lots of cafes and coffee shops very close by. Included is a buffet breakfast. Nothing unusual there. Most of the fruit is canned but there are other choices. Eggs, yogurt, breads, sweets, cereals, cheese, olives, coffee and juice. Perfect location for us and a decent price.
title: Good location

review: Easy hotel to just sleep in. Breakfast is nothing to rave about. The location though is perfect! Walkimg distance to everything you meed to see and eat in Athens. Small rooms. Good a.c. but can be loud at times. Friendly staff.
title: Good location

review: Good price (although it was a special discount for that day) Proximity to Metro Line 2 (the re coloured one) is good. Smiles on people working there are a bit rare. Photocopy of my ID was taken despite I used a chip-card with a PIN. Average all-in-all.-
title: Average in total, good when price and transportation are taken into account.-

review: I had the pleasure of staying here for a weekend at the beginning of July. The hotel staff were very helpful, great breakfast, amazing bar, decor, clean and fully stocked rooms with everything you can possibly need for a great time. The swimming pool and gym area is out of this world. The hotel location is in a beautiful setting with close by bars, quality shops and a 10 min walk to the metro. I’m looking forward to going back and staying at this hotel. Luxury doesn’t even begin to describe how wonderful it is to stay here.
title: Great Hotel, Excellent service

review: Great place, helpful and friendly staff especially at the reception. The lady at the rooftop bar was amazing and helpful and you could clearly see she enjoyed her job. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Pool was small. Recommend this especially for the young travellers as the rooftop was buzzing till early morning.Great variety for breakfast. Would definitely recommend to travellers and especially young travellers who would like to meet other young travellers from around the world. Thank you for our comfortable stay.
title: Great especially for young travellers

review: basic rooms , poor bathroom , poor air conditioning , very nice terrace , very nice and helpful staff , very good breakfast , not very well located, but as conclusion for a city break is ok , try to get rooms with balcony
title: basic hotel , with very nice view of the Aropolis

review: Stayed overnight in this wee hotel in Athens. Is in the Omonia area of Athens. Convenient for the subway, and a short walk to the famous Omonia Square. One part was a bit shady, but the rest of the area was fine. Like any huge city- just be sensible. Don't be out and about late at night. Perfectly fine during the day .The hotel itself was brilliant value. We had a room and breakfast for €30. Okay- breakfast was a bit Spartan, (continental) , but was ok.The rooms are painted in weird colours, but are lovely and clean, and the bathroom is tiny but really well thought out, with everything you need. We loved the quirkiness of this little place. You couldn't stay more than a couple of days there, I think, or the lack of space might get to you. But brilliant for an overnight.Really liked this wee place, and the reception staff were just lovely.Don't expect beautiful views from your room- it's in the middle of Athens, and not very pretty- but within walking distance to the Acropolis etc.
title: Basic, quirky, clean, and cheerful.

review: The staff is professional and nice.It is always a pleasure to stay there.The pool area is truly an Oasis after a long day in Athens! When stopping in Athens we go there.We have been staying from the year 2000.We like the area because we can walk to Glyfada where you can find restaurants and shopping.

I arrived there with 2 of my friends on the 29th of June. The hotel is located in the centre. You can find a lot of coffee shop in the same street (even starbucks!), bakeries, supermarkets, bus stops, and the metro station is only 5 to 10 minutes away. Location was perfect.As for the hotel service, it was perfect. Everything was clean and staff was very helpful. Breakfast area is really big and the food was tasty.And at last but not least, the rooftop pool! We went up there everyday! The view was awesome, drinks at the bar up there where perfect, water was always clean, and each time we went up the staff provides you with 2 towels and makes sure to find you a good seat. The price in comparison to the location of the hotel is very fair.Thank you for the pleasant stay!
title: Perfect Hotel

review: Beautiful hotel, roof top bar and pool. We didn't see any of Athens cause we were only there for one night, but the hotel is perfect. The staff are friendly, there is a bakery across the road that has some nice foods in it. For an extra $30 euro we got a 6pm check out. You'll have to organise this when you check in though. Would have liked to see a bit more of Athens, so next time maybe we'll have the opportunity to explore. The beds in this hotel were the most comfortable we had during our four week trip in Europe!! Great views of the city from the roof top restaurant!!
title: Stayed just one night for transfers

review: Disgusting smelly old rooms and floors and rude staff, not worth the money at all. You have to pay $12 euros for wifi in the room for only 24 hours. A huge rip off, no mini bar no extra locks on doors. And when we asked the cleaning lady to clean our room she huffed and puffed and told us she didn't want to, I think she might have hit her head and forgot that cleaning hotel rooms is her job..
title: Not worth the money

review: We picked this hotel over another Athens hotel because it had dedicated parking and a pool. We arrive and my husband goes to park only to be informed a car is too big and we are not allowed to park there. I was not happy. However, the front doorman came to the rescue and found us parking garage. He was so nice and had great customer service skills and was the only good thing about our stay.We got up to our rooms (needed to book 2 because of our big family) to find 2 twins bed pushed together in each room. Not the best, but it worked. The furniture is dated, the TVs are ancient, smells like smoke and there is no shower door or curtain. It is just a half glass wall so water goes everywhere. To top it off, they charge 12 euro a day for internet access in the room, and that is only for 2 devices. Probably the worst thing about this hotel is the pool area. They have a beautiful rooftop pool with a bar. However, it is a very small pool area. It is lined with chairs and people sunbathing on the ground, so you can hardly walk around the pool. We arrived at the first day at 18:30, knowing it closes at 19:00. With 3 kids in tow, the lifeguard proceeded to get an attitude and tell me that there are no more towels and we only have 30 mins to swim, so we should come back tomorrow. Well my kids were in their swimsuits at the pool, so there was no way I was not going to let them swim. We swam, had a nice time and my husband brought up our own towels. The next day we came up earlier in the day, found a spot on the ground and went swimming. After about 20 minutes the same lifeguard from the previous day came over and told me my 8 year old is a bad swimmer. I told her he is still learning, and she said she knows these things and he is bad. She came over another 10 minutes later and threw a flotation device at him and said he must wear it. He threw a fit because he did not want to wear it and he could stand fine in the shallow end (Plus my husband and I were right next to him in the pool). The lifeguard then proceeded to speak Greek to another guest and talk about my son and how we should not be letting him swim. Little did she know that my husband can speak Greek and heard every word. We immediately left and my husband went to talk to the manager about her behavior. The manager seemed to take our concerns seriously and encouraged us to go back to the pool, but I did not feel comfortable going back there with her there. Besides with the mob of people lining the pool sunbathing, we felt like the kids needed to be quiet and not be splashing around. It is a very odd setup.Overall, do not stay here, especially with kids!
title: Wished we chose another hotel...

review: The place maybe was luxury and presidential in other times. Now in 2017 you have to pay if you want wifi in the room. Ok ... The hair dryer was from 80s too and the toilet didnt work. We arrive at the hotel to do the check in and the staff was very unpleasant with us. To do the check out we arrived 1 hour late and they want to make us to pay the extra day (only for 1 hour late) we understand that we were late but 35 euros only for 1 hour and the negative attitude to make possible understand our position was very unfear, unpleasant and disappointing. We have to come back in 6 days in this hotel because We have already made the booking but I dont think that I can change my mind about them. We dont recommend this hotel not at all to anybody. I hope my experience was helpful to everybody. I can assure I will never come back!.
title: Very awful

review: This hotel is very old, the rooms are not pretty at all. The wifi is charged, expensive. The hotel receives a lot of tours and school trips, etc... so it is very busy. It has a pool on the top floor which is nice, but the personnel is unfriendly as can be. If you have children that can swim... well you have to be inside the pool too to take care of them! The pool can be visited from 10 am to 7 pm... very short time. The breakfast buffet is a bit expensive for what it offers so you are better having breakfast in any of the coffee shops there are just crossing the street. To get to the center, you have to take a taxi that will charge you around 10 euros. I would not choose this hotel again.
title: Old and far from city center

review: For this price it is a good deal. The rooftop is very nice with a pool and a nice bar. The breakfast is very average, and very crowded. The rooms are clean, but old. The bed was soft and an average size. Also in the bathroom you could hear the neighbours and in the room you can hear the traffic. Too less sockets in the room-not handy at all.The staff was friendly and helped us with everything, they work hard and were kind. For us this hotel was fine for our citytrip. With Uber it is € 4,- to the center, and it goes pretty fast. If you wanna relax the rooftop is the best.Oh and to the manager of the hotel: please fix the wifi, it is 2017! Wifi should be free :)
title: Ok hotel, location is good

review: After traveling around for 10 days, this was very comfortable stay! I slept very well and the rooms were very nice and clean! They have a great breakfast buffet even though it was very crowed. It's few blocks walk to and from the metro, but content location. I was very happy with my stay.
title: Comfortable Stay

review: Breakfast ok however too many guests, which meant that we had to eat it in a conference room on plastic foldable chairs since no tables were available. Pool and rooftop is nice allthough small and over crowded. Restaurant overpriced. The staff in the restaurant and by the pool were the most rude I have ever encountered (apart from a man called Dimitrios that was very service minded). Not interested to take orders, when instead walking to the bar to order I was told to sit down and wait for a colleague (that never came). The last day we were asked to pay 40 € to use the pool since we were not allowed to be in the hotel after our 12 o'clock check out, even though we arrived late and planned to leave late. The hotel in general needs an update and the room was old and smelled like mold.
title: Worst service

review: The hotel was very nice and the staff were helpful and courteous. The rooftop was amazing and spectacular views. The hotel was a little far from the sightseeing places but we took taxi's and were very cheap. The only thing I did not like is that they don't have wifi in the rooms only in designated areas of the hotel which was annoying.
title: Great Place

review: The rooms were clean and the size was pretty good. Our rooms were on the 14th floor with a good view of the city. Though we didn't get time to use the open air bar, we did have a look at it. It was beautifully lit at night and gave a wonderful view of the city. The bathrooms were neat and had enough space. The breakfast had a wide variety of food. Overall a good stay!
title: Good big rooms

review: Upon booking at the President Hotel for 5 nights a few months back, I was unaware of the mixed reviews previously posted. After 10 days of island hopping my girlfriend and I were looking for a comfortable room with all the amenities.Our first impression at the front desk was a good one as we were greeted by a friendly receptionist. The lobby mirrored the pictures we had seen online. We made our way to our room and were happy with the size and layout, albeit without a double bed (there were two single beds pushed together.) Okay, no biggie. Breakfast is served until 1030 and on our first morning we were somewhat late and filtered through to a banquet room where there was ample spread. The next morning we were in the main breakfast area where there was a noticeable difference of selection and quantity of food and drinks.We later made our way up to the pool bar where again we were impressed with the facilities and bar. Such as all Greek restaurants, service was slow and we embraced the holiday mentality. It was only the following morning at the pool where we were met with sun-craving guests jostling for a sun bed. Fortunately we were able to secure one while others were left disappointed and frustrated having to sit on the floor.Although comfortable in the rooms, it is not quite 4 star quality. This is not due to not trying but rather assuming that there has been no further investment in renovation and updating.I would stay at the hotel again.
title: An honest and objective review

review: This hotel gave us a warm welcome. Taxis queue outside the hotel which are cheap. Triple room was spacious. Cocktails in the rooftop bar were too strong to enjoy. Pool was lovely.Breakfast was great selection of buffetGood location near to paramou metro.
title: Great location

review: Stayed at this hotel for 1 week. Hotel is nice, room are big, bit outdated but fine. Lobby downstairs is lovely. Room high up has good view. Good coffee shops etc. Pool floor is nice. Overall would stay her again
title: Good hotel

review: Location is quite good as there are a lot of shops around. The lobby is beautiful but the rooms are very basic and have a dated look. There are no amenities like electric kettle, complimentary tea/coffee etc., the mini bar was also empty. The TV was an outdated CRT one. There is no free Wi-Fi in the room and they charge €12 per day and €20 for 2 days. However the lobby has free Wi-Fi but that too . Breakfast spread is decent and food was tasty but the area is too small and overcrowded. There is a Pool & bar at the 20th floor which we liked somewhat. Overall it's a 3 star experience at most.
title: Average property, could've been much better

review: The President hotel is a beautiful hotel that greets you with an artistic foyer and welcoming staff. The rooms are clean and well maintained though the furniture is a little old. The room was comfortable and relaxing. The rooftop bar and pool area is stunning, though it was hard to get a lounge to lie on as they were always taken and thus we regrettably didn't swim. Breakfast was fabulous with a huge variety of food and drink available. The service at breakfast time was perfect and any finished plates were collected promptly. There were taxis always ready just outside the hotel awaiting to be used, which was convenient. The only drawback was we didn't feel safe walking around that area at night. As we nearly had someone try to take our phone when we were at the bakery directly across the hotel. We enjoyed our stay here and hope others will.
title: Nice

review: Lobby appeared semi decent, pool area was small but somewhat decent. Service was terrible. Upon entering the hotel, it appeared somewhat updated. Once we checked into our room, it looked worn and old. We didnt even want to walk on the floors barefoot and slept with our travel blankets because the linens were just disgusting. The lamp that is suppose to be screwed to the wall fell on my head when at 4am and woke me up. I told the front desk and they did nothing. The lady didnt even apologize. We were scheduled to go back after our island tour and ended up changing hotels. This hotel would get zero stars from me and I will never return.
title: Terrible service. Dirty linens, outdated, disgusting floors

review: Terrible hotel in this day and age ... dirty rooms , AC weak in this heat and no tea coffee station in the rooms !!! Unhelpful reception staff with major attitude ... had to buy water and no room service after 12 pm !!! Only the rooftop bar and pool were good but even there the life guard was like a policewoman ... do not recommend at all
title: Horrific

review: Dirty rooms and dirty bath towels. Unhelpful and rude reception staff with major attitude!! No mini bar in the rooms! Do not recommend it!! Please note that this is the first time i bothered writing a review for a hotel!!
title: Terrible!!

review: As a global traveler it was a good job the earplugs were packed when staying here. The double glazing did not keep the highway noise at bay and coupled with the loud air conditioning sleep was at a premium!Breakfast was fine, bar service was friendly, wifi worked well and the reception team were helpful and efficient.Premium room was ok and bed was comfortable if only I could have stopped the constant road noise.Will not be staying here on next visit to Athens.
title: Don't forget your ear plugs!

review: If your main priorities are getting an excellent location without having to pay much, then this is for you. It's just a short walk away from Monastiraki station and a number of the ancient sites and is surrounded by places to eat. The price was amazing. But the facilities were basic. I had a private room (with shared bathroom) but the walls were paper-thin and didn't block out any street noise. There were some opaque windows for light, but no view to be had. But if all you're after is a place to sleep at night, it does the job and I've no complaints.
title: Basic but cheap and with a good location

review: We arrived in Athens on one of the hottest days. Our room was on the 3rd floor. There is no lift but the walk was worth it as our room was a cool oasis. A door by our room lead to the roof terrace with a view of the acropolis. The air conditioning worked brilliantly and enabled perfect sleep. The hotel is a short walk from a variety of places to eat and within walking distance of the major sites. The room was spacious and clean and the staff friendly.
title: Perfect stopover

review: My family and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, every thing is new, in high standard.It is very easy to reach from airport to the hotel, and to the main attractions, as the metro station is only 3 minutes by foot.Very nice, professional and very helpful staff - thak you!I recommend this hotel!
title: very nice hotel

hotelLocation: 35 Leoforos Possidonos, Paleo Faliro, Athens 175 61, Greece
review: We stayed at the Coral prior to A sailing vacation, and the hotel had been organized by the sailing group. Very nice facilities with a great view of the waterfront from the lobby, lobby restaurant and breakfast rooms. None of our party got rooms on the oceanfront but room rate was <€100 per. Night so no worries there. Rooftop pool with retractable roof for sunbathing was fun and relaxing and a swim in the ocean from one of numerous handy beaches was possible also. Getting to Athens city Center was simple enough by tram but took about 30min each way. Breakfast buffet was included in room rate and buffet was fairly complete by North American standards. Bacon and eggs, lots of pastries and fruit and fresh squeezed OJ that you make yourself with the help of a machine that literally eats the oranges!A couple of youth tour groups were I the hotel at same time as our group and hallway and breakfast got a little noisy with some their excitement but it wasn't a big deal. Staff was very welcoming and helpful whenever we needed something (safe unlocked, bag storage, tram directions etc). Rooms were good sized with comfortable beds and all conveniences (coffee, hair dryer, a/c etc). Elevator was a little tight ( 4 ppl) so some waiting involved there or get your exercise on the stairs (6-7 floors max)Great oceanfront boulevard made for a few nice walks and a decent running location (2-3km long or so). Mega yacht harbour nearby was fun to visit and ogle the big boats. We'll use this hotel again if/when we're back in Athens
title: Two nights before sailing away

review: Very nice and welcoming hotel , excellent service and very very kind stuff , I been here now the second time and would go here anytime again ,too located in the heart of Athens , just a bit far from the airport .Very nice roof terrace with a pool , Good breakfast with everything you can ask for .Once again , i stayed in many hotels but the stuff here is very very professional .Rooms are big and clean ,
title: Very warm end welcoming ,top location to the city

review: Hotel is very clean. ATM in lobby. Reception not always smiling and welcoming. Porterers, bar, and restaurant staff are very friendly. Little far to walk to town's center if it is very hot. About 20 minutes on foot to the national Archaeological museum, otherwise taxi is five euros. You can pick up the hop on hop off red bus tour from outside the museum. Small grocery store near hotel is very convenient for water, toiletries. Some cafe style restaurants near hotel as well. Continental breakfast is excellent, great variety. Rooftop pool is a nice size. Small fitness area, sauna, and massage chairs where you pay with euro coin to use.
title: Nice hotel, but bit far to walk to town center

review: Center of Athens, 43 C! We were ready to visit the pool of the Zafolia hotel. We go towards the reception to ask for permission to visit the pool. For some reason the woman receptionist tell us that there is no space for us although the other stuff of the hotel was sure there was! I have to say that I was pregnant and visiting the pool while I was 15 min under the hot sun was the only relieving solution. I believe that this was a very inappropriate behavior !
title: Inappropriate behavior of the receptionist

review: The hotel is located in one of the busiest streets in Athens. On the top of the hotel the pool overlooks the entire city with all the mountains around.There is a nice bar on the roof and in the lobby with food options ( good prices) also the breakfast is amazing with fresh baked goods and good variety of food.
title: Clean and great hotel

hotelLocation: 48 Charilaou Trikoupi Str., Kifisia, Athens 145 62, Greece
review: Stayed there in June 2017. Was fully booked so booked the standard room. Comfortable beds and clean and would stay again. My only issue which very annoying is Seminaris blocked the room fee on my credit card at time of booking which somewhat aggressive but can understand but did not unblock the amount nearly one month after our stay despite having been paid in full on my card on checkout. Called twice and got all sorts of excuses why not unblocked including "contact your bank" which obviously nonsense as Seminaris are the only ones that can unblock it. Hopefully sorted soon but its the first time this has happened in Greece.
title: Good hotel in Kifisia but credit card issue

review: Great staff- they let us check in at noon upon arrival, even though it was supposed to be after 2:00. The neighborhood was a little sketchy and someone hard to find, but overall pretty convenient location to metro. Great price for the room with bathroom inside, breakfast provided, and computer to print boarding passes available.
title: Good price- recommend

review: The hotel was great and staff very friendly and helpful but ubication of hotel is horrible. There is a lot of Pakistan and afganistan Imigrants they are all night screaming like fighting so I felt not secure and comfortable there.
title: Good hotel and nice atention but bad ubication

review: Absolutely ok place, although nothing special. Clean and proper, quiet at night. Not quite what I expected from the picture, which showed both a view and a balcony, got an interior and a small room, but fine for a short stay for work travels. Wi-fi and airconditioning. Slightly dodgy area. Good enough breakfast, but what's with swiching off the lights when the service finished?
title: Clean and proper, although nothing special..

review: The place it self is good also old fashioned but the out side view is horrible.being near to omania sq. Metro helps alot. The printer thing was useful for printing your boarding passes. The overall is ok.
title: Good

review: Antonias is the man to look out for. He will help you with absolutely anything you need and be dead cheeky about it. Breakfast is huge, delicious, and free... try the tomatoes. Air conditioner works like a charm, when you can figure out how to turn it on. It's just a wonderful place to stay at a wonderful price. And, honestly, if you're really afraid of the neighborhood, as some reviews have suggested, don't go to Athens. Neighborhood is fine and close to nightlife without it being a noisy distraction.
title: Great spot at a great price with great staff

review: Hotel is situated in center and metro is not far away (3-5 minutes). But neighborhood is big problem. Drug edicts, pickpockets, jobless etc. At evening armed security in front of hotel. So recommend to order taxi to leave and return to hotel. We were warned each tome from taxi drivers to be careful in that part of city.Breakfast is OK, but not enough tables for all guests. Cue for elevator as it is small and there is only one.Rooms are old, dusty and carpets are full of stains. Beds are comfortable. Air-condition units are silent so it is possible to sleep if you leave them switched on.Bathroom is ok, with hairdryer, but we were missing liquid soap. Dispenser was empty for all 5 days.No safety deposit box in all rooms, some have some not. That was a problem.
title: Poor neighborhood

review: Hotel in a good position close to Omonia station. Room very clean and staff kind and friendly, ready to solve any your problem. Only things to improve is the breakfast. I'd like to find more sweet staff and not just olives ham and egg. I'm italian ;)
title: Good Hotel

review: The hotel was okay but the area was super bad. We don’t feel comfortable to go around that area as we have to go and come back to pass those area. It is very creepy. Lots of drugs addicted people (we saw on our eyes doing it ) very scary even for a guy.
title: Never again

review: Very clean and tidy, great room with a large balcony. Great air conditioning for those hot summer nights.Walking distance from all the major sites in Athens. Very friendly staff. Best value for money. Will definitely stay here again, as well as recommend to others!!
title: A+ place to stay

review: Nice hotel in a less than ideal neighborhood. A little sketchy and not as close to central attractions as we would've liked. Still, a good value, strong AC, clean and comfortable. Really good breakfast too.
title: Nice enough

review: It was a beautiful hotel. I like the place. In a few minuits You are in Omonia and some minuits later you can be in Synatgma or Monasteraki. Stuff of hotel is lovely and very helpful. We are looking forward to come back
title: Lovely hotel in the centre of Athens

review: It was absolutely wounderfull. The hotel staff was very kind and helpful in all the respects! Climatisation has worked fine despite of the july heat. Breakfast is really opulent and deliciou. I had a very quiet room, as I asked it.
title: A nice stay at Marina

review: The stay was agreable, although the room was very hot. It was necessary sleep with the air conditioner. The room was very clean and spacious. In addition, the staff's treatment was very good and they help us a lot.
title: three days in Athens

review: nice hotel, good wi-fi connexion, staff is welcoming. Average breakfast. Room are tiny (either the superior). Balcony are a joke. Bathroom need to be refresh. Blankets are not cleaned by the way. Neighborhood is...a problem. Subway is not so close by the way. Too expansive for the services and the location. It could be a two stars hotel.
title: Average hotel, not worth his stars neither the price

review: I visited Athens for business. I booked Oscar. It was a very nice stay in this hotel. Quiet, friendly personnel, excellent service, rich breakfast. I am very satisfied and I recommend it no doubt. Just perfect!
title: The best

review: Was looking for a reasonably priced hotel that is clean. I got that here and that's about all. The room was clean but very cramped. The bathroom very small, no place to put anything. Breakfast was included which was nice, however it was the same unappetizing food every day. No Greek olives or cheeses! Also, it is not in a very nice part of Athens.
title: You get what you pay for

review: Larissa metro train station is 100 metres away. The room was clean & the pool on the top deck is a bonus. Only negative is that breakfast is basic and the bread on both mornings was stale. Reasonable value so no real complaints.
title: Good location with views

review: The best feature of the Oscar hotel is its rooftop pool and bar-resto. The lobby staff were friendly and efficient but the hotel is far from everything. There's a metro and train station nearby but that feels like going to work. The rooms are ok but mostly noisy and hot with carpets!!
title: reasonable

review: Stayed for one night,very close to the train station was the reason,anyway our room was very basic,but ok.Swimming pool on the top of the hotel plus restaurant and bar,with a great view of the Acropolis in the distant.That evening we ate at the top of the hotel restaurant,the service,food and drinks were very pleasent and made a really nice evening for us.Breakfast basic as can be.The hotel was busy with a few groups of young teens on school trips.As always in greece you have the great service and friendly welcome that somehowstops you from seeing any bad points.So would give this another stay if using the train station again.
title: Ok Short Stay

review: Stayed here on our last evening. Pool with a view on the top floor. Helpfull staff (e.g. For printing boaring passes). Parking car be an issue. Public transport closeby. Walked from here to archeological museum.
title: Correct

review: Every time we travel to Greece through Athens International Airport we are spending at least one day at Oscar hotel. Why we are coming back? The personnel is very polite and knowledgeable about the surroundings of the hotel and the cheapest way to move around. The hotel it's a few meters from Larrisa subway station. You can travel with 1.40 Euro to the Acropolis, which is the 5th station in direction Elini. Super close to Omonia station from where you can catch for the same price the train to Pireus Port or as they say in Greek Peierias. The hotel has a lovely swimming pool that over looks the hill close to the temple of Athena. The breakfast is excellent and the room are big enough to accommodate 4 people. And from the roof you have the most amazing panoramic view over the Athens.
title: The best place close to archeological attraction

review: nice pool at the last floor, staff very nice, but not worth the price you payis not possible to smoke at night in the rooftop because it became restauant,they gaved me the room before check in time so i appreciate it
title: nice pool

review: Just spent one night here, but not a great place to stay, putting it nicely. It's in a pretty sleazy neighborhood, so we didn't feel totally safe arriving here late at night. With that said, it was quite easy to find a taxi immediately outside the hotel. The room had crappy AC but eventually it did the trick. Weirdly the room only had one outlet. In the morning there were tiny little bugs in the sink. The elevators took forever to come. The breakfast was actually really good and it was included in our stay, but that's probably the only redeeming quality. Also, the hotel staff was nice. One night was fine here but absolutely wouldn't recommend it for any longer.
title: Ehhhh

review: The hotel has renovated and older rooms. The renovated ones are on the top floor. Family rooms (suites) have space but no balconies. Guadruple rooms have big balconies facing the street, but there are only two good beds. The rooftop pool, bar and view are spectacular. The area around the hotel is not so nice but there are small grocery stores and metro near. You can walk to Plaka and other more touristic places (taxi fare is less than 5 euros if you are too tired to walk back). Breakfast is good.
title: Hotel with a pool and spectacular view

review: The hotel lacks any warmth or great service from the staff, it hosts group tours on 18-30 style holidays so it can get pretty loud when you'd like to relax at the rooftop bar and the area didn't feel overly safe. However it is very clean and spacious with good air-conditioning so if all you need is a base it's perfectly fine and comfortable. The only thing that really disappointed us was that we had an evening flight out of Athens and once we were checked out of our room they wanted to charge us an additional 50 euros to be able to use the pool or shower before leaving for the airport. I have never known a hotel to do this before including elsewhere in Greece.
title: Medium

review: This hotel is lacking in atmosphere, basic facilities, rooms and especially bathrooms in poor condition. It's an overpriced coach trip stopover in the middle of nowhere. I didn't enjoy my stay here at all.
title: Overnight stay

review: Rooms were basic, good value and fitted our needs during our 3 night stay in Athens. The pool was refreshing after a day of sightseeing in hot temperatures. We enjoyed the rooftop bar and the lovely view from it. Location was good.
title: Hotel with a pool and nice view of Athens

review: Cons: The location of the hotel is seedy and horrible... as we walked from the metro stop to the hotel, men were breaking areas of the sidewalks to fill bottles with water from the underground pipes, litter was everywhere, and the area is severely run-down. I was embarrassed to bring my family and international guest to this hotel and neighborhood.Upon arrival, we were informed our Family room was on the 3rd floor. Once entered, it was clear it was a double room in which they tried to squeeze in a single bed and a rollaway. Chairs from the desk were moved to the foot of our double bed and crammed against the rollaway.Per my discussion with the check-in staff, we were moved to a family room on the 9th floor facing the back streets of Athens. We were informed that the room on the 3rd floor was indeed a family room (which I know it was not). Here's the description copied from their official website. "Dorian Inn Hotel offers a great variety of Standard Single, Double and Triple rooms and from the 9th to the 10th floor we offer Superior Double and Family rooms for an unforgetable* stay in Athens!"*original spelling from hotel websiteUpon departure at 1:00 p.m., we saw a man sitting on a doorstep, sniffing white substance and a woman sitting on the sidewalk with 1 adult dog and 2 puppies who appeared to be malnourished... so very sad. For all these reasons, I will not stay at Dorian Inn Hotel in the future.Pros: The breakfast was very good and the support staff was professional and accommodating. The rooftop pool and bar were very nice and offered fantastic views of the Acropolis and Athens. The pool was medium size and well maintained, but more sunbathing chairs should be provided.The family room was spacious and had central AC, minibar, small dining area, and a separating privacy screen. The bathroom was large and amenities were plentiful.
title: Run-Down Hotel and Seemingly Deceitful Booking Practices in a Neglected Inner City Area

review: By day a busy area, at night it a bit quieter. You will want to stick to the main roads. Hotel staff are very nice and give a good friendly service. Easy walk to the Flea Markets and Acropolis. I would return.
title: A nice place in a mixed area

review: My wife and I stay at the Dorian hotel in August , 2016. This hotel has a pool and roof top restaurant. Late one evening we booked a reservation at the restaurant. Beautiful scenery over looking Athens and the magnificent Acropolis at night. We and wine and a romantic dinner. The restaurant provided excellent food and amusing service. the Price was very reasonable dinner for two. The hotel is older but very comfy. Front desk is extremely . They will answer all your questions. The hotels offers tour daily to the important sited. Hotel is very close to the hop on hop off bus stop. Another plus is that you can pack you l suitcase and walked to the main square and take bus to Airport.
title: Nice hotel near hop on hop odd stop in Athens

review: I had a very pleasant short stay at Dorian Inn on my way back to Rome. The room was clean, comfortable and the staff was polite and helpful. This is centrally located, only a few minutes walk to Omonia Metro station. The rooftop restaurant of this hotel was possibly the most remarkable place to be mentioned. One may enjoy 360 degree view of Athens city from the top. Wonderful view of Acropolis, specially at night was excellent. I couldn't manage time to use the rooftop pool, but enjoyed the breakfast they served. Would love to stay once more here, if I come to Athens for any reason.
title: Excellent 360 degree View of Athens from Rooftop!

review: I stayed at this hotel as a solo guest and as part of a tour group and regularly stays at the hotel during peak season. As a solo guest my room was nice and comfortable and the restaurant up on the top floor serves amazing food and the service was fine. But coming back to the hotel as part of the tour group my experience much like others part of my group was beyond lacking. I was put in a room that was made for 3 people but the third bed was just a uncomfortable mattress on the floor which is unacceptable as I have paid the same amount of money for the room as the people who have proper beds and if the room is for 3 people than make it for 3 people! We all later that night went up to the top floor to dine at the restaurant our tour group had to order and pay at the bar as table service wasn't allowed for tour groups as in the past people have left without paying there bill, which I was understanding of. But after 15 of us waiting 1.5 hours for our food and then meals also coming out not the way they were described on the menu no wonder people have left without paying. Waiting 1 and half hours for food is unacceptable and not 1 apology was given to us for our patience.I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and would never stay here again in Greece
title: My stay at dorrian inn was lacking professional service!

review: Good location, near Omonia station. good food and good customer service. rooms are good but need a renovations. The upper floors are renovated so the room are better. Everything is clean and the lobby and the reception are well organized. The best experience in this hotel was dealing with Ms. ZETA, always milo and ready to assist you with every queries, she is the superwoman in this hotel. She was our "FRED" during our stay. God bless her. Definitely I'll stay again in this hotel and recommended to my friends.
title: Great stay

review: Try to always book in, great location, beautiful roof top restaurant with views of the Parthenon ..... I was told that a percentage of the profits go to a local orphanage which was a request of the owner when he passed away, hope that still happens. Unfortunately, it doesn't have a Pool but it's a 15-20min to Monastiraki which has lots of restaurants & great shopping.
title: Athens Stopover

review: When we arrived at the hotel, we were welcomed in an exceptionally friendly manner by the staff and as we were proceeding to our room, our luggage was being carried for us, the proper way ;) The room wasn't exactly what we hoped for, because it looked rather old and the bathroom wasn't really well-maintained, the bath and shower weren't what I would call marvellous etc.. Nevertheless, we slept rather well. The lobby itself was absolutely stunning, as it was decorated with beautiful ancient-Greek-looking mosaics, but still looked very modern. On the rooftop, one has an absolutely breathtaking view on the Acropolis of Athens and the restaurant there is one I can really recommend.Overall, we had a very pleasant stay.
title: I am very satisfied.

review: We had a good stay at this hotel. The lobby is very impressive. The staff weren't overly friendly but still professional. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The buffet breakfast that was included was good too.
title: Very Nice Hotel

review: Nice new renovated rooms. Corridors and cleaning service excellent! Nice breakfast good value for money. Nice helpfull staff. Nice location walking distance from plaka and ancient athens. The hotel is recomdnded
title: Nice hotel

review: We enjoyed our stay at Titania Hotel. The staff were pleasant and helpful. It was on the main "hop on hop off" bus route. Also not too far from the Plaka by taxi. The rooms were good and clean, bathroom small but adequate. Delicious breakfasts.
title: July 2017

review: The hotel lobby is beautiful. You have several areas to sit and relax. There is a little area for coffee and doughnuts, bagels etc. The staff is very nice, friendly and helpful. The room size was not bad for Europe. There is a fitness center, however, it is only open from 8-2. I was gone before 8 and did not return until after 2 so I was disappointed because I love to workout daily. The rooftop restaurant was awesome. The views are breathtaking! You can see The Acropolis and at night it lights up. The sunset views are amazing. Also, there is a buffet restaurant, the food is good but a lot of the same foods daily. Within walking distance to shopping district of Plaka.
title: Loving Greece

review: Titania Hotel is ideally situated in the heart of Athens and is only a short walk away from Syntagma Square and the shopping centre. My husband and I only stayed for two nights – before and after our trip to Syros – but we’ll definitely choose Titania for a longer stay next time we visit Athens.The rooms are spacious, functional and beautifully decorated. Cleanliness is impeccably meticulous and excellent sound insulation shuts out all the noise of the busy city. We were also pleasantly surprised to see that on our last night we were upgraded to a luxurious suite on the ninth floor with a breathtaking view to the Parthenon. As we had to catch the ferry to Syros very early in the morning, we greatly appreciated the early morning breakfast buffet consisting of a wide variety of jams, bread, rolls, croissants, cheeses, delicatessen, fruit, cereals and sweets. Normal breakfast includes hot dishes as well, such as eggs, omelette, bacon, baked beans.You should not leave Titania Hotel without having a drink or dinner at Olive Graden situated on the 11th floor and offering a superb view to the Pathenon by night. Although the restaurant is a bit pricey, it’s well worth the experience. The food is excellent and the service is impeccable. All the staff are very polite and helpful. For all these reasons, I strongly recommend Titania Hotel for couples, families or business.
title: A Great City Hotel

review: An excellent hotel in the center of Athens. Rooms are very nice and clean and the staff very polite. The breakfast is very rich offering to visitors many things to enjoy. On the top of the hotel their is a bar where you can see around the town of Athens especially during nights where the scene is fantastic. From the hotel you can walk easily to the market area or to Akropolis. Also it is very easy to use bus or taxi.
title: excellent hotel in the center of Athens

review: Pleasant staff, pleasant environment, lovely roof top bar (although a little expensive). I had the upgraded room which was fine but I know others that had the standard room didn't even have tea making facilities and they had no balcony and they didn't want to spend much time in their room. I believe it is definitely worth the extra money to upgrade your room prior to your stay.
title: Upgrade your room

review: I have visited the hotel end May for about 10 days at the executive level on the 9th floor. While the room was very accommodating and had a balcony, I would not advise the executive floor, at least not on the front side for the simple reason that the 10th floor is the conference level and I was suffering the whole night from hearing furniture and chairs being dragged on the floor. For the rest it has been a perfect stay, great remodeling, super location and fantastic friendly staff. Actually I am returning there pretty soon. Mind you, this is the first hotel that I visited in Athens that provides sockets on both sides of the bed and at the desk at reach level, so one can charge the phone and the batteries and what-not without having to crawl underneath the furniture to find one. The restaurant at ground level is just perfect but the view on the 11th floor restaurant is breathtaking and unbeatable.
title: Renovated Titania

review: Despite the renovation in Reception area the room are quite dated and need rennovation. Our room had terrible view and it smelled very bad. We asked for a room change but it was not possible until the next day.
title: Room view

review: Central enough but not in chaotic district. Staff is caring. Family-room is a perfect accommodation for 4 members family. The view from the roof garden is amazing. Breakfast is truly abundant both in choice and quality
title: Good for family

review: Was attending a Art Symposium here and I must say the hotel was very less than average.To begin with the rooms were super small. And the service was less than what you would expect from a 4 star. We were there for a week and none of the staff ever smiled. They did what you asked or inquired about but there was no warmth.The breakfast was basic and the same menu for a complete week.On the positives:The pool area was actually quite nice.The views of the beach were lovely and right across the streetThe tram station is just outside the hotelThe price was quite affordable.It was 1.5 hours by train to get to Athens Parliament in center of town near plaka.The hotel transport to the airport is the most advisable for a fee of 55 Euros - because its a challenge for Taxis & to get to from public transport.
title: Not Impressed with Service & Staff

review: We were in Athens for a few days and spend our stay at this hotel, it was very clean and comfortable. Staff very helpful and friendly. Breakfast included and had a good choice, help yourself buffet and plenty of food. Orange juice and coffee very disappointing, Both from machines and orange was not fresh juice more like squash. coffee dreadful. Good buffet for evening meals 12 euros good value, but we ate out as there was so much choice.
