Took the tram five stops to Glyfada and lots of lovely restaurants there, five stops towards Athens (Syntagma) a lovely beach restaurant there are two there we went to the first one on left looking at the beach it was FAB food delicious value very good, lovely setting. Overall would really recommend the hotel the pool is very nice really good, and the beach is across the road from the hotel. The bus from the airport stops right outside the hotel Although there is a very busy and dangerous road to cross when arriving, We did it with three children and lots of luggage. Bus stops on the same side of the road when leaving and runs 24 hours every 20 mins, 45 mins journey for a few euros. tram stops outside hotel easy to get to Athens and the opposite way also.
title: A lovely break in a lovely relaxing hotel

review: We have stayed at hotel Astor several times, the latest being last week, for one night only. We had a room on the 8th floor with a stunning view of the Acropolis. Even if you have a room with no view, the breakfast room is on the 9th floor and all guests can enjoy this. The room was clean and comfortable as always and we were steps away from the metro station and Ermou street shopping as well as other attractions. Highly recommended!
title: Excellent location and good hospitality

review: Astor hotel is an old hotel in Athens. The best thing of this hotel it is the location which is in walking distance to ermou street and syntagma (near shops, near bars, restaurants and tourist attractions).Staff is helpful and polite. Breaksfast needs improvement. The room was nice spacious and clean (we asked for a double and we got a triple but it was ok) with nice view, but on balcony there was no chairs to enjoy the view. Nice rooftop with amazing views. The only bad thing was the smell in the room which was awful and could not stand it. it was like the carpet had mold and they cover it with something. An ok hotel overall if you dont mind the smell which is something you cannot avoid - dont know if it was only our room or if all rooms are the same.if i'm staying again ??? only if i dont have any other choice, which is a shame cuz its an ok hotel if they can fix the problem with the smell.
title: An ok hotel in the center of the city

review: 3 night stay in July 2017It's central , close by to lots of attractions It's cleanThe staff are fantastic, and extremely helpful. Good rooms Good breakfast , lots of choiceGreat views Reasonable pricedHighly recommended
title: "Ticks every box"

review: Not a pleasant experience at all. Set back on a dingy street, the hotel offers randomly poor customer service and staff with sticky fingers. We booked our stay at the Astor with a group of 12 people, so good business for them - but after our poor overall experience they won't be seeing business from us again. Here's why: Some of our group are 70 years+ and naturally, occasionally forgetful. While enjoying our breakfast out on the balcony (which it has to be said, offers a great view of the Acropolis), one guest (my sweet Nanna, just about the kindest woman you'll ever meet) accidentally left the door on the balcony open. which separates the rooftop viewing area from the eating area, as she walked through it. Instead of simply closing the door and forgiving the obvious mistake, a particularly angry witch of a waitress who was on staff at the time decided to make an example of her - slamming it shut and pointing and gesturing as if she couldn't believe the incompetency of her guest. I can only assume she got out of the wrong side of an empty bed that morning, or perhaps was up all night in a full one and forgot her basic customer service training in all the excitement. Leaving the Astor was an all-round bizarre experience. We had left our luggage at the hotel while exploring Athens for the day, and went back later to collect it + order taxi's so we could move on. When the bags were rolled out from the back room on a trolley, some of us tried to get our luggage...and for some reason the bell-hop spazzed out like a dog on heat. "No no no, don't touch! I'll do it!! I WILL DO IT!". This wasn't a friendly suggestion or an insistence to help while we put our feet up and relax; it was really oddly aggressive. I don't take that kind of crap, so simply grabbed mine and smiled. They are our bags, if we want to touch them, we'll touch the hell out of them. How strange to get so defensive over other people's possessions. Good job we didn't ask him to babysit. The final and worst insult though, is that after leaving we immediately realised various members of our party had left some items in 3 of the rooms (we realised this about 10 mins away while still in the taxi). Like I said, naturally forgetful. We made multiple attempts to contact the hotel to ask if we can return to pick them up before setting sail on our week-long cruise. No answers. So we sent in some emails. But for the entire week we were away on the cruise...still no answers. Docking back in Athens one week later, we called Astor and finally got hold of reception to explain the situation, who asked us to call back later. We were then informed that apparently nothing was found in any of the rooms. We stayed one night and the only other people who would have entered the rooms between us leaving and trying to immediately contact them were staff. The items left behind were: one man's shoe, a woman's dress, a man's orange top + yellow trousers, a man's shirt and a Samsung charger. So..somewhere in Athens, there is a one-legged, cross-dressing thief from Astor who looks like a piece of fruit carrying a Samsung phone charger with a UK plug. Be sure to avoid him/her/it, and do yourself a favour by avoiding Hotel Astor as well.
title: Come for the sights, leave with less items and a bad taste

review: We stayed here 5 nights over two rooms. The rooms were fine although one had a musty smell. That room also had some noise from adjoining rooms. My right I was quiet and clean. It is very close to the parliament building so we easily saw the changing of the guards, and it is a short walk to the plaka area. It is an easy walk to the acropolis too as long as you don't get lost in the winding streets. The top floors have a good view of the acropolis. Breakfast is up there on the 10th floor. I would say suggest booking the floors 7 to 9. If you want a room view. The lower floors have terrible views. Fortunately for me I do not travel to sit in a room and look outside. I am only there at night and do mot care.
title: Worth considering

review: Astor hotel is located in the historical area of Athens, easy access to public transportation, caring staff and a GREAT VIEW TO ACROPOLIS! having a good breakfast while watching Parthenon is a great pleasure; I will be there again hopefully!
title: Reasonable choice

review: The hotel is located in the center of the shops in downtown and the most popular walking street in athens next to the syntagma square, we didn't need to take taxis during our stay. The room was fine, maybe the bathrooms needed some maintenance but they were clean. The staff were so nice and friendly.
title: Perfect location

review: We stayed here during a short visit to Athens. It provided a nice central location to what we wanted to see. Rooms are adequate (however no in room safe). If you want to store valuables, you need to use a personal safe through the front desk (a bit antiquated, but it worked out just fine). The absolute BEST part, is the breakfast view! Stunning view of the Acropolis!!! Actually also went up in the evening to watch the lights come on surrounding the Acropolis. While we did find someone to serve drinks (we were the only ones up there), so feel that the hotel is overlooking a great opportunity in the evening to capitalize on their space/view (maybe having a bar set up and light bar snacks offered).
title: Great Location!

review: Stayed in this hotel for one night as a party of 12. All family catching a cruise ship around the Greek Islands the following day. Several of us being forgetful and tired as didn't arrive till around 3am forgot some of our items the next morning at check out. Despite 3 phone calls and 2 emails to the hotel to ask about our left items we were informed nothing had been found. I find it hard to believe a full ladies outfit a man's shirt one shoe and a phone charger all magically disappeared! !! Maybe the management need to vet their staff alittle more closely to avoid a cross dressing one legged member of staff hopping around the streets of Athens swinging a Samsung phone charger around their heads NOT A GOOD ADVERT FOR THE HOTEL AVOID
title: Shambles

review: Very mediocre hotel with a un-interesting location. Carpet in the rooms reeks of old cigarettes and vommit. The only service-minded person was the receptionist. Ala carte menu was a total disaster, the worst food we ever experienced i Greece. Disgusting house red wine. We looked forward to a quiet night at the roof garden (wich was ok) with some food and a caraffel house wine, and ended up speechless over the lack of quality and service.
title: Mediocre hotel with catastrophic food.

review: The hotel was very basic with only few amenities being provided. They didn't keep any bottle of water and no dental kits were provided. Since plug points are different as compared to india, we had asked for an adaptor to which the reception asked to come down and collect ourselves. There was no hospitality in this hotel. Since we only needed to sleep for one night we adjusted through. Not at all recommending this hotel to anyone. Instead there are very good budget hotels in the main city which should be explored. The area in which the hotel is situated is also not convenient.
title: Wrong decision

review: I booked this hotel at 11pm at night and checked in 30 minutes later due to my other hotel being really average. I chose this hotel because of the location. It is a few minutes walk from the main shopping street, buses, train etc.As a girl travelling on her own, it is a great hotel because of it's location. I would stay here again. The staff and cleaning staff are really friendly and very helpful. Breakfast is included which is good. It's nothing special but it's fine! I have been having fruit and yogurt (because it's gluten free) but there's a lot of other options.There is an amazing Absinthe bar across the road down a lane way. Full of locals which is great. The bed in the hotel was not good at all. I could feel every spring. Having a terrible bed in a hotel is the worst because after a long day of walking and sightseeing, you want to have a good sleep. These beds don't allow that. The pillow was fine. Very spacious room with a large window. Bathroom is fine. Everything works. They give you fresh sheets every day and mop the floor so it is very clean. No kettle! I thought that was unusual. I like to make tea in my room.No iron.No full length mirror. Aircon was great. Wifi works best at the door and the window. I'd stay here again but the beds really let this place down. If you love a comfortable bed then you might want to look for another hotel.
title: Great Location

review: The only good thing about this hotel it's food location. Yet they have poor wifi. Very small rooms. Super unfriendly staff. And it's always loud. Poor food and beverage quality. In general I won't recommend it since it's also over priced.
title: Not a pleasant stay

review: We booked a superior room. We did not get one. We seemed to be situated in an unrenovated part of the hotel. The room was average, nothing special , needed a bit of modernising and was not superior. There are surely much cheaper options in Athens for what we got.Was it the noisy air con? The fact you had to attach the shower head to the wall? The yellowing walls? It just looked tired and not superior.On the bright side. The top floor has a pool and sun beds which is nice. A good view of Athens too.The breakfast is good. Varied choice. Large area to eat in. Quite relaxing even when busy.Did not trust the wi fi.One advantage of the hotel is the metro just outside which allows you to avoid the cab drivers who just want to rip tourists off.Walking to Placa takes 25 minutes. It is not a pleasant walk as you will pass groups of refugees. Just makes you feel uneasy.The hotel is extremely popular with tour groups. For this reason check in can be time consuming.My overall impression of this hotel is if you can forego having a swimming pool choose a hotel closer to Placa. That's the best area to be in. This hotel is primarily aimed at tour groups. It is over popular for what it offers. The nearby metro is a big plus just don't expect your stay to be memorable. Just average.
title: Average

review: Stayed here late June , great clean room lovely staff , very centrally located . Pool area was fab to lounge by in 42 degree heat lovely cocktails , and the food and views were beautiful , hop on hop off bus stops just around the corner which is handy . The food in Stanley was super !
title: Great stay

review: My wife and I stayed here on the tail end of our honeymoon before heading back home. We really enjoyed our stay at the Stanley. It's an old and historic hotel that has been well maintained and updated through the years. We felt it was very well located with respect to the main touristic highlights, and the view of the Acropolis from our room was amazing. It's very well priced, and I'd highly recommend it to someone looking to experience Athens.
title: Athens Hotel

review: Whilst not in the most salubrious of locations, The Stanley is right for the price. Our spacious room was one of the refurbished rooms and it was very clean, comfortable and quiet. The front desk staff are efficient and very welcoming, providing top notch personal service to all guests despite how many check ins they were dealing with. Commendable. Unfortunately, I didn't really get the same vibe from the roof top bar staff.Plenty of variety and choices in the buffet breakfast served in the sun filled Livingston room. And there seemed to be a Greek barista on hand to personalise your coffee order. So great start to the day.It's handy to the metro and there's a 24/7 bakery conveniently located on the corner downstairs. If you're looking for a clean, economical hotel and not too fussed with location, you can't go wrong with The Stanley.
title: Right for the price

review: We had such a lovely stay at the Stanley Hotel in Athens. From the moment we booked we were very impressed as the hotel sent us a lovely email with information about the hotel, about Athens and also a 3 day suggested itinerary of places to visit during our stay!We stayed in a Superior Room (Acropolis View) and were super impressed to find it actually did have the most wonderful view of the Acropolis and Mount Lycabettus - these are lit at night and it was so wonderful having a drink on the balcony before bed and taking in the views - be aware that there is a main road directly below you so it does get a little bit noisy but is easy enough to ignore! Once inside the room you don't hear the road as there is really effective double glazing. There is no furniture on the balcony but we brought the chairs and little table from inside out on an evening. There was also a minibar with some complimentary drinks. Bottled water was replaced daily. The room itself was very clean and comfortable with a TV, safe, tea and coffee making facilities, plenty of wardrobe space and good air conditioning. The bathroom was clean and toiletries are provided. We were impressed with the friendly staff. My husband had mentioned that we were there celebrating my 30th birthday and someone came up to the room after we checked in with a bottle of complimentary champagne and chocolate covered strawberries - what a wonderful surprise!The only negatives I can point out are the lifts - these are very small and you can sometimes be waiting a very long time for them, one of them kept breaking down while we were there and the other one was malfunctioning and only stopped at certain floors! The pool area could do with a bit of a refurbishment, it was ok but there were not enough sun loungers. Be aware that the pool is quite small and does get busy but nice for a quick dip to cool down in. The area is very central and the "Metaxourghio" Metro station is right outside so great for exploring the city.
title: Acropolis View

review: Probably the worst hotel we stayed at during our trip around Greece. Not only was the entrance of the hotel hard to find, but the rooms shown in the pictures look absolutely nothing like what a standard room at The Stanley looks like. The management informed us that those are only the specialty suites. It was outdated, small, and not renovated but thankfully after enough complaining, we were "upgraded" to a bigger room but with the same outdated features. The pool and rooftop bar are also highly exaggerated based on the photos and even with a 50% discount card for your first drinks everyone gets as a guest, you are paying more for beers than at any of the surrounding restaurants. The bed was pleasant and it was convenient to get to the city center with a metro station out front. Avoid the taxis if you can, they are quite expensive and the drivers are very rude. The 4 star rating is not justified with this hotel, it is closer to a 2-star hotel.
title: What to Know About The Stanley.

review: It was out first time to Greece, we were a bit concerned about all the online stories about pick pockets etc.. I choose this hotel after quite some research.. We were surely not disappointed.. The hotel as such is strategically located on a well known Karaiskaki Square.. All taxi drivers knew the place.. The hotel is surrounded with bakeries, 24 hr restaurants, convenience stores, taxi stands, the open blue + red + yellow busses stop right by the hotel.. The famous Monastrisaki Square is a good 25 mins walk, through main roads and interesting markets.. We walked all times during the say an night without any issues.. The hotel is good, a bit dated.. The toilets need renovation.. The staff are very friendly.. Breakfast though monotonous (we stayed for a week) was tasty.. The view of the acropolis is something all buildings have at Athens, therefore not a big deal.. Overall a good and safe hotel to stay in..
title: Definitely a good option at Athens...

review: This hotel is used for student travel groups and, this , can be noisy. Lower cost rooms are not very clean . It is also in an iffy part of town. However, staff are helpful and breakfast has a lot of choices. It is very close to the metro , so within a few minutes you can be in the main tourist area.
title: Close to metro, nice pool area,

review: Very nice view from the roof.Good breakfast.Extream heat in the elvators & the corridors.You need to wait around 10 minutes to the elevator.People working at the reception think that they are doing you a favor by staying at their hotel, they forget that the guests are paying their salaries.
title: Extream heat in the elevators & the corridors

review: Hotel staff are friendly, helpful and speak many languages. The hotel has all the amenities expected of a 4 star hotel with the added surprise of a wonderful roof top terrace with pool and spacious sun lounge area and amazing views over the city. Prices of drinks and food in the hotel are reasonable for a city hotel. Room was very clean, comfortable and well equipped. A bit smaller than expected but in good condition and with a very effective air conditioner. The hotel has excellent access to the local metro and a superb 24-hrs bakery which also does some Take away food during the day. In front of the hotel there are 2 bars if you don't want to drink in the hotel and a small estatorio (lots of typical Greek mezze and gyros) as well a decent restaurant/taverna round the corner called Alexander the Great. Whilst the area is somewhat run down it is not that different from most of the other areas of Athens unless you are right in Syntagma Square. I would definitely stay here again!
title: A pleasant surprise

review: When I first arrived at this hotel I was pleased with the look of it, it was clean and well presented. The streets around the hotel are not very nice but exploring the area further many streets in the Athens area seem run down. But once you are in the hotel you feel far away from it all. The hotel is located right near the metro station so you don't have far at all to go if you want to catch the train.I stayed in a room on floor 6 - the room was a nice size and very clean. The only let down was the balcony view, it was overlooking other hotels and a dirty street. But this didn't really bother me too much as I didn't spend much time in the room as I was out exploring Athens. The bed was very loud and creaky, any movement in the bed made a loud sound - sounded like it was going to collapse. In the mornings from half 6 to half 10 is the breakfast buffet. There is lots to choose from whether you want cereal to a fry up. One night at the hotel I decided to have dinner at the hotel restaurant which is located on the 9th floor (top of the hotel) it had a great view of the Acropolis - you can choose to sit inside or outside to eat. The menu didn't have much food choice. I went for the burger, it looked great but came out cold so I had to ask them to warm it up. The waiters were polite and apologetic. The afters were lovely. Next to the restaurant is a little bar area that you can sit at and watch the telly. After having a dinner here which was a let down I decided to try the room service as it looked cheap and had a lot more choice then the hotel restaurant. The food from room service was tasty - so would recommend using this rather than going to the hotel restaurant. The pool is also on the ninth floor, it has a few sunbeds and seats around it. The pool isn't huge but it is long enough to have a little swim. On the 4th floor is they gym- but I never visited this.Overall I would recommend this hotel as it's good value for money. The staff are polite and helpful. The hotel is clean and well looked after. It is opposite the metro so makes it easy to travel to places.
title: Pleased

review: We stayed at the Stanley for 3 nights .. It made us hate Athens to be honest... The location of the hotel and the rooms are not as they seem on the website... We stayed in the executive room with double bed ... The bathroom was disgusting with old white shower curtains and you could hear everything going on in the next room while you're in the bathroom ... There's no ventilation and it just feels like you're in a cheap hotel .. I didn't like it at all to be honest and felt it was unclean ... Upon booking I thought that the hotel was in the centre and it's not ... It's 10 mins away by car from the main streets in the centre syntagma square and monastiraki and you can't walk there because the streets around the hotel don't look safe.. In addition to all this, we were charged for a bill of€25 after we had checked out from the hotel and left: for drinks at the pool bar where neither myself or my husband even checked out during our stay let alone stayed for drinks and when we requested to see the receipt it just had our room number on the top without even our family name or my husbands signature .. We told the hotel that this was not us and that we didn't even visit the pool and until now, one week later the money had not been refunded. Never visiting this hotel again and I advise anyone going on a fun romantic trip to stay in the centre or in glyfada near Astir beach.
title: Tolerable if you're on a very low budget

review: My experience in this hotel is terrible. My first night was above a noisy machine room and couldn't sleep for most of the night. I requested a quieter room the next morning, and found out that I was put into a room next to another machine room. I would not come back to this hotel again if I have choices, based on the high chance that the room will be noisy.
title: Noisy rooms

review: The service was ok, not a good place to stay if you want to walk to the shopping areas. The view from the roof top was very nice at night. When booking our room online said the rooms were Newley renovated but noticed that the bathrooms need renovations. The food at the hotel restaurant was by far the best we had in the city. A taxi to the main square was about maximum 3 euro. It's also a 3 minute drive to the train station.
title: First time in Athens.

hotelLocation: 385 Syngrou Avenue, Paleo Faliro, Athens 175 64, Greece
review: Metropolitan Hotel and staff have come through with very good customer service. We arrived late on the ferry from Naxos. Got picked up by taxi and made it to hotel. Was greeted and provided our rooms in a timely manner. The breakfast is very good. We look forward to staying at the Metropolitan when we come to Athens.
title: Athens vacation

hotelLocation: 385 Syngrou Avenue, Paleo Faliro, Athens 175 64, Greece
review: First look at the hotel and its lobby leave you with a satisfying feeling but once you enter the rooms the illusion soon fades away...the rooms are extremely small and unclean...the housekeeping is poor to the next level...had such a horrible experience staying here! I strictly advise against choosing this place to stay...the buffet too had very less choices of food to offer.
title: Disaster

hotelLocation: 385 Syngrou Avenue, Paleo Faliro, Athens 175 64, Greece
review: A clean and comfortable hotel. Maybe a little bit out of the heart of Athens but in the evening It took half an hour to arrive from the airport and all around there are some taverna and restaurants with some typical Greek food with convenient priceDefinitely I would advise this hotel to people traveling for business
title: One Night in Athens

hotelLocation: 385 Syngrou Avenue, Paleo Faliro, Athens 175 64, Greece
review: We stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel in June for 2 nights and were incredibly disappointed with this hotel. The lobby appears reasonable however once you enter the elevator that is where the illusion stops. The hallways are old and dark and you feel like you are going on a school camp rather than an apparent 5 star establishment. The room was terrible. A very old looking room in desperate need of an upgrade. The bed was horrible, a regular sized double bed which felt like we were sleeping on pins as the mattress was very thin. The overall room and bathroom state was very disappointing. Once we saw the room we thought perhaps an upgrade to the suite may help - once again it was marginally better. However we had no choice but to stay due to our travel commitments. The outside noise travels in very easily also.We will never stay here again.
title: The furthest from a 5 star!

review: The hotel is in a great location and with a little more effort it could be a great boutique hotel destination. Mrs. Litsa Bilbiris at the breakfast restaurant is excellent at guest relations and helped to solve a problem which should never have arisen. she could really be someone to impart her knowledge to the rest of the staff.also, your coffee at breakfast is well below average. A decent machine would give your guests great coffee which is a test to quality of service. the rooms could be cleaned better also.otherwise we enjoy the hotel and have been visiting you for about 10 years
title: Trey harder

review: This is a beautiful hotel with elegant rooms, excellent breakfast, lovely roof-top pool, and spectacular views. The staff was friendly and helpful. We would stay there again and recommend without hesitation.
title: Superb

review: Athens was our first stop on a 8 day holiday in Greece and i was a bit skeptical about the city (post recession) and the customer service levels. I was pleasantly surprised by the hospitality shown by everyone at this hotel. The receptionist Xristina, was particularly helpful as she helped us making reservations and figure out our itinerary even for our next stop, Mykonos. Furthermore they were very flexible with the checkout time and offered a great breakfast. The hotel is and feels very new and the location is perfect if you don't want to be right in the middle of the action but want to be close enough.
title: Great location and service

review: This was my first visit at this hotel as arrive often for business. My usual hotel was duly booked so I chose this one. And it was amazing! Small, very modern and clean. Reception super friendly and helpful. Great alcohol at the bar of the hotel. Room was spacious and clean. Modern and equipped with all that needed including cold drinks, coffee and bottle of wine. Also a large balcony. Breakfast is on the roof and super cool with nice view. Area you can't choose better. In the center city but quiet area. Super chic with lots of high brands store and restaurants. Close to all shopping and tourist attraction. Will definitely return and stay there again.
title: Great!

review: Fantastic friendly and helpful staff, breakfast improved further since last time, rooms very nice and good value. Area superb. A few things to improve would be: easier to use air condition, another lift as waiting times can be high at times, cooler bed linen for the summer as the bed feels a bit too hot in the hot season in my opinion.
title: Great again it was my third stay

review: I arrived here yesterday, after canceling three other hotels in the center of Athens. While this cozy, beautiful boutique hotel is centrally located, but it's quiet and away from crowd. Front desk ladies were most friendly and helpful in suggesting several tours. Breakfast is great. The hotel is located in a residential, posh area, surrounded with high end stores, but just 5 minutes walk away from Metro, Parliament, National Garden and many other activities. I am enjoying my stay and will most definitely recommend and will return in future, it feels like home. Thank you
title: Superb Hotel with Friendly faces

review: Maybe because of the facilities they have the 5 stars but the quality of the facilities and finishing of the places, especially the rooms are very poor. The noise from the airconditioning system outside is terrible. The very old air conditioning system in my room was very dirty.
title: Good location but poor 5* hotel...

review: The hotel is tucked off of a windy road at the base of Lycabettus Hill. It provided wonderful views of Athens and the Acropolis. We had a wonderful dinner at their rooftop restaurant and dessert! Oh my! Dessert was heavenly! The included breakfast had a pretty varied selection to choose from. Sour cherry juice is amazing and refreshing. A room for two is smaller by American hotel room standards, but I expected it so I wasn't bothered by it. I did appreciate the bathroom having two doors separating it from the main room. This is important when you're sharing a room with someone. It helped with privacy. The room was nicely done and clean.The view was amazing! As you walk into the room and open the curtain to the balcony, you are hit with an awesome view of the Acropolis!. I loved waking up and going to sleep to this view!The hotel staff was beyond excellent! everyone from concierge, check-in, the spa and restaurant were very friendly and welcoming. As a said, they made the start of our trip wonderful. Thanks St. George!!
title: A Wonderful Start to an Epic Girls' Trip

review: St George is located in a nice leafy part of Athens with great eateries and shops within walking distance. It has amazing views of Athens and proved to be a comfortable stay for one night. Rooftop pool was a great place to unwind and have a drink. Rooms require a facelift and hotel is in need of a little refurbishment. Room was overcrowded with arm chairs and fridge was warm.
title: Lovely location with great rooftop pool and amazing views of Athens

review: I stayed in 9 different hotels in the last two months and this is the worst rooms that I was given.Firstly they put me in a room where the air conditioning water was coming in instead of going out and made a huge paddle inside. When I complained they said to put me in a suite at no extra cost. The air conditioning again was making some noises but no water leaking, The bed was very hard, the settee was partly reaped and part of the wallpaper was yellowish due to water leakage at some point.The whole decoration must have been at least 12 years old.
title: Bar rooms

review: We stayed here for two nights although the second night we have to leave at 3:00 in the morning for a flight . It was clean, comfortable , and walking distance to the old town area and Acropolis . Breakfast was simple but ok. The only negative is the desk controls the air conditioning and will only turn down to a certain level not to your comfort level. This part was not comfortable. We had a view of an abandoned building but weren't in the room much anyway. Easy to find your way around from here.
title: Convenient location

review: We stayed at Athens Cypria Hotel three nights in late June (23.6.17 to 26.6.17).We booked several months in advance rooms for two families: a family unit for four people that included two double rooms with a connecting door and a superior triple room for three adults that included one king bed and one single bed separated by a partition (also had a Jacuzzi).Both rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable.The hotel's location is excellent! In a small and quiet alley that starts from the famous Ermou Street. Within walking distance to all major sights in the city, 3 minutes' walk from Syntagmatos Square.The hotel has been recently renovated, which is a big plus. Its design is modern and pleasant. The breakfast was excellent; it included everything needed to open the day with.The staff was friendly and courteous. A very good choice to explore the city by foot.
title: Athens Cypria Hotel - A nice hotel in a fantastic location!

review: Got to the hotel for the over night stay and expected a small room it's Europe after all. The front desk clerk said the rooms are recently renovated and you can tell that there was new furniture and new laminate flooring in the room. The washroom is still a 1990s style and that wasn't a problem either. But a 2" gap at the bottom of the door to the hallway and into the washroom was a little concerning especially when you can hear everything down the hall.But the hotel was definitely ideally located centrally to the shopping district and was a 15 minute walk to the acropolis. Have to say the I was not impressed with the front desk staff. The night we arrived we asked if they would change the arrival of our airport shuttle by 30 mins. No problem she says. We asked the young lady at the desk 3 times and asked if she was certain she made the call and she assured us she did. "No Problem" Needless to say she didn't and we had to run since there was a delay at check in.
title: I can hear you

review: Reasonably priced hotel in a great location just off Ermou near SintagmaMany options on the nice breakfast buffet but they don't start until 7 am which is a problem when you have early flightsStaff are all pleasantMany options for dining within a short walkThe rooms here are small and could do with some modernisation and revamped bathroomsIn house caffe has reasonable meals at good prices tooIn room mini bar and safe were handyWalls are very thin and neighbours were making a porno with a goat I think?Overall would I stay here again? YESWOULD I RECOMMEND TO MY PARENTS AND FRIENDS?YesNot quite the 4 star I'm used to but it served the purpose
title: Great central Athens location

review: Clean rooms, comfortable beds, good location, helpful staff and rich breakfast.Close to everywhere.It was my first time in this hotel, i will prefer it again for my holiday and future bussiness trips. Thanks to whole the staffs for their helps. They always smile :)
title: Very good hotel

review: Athens Avenue HotelGrounds and Amenities: Fairly new hotel with a much appreciated cleanliness. The designs are very sleek and modern. Nice touch! Restaurant: The food was excellent! The breakfast buffet is doesn't have a wide variety however it has items you will desire to start your day. Well done! Staff:Very pleasant staff. Front desk and restaurant staff were phenomenal. I had several questions and they were able to answer them and provide recommendations for me. The check-in was absolutely quick and painless. Very impressed' Location:I wasn't a huge fan of the location. I am a solo traveler and found it difficult to walk around the area at certain times of the day alone, even before sunset. I didn't feel unsafe but I felt uncomfortable. The location has large amount of strip clubs and sex shops. Overall:I'd certainly stay here again but not alone. I'd recommend to family and friends.
title: Modern Sophistication

review: I am a representative of a Dutch Shipping company and we had a corporate event (80 pax) at Divani Palace Acropolis in April 2017. Accomodation, conference facilities and meals were above our expectations. Super friendly personnel helped us in planning and implementation of our event and all our wishes were fulfilled. Location is just perfect, I would like to highly recommend this hotel both for business and leasure purposes. Special thanks to Ioanna and Dina! Polina
title: A delightful stay in April 2017

review: I loved that the staff met us at the door to our room with cookies and ice cold water!We had a great view of the Acropolis from our room.The swimming pool was nice and the surroundings were very pleasant.The roof top restaurant was very good but the soft drinks were over priced. My husband ended up spending $20.00 US on three diet cokes. Wine would have been cheaper.The morning buffet was very good.The bar was open late and was willing to give me ice for my room.The staff helped me find the roof top movie theater that does movies on Saturday night. there is nothing like sitting on a roof top and watching a movie and having the Acropolis in the back ground.
title: Great place to stay for the tourist in Athens!

review: We stayed at the Divani Palace Acropolis twice - each time for two nights - on our way to and from the Greek islands. The hotel cannot be better situated for all the sights. The rooftop bar has incredible views of the Acropolis. The hotel is within close walking distance of the Acropolis, the Acropolis Museum, etc. Staff were always very friendly and helpful. We booked an executive room (which is a grade higher than the entry level - deluxe room). The room had air conditioning and free wifi that both worked relatively well. The only downside to the room was the twin beds that are standard in executive rooms. As a couple, we would have preferred a double bed.
title: A very good room in an amazing location

review: For a chain for hotels, the Divani Palace Acropolis has given us extremely friendly and personal service. The people/staff provide you with a 10/10 service and add that extra touch to everything they do for you! I am highly impressed.The breakfast spread is wide, the hotel location is fantastic (a few mins walk from the Acropolis and the Acropolis museum), and the rooms are cozy and comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel and location.Thank you to the staff for making our stay a great one!
title: Great hospitality and great rooms

review: We are currently staying at the Divani Palace Hotel. This hotel is in the perfect location, walking distance to the Parthenon, Acropolis museum, Botanical gardens, Syntagma square and many more. The are plenty of restaurants, coffee shops, mini supermarkets nearby. The buffet breakfast is lovely, especially as they have the Greek cuisine on offer as well as the traditional western breakfast. Greek dishes included are the yummy rizogalo, the egg cheese and tomato mixture, the greek sweets and the creamy feta. The rooms are clean and comfortable.
title: Great hotel in the perfect location

review: We stayed 2 nights at the hotel. The room for 3 was perfect for our needs and the location of the Divani is exceptional. As you can see the view from the roof top bar at night made the last night of our trip!The hotel is clean, public rooms very attractive. Breakfast is well done and varied. The food in the pool bar and roof top bar is very good and well presented.Located near the Acropolis museum and Plaka area. Cabs are easy to get, but be sure you predetermine the price before entering!
title: Great hotel but view from Roof Bar Incredible

review: We were warmly welcomed into this beautiful oasis in the heart of Athens. I was traveling with two teenagers who were very quickly made to feel welcome during a summer heat wave. We were fortunate to be allocated a triple room with a breathtaking view of the Acropolis. The breakfast were very well prepared and extensive. Lunch however was very slow and I am guessing most people do not have lunch here as the bar man who took our order seemed bored and made us feel as if we had disturbed him. The front office staff were initially very helpful however I guess it depended which individual served you. Overall a very pleasant and well situated hotel.
title: Amazing View

review: Here we are the three of us having cocktails and dinner with the Acropolis either directly in our vision or over our shoulder- depending on where we sat- magnificent! Food was really good and service friendly and attentive. I have dined rooftop at the Intercontinental - this is good or better. I would recommend the hotel and the rooftop to anyone. Tomorrow morning at 0800 we are off to climb the Acropolis.What a place. Kinnaman's
title: Lovely dinner

review: We stayed here twice in July 2017 - before and after a trip to the Greek islands. This is an ideally located hotel if you are a tourist visiting Athens. You can literally see the Acropolis from your balcony (assuming an upper floor on the street side and you lean out a little!). Be aware, it's an old style hotel, with a very 1980/90s feel, sort of place where the shower is over the bathtub, and at least our room was a bit tired, mattress a bit worn, etc - and we were upgraded on our second stay to what they call an executive room which is a step up from the standard room. So on the star rating system it's a more like 3.5 to 4 star than 5 star. But having said that we thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and would stay here again, the charming staff and great location more than compensate. Finally the breakfast included in our booking was excellent- a great range of Greek and western style food. Hence the rating of 4.5 which I have rounded to a 4.
title: Great location and service

review: I was excited to be staying walking distance to the Acropolis Museum. This hotels public areas are quite good but the rooms are a little tired. I stayed 3 days. In my first room the window shutters were shaking from the air conditioning. I changed rooms. Then the first night the air conditioner leaked in front of the bathroom door. A known issue as the light globe had been removed. Staff drained water. Stayed in the room ad hotel was full. Afternoon of day three same issue. Staff drained water again. I was due to check out that day. Avoid room 623 if you are staying here. Staff are friendly and courteous. Could not fault them. Doorman very knowledgeable with excellent English.
title: Rooms furnishings are a bit tired.

review: This is a great choice if you are looking for somewhere centrally located. The Acropolis is five minutes walk, as is Plaka (highly recommended). To reach anywhere further afield, taxis are readily available. All the staff were polite and helpful. We especially appreciated the doormen/busboys in assisting with luggage and calling taxis. We only stayed the one night because we had just come off a cruise and were returning home the following day. If we were in Athens again we would stay at this hotel.
title: Great place to stay in Athens

review: The hotel itself is just as you see in the pictures and is in a great central location for visiting all historic places. We were very glad we chose this hotel. What stood out to us though was the incredible staff that helped with every minor detail and any minor concern. We actually had a child get sick on the trip and the staff was fantastic. They got us to a local doctor that spoke English, had all transportation arranged for us, and then found a pharmacy open on a Sunday and arranged a car to take me to and from the pharmacy. The driver even came in to help as google translate and myself were doing a poor job. The driver translated for me, got the medicine for my child, and took me back to the hotel. The rest of the week the doormen asked my daughter how she was and watched after us. What an amazing group of people and what an unmatched level of service. The amount of languages spoken by the staff was also impressive. Michael, the doorman, is one of the nicest people we have encountered in our travels. Thank you for everything and for going above and beyond!
title: Great Hotel with AMAZING HELPFUL STAFF

review: Were there from 19th to 21st July and had a great time with the family and especially the dinners at the sky lounge with the scenic view of the Acropolis at night is a sight not to be missed . I've never seen such hospitality of the staff at the Sky Bar/ Lounge .with what love and courtesy they serve is just outstanding.would love to visit Athens again and stay here . Congrats to the team for an outstand No show.
title: Again great property for its location and price

review: Excellente site with a stunning view, ggod connection to public transportation. Beautiful rooms. Good and friedly service, very helpful and supportive. Outstanding roof garden (restaurant and staff). Breakfast buffet not very selected for a 5 star hotel. The movements of the chairs in the neighbouring rooms were much too loud. Pads under the furniture might solve the problem.
title: We enjoyed our stay

review: Given this is a 5-star hotel, I had rather high expectations coming into the place. The good: I was very impressed by the entrance/lobby of the hotel which is absolutely stunning. I was also very pleased with the hotel staff who helped us with our luggage and allowed us a slightly later checkout because our flight was a bit later. I was also very impressed with their breakfast. They had various options ranging from eggs and bacon to yogurt and dessert and everything in between! I know what authentic Greek food tastes like and am often am disappointed by these Greece hotels food quality, however this hotel had an overall great breakfast and their Bougatsa was one of the best I've ever had! The gift shop, which is located near the breakfast area, was also very large and offered great discounts. The location of this hotel was also perfect!The room itself had its pros and cons. The good: The view, the bathroom and the cleanliness. The view was great! We had a balcony with a side view of the Acropolis which was very nice. The bathroom was also very nice and large with a large tub/shower and a large, bright mirror. This was perfect given we were 3 women who needed the space to put on makeup! The room was also very clean.Now for the bad: Our room smelled very bad 70% of the time. At first it was more so like a sewer smell but we woke up in the morning very early to a horrible fish smell. We had to keep the balcony door open to get some of the smell out which made the room very hot so the whole time we had to choose between hot and fresh smelling room or cold and smelly room. We were at the end of a hallway and when you approached that part of the hallway, you would smell it. With that said, I'm not sure whether it's just our room or the whole place but regardless I would like to see the hotel do something about this. This smell is not a lack of cleaning or anything on the part of the staff, but regardless occurs and should be addressed. Our room also had a problem with the door knob to the bathroom. Every time one of us went in there it would not lock; we knew when someone was in there not to enter but it was still slightly annoying. However even worse: when we were leaving the door randomly locked and one person in our group got stuck in the bathroom. One of the hotel employees came with the key and he still couldn't open it and had to call the technician who finally got it open. They handled this manner in a very attentive and fast way however it is also something that the hotel needs to look into ASAP.
title: Not what I expected, but not horrible either

review: Very disappointed. Lobby etc lovely, however the photos of the pool on the website, are absolutely not what you get. I was expecting something fabulous and got a very small pool, which looked nothing like the photos. Bedroom definitely needs upgrading and bed linen is disgusting. There is a newer wing, which according to reviews is much better. However, I am angry that I am charged same price, but got second rate. I also think that 60 euros for one adult and two children to have a continental breakfast, is outrageous in a hotel of this standard. I actually thought it was a candid camera moment when the receptionist stated the price, however, it wasn't. Needless to say, we didn't take the offer up. The hotel needs to charge prices in line with the standard and quality that they deliver elsewhere.
title: Not 5 star and pictures of the pool do not reflect reality

review: We booked the divani palace because of its close proximity to the acropolis and plaka all of which are within walking distance . The hotel itself is very nice . It's very clean and modern . Staff were friendly . There is a gift shop , pool and it all so has a rooftop restaurant. The restaurant has a direct view of the acropolis which is magnificent at night . Something you really don't want to miss . Enjoyed our stay in all . Oh there are also ancient ruins on the lower level which they built around when the were constructing the hotel .
title: Week in Athens

review: My husband and I stayed at the Divani Acropolis for three nights and enjoyed it very much. We could see the Acropolis from our room, esp. impressive when it is lit at night. It is close to walk to the Acropolis and the Museum. We walked the few blocks from the Metro Station after taking the metro from the airport and had no difficulty finding the hotel. The bed was a king size and comfortable. The bathroom had a large tub with a shower. Our hallway and room was freshly painted--didn't feel "tired" to us. The air conditioner kept the room at a comfortable temp and we didn't hear outside noise. There was an outdoor pool, which we used every afternoon as it was over 100 degrees the week we were in Athens. It is easy to use the metro to get to the other areas of the city. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the lobby is large and impressive. We saw many different restaurants nearby as we were walking around. The staff told us where to catch the XPress 80 bus to take to the port for the cruise we were taking. We would definitely stay there again.
title: Great Location, Enjoyed our Stay

review: We stayed at the Divani Palace in early july 2017. The room was clean ,not that large for two and a kid and a bit outdated. The staff was helpful and friendly but very little English. The rooftop restaurant was OK, but street restaurant there much better . A very short walk to the Acropolis and the Plaka. The area seemed very safe and friendly. Overall, we really liked the Divani Palace and would definitely stay there again.
title: Good hotel ,great location close to everything

review: The Divani is in an ideal location. The Acropolis is within walking distance, as is the museum and many other tourist attractions. We haven't stayed in many hotels - we thought the lobby was swish, considering the price we paid for 4 nights! The rooms don't have the best views - onto residential areas - but we only used it to sleep in! Beds were comfortable, shower hot and plenty of water. Towels changed as needed and beds always remade. We didn't stay long enough for the sheets to be changed.The pool was refreshing - closed 3-5.30pm and shaded for a large amount of the day. Best time to go is 11-2.30 as we found few people there and lots of sun!Drinks are somewhat expensive but the iced coffees are delicious. However, walking up the road to Dive Coffee gets you a bigger one for a cheaper price!You MUST visit Sfika for food. It's not far - you can almost see it from the door to the hotel. The food is delicious. We went to the "Secret" Rooftop restaurant. Pricey and, though everyone was so pleasant, not really worth it.We used the blue tour bus - ticket allowed 2 days of exploring! Just what you need!We're off to Santorini now!
title: Honeymoon Part 1

review: Divani Palace Acropolis is a wonderful hotel. We stayed 3 nights and loved the hotel and their very nice staff. the pool area is very nice and lovely food. The roof terrace has a fantastic view and the rooms a very nice and cosy. Also the area is so charming. we can only recommend this hotel to everyone. we loved staying here .thank you Divani Palace . Best regards The Engholm Family from DK.
title: lovely hotel

review: A solid choice! The location of the Divani Palace can't be beat, it's a two block walk to the base of the Acropolis and we had a great view of the Parthenon from our balcony! It's also only about a 10 minute walk to the Plaka shopping/restaurant district! The hotel itself is older and a bit dated, but the room was comfortable and clean. The staff was great and very helpful when we had questions. The rooftop restaurant was a bit on the small side, but again you can't beat the view! The food was also excellent (the grilled lamb chops and the Valrhona chocolate filled with crème brulée were fantastic)! Breakfast was good with a wide variety of offerings. And while the hotel itself does not have an airport shuttle service, they were more than happy to arrange that for us. All in all, a great choice for us!
title: Good choice!

review: Clean, nice hotel. Pool was a nice treat in the hot weather. Balcony faced the pool with a slight view of the Acropolis, but only had one chair. In room safe. Didn't eat here as it was way too expensive. Lots of nice dining options close by. Very convenient for the Acropolis.
title: Nice hotel in convenient location

review: As others have noted, the best part of this hotel is the location. You can easily walk to all of the major tourist destinations. We had a room on the top floor with a view of the Acropolis from our balcony. Overall, the hotel and the rooms could use a major update. It's clean enough, but very dated. I certainly would not consider it a five star hotel. Breakfast was fine; nothing special but nothing to complain about. We also dined at the rooftop restaurant; the view is fantastic, the food is decent and, as expected, a bit expensive. We were satisfied but not wowed, and would probably look for something a bit more modern during our next trip to Athens.
title: Five Stars in the 1980s

review: The hotel is in good location. It has huge halls and pretends to be luxury - but it is not. Especially rooms are definitely not 5 stars. They are ok, with everything needed but nothing special. When booking, the description says that the executive rooms should be of better standard than de lux, especially they should have better view. This is not true - we were able to compare because we reserved two de lux and one executive and actually the cheaper rooms had better view. This so called 'better view' costs about 35 € per night. The hotel stands perpendicular to the Acropolis so all the rooms on the side with the view have similar, not the best perspective. It is beautiful but not direct look at Acropolis ;-) This can be found at the roof restaurant.The breakfast is good, very nice people working there (as opposed to the front desk where a little more genuine friendliness would be nice). There is a lovely pool area but the sun comes there only for a few hours during the day (otherwise covered by the shadow of the buildings). The prices in the bar are too high - for example espresso costs 4€ - it is a pity because almost nobody orders from that bar. Overall the hotel is good but I had much bigger expectations therefore maybe I am a little disappointed.
title: OK but not really 5 stars

review: This hotel is amazing it's clean, modern and centrally located. The breakfast was delicious. The room while smaller had enough amenities and facilities. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a nice hotel that is close to all things.
title: Wow

review: A gem in one of Athens' best neighborhoods, on a quiet street. A great location on the foot of Mount Lycabettus with breath taking views of Athens, the Acropolis, the city, all the way to the Agean. Minutes away from Kolonaki Square, and great shopping. Less than 10 minutes from Syntagma Square and within walking distance to Monastiraki and the heart of Athens. A boutique hotel that I would say caters to the eclectic customers who want it all but without the hustle and bustle of the noisy city sights. The staff is most pleasant and accommodating, the restaurant lovely, as is the pool area on the roof top.
title: Breath Taking Views

review: First stayed here in 2012. Returned again for one night before joining a cruise. Same high standard of service, lovely breakfast on a high floor to overlook the Acropolis. Fab rooftop pool with bar and sun loungers to enjoy the magnificent view. Thank you to the lovely staff on reception who booked us a meal at Kuzina to return where we had eaten a memorable meal on their roof top in 2012. It was just as good this time! I would highly recommend this hotel for any stay in Athens.
title: Another lovely stay here

review: Fantastic view from the balcony, excellent service!! Good location. We stayd one night can recommend this hotel egen you stay in athens!!!! We hasa Nice stay and will probably book this hotel again if we travel to athens!
title: Nice Hotel

review: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights after sailing from Venice. The hotel was well staffed, the room was fine on the lower ground floor with what is described as a courtyard view and had a nice balcony with 2 chairs and table on it. It looked out to some trees and a close up view of the next door building.The bathroom was well equipped and quite well maintained. We had a very comfortable bed made up of two singles booted together. The pool area was quite well shaded but sun beds were at a premium. The pool itself was very clean and a nice temperature. The hotel is in an up market area of Athens with some very nice eateries and cafes close by down the hill a bit.
title: Lovely and relaxing stay during a hot July 2017

review: I love this hotel and come back several times a year. Great location, wonderful rooms, the best view in town and super friendly staff. If you travel with your wife or husband, you need to enjoy a evening on the balcony of the restaurant.
title: I love this hotel and especially the great staff.

review: We stayed here two nights: the first night after arriving in Athens for our honeymoon, and the last night before we left anthens at the end of our honeymoon.The first night we stayed in the "acropolis view" room on the 5th floor. This room was the worst room we stayed in during our honeymoon. It was very very small, a/c didn't work, no hot water, and old bathroom. Not what you would expect from a 5 star hotel.The last night we stayed in a standard room on the 4th fourth floor. The room and bathroom were much more modern and updated.The front desk service was good however they obviously push restaurants they work with. They charged us 7 euros for a miniature Pringles chip...absurd. We stayed in hotels in mykonos, santorini, crete and this hotel was disappointing compared to the others.The breakfast offered was very limited, and again the worst breakfast at a hotel we had while in Greece.For the price: I would recommend trying to a find a better hotel, as in my opinion, this hotel is not a 5 star hotel.
title: Not that good

review: Nice location and overall good hotel for Athens. However on our second visit the Check In was delayed by over 2 Hours and we didn't get in to our room until 4:20 pm. We were informed that our room had a broken fridge but the upgrade they gave us was a worse room than the one we requested (we had it in our first visit) with old furniture and in need of a serious renovation. We were disappointed, and so after a back and forth with management we were placed back in the room with the broken fridge. Still, even with a broken fridge it's a very nice room, #310. The whole ordeal was entirely not necessary and could have been avoided. It was especially unacceptable because we were returning guests and intended to keep this hotel as a basis for our yearly Athens visits.
title: Second visit was disappointing

review: Nice hotel property with pretty decent view of the Acropolis! close to restaurants ad shopping area. I didn't have the best view from my room but it was comfortable. The hotel staff was very nice and accommodating.
title: Greek Islands Visit - May 2017

review: A boutique hotel is a hotel which typically has between 10 and 100 rooms in unique settings with upscale accommodations. That's what St. George Lycabettus exactly is. Read my whole review on RoxiRose .com and find out which are the best things that we experienced here.
title: Best Boutique Hotel in Athens

review: We spent one night here at the end of a cruise from Venice. Good accommodation and bathroom, although no view as overlooked the hotel inner courtyard. Rooftop swimming pool and bar good but noisy from A/C machinery. Good breakfast with super views across Athens from the restaurant balcony.A bit away from the city centre but only a short taxi ride.
title: Excellent roof top views, good service.

review: I have already mentioned the interest of this hotel for the outstanding sightseeing over the Acropolis and the entire city of Athens, that you may enjoy at breakfast or for a drink at sunset on the terrace near the pool . The staff is very friendly and helpful. But I recommend climbing to the top of mount Lycabetus nearby: for the lazy, there is a funicular (3 mn from the hotel and 10mn up, altough there is often a queue of tourists, so count 25-30 mn) , but it is better to walk up by the road and the partially staired path (30-40 min from the hotel for normal people, 15-20mn if you are trained at mountain climbing) . The terrace of the monastry is the ideal place to observe the sunset. If you are lucky and observe carefully, you will see the "green light" at the last second.
title: Mount Lycabetus at sunset nearby Saint Georges Hotel

review: The location of the hotel is probably the best one in Athens, as from the rooms you have a great overview over the entire citiy, to the Akropolis and behind to the harbour and the sea (if weather is clear). You can reach all museums and sights be feet, have good restaurants in the near and an open air cinema with good films in the evening directly in front of the hotel. In the morning you can swimm in the pool on the roof or walk up the hill to the very top to have a marvelous 360o view.
title: Balcony

review: Athens gets hot! Very hot. So, this is a great hotel because it has a nice rooftop pool with a bar :) The breakfast service is great, and if you stay for more than 3 nights you can get lunch at the hotel for free, which was also delicious.
title: Great hotel with a nice pool!

review: The hotel view is unbeatable, but if you stay somewhere else you can still enjoy it with a glass of wine on an evening. the food was okay, definitely overpriced-well prepared and presented but short on vegetables or things not drenched in oil or sauces - but they went out of their way to find me salad ingredients and vegetables! I will definitely stay there again if I go back to Athens.Be sure to ask what kind of room you're getting - some are stunning with big balconies and some are just tiny standard rooms with barely a window.
title: Beautiful stay overall

review: Nice hotel with an awesome rooftop pool that looks out over the whole city, including the Parthenon. Near a lot of upscale shopping and residences in an area that seems like Athens's Upper East Side. Also right next to the path up Mt. Lycabettus.
title: Great rooftop pool

review: Saint George was recommended to us by our daughter and son in law . From the time we entired your lobby we were greeted with warm smiles and courteous service . After checking in front desk offered us coffees while we waited for our room , small gesture but very thoughtful . Staff was very knowledgeable and helpful in recommending sites in Athens . But best of all was our evening dinner and the incredible view of Athens and the Acropolis by night . Also a special thank you to our waiter Kosta for treating us like royalty . Looking forward to visiting Saint George Lycabettus and staff in the near future .
title: Last two nights of a three week vacation .

review: The hotel was great, right in the heart of Athens Kolonaki suburb, moments from the centre of the city.The staff are extremely helpful, the Acropolis views amazing.Our family room was generous and quiet a great room.The facilities of the gym and plunge pool were an added bonus.Look this up when you're next in Athens - it won't disappoint.
title: Great Athenian Experience

review: Hotel was quite old and didn't look as advertised on the pictures. For the price and the rate, would have expected way better accommodation. The rooms also smelled a lot of cigarette. Mattress was not comfortable at all.
title: Not as advertised

review: We stayed one night as a stopover before heading to Spetses so didn't get to make use of any of the hotels facilities (spa, rooftop pool etc). The location in elevated, upmarket Kolonaki suited our purpose as we weren't looking to explore the city this time & whilst not far from town this area does offer a breather from the full scale madness of central Athens. We were warmly welcomed & found the front desk crew to be outstandingly helpful & efficient. Our room was in the new eco chic wing & was spacious enough & pleasantly but modestly decorated in a muted palette of beige & white. Airy & light with a balcony but not much of a view. We slept well & suffered no noise pollution. The bathroom was fitted out in contemporary minimal style & was fine though the silly vase like basin is a classic case of form over function. We didn't eat in-house as there is a superb Asian/Peruvian restaurant right next door but we did have drinks in the 6th Floor Bar. The views are astounding - surely the best in the city. Drinks are pricey for the privilege of such vistas but it's worth a visit. Decor is a little dated up here as is the case in many other areas of the hotel & from a decor perspective the hotel struggles to scrape a 5 star rating. For the price paid though I was more then happy with our choice - the fantastic views & excellent staff made it a winner for our brief visit.
title: Great Views, Outstanding Front Desk Team

review: This is a fantastic hotel. It has an incomparable view of Athens. Please see our pictures from the breakfast buffet. The facility is top notch. The rooms are spacious, the facility is modern, the pool breathtaking, and the staff is first class. My only complaint is that is sits on the largest hill in Athens and it is a long way from most of the tourist sites. It was not that big a deal to us, but if you decide to walk to any major attraction, I recommend taking a cab back to the hotel. It is a long walk.
title: Incrediable View/First Class Rooms/Not the Best Location

review: Fantastic location, great staff, amazing views - from room, rooftop pool, restaurant / breakfast and great wifi. This is our third stay with the family and it's our place of choice when visiting Athens.
title: back again

review: Very friendly staff and nice rooms, however everything is SUPER EXPENSIVE. It's normal for hotels to charge higher prices for products- foods and drinks but when you are paying almost 6 times more for a bottle of water thats just ridiculous! If you do stay here you may want to consider eating out more and buying snacks and water bottles from the nearest supermarket.
title: Everything is SUPER EXPENSIVE

review: Poor room, very little, with old furnitures, old bed, dirty walls, small armchairs, terrible views... The swimming pool is not adequate for a 5 star hotel, the terrace is very poor (it has a lot of possibilities). The restaurant and specially the bar is very, very expensive. Only the employees and the views from the restaurant save the assessment
title: Really, is it a 5 star hotel?

review: Breathtaking views from both the pool and the breakfast room over the acropolis and whole city of athens, makes this property a great choice. We liked the fact that it was out of the crazy of Athens and set in the upmarket Kolonaki district but it did mean taxis as walking in the soaring heat of july was just not an option. It was a 15 minute walk down hill to syntagma square which was a surprise as the hotel blurb states 800m? But that said, taxis in and around athens are well priced so a taxi to the plaka was 6-8 euros. The rooms are not big but have all you need including a little balcony. The beds are huge and comfortable. But without question, the highlight is breakfast because to be able to sit outside and enjoy a great feed with the best view ever was unbeatable.
title: located on the hill in the coolest area of athens

review: I had a short stay here. The rooms were small and comfy. Slippers and a robe were provided. The check in and check out process was quick and easy. They were very helpful in securing an early morning taxi for me to the airport. I was disappointed that breakfast was not included in the room rate.
title: Nice Hotel

review: Perfectly adequate hotel. Rooms were clean and a reasonable size, all with balconies.Has a rooftop pool and bar area, but the pool is small and basic.Breakfast was the same every day, bacon, sausage, cheese, salad etc. Eggs always available but over-cooked. Tinned fruit rather than fresh was disappointing.Had one meal at the rooftop bar which was OK - nothing outstanding, although the moussaka was poor and microwaved.Location is great, 5 minutes to beach and tram to Athens, Restaurants and bars within a 10 minute walk along with shops.Staff helpful.
title: Great location, but not luxurious

review: What a fantastic find this hotel was. This modern hotel is exceptional value with modern rooms and helpful staff. The highlight was the rooftop pool and bar, wihch felt like an oasis, with its wonderful views to the Acropolis.
title: Great city stay

review: We spent a week-end in this hotel which is very convenient as many things are in walking distance.Warm welcome from the staff and a very good level for the rooms: cleaned and nicely prepared. The best thing is to enjoy a dinner at the rooftop enjoying the night view to the Acropolis and its monuments. Food are excellent as well.Make sure you get a room with a view on the inner court. You will have absolute silence. The AC in our room was too efficient as it could not be regulated so I had to ask for extra blankets knowing it was 36°C outside.
title: Good central hotel

review: Whilst the Novotel did say it is in central it is out of the central zone for cabs. The area surrounding the Novotel may have been great in its day but at the moment it is in transition. More of the less lovely parts of Athens (hookers, addicts and homeless) all harmless but none the less, a difficult conversation with the younger members of the family about why these people had no home to go to.
title: Comfortable rooms in what seems like a downward trending area

review: This hotel was clean, the beds were comfortable, the breakfast was plentiful and the rooftop was amazing... HOWEVER, it is located in a ghetto, with drug dealers and users all around. If you want a hotel where you can walk around outside, this is not the place to stay. If you're okay taking a taxi to go everywhere, then this is a great choice!
title: Great hotel... bad neighborhood

review: Friendly, clean, quick metro ride to major sites. Despite the fact that the area isn't too pretty, I never felt unsafe in the evening. It gets 5 stars for the stunning view of the Parthenon from the rooftop bar & pool area.
title: Great view of Parthenon

review: Great Hotel - Location.. Less So... Staff was wonderful, food and pool area wonderful. Centrally located but a shady area. We walked to dinner one night met some interesting types. Taxi back. I would stay here again knowing the area know but is not "appealing" as graffiti and other dominate the area.
title: Great Hotel - Location.. Less So...

review: The location of this hotel was good very close to a railway...however....the neighbourhood was a little rough...I wouldn't walk through of a night time. Our experience was so varied. We had 2 rooms. I room was a decent size but the other room (located at the end of the building) was so small we found it difficult to use both our suitcases at the same time. In the bathroom was the only mirror but no power point (therefore... I couldn't use my hair straightener).The lady in reception was so friendly and helpful on arrival but the gentleman when we checked out was plain rude. We settled our bill (a considerable size due to amazing cocktails from the rooftop bar!) and there was no thank you for staying with us or "have a nice trip"...I was shocked.The buffet breakfast was excellent, a huge variety of food and heaps of tables..however...you have to first get past the rude staff who are only interested in getting your room number..no "good morning" from them!The only saving grace for this hotel was the amazing rooftop bar (complete with views of the Acropolis). The pool was fabulous too and the staff up here were so courteous, helpful and smiled at you !!Overall it was a fine hotel but honestly I was expecting a little more from Novotel (particularly the staff).
title: Amazing rooftop pool

review: If there would not be this roof top pool bar/restaurant with a nice view on the Acropole, I would only evaluate it as 3 Star: the location itself is not very good (quite unfriendly people on the street) and at least 8-10min from the metro station. Don't walk back alone at night!Breakfast is also crowded with slow replenishment during peak time. You sometimes need to wait 10min to get seated.Otherwise, rooms are to the Novotel standard: clean and staff very friendly.
title: Great rooftop pool with view, but unfriendly area

review: Visited Athens to catch up with relatives from the other side of the globe. We could have picked a better Hotel to start our journey around Greece and Italy. The Hotel, staff and rooms were great. The staff were so friendly and could not do enough for you. They joined us when we laughed and ensured our family and friends were looked after. It was like a 5 Star establishment. Highly recommended and thanks to the staff and particular the evening shift in the dining room and bar. We had a ball.Thank you and all the best you were fabulous.
title: What a great stay

review: we tried this restaurant during our walk downtown Athens . We were surprised by the variety of the menu for a light dinner. The salad with prosciutto was amazing . We also tried the Greek cheeses dish and it was also good. The chef with the eyeglasses was very helpful and he was explaining with politeness and professionnalisme all the details of the dishes . Best choice for a light dinner -lunch downtown !!!
title: Very good restaurant at the basement of the hotel

review: This hotel in Athens is about a 30 minute walk from the Plaka area or a 20 minute Uber/cab. We stayed here one night prior to a cruise. The rooms are acceptable but the bathroom has little privacy. The bathroom has a glass frosted door that is more like a saloon door so you have very little bathroom privacy. The best part of the hotel is the rooftop bar, pool and restaurant. We had a very nice dinner overlooking the Parthenon and enjoyed the views, the food and the drinks. Service was also very good. If you desire a luxury hotel this is not the place but it is a reasonable one night stay for travelors through Athens.
title: Moderately priced & moderatley nice!

review: Novotel had the potential to be a luxury hotel but it constantly let itself down. To begin with they had mixed up the rooms and ours was a lot smaller than expected. Secondly the way children were allowed to run wild around the hotel made the experience far from relaxing. The pool is smaller than it seems and was packed with 20 small children swimming in it all day, despite the pool rules saying that children must be accompanied in the pool, however parents seemed to let their kids mess around in the pool making no adults want to swim and the staff did not do anything about it. Due to the lack of sun beds it felt like a race to get somewhere to sit on the rooftop! The worst experience I had here was with the food on the rooftop. Not only were the prices generally extortionately high (€4 for a can of coke) but the hotel prices were unbelievable. We thought we would eat there due to the area surrounding the hotel having no shops or restaurants. Although the prices were very high we thought the food would be worth it and we couldn't of been more wrong. I ordered the lamb shank which came from frozen and I'm sure they had been using the microwave they had in the kitchen. My boyfriends food was awful, he ordered a chicken burger but what arrived was a plate of chips with two minuscule patties oddly flavoured. I regret staying here and would recommend anyone looking for a relaxing stay to spend the extra money and go to a different one as this hotel is not worth the price!
title: Very disappointed

review: It was not too difficult to find with GPS. While the indoor parking is a test of the driver's skill esp we had a big car, there are plenty of outdoor parking around the hotel. Room is quite the bare minimum. Novotel is a usual 4-star in Asia, but this one would be our 2/3-star. Amenities are at just minimum, towels were very "thin". The room wasn't that comfortable overall to make me stay in longer. Lots of choices at breakfast with both hot and cold dishes. Staff looked very grumpy though. Hotel souvenir shop got some interesting stuff. I like that the hotel installed a kinnect at the lobby, this keeps the older kids entertained.
title: An okay choice in Athens

review: Come on Novotel, you can do better than this. Athens is a big busy hot city, so you want a hotel which provides a little calmness close to the city centre where you can feel safe. I'm afraid this hotel does neither. It is a hike from the city, the place is constantly busy with lots of children making lots of noise and with package tours using the hotel as an overnight stop, it was bedlam especially at breakfast. The hotel also sits pretty close to the red might district, so evenings are not exactly joyous returning by foot to the hotel.A poor example of a city centre hotel.
title: Busy busy busy

review: We were in the hotel two days and the experience was nice, the staff friendly and willing to help. Breakfast very rich and varied. The hotel has good location to go to different places by walking or by taxi. Thanks for the attention.
title: Atenas
