review: Nice hotel not far from the main railway station in Athens.A bit to walk from the hotel to the nearest sub way station.Very friendly staff and the hotel helps arranging transport from the airport.Excellent breakfast with a variety of food.The roof pool is packed with children, so not the perfect place to relax, if it is a quiet moment you are seeking.I would recommend taxi for transport in the evening and night because of the district of town that the hotel is situated.Nice and comfy beds and gods cleaning.
title: Nice hotel with very good breakfast

review: I was here for 4 nights and I paid nearly 60 Euros a night. At first, I was given a room which was on opposite side of the street. It was very small and it had no window so I asked them to change it. Then, I got a room that has a balcony to the street, but the AC was not working fine and it was hot. I asked them to have a look at it the second day and they fixed it. I was happy with the service. It was a Best Western class so I was not expecting something extra. I heard the street was a place for prostitutes before and the polis cleaned it up, however, locals told me to be sharp when I was going back to the hotel at night. I could see weird and junky people when I walked to a museum close to this hotel, but nothing bad happened.
title: Get a street side room

review: Stayed here 4nths had 2 rooms as 2 couples... Guy at desk very friendly and helpful and he doubles as our bar guy in the small bar/lounge room where we ended each day to wind down after very busy day exploring the interesting city. Rooms with all the basics, very clean but shower recess very small and water goes over floor but nothing a towel didn't fix. The Breakfast was very good.. something for every one. The lift is very small but it made interesting talking point. No complaints and would return if ever in Athens again. Value for money!
title: good location/value for money

review: This is a basic budget friendly hotel that was adequate for our needs. What it lacked in accommodations was made up for by the wonderful staff that offered assistance, directions, etc. The only problem was that we were offered only 1 key card which wa a little inconvenient. We were concerned about the area initially because of the graffiti on the nearby buildings, but didn't encounter any problems. It was located right across from the Archaeological Museum which to me was the best museum. Also was close to good restaurants. Roof top area has distant view of the Acropolis.
title: Amazing Staff!

review: Place is ok to sleep. Showers are small. Bed is comfy. Room is a bit warm. A.C. is loud. Breakfast is not worth the package or 9euro separate charge. Better eat outside at many restaurants. Staff are friendlyHotel location is convenient but area seems dodgy at night.
title: Mediocre

review: The staff were all great especially the barman who helped us organise a drinks party for our daughter's 21st. He couldn't have been more helpful. He chilled the wine we brought with us in his fridge and provided glasses and ice buckets. We would also recommend the breakfast.
title: Great service

review: The hotel is a ten minute walk from the metro station and conveniently located to many sights around Athens. The rooms are a good size, shower a little small and not enough water pressure, but is was great to have a balcony too. All the staff are very friendly and knowledgable and I would definitely stay here again.
title: Convenient location

review: We stayed only for one night but the efficiency, professionalism, cordiality and helpfulness of the staff amazed us. We arrived while it was raining and they insisted on going out in the rain to carry our luggage; they did the same thing the following morning on our check out. They quickly provided my elderly mother with a chair while we waited for check in, which was fast and efficient. They gave us an upgrade although it was a one night stay, recommended a great restaurant for dinner and had us directions as well. The room was spacious, with a balcony and all the necessary amenities. Thanks to the staff, hats off to you.
title: People are the best feature

review: Olympia Film Festival authority booked the hotel for me. I stayed only one night here before joining the festival at Pyrgos. I had very little time, but I could use my time seeing the museum, that was at a walking distance. The neighborhood was quite and peaceful and the streets were full of ripe oranges. They served a very good breakfast and I must say my short stay was wonderful!
title: Wonderful short stay!

review: Family of 11, 3 rooms. Hotel is in a good location, however the neighborhood is very run down. Upon arrival, a very cheerful staff greets you. There are several stairs to climb to get to the central elevator, which is very small. The staff happily gets your bags to your rooms, so this is not an issue. Very clean breakfast area with a lovely woman making sure you are seated and comfortable. Rooms are very clean, bathroom is a decent size. Air conditioning is adequate.There is no hotel appointed parking. They suggest a parking garage, but it is several blocks away and not a well lit walk back to the hotel. Many shopping areas are an easy walk in daylight.When you need a cab to town, the hotel will call you one. We loved our stay here!
title: Great value, location & service

review: Arrived for two nights stay with 3 other families. Staff couldn't have been more better. Really helpful and pleasant. Good value restaurants and bars a short walk away. 1/2 hour walk to Plaka for slightly more expensive bars and restaurants!Thank you.
title: Excellent service and value for money

review: Stayed here for 2 nights as a solo traveler. The rooms were very clean, beds were comfy and the rooms were quite. Having a small balcony was a nice touch also.Staff were very nice and always happy to answer any questions.Hotel is in a good location, I felt safe walking around the area and it is only about a 20/30min walk away from the main touristy areas.
title: 2 night stay

review: This is a nice hotel mere steps from the metro and abundant shopping, and a short walk to markets and the Monastraiki neighborhood. The hotel staff is efficient and friendly. Don't miss the free breakfast. I usually don't care much for breakfast buffets but this one is full of fresh fruit, bread, pastries, eggs, meats, yogurt. The options are plentiful and the staff keeps the food very fresh. The rooms are clean and the hotel is very quiet.
title: Underrated.

review: Located next to the metro station and also a taxi piazza outside the hotel makes getting out and about very easy.With a very modern design, very nice and clean rooms. Children friendly hotel.Very nice breakfast.The prices are really good
title: Value for money

review: We had an adjoining room - king bed and bath in one room, king and pullout and bath in the other - fantastic rooms, great breakfast in the morning and extremely helpful hotel staff. Hop on / hop off bus has stop right at square. Very near flea market and many other fun parts of Athens.
title: Excellent hotel - especially for family of 5.

review: We stayed here for 5 nights as a family of 4 (children 8/12). Room was spacious. Kids slept on the sofa bed. A/C is very good and effective. 2 Flat screen televisions on the wall infront of each bed. Mini bar available. Coffee machine only makes coffee. No kettle or tea making facilities available. Several sockets available for charging devices - though no USB sockets... Bathroom has excellent lighting and storage for many toiletry bags. Jacuzzi jets in bath was an absolute treat! Shower & bath is a 2 in 1. Only received toiletries on arrival - not again. Towels good quality. Face cloths not available in room. Bathroom drainage didn't work so well but maintenance took care of that. Very impressed with the safe where electrical devices can be locked up while charging - a very well thought through idea! Breakfast was a 6/10. Same same every single day. Not even the slightest variation in dishes being served. Dissapointment with the two Greek pastry dishes - very basic and really didn't impress us at all. Basic juice, filter coffee and tea available. Any other beverages to be charged accordingly- though no signs mentioning this anywhere. We loved walking in to his hotel after a long day and it always smelled so fresh and clean! Cleanliness is 10/10!! Staff are well trained, professional and all so friendly except for one terribly rude young waitress who screamed at me and made a big scene at breakfast about me politely questioning why I wasn't charged for my cappuccino the previous morning. A friendly explanation would have done. I felt very embarrassed to say the least. The manager on duty during breakfast was extremely kind and was aware of every move in his breakfast room, unfortunately he wasn't around during this particular incident.Right outside the hotel is a fabulous bakery, oh the Baklava!!! and also a drinks kiosk. The hop-on-hop-off bus also stops right outside. Entrance to the Omonia Metro station is 10 meters away. At night a wee bit dodgy - felt unsafe and threatened - though no one said or did anything to us , maybe human nature when people that seems to look like a thread are hanging around and police often comes out and round them all up. Many taxis also always available. Would stay here again and recommend this for first time visitors of Athens.
title: Uncomplicated

review: The location of the hotel could not have been more perfect. It's just a short drive from the airport and the hotel is centrally located in Athens city center. Great design and a short walk to all the chicest restaurants and shops!
title: Chic Boutique Hotel in City Center

review: With good access to Metro and easy walking distance to lots of sights and restaurants this was a perfect place to stay in the city. Good cool room to escape to when the heat of the day became too much.
title: Great place to stay

review: The service was decent, the breakfast also decent, people were helpful at the reception, the best though is the location which is very accessible. The only part I would compalint about is their lifts, they are terribly small and can suffucate you especially with more than 2 persons and when 5 get in, Oh Boy!! The plaka, the acropolis, the Syntagma square etc are all walking distance so sourcing food and place to spend time walking is plenty and good. even if you take a taxi, the minimum fare is charged which EUR 3.5, please note the taxi people can be quite ecasive and demand much more so please be cautious.
title: We liked the location most

review: Great location (metro is a stone throw away, 24hrs convenient store right outside the hotel, walking distance to most places of interests and eateries, very safe area), very comfortable bed, very clean toilet with strong shower head, good breakfast which serves till 11am, most friendly & very helpful staff, etc. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Athens.
title: Fantastic Stay @ Athens Tiare!!!

review: This hotel just gets it right. Their most important assets are their employees. People who stood out for us were the Front Desk, especially Maria and Dieu who went above and beyond the call of duty whilst we had to spend 3 extra days in Athens as we became ill after having consumed tainted food on a cruise ship. The location is excellent and close to almost everything. The area seems a little dodgy at night however, it never felt unsafe and it is like any other city in the world, perhaps safer than most. There are many restaurants and coffee shops surrounding the hotel, with an excellent dessert shop right next door. The rooms are spacious, the public areas well laid out, the food really good (especially the breakfast and room service) and the decor is modern yet functional. This is a design hotel and a lot of thought went into the refurbishment. I especially like the interactive smart TV's in the rooms which are able to be mirrored to a personal mobile device. The wifi is free and fast. The beds and pillows (they have pillow menus) are extremely comfortable and all areas, including the rooms are immaculately clean and well looked after. They have plugs next to the beds and also a USB charging cable for telephones or iPads. The AC worked well, especially during the 38 Celsius heat whilst we were there. The rooms have fully stocked minibars and a highly quality brand of soap, body lotion and shampoo is provided in large pump action bottles. We were very happy with our stay here and are already planning our next visit to Athens in December. We shall certainly again stay at Athens Tiare Hotel. The only feedback I would give the management is to provide drinking glasses in the bathrooms, even if they are plastic disposable ones. The towels are not the best quality and should perhaps be changed for something slightly better. Other than this, everything was near perfect. Thanks again to Maria and Dieu for your amazing efficiency and making our stay extra special.
title: Other city hotels should learn from Athens Tiare

review: Hotel's location looks good. So we booked. May be the cheapest room, because we only spent one night in Athens. The room was too small and didn't have any window; its ok, thats why it is the cheapest room. But what about the towels... Their colour went yellow and smell very weird. And the bed also smells like that. Just try another hotel, there are many options in the centre of Athens...
title: Just find another hotel

review: Booked a deluxe room with city view for 3 for about USD 140, which was a really good deal considering the location the hotel was in. During check in, the receptionist told us that the rooms will be ready around 12 noon. We decided to wander around the shops. When we returned at 1.50pm, we were told that the room was not ready and will require another 15-20 minutes. In the room, there was a lack of facilities such as a kettle, or drinking cups/glasses. There wasnt any glasses in the toilet as well. It was pretty much like a high-class hostel room instead.The location was great, right above Omonia train station. And there was no designated turn in/ drop off bay catered for the hotel guests. We arrived by taxi and had to alight alongside the road with our luggages.
title: Good location, but lack of room facilities

review: The hotel was beautiful. The staff were professional and most importantly it was clean. The rooms were a good size with all modern facilities. Nice and quiet for a good sleep and within walking distance to some delicious restaurants. Right near the train station made life easy. Thank you!
title: Very clean, modern and convenient location

review: Went there after long fly and had found our hotel had no reservation for us.We booked the room on line. We went there the first thing they give us was a refreshment drink.Staff was friendly and they were sorry that we had some unpleasant experience.Room was Causy and clean.Bathroom was nice and clean as well. Water pressure was very nice.Breakfast was good.Internet was SPEEDY.Gym was ok.Coffee shop down stairs was nice.All in all highly recommended.
title: Nice

review: Typical old hotel with old infrastructure that goes through a designer refurbishment and gets a modern "boutique" tag...Toilets, elevators and general systems look old and tired. Walls got a Creative paint instead of plain white and so did some of the old furniture.Fail to see 5 star level and more a glorified 4. Breakfast is ok but not impressive and service is slow and average. Website looks better than real life. Price follows category so don't come thinking that you got a well priced 5 star deal.
title: Not impressed but right value for money

review: The hotel is about a 10-15 min walk to the center of Athens. The hotel is lovely, chic, had beautiful art displayed but what was amazing was the staff. SO beyond helpful! We went to Santorini for 3 days and they let us store our bags there with no charge AND made us to go breakfast packs to take with us on the ferry since we were departing so early. They took so much time to show us where we should go and visit.
title: Amazing service and lovely hotel

review: Absolutely loved this hotel. Room was lovely. Breakfast served on the balcony outside. Even made my milkshake mad boyfriend a milkshake for breakfast every morning. Felt really safe around the area and walked to all the main attractions. Day trip to one of the islands a must!
title: A real gem!

review: We stayed here with friends for 4 nights. The rooms were clean, the staff extremely friendly and the breakfast buffet just amazing. A 15 minute walk and you're right at the bottom of the Acropolis. There are a lot of restaurants nearby and the nightlife center is very close as well. We would recommend it!
title: Great hotel

review: Pallas Athena Grecotel Boutique Hotel makes our stay in Greece wonderful. The place is so accommodating, the rooms are decorated beautifully. The price is reasonable and worth it. The breakfast served was delicious. Hotel staff are hospitable and caring, they can be easily asked for favors and make way to give it to us. Recommended!
title: Beautiful and spacious rooms

review: This hotel was a great surprise, as it was a great value as well as a modern quirky fun hotel in the middle of the city. The hotel was centrally located to walk to the squares and sites. Neighborhood was a bit sketchy at night and would recommend being in a group in the evening, however we had no trouble and enjoyed our stay. Our room was huge with a large terrace and nicely appointed bathroom amenities. The restaurant was lovely and the friendly waiter even taught us some Greek to get us through our visit. All in all the hotel and staff were pleasant and I would recommend this hotel.
title: Great Modern Hotel

review: Lovely hotel in central Athens with really friendly, helpful staff. The breakfast is great but we didn't eat in the restaurant for lunch or dinner. The rooms and bathrooms are big, and most have a balcony (I think). Although if you're looking for a view of the acropolis you'll need to request it - our room was out the back of the hotel and looked onto an old disused building! Didn't bother us, but might some people I guess. There's a stop for the sightseeing bus tour in the square right opposite the hotel, and it's a 10min walk Monastiraki station (where you'll find a good little flea market), and only another 5mins to Plaka from there (lots of lovely cafes and restaurants).There's no pool and the gym is tiny, but overall pretty good value for money and a really handy location.
title: Nice boutique hotel, great location

review: The rooms were a bit small, but were well taken care of and clean. The breakfast was really good, and the dining area had a nice outdoor terrace which we enjoyed eating on. The location was excellent as well it was within easy walking distance to the popular sites. Would definitely return if we were are in town.
title: Nice hotel

review: We stayed 4 nights in this wonderful hotel and were able to walk everywhere in central Athens. Our room looked out at the Acropolis, which is especially stunning at night. The roof-top pool and cafe / bar had an even better view and offered nice lunch and snacks.
title: Perfect Plaka Location

review: I had visited this hotel at the past for different reasons,but now realize that is very nice also for business meetings and workshops! My team meeting was there and was very successful. The service was great the rooms nice. Not hesitate to use this hotel for this perpoze
title: Business friendly also!!

review: I booked a jr. suite and the room was very spacious. We had a small balcony with a view of the Acropolis which was a bonus. Check-in staff: excellent. Concierge: ditto. The room was immaculate and well furnished also. The included breakfast buffet was out of this world with so many choices! I'd never been to Athens before and only had a few days so I wanted a hotel in a good location and this fit the bill. 8-10 min walk to the Acropolis, the New Acropolis Museum, a metro station, good restaurants and shopping. Around 8:00 pm our first night there was a knock on our door. Room service...which we had not ordered. A nice bottle of (Greek) red wine, two glasses, 2 plates and 4 or 5 pieces of fresh fruit. Compliments of the hotel. Nice!!
title: Fabulous Hotel

review: We stayed here two nights at the end of a cruise. It was a wonderful spot to complete out trip. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. The reception desk was more than helpful in recommended restaurants and helping us with transfers.
title: Very nice

review: The hotel is very centrally placed in Athens and in a great location. It also has a rooftop pool (very small) which is fabulous after a hot day sight seeing. The pool however can get very busy and there are very few loungers. The rooms are very small and the AC is poor. We had dinner one night on the rooftop terrace, food was OK but the view of the Acropolis is spectacular. Breakfast is good with a wide choice and something for everyone. This hotel is very expensive for what it is and we left feeling a little short changed. It is definitely the location you pay for.
title: Great view from the rooftop but overall an average hotel

review: A fantastic hotel, in the heart of Athens. So close to the Plaka and shopping as well to the museum and the Parthenon. I would highly recommend staying there! The rooms, food and service were all amazing. Must do dinner at the roof top restaurant one night while you are there.
title: Great location with amazing views!

review: Great central location for exploring, minutes from the Acropolis and loads of local dining options.Clean well served rooms, and the optional Acropolis view is well worth paying the extra for. The roof top restaurant is a great place to spend an evening, watching the city and Acropolis light up at night. Very helpful and attentive staff. Complimentary fruit and wine in room a nice surprise. The Kids loved making their own waffles at breakfast - a hotel first! Petite and bijou rooftop pool - very popular. A great place to immerse yourself in the wonders of Athens!
title: Great location to explore from

review: The hotel itself is older but very clean and the service can not be beat. In the heart of the action and a short walk to the Acropolis, you can easily and safely roam the streets of Plaka. Great shops and restaurants are to be found. The hotel pool and bar on the rooftop offer a great view of the Acropolis. It's truly amazing at night! We don't regret our choice.
title: Extremely well situated!

review: We loved this hotel and location. In Plaka, close to Acropolis and other historical monuments. We walked everywhere. Rooms were very nice, clean with good airconditioning. Roof top pool with view of Acropolis and nice little bar. Breakfast was excellent with lot of choices. Staff very pleasant and happy to help. Would stay again.
title: Lovely hotel in great location

review: Reception, bar, dining & concierge staff have an air of sufferance. They occasionally make an half-hearted attempt to conceal their arrogance and rudeness towards guests. Unfortunately it's a very weak effort.Good location.Many rooms (including all triple) have poor views and are, consequently, rather dark. Triple rooms are very cramped. Rooms are getting that tired appearance.Good views from rooftop, but the cramped pool area is crowded.
title: Good Location Poor Service

review: The hotel is centrally located a relatively short walk from the airport bus at Syntagma and from the restaurant area in the Plaka. Wifi is good, rooms are spacious and beds comfortable. There are a variety of offerings for breakfast which can be taken inside or at the outside garden. The rooftop restaurant and pool one level lower also provide views of the Acropolis. There is no shade above the sun lounges around the pool though, which is a bit strange.The hotel and its facilities are what one would expect for a hotel of this type Our room had limited views of the Acropolis.
title: Centrally located

review: The hotel is at a central location, the rooms are high quality and the service is great. Not expensive for a 5 stars hotel, good value for money. Breakfast is good and pretty basic. The hotel is located in a safe area, but you do have to walk a little if you wish to get to the bars area.
title: Very good hotel. Nice location.

review: For the price (and the pictures) I expected more. The overall feel of the hotel is that it lacks the gloss of its pictures. It is average - the bathroom was in need of maintenance (glass on the bath to stop the splash was falling off) and most disappointing of all was the air conditioning or lack thereof. After a full hot day of sight seeing, sadly the air conditioner on the room provided little to no relief. The final straw for me was the toilet making weird running noises all night, so I asked to be moved. The hotel obliged the next night, and I was moved to a bigger room - and the air conditioner worked a little better however, when turned on you could smell very strongly cigarette smoke. You can't beat its location, I agree with other reviews but to be frank I could not wait to leave.
title: Average

review: We loved the Electra Palace! Location was fantastic, right in walking distance of the plaka district and easy to get to all the sites. The breakfast was huge and high quality. Lobby was spacious and had two computers we used to book our ferry tickets and some excursions. Room and bathroom were a little small but clean, and in general could use some updates. All in all I would stay again but a little pricey for what its worth.
title: 2 Days in Athens

review: The hotel is located in the back streets of Athens within easy walking distance to Syntagma Square, Monastiraki flea markets and underground metro trains.The hotel is rated is 5 stars and the amenities and service from the staff is 5 stars.The view at night from the pool deck and cocktail bar of the Acropolis at night is breathtaking.The rooms are presented very well and with all the accessories. The only minor blemish they lacked spare power points in the room.In the past we have stayed at other hotels nearby, now that we have the Electra Palace we would certainly return.
title: Luxury and Great View of Acropolis

review: We travel to Greece often but this was our first stay at Electra Palace. This old-world style hotel has an excellent location in the heart of The Plaka, very close to The Acropolis and most tourist sites. Our room was beautiful, better than ones we've stayed in at The Grande Bretagne for about half the price. It even had a large terrace with a stunning view of the city and The Acropolis. BUT.... what happened to the air conditioning?! We were sweating downstairs in the opulent lobby, and couldn't wait to get to the room until we realized (sadly) that the air conditioning there was no better. In fact, we were up most of the night because it was so darn hot. Would we go to Electra Palace again? Only in the fall and winter unless we knew for sure that the air conditioning problems in the hotel had been addressed.
title: Lovely hotel with poor air conditioning

review: Small room, overlooking neighboring roofs and air-conditioning units. I guess there are good rooms, but I didn't get one. Small bathroom with a very small shower. The weather was very hot, and the AC was barely adequate. This is a five star hotel? Really? The breakfast (included) was excellent. Dinner (at the roof terrace) was mediocre -- but the view of the Acropolis is truly spectacular.
title: Disappointing

review: What a lovely place!!! My girlfriends and I met here to start our Greek vacation - it is such a great value. The pool is DIVINE - it overlooks the Plaka and you can see the beautiful ruins! It is by far the nicest hotel in the Plaka - I would stay here again and again! The staff was amazing and very helpful during our stay. Ask for restaurant recommendations or the best way to get places. They will help you!
title: GORGEOUS

review: We stayed here 3 nights total before and after a cruise. The staff was friendly and helpful and the room quite comfortable. If you don't have a view of the acropolis from your room, you may go to the 4th floor swimming pool, a 5th floor bar and restaurant, or the 8th floor roof. Lots of restaurants and shops nearby.
title: Central location with view of the Acropolis

review: We stayed here for just 2 nights at the tail end of our holiday. The hotel is in a superb location within easy walking distance of most of the major sites, and in the lovely Plaka district. Fantastic view of the Acropolis from the rooftop pool. It's a bit more luxurious than we're used to, but we chose it mainly for the location and with the idea of treating ourselves before going home.The building is very nice and quite understated, with a lovely garden area for breakfast (complete with marauding turtle doves - an interesting change from the usual pigeons). Our 4th floor room was fine, with a great view from the balcony and west-facing for the sunset. Breakfast was very good, with something for everyone, Service was universally excellent and the staff were very friendly and extremely helpful.When we arrived our fridge wasn't working, but was replaced first thing the next day. I was surprised that the bed wasn't more comfortable - far too soft for my liking and probably could do with replacing. The bathroom was very nice though the decor a bit over the top.All in all a fine choice for a short stay, and in the nicest part of the city. I think it's quite expensive for what it is, but one's probably paying for the location?
title: Super....but overpriced

review: Very pleased with the location and rooms at this property! Did not spend too much time in the hotel room, as we spent most of our trip walking around and exploring the area. However, we were pleasantly surprised with the hotel's proximity to many attractions. Located within the Plaka, you are close to a variety of markets, shops, and restaurants. Only 10 -15 minutes walking distance from the Acropolis Museum, Acropolis, and Temple of Olympian Zeus.
title: Clean & Comfortable

review: we have used the brand before, this is a first class hotel, location is city centre, we had a panoramic view from our room of the acropolis, roof pool was a great surprise, sitting by the pool with a drink looking at the view fantastic, could have stayed there all day, worth every penny
title: Last night of holiday

review: We had a fabulous time at Electra Palace in Athens. It is a reasonably priced, old-world glamour style hotel in Plaka. We stayed here for two nights at the beginning of our trip and on our last night in Greece. The service was outstanding! Rooms were clean and the breakfast was excellent. We also enjoyed sitting on the rooftop bar in the evenings with a beautiful view of the acropolis. The friendly staff really went above and beyond to make our stay extra special. The first night we received a bottle of wine and a plate of fruit! During the last night of our vacation the hotel upgraded us to the presidential suite. We felt incredibly lucky and could not have thought of a better way to relax in style before the long journey home! The presidential suite was gorgeous- it had two plush rooms, a balcony with a view of the acropolis and a private pool. My favorite part of the presidential suite was the steam room Hammam. What a luxurious way to spend our last night in Athens! We already miss it so much and will definitely stay here again. As for room choices I would recommend staying in an upper level room away from the street noise. This is a great hotel for both couples and families.
title: Old world glam hotel in a great location

review: This is a hotel that really worths your money. Though is a bit "heavy" in style and furniture according to our taste we really did enjoy it. Located in the heart of the city, we were expecting it noisy but on the contrary we experienced a tranquil sleep and stay. Rooms on the upper floors provide the best view indeed.
title: Very good location and service

review: smallish room but we upgraded to a suite for an extra charge as there were 3 of us. the service here is old fashioned hospitality very professional. the breakfast is incredible and included. loved the pool and spa, very relaxing. a short walk to the main sites of everything
title: excellent location and servcie

review: Pros:Old world charm and decorCourteous and professional staff (not friendly)We were upgraded to a suiteLovely breakfastNice toiletriesGood and free wi fiWell located close to PlakaAwesome views of Acropolis from swimming pool especially at night.Cons:Pricey in high seasonEntrance from a very narrow lane belying the grandeur of the hotelBreakfast area becomes very crowdedStaff could have been more friendly. After getting super friendly staff at our hotels in Mykonos, Santorini, Delphi and Kalambaka we were a trifle disappointed. We had a late night flight and I had a feeling they could have given us a late check out but didn't causing inconvenience to us as days were really hot to spend out in the open. The bell hops always pointedly ask if you need assistance with the luggage implying indirectly in advance that a tip is in order. One obviously does tip but to be implied in such a blatant manner in this quality of hotel was annoying.Our rooms though nice and large had no views.
title: Lovely heritage hotel

review: We stayed one night in this charming Hotel in an excellent location in Athens. Close walking distance to shops and sights. The rooms are old fashioned but very comfortable and it was lovely to have the outdoor pool and bar area with magnificent views of the Acropolis. We ate at the rooftop restaurant and the food was wonderful. One of the best steak tartare ever and delicious moussaka in a clay pot. Staff throughout Hotel and restaurant very professional and helpful.For those that like a hair salon there is an excellent one across the road and very reasonable.
title: Charming Hotel

review: We have stayed here close to 50 times and this hotel and the wonderful staff keep surprising us! Every time we stay here we are greeted by the amazing people who work here. The hotel have everything you need; pool overlooking Acropolis, fantastic restaurant, gym, spa, beautiful atmosphere and again we have to mention the staff. We love Athens but this place makes the city even more amazing. This has become our second home and we never want to stay in another hotel in Athens. Book this hotel and you are guaranteed an amazing trip!!
title: Heaven in Athens!

review: We stayed for 2 nights with my family. Loved the view if the Acropolis from the restaurant at night.The roons were comfortable and clean. The staff was helpful. Breakfast was fantastic.The location was good. it waa walking distance to the Museum n Acropolis.
title: Great location

review: The hotel is within walking distance to a lot of the main attractions in Athens. The pool is sweet, but if you're going to swim and relax, do this in the morning. The afternoon is chaotic with families and children.This hotel is disappointing for a 5 star hotel. The attitude of the staff is without enthusiasm and lack of interest for their guests. The breakfast was disappointing and on both mornings we were there, a lot of the buffet plates were empty. You had to ask for these to be refilled.
title: The staff let this hotel down

review: Located in Plaka, this hotel is steps away from good shopping, museums, Syntagma Square and metro. It is convenient for families, couples and tour groups. It has a nice pool, although there are only a few lounge chairs and people fight for one throughout the day. Breakfast is included (or it was for our booking) and is an exceptional buffet with many choices, including make-your-own waffles.
title: Elegant hotel in a central location

review: This is a very nice hotel in a great location in Athens with very friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are quiet, the bathrooms are perfect size, the breakfast was excellent, the pool bar has a fantastic view of the Acropolis.
title: Great Location

review: I was very impressed with the staff and facilities of this hotel. The room is extremely comfortable and luxurious and the staff is extremely attentive and responsive. Breakfast and room service are delicious.
title: Impressive

review: We stayed two nights at the Electra Palace. The view from the back terrace and the pool is unbeatable. We didn't want to leave the hotel because of the spectacular view and the super friendly staff. The wonderful streets of Plaka are a block away, with lots of restaurants and shops. We were able to walk to everything we needed. Even though there were tons of restaurants, we dined at the hotel because of the sunset/night view of the Acropolis. Food was amazing. We would definitely stay here again. Loved it!
title: Perfect Location!

review: Stayed at this hotel with my family, booked 2 rooms. Found human faeces on the bathroom floor in one of the rooms. Still waiting on GM of hotel to call me back. Duty manager changed the room, which for me should have been automatic and a free dinner. Which is very ordinary given price I paid for 2 rooms. I'm sure they will reply now. Didn't even refund the one room. One would assume they would. Way too late. Not what you expect for a 5 star hotel, considering so many other 5 star hotels. Do not book here. How unhygienic and how badly to handle my complaint. Human faeces, very disgusting!!! I rarely post reviews, however, always read them I hope this helps others. Please check out other 5 star hotels in Athens. I would hate for another family to have their last day on their holiday be spoiled like us.
title: Avoid, Avoid.....

review: We stayed at the Electra Palace in June, 2017. Beautiful property. The man at the front desk went out of his way to make our stay the best possible, with a double upgrade on our room. The rooftop restaurant has a spectacular view of the Acropolis. However, the food was pretty third rate and over priced. Hence the 4 out of 5 review.
title: Lovely hotel, great front desk people

review: Great hotel in Plaka district. We would have stayed here the whole trip but unfortunately they were booked up so make your reservation early for summer travel. We book end of May for July trip and some dates were already full. The hotel is clean, great location close to shopping and acropolis. The staff was very helpful. The breakfast was great as was the roof top pool, bar and restaurant.
title: Beautiful views

review: Really high quality hotel, lovely staff.The pool on the roof with the view of the Acropolis was worth the price alone. Also the balcony with the view of the Acropolis was definitely worth the upgrade.Ideally situated for the major attractions, and really near the tourist area, shops, and restaurants. Don't hire a car and drive here though - the streets are a nightmare (we saw many cars damaged on the side of the streets). Taxis are plentiful and relatively inexpensive.Breakfast was well worth the cost, very extensive range, good quality and lovely courtyard to eat in (with separate smoking area too). Dinner was nice for the view, but we found the menu bit exotic, or foodie, for our tastes, and not so much Greek. However, if your tastes run that way, you might really enjoy the food here. Alternatively, there are some lovely traditional Greek restaurants within a few minutes walk.Our room was quite large (relatively) for Europe, with nice decor, and a comfortable bed. Very clean as well.In addition, we left a dress and a jacket in the wardrobe, and once we contacted them, it was shipped back to us as a very reasonable cost. So we highly recommend their staff and customer services.
title: Fantastic location, view, and pool

review: We stayed with our family and they made sure we had rooms next to one another with a shared hallway. Perfect when traveling with younger children . The staff was very friendly and helpful. You have to visit the pool area as it gives you an amazing view of the acropolis and you need it to cool down if you are there in the summer months. Breakfast was a nice spread.
title: Perfect place for a city bisit

review: The hotel is in a perfect location for downtown and seeing the city and all it has to offer. The staff was friendly and prompt, they have to deal with early arrivals and enormous request, which they do with all the grace and leave you feeling special.Thank you to the front office team who really made our day a very special part of our holiday in Greece!
title: One amazing night in Athens

review: Location:The hotel is located in the city center next to the Plaka=old town of the city.Parking in front of the hotel is difficult because of the small narrow street.Check in:Was done efficient, fast and friendly.Lobby: Looking elegant. Ambiance of hotel and room:Old fashioned.Room 423, presidential suite:Located near the elevator.The room had an awful or terrible strong mouldy sewage smell.The reason was found in the Haman which is a separate room in the bathroom.It comes out of the floor from waste water.I guess that the cleaning lady did know it because on arrival two windows were open.In one of these two rooms a bin box was missed.There was not even one free bottle of mineral water in the room.The bathroom has a very small washbasin with very small cupboard or desk.There are no towel holders.One toilet paper holder was broken.Outside on the balcony there are some sunbeds and a rooftop which cannot protect you when it is raining. It is more a design element. The outside pool which belongs to this room was covered with leaves from trees.The matress for my individual taste was too weak(soft?) and uncomfortable.The amenities are of cheap quality.TV:Each room has a small TV with small Screen.The number of channels is poor and not each channel was working correct.The room was not good soundproofed.When somebody was cleaning the room next floor or moving suitcases you get disturbed because of the noise.Design:The room is looking old fashionedbut in general of good taste or former time well designed.Internet ( standard version ) is for free but working slowly.Breakfast:Badly organized, low quality and low choice.Theoretically somebody should control you at a desk to check your room number.But this has only happened from time to time.The choice was poor or very simple. Whether bread nor cake or cold cuts (very limited choice) was refilled fast enough.The staff is not caring about new guests.There is enough staff but no head waiter who has a real concept and is organizing it in a good way.After waiting 5 minutes for a waiter I stood up to ask for coffee.Only two different sorts of marmelade were offered.The Katiki (greek cheese) was of awful taste.You can sit inside or outside.Reception staff:Do not ask two times for the not working internet access code:We got the answer: I already have informed you before!Check-Out:There was no question of beeing satisfied or explaining the bill.Do not forget that taxes will be added to your room rate.My personal individual rating:Location:4 pointsService: 2 pointsRoom: 2 pointsValue for money: 2 pointsBreakfast: 2 points
title: Mouldy sewage smell in the room, poor breakfast

review: our second stay at the Elektra Palace Athens was as good as our first.The staff amazing, breakfast in the courtyard is to die for and the rooms beautiful and clean.The location of the hotel is a skip and a jump for the shopping mall and everything else you want to do or see.
title: Elektra Palace Athens

review: Stayed 2 nights in August. The air conditioning is almost non existent! When we phonedThe front desk to complain, we were told " Sir, it is very hot outside, and that is why the air conditioning does not work well "! The rooms are very small, with ugly decor. The room was very noisy. You can actually hear people in the next room, and especially in the hallway. On the plus side, the shower was good, and the staff was nice. Small rooftop pool, with very few chairs.We travel quite often, and stay in upscale properties, and, this hotel is not worth the high price that they charge! Do yourself a favour, and avoid this hotel.
title: Highly Overated

review: We had a rough beginning at this hotel due to us arriving late however they more than made up for it by upgrading us to a suite overlooking The Acropolis.The hotel is located right next to the Plaka in a a great location.The staff at he hotel go out of their way to make sure you have a wonderful stay.The hotel is in excellent condition has has a fantastic rooftop pool and bar area with outstanding service.I highly recommend this gem in Athens.
title: Wonderful Stay

review: Visited with family for a 5 night trip to Athens and the hotel was really good. Location was brilliant with 5 minute walk to both the main ermou street shopping area and syntagma square, 1 min walk to adrianou street and 10 mins to parthenon entrance. Rooms were spacious and elegant. Breakfast was great with huge variety (definitely get the waffles). I would recommend this for a great stay in Athens.
title: Fantastic

review: - Great Location- Huge, fancy lobby- Great selection for breakfast (hot food options only warm though)- Nice sized room- but A/C in room was horrible. The mini fridge was in the middle of the room and pumped out heat, especially towards the bed. Oddly the items inside the fridge were barely cool. We had to have front desk send someone up to unplug the fridge. Didn't help the A/C though as had to run it 24 hours a day and it never got the room cold enough. Had to use two fans to be able to sleep. (Granted it was very hot in August but the other three hotels we stayed at in Greece had great A/C)- Rooftop restaurant has a great view of the Acropolis but not really of the Parthenon. Food was average and over priced. Great views were blocked by overgrown bushes. Everyone had to get up from their seats and move to find a totally unobstructed view to take their pics.- Pool was nice and had a great view for half of it, the other half blocked by overgrown shrubs - The bathroom in the room has a see-through door (not sure who wants that)- Staff was polite and professional- Overall, a classic hotel that is resting on its laurels and needs some fresh eyes to see it like the customer sees it. If you don't need great A/C and want to be in the middle of the tourist district you will like this hotel.
title: A/C is horrible

review: This hotel is situated in the heart of Athens, right next to the acropolis and museum. We spent 2 nights there, the breakfast was had a surprisingly large selection for one that had no extra charge. Staff were friendly and the scenery around there was fantastic. Definitely recommend for a future stay.
title: Great location / breakfast

review: We stayed here on the recommendation of a friend and had a fabulous experience. The location can't be beaten, and the rooms are spacious with a fantastic view of the Acropolis. The rooftop bar also should not be missed - amazing views, expertly mixed cocktails and delicious snacks. Highly recommended. We will be back!
title: A wonderful hotel in the perfect location

review: The staff at Herodion Hotel was terrific, especially helping out a jet-lagged couple after our wedding 24 hours earlier. We had a delicious dinner at the hotel's rooftop restaurant, saw the sun rise over the Acropolis the next morning. It was a great start to our honeymoon.The only downside was the size of the room -- and elevator -- was a bit small. It didn't matter too much since we weren't in the room very often.
title: Excellent staff, great dinner

review: Really lovely people at Reception, which straight away gives you a warm feeling. the hotel is quite beautiful, with a stone staircase and two upper floors open to the sky, one a restaurant and the other a spa and treatment area with a small, nicely designed garden. the hotel caters for large American tour groups, which makes the breakfast buffet a bit difficult to navigate, but once you know how to navigate it without bumping into other tables then there is everything you could want to eat. The roof restaurant and bar, however, have a rather pretentious modern variation of authentic Greek food, and you could do better by eating in nearby Makrigianni.
title: Nice safe area

review: This hotel was a perfect location right next to the acropolis. The accommodations were very nice but the absolute best part was having dinner on the roof with the best view of the acropolis and amazing food! It was such a nice surprise. I wouldn't have upgraded to a room with a view had I known I could enjoy that. I would highly recommend staying here
title: Beautiful roof top restaurant

review: Soaking in a jacuzzi with a full view of the Acropolis - unbeatable ! Blissfully quiet, next to the pedestrian alley of the Acropolis area - no car noise. Great breakfast with home baked bread and cakes ...
title: Amazing location

review: When we first visited Athens three years ago, we relied on a cruise ship company for a hotel recommendation. It was a nice place but not within walking distance of anything (a rare miss for the cruise ship line).Based on that experience we did our research for this trip and selected the Herodion . It was perfect. Within a block of the Acropolis museum and the restaurant row near by, it was easily within walking of the Acropolis, Hadrian's Arch, the plaka, even Monastriaki (if you push it a little). Walking the other way there were wonderful shops, some featuring hand-crafted art objects.So the location us perfect.The hotel, is very clean with a very relaxed feel and a courteous staff to help with everything. We relied on them for directions, suggestions and just general things. The rooms are nicely decorated and well maintained. The hotel also features breakfast, including European style. My wife's day cannot start without breakfast and coffee. She was completely satisfied with the Herodian's offerings. Especially the coffee!!The hotel also has a rooftop bar and restaurant. We visited for the view of the Acropolis but we did not dine there as we had other plans. The restaurant was packed though.I regret I did not take pictures (my mental lapse). But I know the pictures on the hotel's website well depicts the Herodian.It's a great place. If there is a third Athens trip in our future we will stay here
title: Great Hotel, Perfect Location

review: Located near the ancient monuments, the outstanding feature of this hotel is the staff. Constandina made our stay special with her recommendations on how to get around the city. With her help, we saw more than we would have thought possible.
title: Nice

review: Very nce hotel wit an excellent location. You are able to go everywhere in the city center on foot. Very good view from some rooms and the rooftop to Akropolis!Charming atmosphere, nice staff - a hotel where you really feel comfortable!
title: Long nice weekend in Athens to visit Documenta exhibitions.

review: Lovely hotel with amazing views of the Acropolis from some rooms and especially from the roof garden, which all guests can access for a meal or just a drink. Very close to the Acropolis museum which is well worth a visit. Very friendly staff, nice breakfast. Clean and tidy, good air conditioning. We stayed twice and were upgraded once to an Acropolis view room which was very special.
title: Fantastic location

review: Just loved the position of this hotel, so close to The Acropolis and MuseumsThe service was fantastic and the Hotel had a great feel about itBreakfast was good, but a very small area and got very squeezy The rooftop restaurant and bar looked up to the Acropolis which looked great of a night under lights. There was also a sundeck and 2 large spa that had great viewsWe wouldn't hesitate to come back to this hotel
title: Fabulous Location

review: Loved the location, quick easy check in and bell service to help with luggage. The rooftop restaurant lounge is over the top. Very special. The breakfast is free but not very well staffed or organized. They only have one automatic expresso maker for the entire hotel breakfast so coffee is hard to get and refill. Food variety is good as is quality. Not crazy about my single room, very dark bathroom really small. Best location in Athens so worth the stay, would upgrade the room.
title: Great rooftop view of the Parthenon

review: This is a quiet nice hotel right in the center of everything. It is 5 minutes away from the museum of Acropolis and 15min away from the Acropolis itself. You can walk to the ceter of Athens and there are plenty of things to do all over the area. Nice restaurants in very close distance. The roof restaurant serve very nice drinks but the food is nothing comparing to last years. It has dropped the quality very much bit at least it has amazing views
title: Nice hotel in a perfect area

review: This hotel has a great location next door to the Acropolis Museum and a short walk from the entrance to the Acropolis.Room was small but that is like other European hotels. Great A/C, which is not always found in some hotels.Great rooftop restaurant with the best view of the Acropolis AND the Parthenon. And the nighttime view of the new Acropolis museum is fantastic. Great food at good prices and the staff was perfect. We ate there three times.
title: Great Stay

review: We came to Athens for a long weekend and chose this hotel for 2 main reasons, its central location and its views of the Acropolis. We were not disappointed by either. The hotel is next door to the Acropolis museum on the edge of the Plaka district and has a metro stop 2 minutes away. Every member of staff we encountered during our stay were friendly and helpful and the rooms were very nice. The air conditioning worked perfectly which is not always the case when you stay in hotels and is very important in Athens were it is still very warm even during the evening and night.I said we chose this hotel for two reasons which brings me to the star of The Herodion,The Roof Top Bar. A lovely relaxing bar with attentive bar staff and a stunning view of the Acropolis beautifully illuminated at night.
title: Perfect base for visiting Athens

review: The hotel is lovely and our room comfortable. The food was very good also. The view from the roof terrace where we had our dinner were great. We only stayed overnight on our way to one of the islands but it's the second time we have visited the hotel. Would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to family and friends.
title: Lovely hotel with great views

review: This hotel is in the perfect location to Acropolis, Plaka and metro.Rooms are very small, however clean and comfortable. The only reason giving it 4 instead if 5 is the size of the bathrooms. They are tiny, be careful not to bump into the door handles which are sticking out. Very odd decor.Stayed 4 days and enjoyed every minute of it.
title: Great Location, clean hotel

review: Even though the room was really small, it was so conveniently situated that it compensated for the shortcoming. There was not enough room to open the luggage, so there was a lot of logistics to get clothes ready for next day.It helped a lot that the stop for the Hop-On Hop-Off bus route was just a block from the hotel. We had a 2-day pass, then it was really easy to go to all tourist spots. The staff was really nice and very accommodating. We arrived at 10:30AM and they let us do an early check-in instead of making us wait till the afternoon. The rooftop restaurant is awesome. Make dinner reservations for a sunset dinner. It is so worth it!In this trip, we stayed in 4 hotels in Greece, and the Herodion was the only one that had good AC! We totally recommend this hotel and would stay there again in a heart beat.
title: Excellent Location

review: Herodion is in a great location, right below the Acropolis, the Acropolis museum and the plaka. It has a great view of the Acropolis from some of the hotel rooms as well as the roof-top restaurant. They have a great breakfast buffet that's included in the hotel price. But what made it great is the cleanliness and the great staff. They really make you feel welcome. We stayed here multiple times between July and August, and definitely will return in the future.
title: Great for couples

review: Restaurant Roof Garden on the Hotel Rooftop: wonderful view of the Parthenon, but I came alone for my trip and I feel like nobody's care about you when you are alone while eating, hostess came to talk to everybody except with me, and my plate was barely prepared, when the others were just looking perfect, see picture...booked in this hotel because it's just in front of the acropolis, just 3 minutes to walk... perfect! Rooms are good and kind staff so the Hotel part is very positive.
title: Good and bad

review: Our family of 4 (kids age 18 and 20) spent 3 nights in Athens. This was our first stay at this hotel but the third time to Athens. We loved the location. Rooms were adequate. We paid up for a superior room with terrace but it was too hot to even use the terrace. Instead we enjoyed the terrace on the 4th floor that had two hot tubs (not that hot which was good) and an incredible view of the Acropolis. We also loved the rooftop restaurant and bar for pre-dinner drinks. It has a great view of the Acropolis as well. We arranged a transfer to and from the airport but the pricing was inconsistent for the same size vehicle (45 Euros there and 55 back). Still this was much better than a taxi. Breakfast at the hotel was pretty standard for Athens--not great but good enough. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.
title: Our best hotel experience in Athens

review: Great location and easy to walk to most tourist locations and restaurants.Great restaurant on roof and breakfast room on ground floor.Only downside which was minor was no ironing facilities in room.
title: Great staff very efficient and friendly

review: We arrived after sailing the Greek Island for a week. Excellent location for the Acropolis, museum, shopping and the old town. All are convenient walking. First to note was the hotel was tastefully decorated and the staff went out of their way for us. I have back issues and tried touring the Acropolis the next day in quite a bit of pain. Mark at the hotel desk found a cane for me to use and was very helpful in suggestions on where to visit and did a double ck on the taxi we were to have on departure to the airport. The lower bar was perfect quiet getaway after a hot day of sightseeing for a drink and or read quietly with a nice view of a garden area in the back. The rooms were SPOTLESS! Very important to a retired flight attendant. Loved the deep tub. Our beds were turned down at night and we were nicely surprised they brought up extra luggage racks for our oversized luggage. I read on a review that someone didn't like the dark hallways. In some of the better hotels they use that as a signal to keep the noise down for people that may be resting. Very effective. The Biltmore uses that technique for the staff. The rooftop restaurant was atmospheric and lovely, the food delicious. My husband at times can be hard to please since he travels for his job, but he was a happy man with every single meal. You must try their take on a Greek salad. I had to have that salad every night! The ladies, Fotini and Antzela were so attentive. There were others to but unfortunately the names escaped my foggy brain. For this I apologize because they were all great. The view of the Parthenon was breathtaking especially since the staff ordered a full moon for our visit :-) If you want to visit the rooftop restaurant on a full moon night, I must encourage you to make reservations since those are high demand evenings. Breakfast foods was many choices and varied. Only one hiccup and even that was made right by the staff impeccably. We were overlooked on our last night of dining and they more than made it right. Most places would apologized and then let it go. No,no,no. They apologized alright but went out of their way to make it EVEN BETTER if that is possible. Thanks for a memorable stay. Hope to see you again
title: Perfect Location, excellent staff and great rooms, clean, clean,clean!!

review: Arrived late in the evening at this hotel and the staff could not have been more helpful to a couple of wary travellers. Room was amazing with a view of the acropolis and the location is within walking distance from all to see and do around Plaka. We headed off to the islands and the team were more than happy to store luggage for us for a week.
title: Fantastic location and friendly helpful staff

review: Our family of 8 stayed in four rooms for a couple days before a sailing trip through the Greek Islands. The hotel is ideally located with breath taking views of the Acropolis and an easy stroll to Old Town. I have been there before on business but had to return with my family because dinner on their roof with the views of the Acropolis can't be overstated. Their food and their Greek Salad were among the best we experienced during our 12 days in Greece. The staff is unusually attentive. As an example, my youngest son arrived separately from the airport. As he entered the hotel, one of the staff casually asked how much he paid for his taxi. The staff member said he was overcharged and ran out to the driver and made the driver refund my son the overage! Where else have you ever heard of a hotel staff being so proactive!! There are lots of other examples of how helpful the staff was as well. I would stay there again without question or hesitation!
title: Perfect Location, Even Better Staff!

review: Nice rooms, good service, nice breakfast. Thoroughly enjoyed the terrace/jacuzzi with a view on the Acropolis. No need to go to the hotel's restaurant: there are many delicious places within a 500m radius.
title: Amazing hotel

review: I booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews. We wanted a hotel close to the Acropolis, restaurants and The Plaka area. The Herodion is in the perfect location - within walking distance of all the areas we wanted. We were traveling with our 18 and 20 year old children and requested rooms close to them and we were put in adjoining rooms which was perfect. When we arrived at about 11 am after flying all night they were able to get us into our rooms even though we were hours away from check-in time. Very appreciated as we needed to freshen up. The bathrooms are very nice for European standards with a tub/shower combo. Plenty of hot water and they even had wash clothes which most European hotels do not! The beds are comfy and the free breakfast buffet was delicious and offered plenty of variety. The housekeeping staff is awesome! I highly recommend!
title: Great location!

review: Very convenient and clean with great location. Rooms are nice, but small. Upper floors are very noisy since the rooftop Point A bar opened. If they turned the volume down a bit, problem would be solved. Food in Atrium Greek bistro and elsewhere in hotel is excellent.
title: Great location, upper floors noisy

review: Avoid the breakfast box (much too simple and plain--not worth the money!), and spend a little extra to get an acropolis view room. They're small, but well appointed and the view up the hill is lovely in the morning. My boyfriend and I stayed in a twin room with a view and it was great for our needs. It was soundproofed, which was sooo nice!! We slept deeply and didn't hear any other guests the whole time. Taking in the view with a cocktail on the rooftop at the end of the day was perfect.Excellent service and friendly reception. All over a great experience: 9/10.
title: Very nice

review: The hotel is placed at the New Acropolis Museum under the acropolis itseslf. There is really nice view from the top the hotel, where a restaurant as well as the section with two jaccuzi are placed. So the position is the right one if you want to see the historical centre of athens. It is around 40 minutes from the airport by the taxi (38€). The hop-on hop-off buses stop 150m from the hotel and it is the best way how to see all the main see attractions.First the positives:+ supperb positioned+ nice breakfast+ nice personalSecond the neutrals:- the room was not very spacy. Our room was with the balcony over the street oposit the Acropolis, it was quite noisy when we opened the door, but after closing them it damped it well. I cannot sey the walls were thin, but we could hear voices from the other rooms.- we slept good but the weather was actually a bit rainy and there was no need to run the air-condition, which was not the kind of central air-condition system.We had not negative experience in this hotel.I will recommend the hotel to my friends for sure.
title: Very good choice

review: My single room was so, so small (and I live in Manhattan!) and dated, with windows looking into a air shaft. Very depressing and not worth the $170/night I paid. I stayed at a charming new place called Palladian Home my first two nights before my island trip for half the price but double the space and with views. Stayed at Herodion the last night because it was so highly recommended. I will say, It is a very well run hotel in a good location and with a nice rooftop restaurant. And maybe the other rooms are OK.
title: Tiny sad room but nice hotel

review: Fiance and I stayed here for two weeks in February. Lovely hotel. Staff was very professional and helpful. Great housekeeping staff. Breakfast is included and was the best way to start our mornings. Close to everything! Would stay there again.
title: Excellent Location!

review: Great service, close to everything, lovely rooms, beautiful views. We spent two nights before our tour then 1 after our tour. After all the dodgy hotels on our tour, a night here with views of the Acropolis from our room was just what we needed.
title: Fantastic place to stay

review: Booked a museum package Acropolis view room on the 5th floor. Not just a great view of the Parthenon from the window, but waking up at night you see the Parthenon from your bed! Just down the block from the Acropolis Museum. Great creative cocktails in the rooftop bar, and you can get excellent small plates in the bar from the adjoining restaurant. Good varied breakfast in the mornings on the ground floor.
title: The Parthenon is your nightlight

review: Very good location for the visits to old Athens and the plaka. Very friendly and helpfull personal. The breakfast is very nice. The restaurant on the top offers good food, and you have a nice view on the acropolis. It's a pity, there is no pool.
title: UItstekend hotel op een ideale locatie

review: This small hotel is very close to the Acropolis Museum and the Acropolis itself. It's a short walk to the metro. We had a great room on the 4th floor with a large balcony. The beds are comfortable, the bathrooms a good size, and the maid service excellent.There's a great restaurant on the roof with spectacular views of the Acropolis! Be sure to make a reservation because it's usually very busy. The breakfast buffet is good.
title: Great hotel in excellent location

review: Great location around the corner from Acropolis, Acropolis metro and Plaka area. Everything was on the doorstep: tour buses, souvenir shops, museum, cafes, bars, and tons of restaurants to choose from. Service was excellent, staff friendly and helpful. Fabulous rooftop bar and restaurant with view of Parthenon. Spa and open air jacuzzis on 4th floor- great for chilling after a long hot day's sight seeing! Rooms were air conditioned, clean and functional with tea/ coffee facilities and a safe. Breakfast was a self service buffet with a generous selection to choose from and staff happy to accommodate any additional needs. There was also a lovely bar and lounge area with atrium on ground floor but we didn't use it as we went to the roof top bar instead as the evenings were so lovely. Would recommend!
title: Great central location

review: The hotel is beautiful, clean, and in an excellent location. The rooms were comfortable and a great place to stay after a long international flight. The rooftop restaurant and view of the acropolis were fantastic as well.
title: Perfect location

review: We recently stayed at the Athens Gate for 6 nights and were very pleased with this Hotel. It was clean, welcoming and the staff at the front desk very pleasant. The views you get are spectacular. The included breakfast offered each more was fantastic and never mind the incredible view of the Acropolis on top of it. I would definitely book her again returning to Athens. Crystal & Jamie Looney
title: Highly Pleased

review: We stayed in Athens for 2 nights at the Athens Hotel. The hotel was nice and clean with decent front desk service. There was nothing exceptional about the hotel but also not much to complain about.Would recommend as a decent but not inspiring hotel option.
title: Decent Hotel with Good Service

review: Comfortable room, with comfy bed and helpful and friendly staff. All spoke English. With views to die for of the Acropolis on one side and the temple of Zeus on the other side while enjoying your breakfast in the Rooftop Restaurant.
title: Super view

review: Rooms are great but the airconditioning never worked properly. The restaurant views are superb and the reception staff were exceptional and extremely helpful. We had dinner one night the food was not great but the fried feta starter was superb.
title: Great location

review: People may choose the Athen's Gate hotel because of the wonderful views, but the location and the service is why I would choose to stay again. The view from our room and from the roof top restaurant where you eat your complimentary breakfast is stunning. You can view the acropolis from one side and the temple of Zeus from the opposite side. We walked to several of our tours and every evening for dinner because the hotel was centrally located. If we needed to go to Piraeus port the hotel staff secured a taxi for us. Every staff member we had contact with was courteous, professional and helpful.
title: Acropolis Views

review: We spent 3 nights here and were sad to leave. The staff at reception gave us a very warm welcome on arrival, which we appreciated. When we got to the room, we loved it but found it warm --combination of a brutal heat wave and A/C being off when the room isn't occupied. When we left for dinner a little while later, we mentioned it to the staff (since we knew it wouldn't cool down while we were gone), and they went ahead and cooled it so that it felt pretty good by the time we got back. We slept great on the beds there, enjoyed sampling all the delicious breakfast items while looking out at the Parthenon, and got addicted to nightcaps at the rooftap bar with that glorious view. You can walk to everything from the Athens Gate --Plaka (5 minutes), Syntagma Sq (10 -15 minutes), Acropolis Museum (5-10 min) -- so the location is perfect. And we'll not forget the kind staff, who went the extra mile not only by packing us a breakfast for our early morning flight but also mailing to us in the US an item we accidentally left behind. An all-around wonderful stay.
title: Unbeatable location and Acropolis views, lovely staff -- I'll stay here again

review: Very close and handy to main ancient sites, with friendly and helpful staff. Great view of Acropolis from 6th floor window. Good breakfast. Traffic busy outside front of hotel, but not a sound from our room, facing the other way.
title: Great position

review: We have stayed at Athens Gate several times and always love it. The rooms are comfortable and clean, with great bedding (the best pillows!) and their customer service is top notch! On this past trip, we have several one-night stays as we popped in and out of Athens while traveling around Greece. For each stay they had our room keys ready for us on arrival (even though they didn't know exactly when we'd arrive) and warmly welcomed us back. They're great at helping with transport arrangements too. The breakfast cannot be beat and it's offered in a dining room with a spectacular view of the Acropolis. Right next to Plaka and short walk to Acropolis so it is a great location for everyone you'll want to do in Athens. The only downsides are: tiny elevators and limited air conditioning in the central hotel areas (though every other small hotel we stayed at were the same). Also, you do get some street noise in the rooms that face the main road. But those are minor problems and are countered by an overall excellent experience.
title: Nice hotel, great customer service!

review: The hotel is centrally located a short walk from Plaka, Monasteraki, the National Gardens, etc right between the Acropolis and the Temple of Zeus. Because these huge monuments are located on either side of the hotel, many rooms have fabulous views. So does the rooftop restaurant and bar, where the complimentary breakfast buffet is served. The Greek yogurt and fruit was excellent! The staff is also very helpful and courteous, and rooms are well-equipped. The only downside to this hotel would be the size of the rooms, which are quite small. My husband and I each had a large checked bag and backpack, and in a standard room there was no way to even set both of our bags down without having to jump over luggage to get to one side of the bed. After our first night we moved to a superior room and it was ever-so-slightly larger but still small. Given that Athens is a major metropolis and the location and quality of the hotel, I don't think the room size is a major problem but just be aware. Overall, a very nice stay and we would return!
title: Well located, clean, and good service.

review: This hotel was nice. The location was excellent, just a short walk to the acropolis, zeus' temple, the museums and plaka. The view from the rooftop was amazing! Breakfast was included and the "sister" hotel was a short walk away, which we appreciated because it allowed us to use the pool there. The staff was great and very helpful. The wifi needs improvement, as does the air conditioning! We had to call down to ask for the staff to help us with that several times. Overall I'd recommend this hotel. (If you have large luggage, you be entertained by the size of the elevator, lol.)
title: Nice location.

review: Need a beautiful drink and some lunch or a snack with the acropolis within touching distance? The athens gate is the place, great drinks delicious food great staff and beautiful bathrooms. A must for a well earned tourist break
title: Fantastic view

review: +: location, the view on the Acropolis, the view on the ancient ruins, the staff is very nice and welcoming, breakfast is nice, the decoration of the rooms is nice. -: rooms are small for the price even though the equipment is nice I think it's a bit overpriced compared to the price in the surroundings. Nice hotel, well located but a bit pricey for the room's size
title: Nice hotel well located

review: This hotel was wonderful. It was very clean with modern amenities and a friendly staff. It was reasonably priced and exceeded our expectations. The location was central to all of the must see attractions of Athens. I would definitely stay here again.
title: Great Hotel

review: Athens Gate Hotel was perfect for our 1st trip to Athens. It was in the heart of all the action, steps from the Plaka, acient ruins and cool places to explore. I would highly recommend for the newcomer to Athens. It is a bit pricey but you can't beat the location and friendly service..worth it.
title: Great experience

review: Nice hotel in the heart of the city, 5 minutes walk from the Acropolis museum and the old part of the city. Nice clean room, polite people, nice breakfast with amazing views of the Acropolis and great coffee.
title: Short city break

review: As always - the views from the upper floors are magnificent - either towards Acropolis or towards the Arch of Hadrian and Temple of Zeus. But standard of the rooms on top ( "Executive" ) are perhaps not Executive.. The terrace outside the Executive rooms are large but do not compensate for the lack of table inside giving no place to put a PC for some writing...The staff is friendly and the cleaning is excellent - as always...
title: Excellent views and good service ...but "Executive" room?

review: At the Athens Gate Hotel, from the moment you enter the building you are greeted and helped right away. Staff is extremely nice. There is WiFi within the building and can be sketchy at times but if you're in the lobby it works perfectly fine. The lobby is pretty huge as there are multiple sofas, also has a tv, fireplace, computers, a bar which is a very comfortable setting. Free breakfast in the morning. There is no pool in this specific hotel, however, they do have a sister hotel nearby about 10 minutes away walking and you will have access to that pool. The views are second to none as you can see the temple of Zeus across the street and the Acropolis from the top floor. Amazing hotel.
title: Wonderful

review: If you only have one day in Athens, stay here. Can walk to everything. The rooftop is great for evening drinks and breakfast. I wouldn't recommend the dinner-they were out of 3 of 4 fish entrees and the food was mediocre. it is clean , quiet, and the BEST location.
title: Best Location

review: We stay for 2 nights. It is within walking distance to the acropolis, and all attractions. We arrived and the attendant parked our car for us. You really do not want to be driving in Athens, Park and Walk. The view was great as was the room. We had breakfast which was included on the roof terrace. The wifi did not work that great but we found this through Greece. I would defiantly stay there again.
title: Vacation With the Family

review: Fabulus rooftop terrace. Go at night to see Acroplos in lights. Location is great. 3 blocks from acropolis metro. Staff quite helpful.The rooms aren't anything spectacular. Although many have small terraces.
title: Rooftop bar wirh great views. Short walk to Plaka, Acropolis and more.

review: This hotel is a gem in the vibrant touristy area of Plaka. You really can't beat the value here: nice amenities, walking distance to everything and incredible views of the Parthenon and Temple of Zeus. The breakfast is abundant and delicious (I especially loved the dolmas!). Well done, Athens Gate!
title: Comfortable, modern hotel in fantastic location

review: This is a beautiful hotel within view of the Acropolis. It has a roof garden restaurant with magnificent views of the Parthenon. I would have given it five stars except that its two tiny elevators are not quite sufficient to get guests up to the 8th floor roof deck for breakfast, while getting other guests and their luggage out for check-out, and the stairs mostly lack hand rails.
title: Very nice hotel, great location

review: The hotel is very conveniently located near Athens Gate and walkable distance from Acropolis. The famous Plaka district is also at walking distance from the hotel. All the 7 archeological sites are in close proximity.However, I found the hotel a bit expensive for stay and nothing exceptional. But I must say that they have a breakfast box service, for people with early morning flight, which you dont find in many hotels.
title: Conveniently Located but expensive hotel
