review: The view is to die for. Not to mention the food. We spent a lazy afternoon relishing Greek cuisine and sipping wine here. The weather changed from hot to cold to wet to hot and cols again ;) ALL within 45 minutes. Worth a halt :)
title: Terrific view!

review: We stayed for a week in a 5th floor superior room overlooking the Temple of Zeus. The room was modern, clean and spacious with a mini bar fridge and balcony. The ensuite had a walk in shower with complimentary toiletries and slippers. It was very hot while we were in Athens so we were very grateful for the air conditioning. The bed was comfortable but the road outside was very busy with the main noise from horns and motorbikes. It did occasionally affect our sleep but in my opinion was worth it for the view.The hotel is in an excellent central location within easy walking distance of all the main sites.The rooftop bar/restaurant has excellent views of the Acropolis on the restaurant side and the Temple of Zeus on the bar side. Breakfast was a wide choice of hot and cold buffet food which was delicious. On the last evening we had dinner in the restaurant with an excellent view of the sun setting over the Acropolis. The 3 course meal was of a much higher quality than anywhere else we ate in Athens and was delicious. All the staff from the bar, restaurant, front desk, maids and doorman were without exception friendly, polite, efficient and helpful. Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable.On our final morning we had an early start and were able to arrange a breakfast bag to take to the airport with us.
title: Excellent hotel in fantastic location

review: The location is perfect and within walking distance to the most important sights. Breakfast was wonderful at the rooftop restaurant with great views of the Acropolis and surrounding areas. Staff was very polite. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others.
title: Nice hotel and great location

review: Our fifth year this year. This place is completely reliable. The staff are ongoing and there year after year. Therefore the service is excellent, focussed and attentive. The rooms are clean and have amazing views of the temple of Zeus. Every year we come we feel at home, safe, comfortable and with the best view of the acropolis and breakfast meals. This is what I call excellent value for money. Nothing to fault ... just praise!
title: Excellent and well priced

review: Rooms are clean and simple with hardwood floors. The location is perfect for walking around Athens and seeing the sites. The free breakfast on the rooftop can not be beat. We stayed before and after our cruise and stayed in two different rooms. The first 3 nights we stayed overlooking the Temple of Zeus (4th floor). The view was great however, there is a lot of traffic noise all day and night. (It was fun to watch the crazy motorcycles from the balcony). After our cruise we had a "no view" room out our window was a deserted office building wrapped in large black tarps. This room was definitely not as welcoming with the black tarps right outside the window. The cost of the hotel seems high based on the rooms and amenities, however, the room was very clean, the staff was nice, doormen were always helpful, breakfast was fresh and delicious. Internet was available but very slow and difficult to load any pages.
title: Clean, Simple and Great Location

review: We stayed here for three days and were very happy with it. The staff was awesome, the hotel was clean and the food was great. What more could you ask for? We were central to everything. We actually walked to the Acropolis in just minutes. The thing that really impressed me was the staff. They went out of their way to help with anything and everything you needed. We had to leave really early in the morning, before breakfast was served, so they made us a breakfast to take with us without us asking for it. Very nice touch. That's the way they were the whole stay there. :)
title: Great Place to Stay

review: My 16 year old son and I stayed there last week and really enjoyed it. The location is walking distance to almost everything you would want to see and do. Close by there are great restaurants and shopping. There staff where very helpfully. Especially and doorman named John from Montreal. The rooftop restaurant had very good food and amazing views. It is not inexpensive but great dollar value.
title: Great location, helpful staff

review: Stayed here post cruise for four nights. Chose the hotel based on location. As everyone says it's within walking distance to just about everything on the must-do list. Staff very nice and room very clean, though pretty small. We booked a room on the executive (7th) floor knowing we would be on a busy street. The latter is the biggest negative. The main artery through downtown Athens goes right by the hotel and it can be pretty noisy if you face the road and Temple of Zeus, but the view is terrific. 7th floor also has large balconies but we hardly used as the noise is not very relaxing on this side (the glass railing also freaked me out a bit). Room quite small even on this floor with very basic chairs. Bed was ok if a little too hard.The hotel was baking hot when we arrived as it was during a hot stretch and there is no AC in the halls. Zeus side of the hotel also gets summer sun most of the day. They turn off the AC if no one is in the room. Took hours to cool down as the AC was not powerful. After asking about this at the desk we were given a key to keep in the inside room slot to keep the AC running while we weren't there. Afterwards it stayed cool but we were also blessed with a mid summer cool down which also helped. Bath ok, but no plug in it which was annoying. Rooftop bar and restaurant ok as well. Breakfast was acceptable with a variety of usual items. Bar area on the roof nice place to chill with terrific views of Acropolis, Zeus, and rest of Athens. Didn't eat at the restaurant at night as it is somewhat expensive with a very limited menu but you can go up and take in the sights anytime.We paid more for the 7th floor room mainly because I wanted to ensure we were as far away from the street noise as possible. You can request a room on the Acropolis side of the hotel but be forewarned there is an abandoned building on that side which is not very attractive. We thought our price was a bit high for the size of the room and general amenities, but the location made it worth it. If I ever go to Athens again I will probably try to stay in the Plaka for the experience.
title: Nice but noisy hotel, great location

review: This hotel was in a perfect location! Everything was within walking distance. We were able to walk and see beautiful sites as well as spend a day at the Acropolis. Great restaurants were nearby. At sunset the hotel has a great rooftop view!! There is a restaurant that looked good, but we had other plans. The service was great and they even packed up a great bagged breakfast for us to take the morning we headed to the airport. Great hotel and excellent service!
title: Great hotel location and view

review: Perfect hotel to stay at if you want to have easy access to all the historical sites. Clean rooms good view from the roof terrace, buffet breakfast included, ask for high floor as it's quieter the higher you go, staff very friendly & helpful. Great restaurants, bars around the corner in the Plaka area very reasonably priced, hotel restaurant expensive and not much of an atmosphere when we visited. Athens a great city to visit, would love to go back.
title: Great hotel

review: Nice hotel. Had all the amenities. Close walking distance to all the tourist sites. Many restaurants and cafes close by. Nice rooftop restaurant - good variety of choicesfor breakfast. Dinner is also nice at the restaurant.Would recommend this hotel for those planning a trip to Athens
title: Great hotel

review: This really is the "Gate" to Athens. Fabulous service, rooms are great and clean, fab food. The views of the Acropolis, and Temple of Zeus are not imaginable until you are there. Close to all the things you want to see, and right near the Plaka , the old shopping district ...
title: Athens Gate Hotel

review: This hotel is in a perfect location to visit the ancient sites and Plaka district, the staff are very helpful and the roof top restaurant provided a wonderful breakfast and dinner. After reading other reviews I had requested a higher floor to escape the noise and did not find this to be a problem.However, unfortunately the air conditioning could not cope with the 40 degree temperatures and the two nights we spent there we could not sleep due to the heat in the room. Additionally you could not retreat to your room throughout the day because the heat was so oppressive. There was an attempt to fix the air con and it had improved slightly by the second day but I would expect good working air con in all rooms in the heat of a European summer. On a positive side the hotel staff kindly prepared a breakfast bag and filtered coffee for us given we had an early departure for the airport.
title: Great location but...

review: This hotel has a great view of the acropolis with a five star restaurant. The rooms were quaint and very modern. The beds were very soft and the bathrooms were roomy. The Athens attractions are in walking distance. If you are coming to Athens this hotel is an amazing choice.
title: "Athens GREAT Hotel"

review: This is a quality clean hotel and staff is efficient, friendly and professional. The breakfast was fantastic. What a great view of Athens. The elevator requires your room key to activate. makes you feel completely safe.We will always stay here when we are in Athens.
title: Great Stay

review: For years I have stayed at the Grand Bretagne but now I am wondering why! As rich in history as the Grand Bretagne is, the Hilton is just a much more comfortable place to stay. From the clean, modern guest rooms to the wonderful breakfast buffet to the rooftop bar/restaurant with unparalleled sunset views, it is hard to fault this hotel. My only "complaint" comes with the pool, which was absolutely packed - we could not find a chair for ages. But once we had a chair it was a lovely place to hang out. Will definitely go back.
title: Fantastic place to stay in central Athens

review: We have stayed here a number of times over the years and it is always a clean, well maintained hotel. The outdoor pool area is one of a kind in the middle of Athens. Very comfortable, clean, and friendly.
title: Solid hotel

review: We come to Greece 1-2 times per year and always stay here before heading to some islands. The staff is great and the rooms are very clean. The beds are amazing with nice pillows. The galaxy bar is a must for drinks and dinner. A++
title: Our first choice in staying in Athens

review: I have expectations as a Diamond Hilton member but this hotel exceeded even those. Let's start with check in. I was recognized as a Diamond member and they insisted on an upgrade unlike the Waldorf in Rome that would rather charge 20 euros for a martini. The room with a view was awesome and I recommend it to everyone. It was a surprise that was unexpected. The best part however was the best executive lounge EVER. Most Hiltons have Eli I aged this perk but this Hilton upped the ante. Happy Hour between 6 to 8 gives you not just extensive snacks but beer and wine and hard alcohol. In a town that expects 20 euros for breakfast this is an oasis in the crowd. Keep this up Hilton. You have reinvigorated my reason to be a Hilton member.
title: Hilton Loyalists this is an awesome hotel

review: This Hilton is a perfect hotel on a perfect location. Great place for leisure and for conferences. Great service, nice lounge and fantastic breakfast buffet Close to Kolonaki shopping and business area, walking distance great restaurants in the area
title: Perfect hotel

review: The Athens Hilton is a quality hotel close to all the Athens sites within walking distance and the use of the Metro. Great service and quality accommodation. The executive lounge is a great place to unwind after a trip to the Acropolis or the Museum. Happy hour is fabulous from 18.00 until dinner time on the rooftop at the Galaxy restaurant with a view of the Acropolis.
title: Quality Hotel close to all Athens sites

review: This hotel is in a great location with views over Athens. We stayed on the executive floor which in hindsight was a bad idea. The room was next to the lounge and it was very noisy all day long. I guess people can't keep away from free cookies !Room was very comfortable. Nice balcony. Check out was tedious. Tip to hotel - at around noon it's probably a good idea to have more than one person working at reception! It took 35 mins to check out.
title: Nice hotel and location

review: The hotel can be reached easily by bus transportation from the airport. You can save $ here (6euros for bus) versus taxi that could cost approximately 38-40euros. The outdoor pool is a must during summer period! The hotel is about 20 minutes walking distance to the Acropolis area. The complementary internet connection is ok.
title: Nice location with swimming pool

review: This is our second year staying at the Hilton. As. Platinum member of another hotel chain we chose to come back to the Hilton. The staff is excellent and attentive....our room has a stunning view and pool is awesome!!!!I would highly recommend the Hilton Athens!!!
title: Exceptional Service

review: Don't be fooled by the aging exterior. The rooms are very modern with high quality finishes, several offering magnificent views of the Acropolis. Pluses include amazing pool, phenomenal rooftop bar setting, and first class spa. Despite the amazing setting, however, service at the rooftop bar is nearly abysmal and a negative incentive to go up there. Overall, the service was very good. It's a good mile plus walk to Plaka so plan accordingly, especially in the hot months. I would be happy to stay here again.
title: Excellent choice for room size, quality

review: Outstanding property. The pool, rooftop bar and rooftop restaurant are a must. The Hilton Athens is among the best properties in the Hilton network and the Beautidul views of the Akropolis certainly make it a must.
title: Hilton Athens is Outstanding. Great service and beautiful property.

review: Hotel is well situated, very clean. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The view is amazing. Pool was very well kept. Water could be a little warmer. Staff at the pool could be a little faster. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. Looking forward to returning.
title: Simply Outstanding

review: A wonderful hotel in Athens. Would recommend going to the galaxy bar as well as walking to the Plaka at night. Stunning rooms and the service was consistently great throughout our stay. Would stay again in the future.
title: Fantastic

review: I had dinner at Byzantino Restaurant. Could not finish my meal after taking small bites; I was feeling tired from jetlag. I requested to have it in a "to go" box from my waiter. He said that I could not take my leftovers to my hotel room. He said he can have it delivered to my room but in a plate. How am I suppose to place inside my small refrigerator to keep chilled? Very disappointed. I just wasted my money. I've never heard such "insane" reasoning from a major hotel chain such as Hilton that I have ever stayed.I talked to the Manager on Duty (MOD) before posting. He was not helpful; he left before we came to a reasonable resolution to my complaint.Am embarrassed to be a HILTON HONORS GOLD member.A restaurant supervisor approached me and offered to adjust off the main course from my bill. That's the simple resolution I was looking. He did exactly what the MOD should have offered to me before walking away. The MOD failed to make this hotel guest happy by mishandling this situation.
title: Disappointed HILTON GOLD hotel guest

review: We loved the chance to go to a chain hotel after weeks in Botiques, This is a fun touchstone to have a concierge floor, a happening pool, and a really amazing in door pool, with an above average health club. You are not far from the national museum, and can see the acropolis from the hotel.
title: Industrial US Hotel, BUT REALLY fun.

review: Superbly located in central Athens near to e.g. the main conference center and tourist sites. It is well meintained, and its pool area is well designed, generous and well managed. The conference center was also excellent. One of the restaurants in the hotel was closed, a sign to us that the hotel is waiting for better economic times to fully blossom again.
title: Classic Hilton, but has probably seen better days

review: Wien you book a Hilton you know you are going to a top hotel. This one has a fantastic pool, a great gym and SPA. Very much appreciated the welcome drink at the roof bar with a fantastic view. Great breakfast buffet and friendly employees. Who could ask for anything more?
title: Excellent: that's all!

review: Beautiful room, great view particularly from the rooftop bar. The only downside was the check in. This was a mess. All good otherwise. Several good restaurants within an easy 5 minute walk. Room service and hotel food can be outlandishly expensive.
title: Nice hotel.

review: Excellent price for an excellent locationEnjoy the Galaxy bar with a nice view of the Acropolis Pool and hymn quite nice as well and nice to enjoy after a hot and long visiting dayWe reserved the Olive suite which is quite nice for a family.Breakfast is nice and some nice restaurant options close to the hotel
title: Tip Top

review: We stayed one night before we traveled on to Mykonos. The hotel is very busy and mostly a business crowd. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The hotel's location is convenient. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good with lots of variety.
title: Good Business Hotel

review: HILTON Athens is really the best hotel in town, and also has the best rooftopbar as well. The hotel itself is really big and so you have a wide range of possibilities to pamper yourself. Indoor- and Outdoorpool, Fitnessroom (unfortunately just one bicycle, that should be fixable), Executive Lounge with a amazing view and as well an amazing service and hospitality. I had the King Olive Suite and have not regretted it at all. The whole suite has a really good atmosphere, a private I would say. (Hilton Budapest could learn right here, how to arrange a suite you feel perfectly welcome). Also my question after one more lamp was fulfilled within one hour without any problem. The guide who was recommended from the Executive Lounge Guest Service was 55,- Euro a hour and it fitted perfect for three hours for the Akropolis and the museum. I would recommend to not meet in the hotel, you should meet with the guide at the container, where the group and guide tickets are sold, so you will have more time with the guide. Also the breakfast is really HILTON like, there is everything you are expecting. The whole crew is friendly and is very helpful. The only disappointing thing was with the outdoorpool, as you only get one big towel, which you lay on the sunbed. Asking for one mor (even a smaller one, which is handed out for fitness) was denied, which is not 5 star hotel class at all. But I strongly recommend the hotel, if you want to be sure, that your stay in Athens should be perfect. Because: If your are not satisfied, HILTON will make it alright, as they say in their ads.
title: Best place in Athens

review: I haven't stayed at this Hilton for years. Its modern renovations and exceptional guest rooms with phenomenal views made it a treat to return. The huge pool and diverse amenities are made possible since it is little out of downtown, but how welcome to have a pool to relax at and cool off. Taxi's are incredibly cheap in Athens, so this is perfect.
title: Beat the Heat in a Great Setting

review: This hotel is located close to the Acropolis and other local museums and park. It has excellent facilities and very helpful staff. the rooms are beautifully appointed and some have great views of the city
title: Excellent service and location

review: We stayed two nights at the end of our vacation through Italy and Greece. It was great to know that we had comfortable and safe accommodations lined up for the end of our trip and the Hilton and it's staff did an excellent job. The rooms were clean, quiet and comfortable. The breakfast was extensive and fresh and the indoor pool has some fantastic features to help relax. We highly recommend this hotel if you are in the Athens area.
title: Excellent Athens Hotel

review: Hilton Gold Member, hotel was very helpful prior to arrival, i was upgraded nice room. great tub which we all took turns enjoying after a long trip. If any complaint, i think the Exec lounge could have a nicer range of food and drink , more to choose given the amount of people using facility. Very nice hotel, highly recommend given points and price. Skybar fabulous view but a bit pricey. I would recommend, nice hotel ,great service.
title: Excellent hotel, price, upgraded

review: We chose this hotel for the pool so our 2 yr old can have some fun. It made a difference as we could do the touristy things and then enjoy playing with her in the pool. Getting into town was quite easy. Depending on the weather we walked or caught a bus/ train. The airport bus was right outside the hotel. Extremely friendly staff. Fantastic wi-fi.
title: A delightful stay in Athens

review: We enjoyed our stay at this property. Excellent service, great location, comfortable rooms and great views! The Executive Lounge had great options with friendly and helpful staff. All staff spoke English and made sure they offered their help.
title: Excellent value, great service

review: Had a great time and the room was amazing . Beautiful hotel and beautiful city. Service was very good as we got all our questions answered and we had loads as it was our first visit . Would recommend to anyone visiting this amazing city .
title: Great stay

review: This is a perfect (business oriented) hotel in the heart of Athens. Service is always good and friendly (I particularly liked the prepared speedy-checkout envelope in front of my door at 6 a.m. - very good idea!), breakfast is phantastic and the location ideal. Thus: strong recommendation.
title: Very good in any aspect

review: ‏Hello, I would like to complain about the terrible experience I experienced during my vacation at the Athens Hilton‏When I got to the hotel I went down to the swimming pool of the hotel The service was shocking and no waiter came to me and took me half an hour until I arrived for a drink and 2 glasses of water outside the temperatureThe outside temperature was 35 degreesThe drinking glasses that came after 30 minutes from the time I ordered were hot and the waitress did not bring the water and said she was coming back to get it just gone and did not come back I felt I was going to faint and that did not come water I went up to the room with a strong headache and it ruined my night and night I had to take pills All to the hotel but no one did with you nothing just the next day I spoke with the manager did a favor thatIn addition, we did not clean the room for two days. The room was filthy. We stayed in the shower without towels and leftover food from the night before we had to get out of the shower and call the receptionist to bring us towelsThis is something that certainly can not be for a 5 star hotel and at the Hilton chain I am a member of the club at the highest level I have never had such a service Such a terrible experience of cleanliness and careleI will never go back to this hotel
title: Never come back

review: Wow..a classy full service hotel in Athens, Greece. Clean rooms, excellent service, 5-Star workout room, spa, rooftop bar, and pool. Rooms are solid with comfy beds and nice and well functioning bathroom and appliances. It appears all rooms have hardwoods or faux hardwood floors and no carpet to hid the nasties. Also all rooms appeared to me have a balcony and can support fresh air. It reminded me of the classic Hilton-Istanbul and the Intercontinental-Dublin, which are among the two finest hotels I've ever stayed.
title: Most Excellent, Classy, Int'l Hotel

review: Roof top bar is a must, fantastic breakfast and rooms are stunning. Views are best in Athens I would think. Location is pretty central and staff and very helpful. Additional drinks and food are expensive!
title: A heavenly experience

review: Take the time to go to dinner at the Hilton in Athens. The best view of the Acropolis and city at night! The food and service were just as amazing as the view. Whether you're staying nearby or a metro ride away, it's worth the trip.
title: Best view of the Acropolis

review: We were very pleased with this hotel despite the large size and location. My family and I are Hilton Diamond members and enjoyed the Executive Lounge for the breakfast and the evening reception. Rooms are standard in size but have great showers and balconies. We had an amazing view and enjoyed a glass or two of wine every evening while watching the sun set over the Acropolis.I must mention that my teenagers loved both the indoor and outdoor pool. This really is an oasis in the middle of a city.If our travels ever take us back to Athens, we will gladly stay at the Hilton again.
title: Great amenities

review: This hotel is in a perfect location of Athens!!!! The hotel is superb. The rooms are large and well appointed with every room having a balcony. The pool and spa area offer great treatments. The pool is quite large and offers drinks and snacks. Roof top bar has the most amazing view overlooks the Acropolis. Breakfast in the morning was especially good. Staff is attentive and gracious. Cannot go wrong with this hotel!!!!
title: great stay

review: Hilton's staff and facilities were perfect. They arranged shuttles to the airport and Piraeus Port, which were reasonably priced and arranged at a moment's notice. The bar has a view that's second to non, of the Acropolis. The hotel's proximity to museums, embassies, and parks makes it a great location.
title: Great Stay

review: Now i'm not entirely sure how groups like the Hilton operate, I imagine this hotel is owned by a local copunterpart and the Hilton operate if for them it in some kind of deal much like many other hotels around the world. If that is the case I feel that the owner needs to update the rooms a bit and modernise the hotel as a whole. Yes a big investment and perhaps Greece isn't giving a great return at the moment, but the room rates feel a bit quite high for what you get. The pool is ok, but for some reason it had the feel of a miami retirement home. I'm not sure the deal but there were group classes in the gym which I haven't seen before in a 5 star hotel. I wouldn't say it was a bad experience and for the business user it's probably perfect but for those looking for a 5star hotel experience I probably wouldn't reccomend. I would however say that we did not try the restaurant, bar or any of the other hotel facilities apart from the gym and pool so my review doesn't cover everything.
title: Could do with a touch up

review: Top bar was the Oasis Pool Bar at the Hilton. Superb amenities, relaxing atmosphere and - - -Mary, The most charming hostess with the mostest. All the guests during my visit in June found this bar, and Mary in particular well worth the visit again and again.The hotel maintains the highest standards, I hope to return soon.
title: Hilton Athens again

review: Visited Athens for a family holiday abd Athens Hilton was the best choice we made! It is by far he best hotel and service anyone can find in athens! Great location, great food great service!! The rooms are minimal but functional, the pool area was fantastic and their spa was an amazing experience
title: Holidays. In Athens

review: The location of this hotel is excellent, within walking distance to shopping about 15 min. Breakfast excellent, galaxy bar + restaurant 13 floor really friendly + professional service.Nice outdoor swimming pool. Pool bar staff was a bit unfriendly, busy?Hotellin sijainti on loistava, Galaxy bar 13 kerros huippu näköalat Akropolikselle + palvelu. Fine-dining illallinen ++ oli loistava.
title: location & view is excellent

review: for business or leisure. Our room had a view of the Acropolis. Nice! The hotel has several bars and restaurants. We loved the Galaxy restaurant at the penthouse. What made it special for us was not only the excellent quality of the two dinners had there but the waitstaff. Especially Mr. Grigoris, the consummate professional with a great sense of humor stood out. In the lobby level bar/restaurant Dimitri aka Tall Guy, was outstanding with his professionalism and helpful and pleasant attitude.If we ever go back to Athens this would be our hotel of choice.To get to the hotel here from the airport it is fixed fare of 38 Euros each way. The X95 express bus costs 3 Euros for seniors so does the metro (best to avoid b/c of pickpockets)
title: Excellent venue

review: My wife and I were here between 10 day tours in mid June 2017. We found the hotel to be very clean and well appointed - great views. A quick cab to "Old Town" for eating and shopping and an easy walk to good moderately priced local restaurants. We found the hotel employees to polite and helpful - will stay here again.
title: The Best of Locations

review: We stayed at Hilton for our honeymoon. The stay was memorable. The hotel is centrally located. It is nearby to Acropolis and other tourist spots. Service was professional. I would recommend the hotel for stay.
title: Awesome stay at Athens

review: As Americans who had never been to Greece, we booked the tried-and-true Hilton. Very efficient staff at the Front Desk. Beautiful, spacious rooms including marble bathrooms. We got an Acropolis view and it was well worth the extra money. The breakfast buffet is delicious with so many choices, book it as part of your package. The pool and pool bar were nice. Drinks at the rooftop Galaxy Bar were memorable and a great place to view the Parthenon during the "golden hour" at sunset.
title: Great Hotel.

review: The location is perfect, the room are clean and very well organized, the swimming pool is amazing and it stay open till late night and the galaxy bar and restaurant are one of the best in the world not only Athens..The breakfast is full of variety so every one can enjoy and the servies you get in all the hotel amenities is just flawless
title: Exactly what one's except from 5stars hotel

review: This modern hotel has always been great. Pay extra for Acropolis view. Its worth it. Spacious rooms - but the kicker is the amazing rooftop bar. Much more refreshing than the Great Britannia. Pool great, huge and clean with all day sun with plenty of loungers. A short walk to parliament square and to some nice bars and restaurants. p.s the breakfast is amazing...
title: Not bad at all

review: This Hilton was extremely clean, comfortable and well-priced. The rooms were beautifully appointed, with very nice amenities. Gorgeous views of Athens from all angles of the hotel. If you are a Hilton Gold member, you have use of the Executive Lounge for complimentary "Happy Hour" and continental breakfast. Courteous and helpful front desk staff gave great info regarding transportation, local sites, nearby restaurants and other helpful Athens information. All employees with whom we interacted spoke excellent English. It is located close to the subway, the original stadium of the "new" Olympic games, the foreign embassies, the botanic gardens and the "Tomb of the Unknown Soldier". Convenient to many popular tourist sites. I would absolutely stay at this Hilton again.
title: excellent experience at the Athens Hilton

review: Was pleasantly surprised when they upgraded us to a larger room for ourv night stay. Really appreciated it. The hotel is about a 15min walk to Old Town /Plaka. Very pleasant walk in summer. The breakfast and lunch was great with the chef taking extra care with our dietary requirements. I used the gym which was well equipped with a fantastic indoor pool. Overall a great base for a stay in Athens
title: Great service

review: The quality and service at the hotel in no way complies with the requested sum of money. There is chaos and incompetence in the organization of services. We arrived at the hotel before 11.00 and asked at the reception whether we could be accommodated earlier, although we knew that the check-in at this hotel, unlike most of the other ones, is at 4 p.m. (sic!) which - considering the demanded higher price for accommodation - we find totally inappropriate. The receptionists promised us access to our room hour after hour, thanks to which we spent almost 6 hours waiting for the Olive Suite. which we had pre-paid several months ahead. First, we were sent to the swimming pool bar, where we spent 3 hours hearing repeated promises of access to our room. After our third inquiry whether the room was free, as an answer we were given a card to the lounge and were told that the formalities would be settled there. The previous guest had left the room later and therefore the room could not yet be prepared. We waited another 3 hours during which we were offered the possibility of paying an extra 250 EUR for a De-Luxe Suite, supposedly the only one ready, which we refused. Our room wasn’t even ready at 4pm but as late as 5.30 pm.Instead of a possible tour of the town or a business meeting we pointlessly wasted 6 hours waiting.As a businessman and owner of a firm I cannot comprehend how a hotel of this category which 2 days before our arrival had takings of roughly 2 million EUR is incapable of securing more staff for cleaning rooms. We were evidently the only ones who arrived ahead of time so, instead of the repeated promises of accommodation, it would have sufficed to tell the room service about the priority cleaning of the vacated room or to let us know that the room would be at our disposal only at check-in time (which it wasn’t anyway).The capacity of the executive lounge, considering the number of accesses and the hotel’s business policy is absolutely insufficient. We had to carry our evening snack to the suite because the lounge was totally full for a long time. We were not the only ones who couldn’t spend time there and deal calmly in the evening. We were not offered any compensation for the late vacation of our room, not to mention the impossibility of using the lounge for business meetings. I will not stress such details as that the suite contained accessories and complements only for 1 person, although it was ordered for 2. At our request to see the responsible manager, Mrs. Kalliopi Paroussis, one of the receptionists who had promised us accommodation every hour and had sent us to the bar, arrived. The result were repeated apologies. No suggestion of compensation for the belated accommodation. From the given business card, we found out that Mrs. Paroussis is only the assistant of the front desk manager, evidently with no authorization, which we consider as incorrect, unreliable dealing and misguidance. In comparison with several visited hotels of the Hilton chain, Double Tree, Waldorf Astoria in various cities I must state that the price level at this hotel does not nearly correspond with the equipment of the hotel, nor with its service. Chaos prevails in there (we were not the only ones waiting for accommodation long after check-in time).I cannot recommend the Athens Hilton to anyone and am warning my business partners of staying there.
title: Horrible, truly incompetent staff, you pay for services, you never get

review: When in Athens on business I have resorted to staying at the Hilton hotel based on previous amazing experiences.Prior to the Hilton normally stay at the King George or Grande Bretagnia. Being a five star hotel one expects excellent service and good value .On arrival we where greeted outside by the car concierge ?? Well received and a polite really nice guy. Apologize for not having asked his name. A queue on check in however I was promptly checked in. My first complaint here is that a hotel of this class should have a dedicated concierge as is the case of other establishments on this level and not have to rely on on checking in staff to do both.My room allocated was away from lifts which was great, however it looked tired and slightly worn. Only one tiny shampoo and conditioner. No tooth paste or brush/razor blade??Looking in the cupboard no dressing robes. This was all disappointing. I had to phone twice to house keeping to bring them along with toiletries. When I received them thanked the staff with a smile how ever they were sullen and I got the impression they were doing me a favor . I had a cup of tea and asked house keeping to replace it with a fresh cup and as I went shopping that day asked if they would remove all the empty boxes and packaging. AlasNone of the above was done and I just left it.On a positive note, got an invitation for a welcome cocktail. Thank you very much. The breakfast is outstanding as are all the facilities.I checked in on the 22nd off July and I am writing this in the Hotel lobby checking out today.I will be back in Athens on Wednesday the 26th for three more nights.Stayed in room 410
title: Compared to last visit ..not as sharp

review: The staff on the Executive Floor are friendly, professional and can handle any request with positive results. They took care of us from start to finish. The breakfast was awesome, too. We look forward to returning soon!
title: Friendliness and Efficiency

review: Great hotel in Athens. Very nice amenities that include several restaurants, some small shops, pool, etc.. Highly recommend a drink at the Galaxy Bar on the roof. Excellent views! Rooms are clean and modern. If your a Hilton Honors member there is an executive lounge on the 11fl offering light breakfast in the morning along with light snacks in the evening.
title: Great Hotel

review: Stayed one night before heading out to the Coast with family. Very comfortable summer stay and the large pool is very much appreciated for warm Athens days in July. Great view overlooking Acropolis. Decent complimentary breakfast in the Executive Floor. All in all a comfortable stay.
title: Comfortable family stay

review: We came on Thursday for the very well advertized pool event in the evening! The pool was dirty ! There were no sunbeds! The service said very rudly to us to wait and that they can serve us ! But the worse thing was the Lifeguard he was extremely rude saying to us that we cannot take our cocktails near the pool! We understood that and then he grabed our drinks and took them to a table of other guests !!! Unacceptable!!!
title: Pool Event Fail !

review: We had short visit to Athens before returning to the States. The Athens Hilton exceeded our expectations in service and amenities. We especially enjoyed the indoor pool, hot tub and fitness center. Dining at the Galaxy resturant with it's amazing view of the Acropolis was the perfect ending to our 10 day vacation to Italy and Greece.
title: Athens Experience

review: Stay in the middle of Athens and enjoy resort amenities. During summer try to spend a day by the outdoor pool - the biggest pool in the city. During fall and winter enjoy a day at Hiltonia Spa . And of course do not miss the Galaxy Bar at the top floor.
title: An Oasis in the middle of a big city

review: For some days in Athens the Hilton is a very nice place to be. Business oriented but with a great sense for a more than relaxing stay in Athens - this is a perfect area. Do not miss the view from the roof-top - it's breath taking. Enjoy your well deserved vacation.
title: Great hotel with amazing roof-top view

review: This is a good hotel in a great location. Its walking distance to all the major sites in the city and is only a few minutes walk from the Acropolis museum. There is tea and coffee making facilities and free wifi.
title: Good hotel in a good location

review: This was a nice hotel that was walking distance from the Acropolis, the Parthenon, the Plaka, the museum and the train station. Our room had a balcony and everything we needed. There is a restaurant in the hotel that also offers breakfast.
title: Very nice hotel, close to the Acropolis

review: great location! easy walk to all things acropolis and many good restaurants closely. The room was a bit small but we were out and about most of the time. Had A/C which was essential. great roof top bar with view of parthenon.
title: great hotel within walking to the acropolis

review: We stayed at the Hera Hotel for 4 nights in July and really enjoyed our experience. The staff were very friendly and accommodating of our constant requests for ice. The breakfast had tremendous selection and the roof top restaurant was very good. We booked a room with a view of the Acropolis and I highly recommend doing this if you can. The location was perfect for access to the main attractions of Athens and there are a couple of great coffee spots close to the hotel. We very much enjoyed our time here.
title: Friendly staff with a great location

review: Stayed at Hera after a long flight from NY. Great location walking distance to Plaka, Acropolis and museums. Room was small but very clean and neat. We ate in the roof top restaurant. The waiter was very attentive and the food was excellent.
title: Hera Hotel Athens, great location, excelllent service

review: The hotel located in the quiet area very close to the Acropolis Metro Station, 5-10 mins walking to the Acropolis entrance and the busy Plaka area. The receptionists were friendly and efficient. When checked in, we told them that we needed to depart earlier than their restaurant breakfast opening of 7 am, they sent within an hour prepacked breakfast to our room. When we returned from Mateora, we stayed in Hera Hotel again and enjoyed the buffet breakfast in the restaurant. The breakfast had limited choice but still good quality and with plenty of vegetable & fruits.Their standard rooms we stayed were well equipped but tight in space. Two of us(slim in size) with two pieces of medium size luggage found it uncomfortable to move around. The rooms and bathrooms were tidy. There were no clothes hooks in the tight bathrooms, nowhere we could hanged the wet towel etc. Bedding was comfortable and towel smelled fresh, soft & clean. The sound insulation with the neighboring room was weak. One time we had a noisy neighbor and we could hear her talking whole night long.
title: Nice hotel in good location

review: We stayed at the Hera twice, at the beginning and end of our stay in Greece in June. Initially we were so tired from the long flight it was a wise choice to have allowed an extra day there.The rooms are small, but well furnished. Comfortable clean beds and a nice view on the upper floors facing the street (front). The breakfast buffet included foods we'd have at home with local sausages bread and fresh yogurt and fruit.The staff is friendly and helpful - even after we blew a fuse/circuit breaker with a power strip plugged into an adapter. They also arranged a taxi to the airport both times we had to leave and made sure our second stay was at an upper floor with a balcony street view.The Roof Garden Restaurant was also amazing. See the separate review....
title: Hera's Peacock has reason to be Proud

review: Sure, it's been said before but it bears repeating: Hera Hotel offers comfort, friendly staff, and attractive rooms but the overwhelming advantage is its location. Upon leaving the hotel, you are within a 5 minute walk to the Acropolis Museum (not to be missed!) and 2 minutes further to the Acropolis, itself. This means, of course, that you can be at those attractions at any time of day and avoid crowds should you choose. We were at the museum before 9 a.m. and had the place virtually to ourselves. Also, the hotel's proximity to the Plaka area is fortunate. There are plenty of interesting shops, cafés, and restaurants nearby. We hail from a big city so we know the value in convenience and ease in a neighborhood for us as residents, and for our guests, and the Hera Hotel offers that in spades. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.
title: Location, location, location

review: As per other reviewers,this is a wonderful small hotel with character and charm incredibly close to the Acropolis and easy walking distance to many other historic sites; given its location,it is excellent value for money,far better than you'd get for the same type of location in other European capital cities. Easy to reach from the airport-good directions on the hotel website-just one change at Syntagma. Rooms clean,light and modern-even a kettle for Brits missing their Yorkshire tea! Small mini- fridge,efficient aircon; nice bathrooms; friendly & helpful staff.Dinner on the terrace is expensive but worth tretaing yourself.Recommended-we would stay again without hesitation.
title: Great comfy hotel with character near historic sites

review: Very beautiful hotel n a great location to all the major sites, and metro station. Rooms were updated, staff was very friendly with great restaurant recommendations and breakfast area was beautiful with a great selection (including ready to make omelets). Would definitely recommend
title: Beautiful Hotel Close To Acropolis!

review: Excellent location, friendly, helpful staff, clean, comfortable rooms and delicious food. The rooftop restaurant is fabulous with a really good view of the Acropolis and even better at night when the lights are on.
title: lovely little hotel

review: The hotel is located close to the Acropolis and other attractions of Ancient and Modern Greece. It is close too to public transport (the metro, trams and bus) to allow for ease of movement around the city. The hotel is charming, tastefully designed without being 'over the top'. The rooms are comfortable though slightly small and are cleaned daily. Our room, away from the street, was very quiet. Breakfast was included in our tariff and well worth it with an excellent range of freshly prepared fruits, vegetable dishes and local cuisine (such as cheese pies). The rooftop restaurant and bar, though pricey, is well worth at least one visit. The views of the Acropolis are spectacular. I save my last comment for the wonderful staff, who were extremely helpful and thoughtful. With our leaving early on our final day, they arranged for a breakfast plate to be brought to our room. It is the little extra touches that make this lovely hotel truly special.
title: A truly special hotel.

review: If site-seeing is what you are doing in Athens, then THIS is your place. You can walk out and zip to the Acropolis and the Acropolis Museum in about two seconds. You are nicely set up to walk almost anywhere in Athens. Our room had a nice view of the Acropolis (so pretty at night). There's a cute, little restaurant on the top floor where you can grab a drink or have dinner with great views. The staff at the front desk is SO helpful and can advise you on anything an everything in the city. Love this place!
title: GREAT location, and SUPER staff

review: Every time my family & I visit Athens we always make sure we include a mid holiday break at the Hilton Athens. The pool by far is the best in town. We luv the rooftop "Galaxy Bar" with spectacular views of the Acropolis & Lycabetos Hill. The breakfast selection is outstanding as well. Staff were extremely helpful in all areas especially check-in. Cannot fault this hotel. A definite must...
title: Our Favourite Hotel in Athens

review: We have just left from a 2 night stay at Hera Hotel. The hotel itself is a lovely boutique hotel in a great location. Walking distance to everything you would need for a stop over in Athens. The rooms are of a 4star hotel standard with a delicous buffet breakfast. What makes this hotel is the staff, the reviews are all true the care and genuine desire the staff have towards making you stay in Athens a wonderful experience is commendable. Thank you Hera Hotel!
title: Lovely Hotel with Amazing Staff

review: Hotel was situated in a great place near the Acropolis. The daily breakfast was very good. We were able to walk to all major attractions from this location and many restaurants were very close by. Staff was friendly and rooftop bar was cool.
title: Great Location

review: Fabulous location two blocks from the Plaka at the base of the Acropolis. One block to the Museum. (which you cannot miss) Room was large, clean and comfortable. The staff was very accommodating. The rooftop restaurant was tasty, reasonable and the service was fabulous. Complimentary breakfast was amazing. I would highly recommend this hotel to Athens visitors.
title: Fabulous stay!!

review: The Hera hotel is a great, little place.Behind the grand façade is a very cozy hotel with lovely, comfortable rooms.Superb staff!Excellent room amenities that many hotels that charge a lot more do not provide.Super comfortable bed, but be aware that a "double bed" may be just two singles pushed together. This is the only criticism I would have.Sufficiently fast internet, a balcony with a table and 2 chairs for gazing over the buildings and the acropolis in the distance.Nice restaurant and rooftop bar. Very decent breakfast! Breakfast can be very, very boring at Greek hotels, but the Hera does a good job!Great location, 100 meters from the Acropolis museum and the underground station. Dozens of restaurants within a 2 minute walk and the Plaka area is 5 minutes away.The lovely people at the front desk organized a car to take us and our 4 big suitcases to the airport. Euro 45 for this, which is a fair price.Overall a really lovely stay at the Hera hotel
title: Excellent small hotel in convenient location

review: Service and comfort of rooms are impeccable! The view from the top floor bar is pretty great and defntly worth a trip. eventhough this hotel is a bit pricey, it is in a great location in the town centre. The food in the hotel is also of a high standard.
title: I found a true home in Athens - Hilton

review: Very nice hotel with great service, and food. Centrally located for access to points of interest. The have an incredible view from the rooftop bar and restaurant with very personable staff, I highly recommend it.
title: Nice Hotel an Location in Athens

review: Hilton hotel in Athens is located very close to city center, basically two metro stations away from Plaka district and Acropolis, its arround 25 minutes walk from those places. Hotel has amazing infastructure, very big smingpool, spa, executive lounge with astonishing view from 11th floor, rooftop bar and two other restaurants. Interiors are fresh and spacious , it looks like it has been renovated recently Brekfast are very good , lot of varieties including standard stuff , live cooking , greek pastries and other specialities. Orange juice is freshly sqeezed. Executive lounge could have been little bit better though. What was lacking was alcoholic beverages such as gin or whiskey but beer and wine was there. Evening dinner in executive lounge is quite simple but its Ok , with some vegan and meet options.Rooms are nice... could be little bit bigger but thats ok. Two pillows to choose , very comfty beds. Big bathroomHonestly this hotel is what you can expect from hilton chain, everything is good and nice. Only small minus for evening fee for pool. I didnt quite understood this. I went to swimingpool at the evening after long day of seightseeing. After long day you dream about gooing into the pool , and hotel has pool opened to the very late hours ( i ve been at 00:30 AM) but as i entered the lady from staff asked me for 10€ fee which suprissed me. I recognize that they organize the pool party , but except from DJ and nice lights it was the same as usual lot of kinds, people swiming, drinking and chilling on sunbeds it seemed to me strange policy for extra payment for entrance to pool at the evening.
title: Everything you can expect from Hilton

review: The Hilton Athens is a hotel that shines like a diamond. The staff are efficient, polite, willing to help and professional. The hotel screams opulence. The Olympic sized pool is a dream to relax next to. The rooms are clean and allow for a relaxing visit. Rain showers, marble everywhere, balcony overlooking the Acropolis, mini fridge, huge closets, quiet and lovely. This hotel makes it their mission to please.
title: Work trip

review: Our stay here was quite memorable, the staff was very friendly and helpful with any questions we had about Athens. The breakfasts included were amazing and started each day we stayed at the hotel in an amazing fashion. The rooms themselves were a little dated, however they were very clean and had a great little balcony to watch the sunset if you liked. The roof top terrace had stunning views of the Parthenon as well as the city centre as a whole. All in all we were very happy with our stay at Hermes Hotel.
title: Perfect location, great breakfast, good hotel.

review: My Wife & I were travelling around Europe on our Honeymoon & were fortunate enough to stay at this hotel during our 1 night in Athens.I've heard from greek friends that Athens can be a bit sketchy to walk around in & that you must constantly be on guard. But I found the neighbourhood around the hotel to be quite pleasant; as there is other tourists & locals about, & full of places to eat & a grocery nearby - of course still be cautious like in any country, yet still enjoy the surrounds as it is brilliantly located within walking distance of stores, the Acropolis Mueseum, & the Acropolis.I've read reviews that the service at Hermes is excellent, & that hasn't changed at all; courteous & very helpful. We were even given a small gift of wine & local sweets as a gesture from Hermes to greet us on our honeymoon. This was a wonderful surprise that we appreciated.The room we were given was humbly small yet cosy enough for a couple, & was modernly decorated... we didn't expect the Hotel to look as good as a 4 star when we spotted & entered, so we were impressed.Extra free offerings were water, tea & coffee available for till 8pm at their lounge area beside reception. There are seats & a selection of reading material in this lounge to compliment a cup of what you fancy... also we were encouraged to visit their sister hotel: Hotel Plaka's rooftop for a drink & a nice view of the Parthenon, so that was great to know.All in all we had a great time for exactly what we wanted :)
title: A God worthy of Olympus

review: Our stay here was great. The staff were very friendly, gave great advice and direction, and the breakfast was great with traditional Greek foods as well as more general continental breakfast foods. We probably missed this on the website, but our bed was really two full-sized beds pushed together. Also, we did have an issue with the hot water in our room and after a few attempts to fix it had to move to a different room. While inconvenient, the staff were prompt and helpful in their response. We also took advantage of the roof top view from their sister hotel around the corner which had a great view of the Acropolis and rooftop bar.
title: Perfect location, great staff and good breakfast

review: Four of us recently stayed here for two nights in the family interconnecting rooms. The whole experience was great, the rooms are a decent size and the location is perfect. It is in the middle of town but in a quiet enough area that you cannot hear much.The breakfast was a good mix of both hot and cold food, and we were pleasantly surprised to find out that the cold breakfast is available all the time, as we had to leave at 5.30am to catch a ferry. Thank you for a lovely experience.
title: Great place to stay

review: a small one of a kind boutique hotel... whats remarkable about it is the super helpful and friendly staff, i have to greatly mention Oana, Tonya and Eva. they never failed to help answer an of my questions concerning where to go, what best is to do, where to dine and even where to shop, i send my great appreciation for them.The location of the hotel is great, walking distance from any place one needs to visit, where you can walk to your destination and enjoy experiencing all the Greek life, tavernas souvenir shops, markets and all. the hotel is quite clean and tidy, it lacks some essentials like cotton buds and the free water bottle but that was last of my worries for it offered what was more important... i highly recommend this hotel and i have to mind you that i was a solo traveler ,,, \
title: friendly and most convenient

review: Stayed in the Hermes Hotel in the centre of Athens ..so handy for Acropolis and the popular tourist areas nearby. Very friendly staff and good rooms with the much needed free internet. Rooms are fairly small but decent and the beds are extremely comfortable. The Hotel has a good and deserved reputation from local taxi drivers and again, position wise it is ideal! The Hermes has a sister Hotel nearby which has a rooftop bar which has views of the Parthenon and guests of the hotel are able to use this if they want. A good basic clean and friendly small hotel with very good staff and perfect location
title: Great little Hotel !

review: Great hotel, the interconnecting rooms were very user friendly for a family. My husband loved the breakfasts too much! Very handy central location to walk to the sites of Athens. Remember to check the view of the acropolis from the roof top.
title: Modern Hotel in Superb Location

review: Excellent hotel which is very central to all the shops restaurants and transport. Fairly priced. Lovely reception staff. Got upgraded to superior room with balcony and view. Recommended..... Mcds close by which is great. They have a triple cheeseburger! Omg!
title: Wonderful

review: We felt that the hotel was going to be a good choice as soon as we began talking with Oana. After orienting us to our room, she shared pertinent information about Athens. Each day she asked us how our day was and offered to help in any way we needed. My birthday occurred on the first full day of our stay and I was pleasantly surprised to see a small bottle of wine in the room with a note - Happy Birthday, Barbara. When I thanked her, she smiled seeming to be pleased that I was pleased. Eva, who greeted us each morning at breakfast was also helpful when asking how we would be spending our day. The room, although small, was sufficient for our needs. The breakfast was incredible. All the sites that we wanted to see were within walking distance. Oana told us about the roof top deck located at their sister hotel - Hotel Plaka - and suggested we have some wine there. The view was breathtaking - especially the Acropolis at night. I would definitely recommend this hotel to travelers to Athens and would stay there again if I have the opportunity to visit the city again.
title: Superb Hotel in a Superb Location

review: We stayed here for one night the receptionists are amazing very friendly and helpful they confirmed our taxi transfer and we got an amazing early breakfast. Would definitely come back.- The room is very clean and tidy- 5 min walk to the best restaurants and shops
title: Great place

review: I stayed at Hermes Hotel for the two nights I was in Athens before heading down to Kefalonia and couldn't have been happier with my choice. Hermes was very modern, updated, and right in the center of plaka. A 10 minute walk from the Acropolis and center city, not to mention the staff was very friendly and accommodating. A wonderful experience all around. I would 100% recommend Hermes to anyone staying in Athens.
title: GREAT Hotel

review: The staff at Hermes are some of the friendliest I've ever met in a hotel. They genuinely care about your stay and are very helpful. The room we had was very cozy and spacious, and was clean and well maintained - perfect for getting some good rest after a day in the hot streets of Athens.The included breakfast is amazing, and we loved that the location is within walking distance to everything. We'd definitely stay again.
title: Central, clean, quiet, cozy and comfortable

review: We checked in around 9pm after spending 6 hours on the ferry. The lovely lady at the counter welcomed us and gave us our room. It was on the 5th floor, very quiet and nice and cool with the AC. The room was spacious and very clean. We were also stoked to have a queen bed. Hermes is a 10 minute walk from the train station and the square. The included breakfast was very yummy with plenty of options. One of the staff members checked on us at breakfast and helped us with some sightseeing ideas. Very pleased we stayed, we will certainly stay again if we come back to Athens.
title: Great location and very nice staff

review: After a month of hotels, eight in all, Hermes might be the very best. In part the staff (Eva & Oana) push my rating over the limit of 5 stars. This will be my first choice for my next trip to Athens. The location is perfect. It is just outside the crazy Plaka and a block away from the main shopping streets. It takes minutes to walk to the acropolis, ancient agora, or the fabulous National Archeological museum. The rooms are solid and silent. I never heard any noise from other rooms or the street. The finishing is beautiful, if you like polished marble bathrooms (floors have roughed marble so they are not slippery when wet). Breakfast food selection is great. Everything from the basic toasts (4 different breads) with jam to eggs and bacon or spinach pie and cheeses with cold meats. There are amazingly good pastry sweets and fresh fruit selections. The finishing touch is the staff who take a real interest in you and what you plan to do with your time. For example, Eva knew after the first day that we had 2 daughters. She readied a large table for us for breakfast as soon as she saw my wife and I look for a table. In none of the other hotels on visit did any staff notice or care that we were a group of four. Lastly, someone on TripAdvisor said the walk to the National museum was best avoided and taxi was the best idea. Oana told us to try the walk and gave us a map of the route. The walk was great. Aolou street was beautiful and full of great restaurants and stores. I am so glad we listened to Oana and I am glad she bothered to ask about our plans for the day. Hermes Hotel should be at the top of your list of places to stay in Athens.
title: Ideal hotel for a stay Athens

review: Fantastic little hotel a short walk away from Plaka district and Syntagma. Hotel was kept exceptionally clean. Breakfast was your standard international breakfast that caters to all. Front of house staff were excellent and very helpful with things like storing excess luggage behind the front desk. The standard rooms are small - but the same as what you would get in most hotels in the same part of Athens. Highly recommended and would definitely stay there again.
title: Great little hotel in the centre of Athens

review: My family stayed in Amalia Hotel in Athens for 3 nights in June of 2017. We're just looking for a place we can stay in Athens for a short staying while doing some sightseeing. For that purpose, I think this hotel was perfect. Its location is really convenient. It's about 15-20 minutes of walking distance to Acropolis (although it felt a lot longer under the blazing sunlight with 95 degree). It's right across the street from the National Gardens and just a few blocks away from the Parliament building(if you want to see the 'Change of the Guards'). And, literally a few blocks away from a thousands of restaurants, cafes, shopping places, etc. And, it you want to ride one of those double decker tour buses, the stop is right across the street from the hotel, too. There is a train and bus stop right there, too. We thought that as far as location is concern, it's just as good as it gets.As for the hotel itself, it's very clean. Nothing really bad to complain about. However, there were no bell boy services when we got there. We had to lug all our bags to our room via a smallest elevator I've ever seen in my life. Not a big deal. But the sheer size of that elevator always brought a little smile to our family on each ride. Felt like that elevator belonged in Disney Land in some Kids' theme park. Room is an ample size and bed is just bed. We all slept well. Didn't have much views from our room probably because we didn't pay more for the room with a view. All good though. Their complimentary breakfast is quite good, we thought. Lots of selections and good quality. I have included some photos from the breakfast. They have a small lobby bar with a friendly bartender. Drinks are reasonably priced. It was a nice quick stop before you go up to your room after a long day of doing tourist stuff.I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay a several days for some sightseeing. The front desk staffs were all pleasant and spoke good English.
title: Clean, Great Location !!

review: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights . The location is perfect . From the airport we took the bus x95 right outside the airport and we got off at syntagma square which is the last stop . From there the hotel is 2 minutes walk . Going back to the airport we took the metro, cross the street from the hotel ( blue line 3) . The hotel is walking distance to all the major sites . Breakfast is excellent. Room is very clean and comfortable with modern bathroom . Staff very friendly . I totally recommend this hotel !!
title: GREAT HOTEL , GREAT LOCATION

review: The Amalia hotel is central to all things in Athens. The staff are friendly and professional and are willing to help the guest with a range of travel related questions. The rooms were clean and well maintained. The view from the roof of the Acropolis is great and when we were there, private. Will recommend it to family and friends
title: Friendly and good

review: Amalia is well located, one block away from the Parliament and one block away from the Plaka area. The Acropolis is 15 minutes walk or one stop on the metro. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. The breakfast is great. Rooms are well appointed. Despite arriving at 4pm, my room was not ready and I had a 15 minute wait.Unfortunately, my room was not the best - located at the back of the hotel and was quite small. The shower was tiny and it was impossible to have a shower without the shower curtain constantly blowing into the shower. Overall, great location, friendly staff. Loses points on my room and waiting for checkin.
title: Well located high end hotel

review: Good clean well situated hotel with an excellent view of the Royal Gardens and the parliament building. The breakfast buffet is extensive and well presented, but if your room rate does not include breakfast, there's plenty of cafes with a minute walk to grab a coffee and food. Reception staff extremely helpful and knowledgable. It's also the starting point for many Chat Tours, a great way to see the country's attractions, I took 4 tours and loved them all. There's an airport bus and the metro within 2 minutes walk, save yourself unnecessary expensive taxi fares. I loved my 6 day stay and will go back.
title: Good base in Athens.

review: we visited Hotel Amalia in June 2017 . The welcome was very warm , and even though we were way earlier than the regular check in time , owing to our anniversary on that day the front desk lady Julia was very kind to give us an early check in and a free upgrade of the room with a fantastic balcony and view . She also included the breakfast for that day for us and recommended a very nice place for our anniversary dinner . This made all the difference as such a warm welcome in the country started our vacation on a high note !! I will give 5 stars to Julia she is just super awesome , and to their customer service as well as they responded to our needs in a timely manner . However I will give 4 star to the hotel for the appearance of the hotel from outside and inside . The room we got was very nice with very clean and contemporary rest rooms however initially the AC was not working properly however they sent help immediately and the problem was fixed .Once again 5 stars totally for Julia and the staff's customer service .
title: Very good Hotel and located centrally

review: We stayed at the Amalia for two nights. The location is great to be able to walk to all tourist areas. Very good breakfast for most but can be a challenge for someone who is gluten free. Elevators are very small. The rooms were decent except for A/C challenges. The hotel staff are very friendly. 1st time to Athens but if we were to return I would not hesitate to stay here again. It is so close to Parliament that you can easily time seeing the changing of the guard routine.
title: Excellent Location

review: This hotel was very nice. The location is great, right next to the metro station and bus station. It is also centrally located for many tours. It was clean and the A/C worked well. The breakfast was one of the best breakfasts on our trip. There were many options.
title: Good hotel with a great location

review: If you are planning for trip to Athens and you don't want to spend alot of money on 5 stars hotel you defiantly must stay in this hotel.first of all : best location , very clean and comfortable ,healthy breakfast and very friendly and helpful staff .the national garden is opposite to the hotel. There are many small shops near by where you can buy water or snack .cosmote phone company is near by where you can get sim card .if we came again to Athens this is were we going to stay :))
title: Great Hotel

review: My second visit to Athens brought to the Amalia best on the wonderful reviews and read and the people are true. My previous stay was close by at a popular 5 star but I wanted to try something different and I'm impressed. The property is located well to trains, buses and taxis. Shopping is a two months minute walk to everything. First impression on checkin around 3pm was friendly and quick . The staff are open and want to help. I had a superior room on the sixth floor which had a large balcony and king bed. ( Parents: A note that the balcony has a low height barrier and I suggest kids should be supervised) . The standard of the room is good and clean including the bathroom and toilet . The breakfast spread is well done and would be similar to a 5 star buffet. I liked it so much that I booked again to visit in 7 day on my way back to the city.
title: It's soo cute and worth the stay

review: Did a little research but still largely flying blind because had not been to Athens and unfamiliar with Plaka but a real find. Great location, in relation to Plaka, the Gardens across the street, the metro, etc., etc. Staff were very accommodating and the rooms and breakfast were very nice.Would definitely stay there again.
title: Perfect

review: Stayed here before our cruise. Very easy to travel here from airport. We took the metro from the airport to a Syntagma Swuare and it was less than a block walk to the hotel which is across from the National Gardens. Excellent and varied breakfast buffet. The room was nicely appointed although we were out most of the day. Go up on the roof at night for an excellent view of the Acropolis and a Parliament building. This would make a great bar/ restaurant area. Not sure why it has. To been developed . It appears to be used for nothing.
title: Great central location

review: We enjoyed our stay here (clean room, comfortable bed, nice shampoo and very nice breakfast). It's well located in the heart of Athens from Acropolis and Plaka district for shopping. However, being well located, it's on the main street so it's noisy despite the double paned windows. We ended up having to move rooms to the back of the hotel which was quieter but if there's a house party in the back, then it's loud (depends on your luck).
title: Great location but can be loud with street noise

review: This Hotel exceeded my expectations. Unbelievable location...walking distance from quite a few important sites, as well as the Plaka shopping district. Very well maintained public areas as well as clean rooms. Also surprisingly quiet considering the fact that it's on a main street. I'd go back in a heartbeat.
title: Great Hotel!

review: We stayed at this hotel on two occasions within a week with a trip in between.The best attribute of this hotel is its location. It is just one block from Syntagma Square and the metro station. In fact, we hardly have to take the subway while we were there. Acropolis and its museum was just a short walk away and so is the flea market, Plaka and shopping district. The meeting points for both the walking tour we tooks was also a short walk.The room of this hotel was ample and clean. Its bathroom was also of a good size. There wasn't too much facilities in the hotel which is fine by us since we are out most of the time. The breakfast was sufficient but nothing to shout about.All in all, a decent hotel at a reasonable price in a great location!
title: Great location to explore Athens!

review: This time I invested in a deluxe room, which is value for money in a city where space and fresh air is rare. Great bathroom. The best bed! Lovely breakfast. Where else do you find a balcony this size in the center of Athens? Got the same room as last summer ❤️.Even more perfect when they remove the carpet and change some of the faded curtains...
title: Back Again!

review: I have just concluded my stay at Amalia Hotel. It has been quite a good experience for my friend and I who are traveling through the Athens area. It is in the Plaka district, which is a safe area in Athens, close to restaurants and shops and within a 15 minute walk to many of the historical sites. The rooms were very clean and the service has been impeccable (the front desk is always at the ready to pull out a map and trace your directions to your in-city destination). Their breakfast buffet was stacked with all types of goodies--for those who are watching their waistline to the fellow gourmand, there is a pretty good, and tasty spread for all (with some Greek goodies that can add to the cultural experience). Lastly, something that stood out to me was that the hotel provides breakfast boxes for travelers who have to depart the hotel prior to the breakfast buffet opening up. I really appreciated this type of hospitality, as it made our transition to our next destination that much easier. If I am ever able to come back to the area, Amalia Hotel will certainly be a place where I'd stay.Here is my ONLY con: The mattress was a little hard. That's it!
title: Great boutique hotel!

review: The best thing about the hotel is the location right next to the Acropolis museum (highly recommended) and a short walk from the Acropolis and all the attractions. The room was clean and basic (too few electric outlets) but the balcony was a plus, especially in the evening. Breakfast was adequate. The airport transfer suggested by the hotel, Welcome Pickups, was very useful.
title: Excellent location, view from balcony

review: This really is a very comfortable small hotel, beautifully clean with helpful and charming staff. The location couldn't be better for visiting the stunning Acropolis museum. For central Athens it is an oasis of calm and surprisingly quiet considering it's location...The rooms are small but perfect and I loved having a balcony.I very much recommend this hotel
title: So comfortable and a perfect location

review: Fantastic hotel in every way, great location, clean, comfortable beds, wonderful staff. Very elegant. Our room had a view of the Acropolis. Life doesn't get any better then that. Top notch in every way! Highly recommend!
title: Our trip to Greece

review: I have already reviewed this hotel,but having stayed in many other hotels during our Mediterrraneam holiday i would rate Philippos hotel as one of the best we experienced.Mid class price but top class all round.The rooms were spotless and the breakfast was excellent.top class service and the rooftop nighttime view of the acropolis was breathtaking Central location ,Gust below the Acropolis.
title: amazing at night

review: Our room was upstairs, but there is an elevator if needed. Staff is always available to help out if you need anything. Maps, advice...anything we needed was give to us. The deck outside our room was wonderful. Breakfast couldn't have been better. The Greek yogurt was amazing and there was always plenty to eat. Location was also perfect, so central to everything we wanted to see.
title: Very clean, staff very polite and the breakfast was the best!

review: We stayed at Philippos for only one night. The location is great if you plan to visit Acropolis. It is only a 10 minutes walk from the hotel. The rooms are ok. Our room had a small balcony. They are clean but not modern.Breakfast was average with the most basic things included. Overall a fine hotel for a short stay.
title: Superb location - Basic and clean rooms

review: Hotel was within walking distance to the places we were planning to visit. We walked everywhere, did not need a bus/metro which saved us some money. Staff was polite and accomodating. Rooms were clean and comfortable, we had a nice view of the Acropolis from our window. Breakfast had a nice variety and was well stocked. The only glitch is probably their wifi, slow and unpredictable.
title: Great location!

review: The location of this hotel is fantastic. A short stroll from the metro station will find you at their doors. It's in the heart of Plaka - wonderful for taking in the sights and sounds. And it's around the corner from the acropolis and the museum. The check in and check out were smooth. The chap on reception was lovely and efficient. The bathroom was next level teeny. I had to do some acrobatics to get in and shut the door. And the bathtub is an awkward shape with an inbuilt step, making showering a bit of a challenge. The breakfast was just OK. No stand out items. If the bathroom were larger and the breakfast better - this hotel would have received 5 stars from me.
title: Great location. Tiny bathroom. Average breakfast.

review: Booked this place for our trip to Athens. Got it as a steal!! The best & cheapest way to reach from airport will be to take the X95 express bus (right side of departure gate) and get down at Syntagma Square (last stop), this is almost an hour drive and take a taxi (1.8 kms to the hotel) P.S: Not many know this hotel by name due to its location, you need to specify that its on Aristogitonos lane. Alternatively you can take the Airport to Monastiraki by Metro (45 Mins ride) and 15 min walk to hotel, careful if you have lots of luggage as this station is filled with few 'strange' people who bombard tourists!!! Pros of ACS:- Colourful budget rooms with basic amenities, top floor ones offer a good view- Greek breakfast loaded with bread & cheese served from early hours- You can book your hop in hop off bus tickets at counter- Self service Tea & biscuits at the lobby- Great location to access and enjoy local food, street joints & Hard Rock CafeCons of ACS:- Very poor response to emails- They are under staffed (probably offseason may be)- Location does get lonely at night as its in between a market
title: A good hotel in city center

review: The hotel is perfectly located to visit Athen’s main attractions.
