You can easily walk to Monastiraki or the Acropolis, to the Syntagma Square, but also to the National Archaeological Museum (just to mention a few). The metro stations at Monastiraki and Omonia Square are just a five minutes-walk away. We came back to the hotel for the second time and stayed two nights as the first time. Our room was clean, the staff was very kind and helpful and the roof top terrace with its view to the Acropolis is just great.The door of the bathroom could not be closed well. And during the night from Saturday to Sunday it was quite loud outdoors (music).
title: What a view!

review: We really enjoyed the hotel breakfast and the bar on the roof. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The location was nice during the day but it was a little sketchy at night. Not far from metro station and good shopping.
title: Nice hotel, not the best location

review: My mom and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights prior to boarding our cruise ship in Piraeus. We arrived in the late and the staff was friendly and welcoming, quickly checking us in. The room was a bit small, but clean and was fine for just a couple of nights. There is a rooftop bar where you'd can get some great shots of the acropolis from a distance. Outside of the hotel entrance is a farmer's market when you can buy fresh produce like vegetables, fruits and even some souvenirs. The hotel is located near Monastiraki square, which is a great place to find restaurants/cafes, shops, and even some ancient ruins.
title: Good hotel in great location

review: The room was clean, comfortable with a good shower (good pressure and hot water). The breakfast buffet was varied and good. The staff was friendly and helpful. We were able to leave our luggage in a luggage room in the lobby when we arrived early and our room wasn't ready yet. They also offered us breakfast that morning even though we hadn't paid for it.
title: Good stay

review: Don't let the entrance to the hotel worry you - from the outside, set pretty much in a bustling market, the hotel seems like it's 2 star, but once you get to your room, you realise you truly made a great choice by staying here. We first got a room on the 2nd floor and had to ask to change rooms as the window was literally looking out directly onto another building, just a stone throws away. It was so claustrophobic we asked to change rooms and we were given the top floor room. Wow what a difference - we were literally looking at the Acropolis!!! The bed is comfortable, air-conditioning works well. Loved the laundry service where they do a whole bag of your laundry for a very small fee within 24 hours. The breakfast was excellent too, varied on different days with extremely friendly staff. The location is perfect, so close to everything, sensational local eateries right around the corner - wine bars, local shops, coffee shops, no tourists in sight! I would definitely come back if I could be guaranteed a higher floor room. The bar on the rooftop has wonderful views, just feels like it can do with some more decorating.
title: Ask for top floors

review: Great hotel for a quick stay in Athens - walking distance to tourist attractions, Monastiraki Square and Plaka neighborhood for great restaurants. Comfortable and safe, nice views from rooftop and good continental breakfast available in the morning.
title: Athens Center Square Hotel

review: Fantastic service, great location and excellent facilities. The breakfast is delicious and the beds and bathrooms are fantastic. Staff are so lovely and helpful in booking transport etc. would definitely stay here again!
title: Great new hotel to stay in Athens

review: Pros: - Close to everything. - Modern, clean rooms. - Two elevators. - A mini fridge. - Eggcellent breakfast . - Great roof bar. - Spectacular view from roof. - Helpful staff. - Adequate wifi. Cons: - Small rooms. - Thin walls.
title: Satisfied

review: Everything was great, service, freindly staff, great spot. The only fault was our bathroom wasa little small. It was clean and had tea, coffee and cold water for you to have in reception area when ever you wanted.
title: Great spot in Athens

review: We stayed in the hotel for three nights. It close to the center, however, the market in front of hotel doesn't provide nice atmosphere. The wifi did not work inside the room at all and we need to come down to lobby to be able to use internet. Breakfast is pretty good.
title: Just OK

review: The staff were extremely friendly and helpful The chef made some delicious Greek treats The location ie 5 minutes from Monstraki is perfect to visit all of the sites The rooms were clean and newly renovated-I stayed twice
title: Friendly staff

review: I spent two nights at the Athens Center Square Hotel as I wrapped up a business trip. It's about a 10 minute walk from the Monasteraki subway station, and also close for visiting the top sights in Athens. It's close to the city market, so vendors selling olives, dates, fruits, and vegetables are in front of the hotel entrance. Athens is a lively city at night, and while the ACSH is close to evening options, I found it quiet. The staff was friendly and helpful, and I was even delighted to have a surprise upgrade to an Acropolis view room on the 5th floor. The room was clean, comfortable, and convenient. There's plenty of counter space in the room for organizing and updated with plenty of plugs for charging all the devices we have these days. The bathroom is small, but it was updated and more than adequate. Lots of hot water in a comfortable shower.I loved Athens, and I'm eager to return on holiday. I will stay at ACHS again.
title: Great location and friendly staff

review: I have to say this was my first time in an Intercontinental hotel and it was absolutely beautiful.First of all the staff were very pleasant and helpful. Me and my partner have arrived very early at the hotel ( around 08:00) and after a significant effort from the front desk and the cleaning staff, we where in our room at 09:30 with normal check in time at 14:00. The room was very clean and specious. A lovely mini bar which was very helpful in the hot Athens days.The quality of furniture was in a mint condition.Location wise was very close to the city centre and there are different ways on traveling to and from the city centre. Hotel mini bus, tram ( 3 minutes walk) and taxi which are just outside the hotel with a cost around 5-8€The roof garden has a breathtaking view to Parthenon with the only problem the necessity of long trousers (dress code) Definitely the hotel we will book again in our next visit to Athens
title: exquisite

review: Stayed here for 2 nights bed and breakfast. The hotel is very modern and has a complimentary shuttle bus service into the centre of Athens. Our bedroom was adequately equipped and the king size bed was very comfortable. We were disappointed at breakfast in Cafe Zoe on both mornings because the hot food was actually either cold or just luke warm. Fortunately, there was plenty on offer in the cold buffet section but we would have liked to have eaten a hot breakfast. The staff in the restaurant were a little on the slow side to ask us what we wanted to drink. My husband prefers coffee and I prefer tea. However, tea was provided as a jug of hot water and a tea bag with a small jug of milk. The waitress asked my husband twice if he wanted a refill of coffee but declined to ask me if I wanted any more tea - it seemed to be too much trouble for them to provide the tea.We had dinner in the rooftop restaurant the first night which had panoramic views of the Parthenon lit up at night, which was very nice. However, expect to pay extortionate price as this was fine dining.
title: Hot breakfast was cold

review: The hotel mainly conference geared but as a family we did not fell that. Large lobby is welcoming and the staff were all great. Rooms a little dated but very clean and spacious. Food and snacks are pricy by comparison to almost anywhere in Athens. Pool was the real clincher as it offered a rest from the 35 plus degrees temperatures of the City. 5 Euros gets you the Acropolis in about as many minutes.
title: A little Oasis

review: We stayed recently for three nights. The hotel is large and comfortable but it is a bit old fashioned. The buffet breakfast is excellent and worth including. The wifi is free if you join the Intercontinental reward scheme. The pool was nice but there were not enough sun beds. There are two restaurants and a cafe but the prices are so high we couldn't afford to try them. The main drawback with the hotel is that it is too far away from the main sites of Athens. There is a free shuttle bus that runs to Syntagma Square every hour but it was a bit of a hassle to go out in the morning, back to the hotel for a rest or to escape the heat in the middle of the day, and then out again for dinner and back again at night. Ultimately, I wish we had stayed in the centre where we could walk to everything.
title: Location not ideal for tourists.

review: This hotel really gets service and perfectly looked after me and my family in Athens. They could not have done more to ensure a difficult situation was handled with real care, understanding and empathy. Couldn't ask for more and would never stay anywhere else in Athens.
title: Best of the best

review: Although the hotel is about a 20- 30 minute walk from the Plaka area, it is one of the nicest hotels in Athens. Beds are very comfortable and rooms are large with good air conditioning which is hard to find in Athens. Spend the extra money and get a club level room. The club level has breakfast every day which is very good along with snacks, canapes, drinks and desserts throughout the day. Sandwiches and wraps at lunch and free drinks in the evening. This made it very nice to wind down after a long day of sightseeing in Athens. Service was also very good and the club lounge had excellent views of the Acropolis and out door dining.
title: Splurge for the Club Level

review: We had a great experience on our first two nights in Athens. Hotel staff were great and always friendly. Rooms and hallways were well maintained. Lobby area was beautiful with very cool artwork. Well located and took advantage of the free shuttle. Would stay here again
title: Great Hotel with Great Service

review: I stayed in Room 384, from 11-17 June 2017.Upon checking in (it was already quite late at night), I had issues with my credit card and the hotel night Team Leader checked me in anyway, and helped me resolve the issue with the bank the next day. I found that very thoughtful of them. The hotel room was very spacious and well-appointed. I liked the decoration, the spacious bathroom and the toiletries provided had an excellent verbena scent which I loved. While it is quite a distance away from the city centre, the hotel does provide free shuttle to the parliament house area which is close to where the main shopping area is; Athens flea market. Definitely take advantage of this free shuttle and shop to your heart's content at the Athens flea market. It was a 20-minute walk from the hotel to the Acropolis, which I did. You cannot visit Athens and not hike up to the Acropolis! Buffet breakfast at this hotel is lovely....excellent selection of food, and I especially loved the rich chocolate log cake. The hotel concierge also helped arrange a day-cruise to 3 islands (Hydra, Poros, Aegina) for me on my last day of stay. The only drawback was, I was not issued a receipt after paying the hotel concierge for the trip, and when I reached the cruise ship, I was asked to pay again. After disputing and the cruise operator calling the hotel, I was finally allowed onboard.....I was the last person to board. So if you use this cruise booking service provided by the hotel concierge, do insist on a receipt. Apart from this one hiccup, the hotel service was excellent. I had a very comfortable and memorable stay at Intercontinental Athens.
title: Excellent Business Trip

review: Very nice hotel. Good location.Big rooms. Nice and clean. Very friendly crew and front desk. The pool is nice but a bit small with limited sitting place around it. Nice fitness room. Recommended hotel
title: Mr D

review: This hotel lives up to its brand name , the service is always pleasant the breakfast is great and the rooftop bar has a fabulous view . All this is to be expected from a 4 star establishment , however if you don't get a refurbished room the decoration is passable , the pool is too small , the drinks are expensive in the bar , €16 a mojito .Tip: nice little shop straight on and on corner right . For cheap local food go to Vassilis, right and follow signs .
title: Intercontinental

review: Stayed at this hotel for 10 nights visiting from Montreal for business. Lobby and rooms are very nice and clean, staff was extremely friendly and food from restaurants and room service was better than expected. They are not in central Athens, but they offer an hourly free shuttle service directly into the heart of the city (and back again) which we used frequently.A few drawbacks...walls were thin and we could often hear laughing from the adjacent rooms. Immediate surrounding area seems to be quite rundown.Only really frustrating thing was the Wi-Fi. I paid for 1 Mbps (which isn't much but all I needed to work). During the day it was fine, usually hitting around 2 Mbps. But between 7-11 PM, it was so slow it was completely unusable. I ran a speedtest and it was giving me significantly slower than even dial-up. It seems their internet cannot handle the traffic at night when people are in their rooms which meant I could not do my work.Apart from that, it was a very pleasant stay.
title: Great hotel and service

review: We stayed just one day/ night in 2 rooms and the hotel staff was courteous and helpful. The room was great value (about $110 E) and having stayed in 3 other hotels in Greece that were close in price, it was far superior. The room was much larger than standard and the decor, facilities and cleanliness were top class. The location was also really convenient to public transport and to drop off and pick up for tours. At short notice I decided to go on a tour on a day when some roads were closed for a state visit; the hotel staff very kindly helped source it and, in the interest of time, the hotel shuttle took me to a convenient meeting place for the tour. They also allowed us to check in early which allowed us to see more of Athens. I only had 2 meals there at an informal restaurent in the hotel ground floor and both were good.
title: Great service and accommodations

review: Have been there on business trips many times, at least 10 I would say, around 2013-4. This time I came back with my wife for a night, on our way to the islands. Always a great choice, can't let you down. Positioned very conveniently, can reach Sintagma square in 5 minutes thanks to the free shuttle bus service which runs like every 30 mins I think. Very grand, elegand, luxurious. They always leave a nice gift in the room which I ended up collecting! Strongly recommended!
title: Fantastic hotel

review: We stayed at this hotel for two nights with only one day to explore Athens.Firstly, the hotel. It was, on first appearances, very large and quite impersonal. However, the staff are very friendly and professional and the room was exceptionally well equipped, large and cool. We were on the first floor and a little disappointed not to have a view of the Acropolis but to be honest we were rarely in the room. You quickly negotiate the hotel and breakfast provided a very good choice of food and not just the usual; smoked salmon, freshly cooked eggs or omelettes and very well stocked fruit and cereals. If you want a traditional English breakfast, the options are there but we found the continental options much better as the bacon etc was not the warmest.Secondly, where to eat at night. If you turn right out of the hotel and then immediately right again, you will see a sign for Vassilios Taverna. It is worth a visit. Don't be put off by the area. The food there was very good and very reasonable. Rest on your first night if you are not sure where to go.Finally, exploring from the hotel. We had a taxi to the Acropolis at 8am and it cost €5. If you hold a student discount card (NUS Extra) - use it! Most of the tourist attractions are free for students and we worked out that we saved about €60, which was some saving. We also used the tram back to the hotel and then back into Athens in the evening for about €1.40 each per journey.
title: A great base to explore from and a very comfortable hotel

review: stayed there for 3 nights while touring in Athens . am an IHG member and always stay at IHG properties across all my travelling but have to say that this one was different from other intercon across Europe specifically !! the first 2 nights we had a superior room which was great then we're upgraded to a junior sweet with Acropolis views on the 3rd night and this was magnificent !!! didn't have breakfast there but couple times with room service which was so perfect . and ofcourse the rooftop Premier bar and restaurant made the stay even better . it is 15 minutes to syntagma square and Plaka district . the hop in hop off bus station is 2 minutes walking at the corner of the house and taxis are there 24/7 so you don't have to worry about transportation . staff are very helpful and this property has really a touch of luxury . couple things they need to look at , internet access which is different from otherr IHG chain hotel and their late night menu options which I found little bit limited ,other of that it was perfect . yes drinks and food there is quiet expensive so you might need to watch your budget .
title: Impressing !!

review: Stayed for 7 days with family. The breakfast was good with a good spread the only disappointing fact was that the spread remained absolutely the same for all the 7 days. The hotel is a good 10-15 minutes walk to Plaka or a cab for 4-5 euros. Or 4-5 minutes walk to the nearest metro station. The rooms were spacious with an extra bed for our little one. The room service was very good. The pool was nice. The coffee lounge Vienna was very nice. Overall a pleasant stay. However the only regret was that I couldn't manage a table in the roof top restaurant despite having tried on two different nights. Tried the guest relations if they could help but could not.I thought a 5 star hotel should have a mechanism to find a way to get a table for their guests who stays for 7 days !!!
title: Good hotel to stay in Athens

review: I stayed here for 6 nights with my two kids, and we had fun. The hotel rooms and facilities are great. However, I did find that the service was sub par. Often the reception desk was under staffed to handle the load, the concierge failed us twice when we wanted help. The first was when we wanted help with setting up our prepaid sim card, the concierge told us they didn't know how and referred us to the business center, where the staff there also said she didn't know how to do it. The second time was when I called the service desk and asked the staff to help me in calling for delivery from a nearby restaurant. He told me he was too busy to help as he was dealing with many other people at his desk. He could've have declined in a nicer way.The food was average as well.The room was good, but I had a terrible view on the first floor, try to get a higher floor for a better view.
title: Great Hotel, average service

review: I've stayed here a few times and am never disappointed. The rooms are immaculate, beds are super comfortable, bathrooms are high end. The spa is beautiful. Location is a bit off the beaten path, but cabs are right outside the door.
title: Luxury, polish, tranquility.

review: Decent hotel but having complained about the appalling wifi on last three visits will use another hotel next time I am in Athens for business. It's hard to fathom how a big hotel in a major city can have such poor wifi in 2017. Also they have they charge a daily rate of €16 for anything beyond the free 1Meg service. Forget trying to stream any entertainment and even basic web pages take forever to load. Useless!
title: Good hotel, let down by terrible wifi

review: Stayed there for a conference, for three nights. Comfortable rooms,and mine even had a view of the Acropolis! Couldn't really fault the hotel's facilities, and less than 20 minutes' walk to the Acropolis, but the area around the hotel is pretty run down given the hotel itself is so upmarket. Not helped by the bin strike while we were there, and I guess few guests tend to walk out, but didn't feel great.
title: Great hotel, but immediate location not that wonderful

review: I called 00 30 21 0920 6000 to see what complimentary spa treatments you would throw in for 2 business travellers booking 2 rooms for 7 to 9 nights. The signal on your phones are so bad that you could not hear me. I did not have such a problem with the Hilton...so why with you!!
title: Reservations number signal is crap

review: I started here prior to a cruise of the Mediterranean and it was great. A free shuttle to the plaka and a great view on the top floor of the acropolis. The breakfast buffet was delicious with fresh food and delicious Greek yogurt.The room was nice too and staff was friendly and accommodating. Got there at 9:00 am they were able to get us a room. I'd recommend this hotel, they even recommended a great restaurant near by with good Greek food.
title: Great hotel with great view of Acropolis

review: We stayed here for one night and it is a good hotel. Service was good from all staff that we encountered and we were upgraded to a suite on arrival which is always a nice surprise.The room was good - but there was some 'tiredness' to it - such as the fan above the shower having a huge crack around it. We also had to ask for the room to be re-cleaned as there were coffee splashes on the bathroom door - it looked like it had been turned-around quickly, but we did arrive earlier than planned so maybe that was why.My only criticism is of the pricing of food and drink. Coffees are 7.50 euros which is expensive for any hotel anywhere in the world (coffee was nothing special in terms of size or quality either) and a GnT from the minibar came in at 22 euros which in my opinion is just too much given the same is 6-7 euros in any bar in Athens.I have read this comment before from others and the hotel has responded that pricing is in line with other hotels in Athens. Just because others have crazy prices does not make it okay in my opinion. I believe It should be seen as an opportunity to offer better value than the competition rather than justification to over-charge. It also costs 10 Euros for WiFI which, given the room was over 200 Euros, should be included in my view.All in all a nice place to stay, but the refreshments offer very poor value for money.The Urbanaut
title: Decent but a little pricey?

review: The region has numerous derelict buildings all around as Grecian economy struggles, yet the prices inside this hotel are astronomical ie small bear and a vodka tonic 22 euros! And I know your paying for your surroundings but they were no different to any other hotel I regularly stay in. And although the rooms were nice its just kind of spoilt when you feel like you're being ripped off with the prices for everything. Profit isn't a dirty word but greed would be a more appropriate one. Such a shame that this is the main thing remembered on a hotel visit.
title: Nice, But Way Too Expensive on Extras, Especially for the Region.

review: The front desk was very helpful. The amenities were generally OK for an intercontinental branded hotel. The breakfast buffet selection was not very enticing. I had visited a few other competing hotel brands in the area within the same class and price range and the breakfast buffet here was the worst.
title: Standard Nothing To Write Home About

review: I have tried many intercontinental hotel and the hotel keeps its promises. The rooms are great, Clean, good, spacious and great breakfast. Service is generally efficient. We took a suite and a family room and stayed 4 nights overall. Concierge services are disappointing though. We asked for a restaurant and were proposed one with a nice view but food was really not good an nowhere like a Greek restaurant but more like a tourist trap. We also asked for a pharmacy on Sunday and were advised a pharmacy which was closed. Luckily The taxi had an app with all open pharmacies on Sunday and brought us there. He also advised us a great Greek restaurant walking distance from the hotel. We also didn't get our luggage from airport and asked the concierge to help but we didn't get any news. Luckily the airport sent the luggage 24 hours later. Concierge services need some action plan....
title: Great hotel - disappointing concierge services

review: Not bad hotel however I would prefer to stay closer to the center. We always took a taxi in so not a great location.However the hotel was lovely - as we were out all the time it was enough for was we needed.It was clean which is always an issue and it had a gym which is what I look for in a hotel.Would I stay there again - yes if you could pick up the hotel and move it closer
title: Nice hotel

review: We stayed for 4 nights on mid July. The room we booked was really spacious with a very nice balcony overviewing Akropolis. Clean and a good service from the Club upstairs. The only issue for this hotel is that is not in center but you can still get the bus shuttle to Sintagma every half hour.Will be back soon.
title: Spacious Clean good service

review: The service is excellent and there is a beautiful pool. This is a good hotel for families with children. The rooms are large and the staff is very attentive and courteous The neighborhood is a bit weird but it is not far from all the main attractions and is and easy to access.
title: Great hotel

review: We spend 5 nights in this hotel, and we were pleased especially with the Club lounge services, our room, pool and hotel gym. Also the rooftop bar is nice in the evenings offering great views to the city. Our room was spacious with nice views to the Acropolis, and it was always kept very clean by the staff. Beds are comfortable. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We used the complimentary shuttle bus to Syntagma few times, but also taxis were (everywhere) easily available. The shuttle / taxi drive to Syntagma takes ~5 mins, and taxi costs <5 euros. Overall a very good stay!
title: Successful visit

review: The hotel is really nice, room was lovely and very spacious. The area the hotel is locate isn't the nicest but it isn't far to walk to the tourist areas. Everything we needed was there but food in the lounge was overpriced and not very interesting.
title: Quick 2 night stop on our way to the islands

review: Ok, so this was part of our family trip, right after our wedding in Cyprus and then a beautiful stay in Crete. We were to spend 3 nights in Athens prior to flying back home. My parents and sister were accompanying us. Therefore, I have booked 2 rooms about 5 months in advance. Informed the hotel that this was a special occasion. From my profile they knew that I was top tier Spire Elite Royal Ambassador within their chain of hotels. Here are my comments:- Although they claim that there is special check-in for elite members on the club floor, we had to wait exhausted at the reception in the line-up before they could speak with us. Not the right level of treatment.- They told me that my personal room got upgraded to the club floor, which is a given benefit of this tier anyway. However, my parents' room got a 2 level upgrade, but no club floor and no club lounge. I have called the guest relations and the duty manager and have asked nicely whether they can at least give club lounge access for my parents, seeing that this was a special trip. Lots of talking from them, but bottom line was a "No" and even the GM the best he has done was to offer a 20% discount for the club lounge. This was a first for me in many years with IHG. Thumbs down to you guys.- Yes, the view from the balcony at the Club Lounge was amazing. We could see Acropolis, however, we couldn't all enjoy it as a family. "Thanks" to the hotel.- The swimming pool is way too small in terms of its size and the sunbeds, considering that they claim to be the largest hotel in Athens with over 700 rooms. Thumbs down on planning.- Concierge: We ask about the hop-on hop-off bus tours and he sends us on the hotel shuttle to the main square to take that bus, whereas later we found out that there is stop right in front of the hotel. "Forgot" to mention it? - What you don't see in the pictures on the hotel's website is that it is located in the area surrounded by shady businesses and by "night" clubs. Graffitti everywhere.- The hotel exterior as well as the rooms look to be in need of renovation. After getting used to the extremely nice hotels belonging to this chain, I was quite disappointed and definitely wouldn't call it a 5-star property.- Overall, I found the service to be a fake pleasant without real recognition of loyal customers. They certainly didn't go above and beyond for us.- I do not recommend it and I wouldn't give it a second chance either.
title: Hotel in need of renovation and with poor recognition of loyal customers

review: Such an amazing hotel with all commodities. The pool is not really amazing and it can get really hot in there, however the strong asset for this hotel is its staff. Everybody is extremely nice and smiling and welcoming, from reception staff to housekeeping. Also the hotel is located just 10 min driving from town centre and has a great shuttle service for his guests.
title: Lovely hotel, amazing staff

review: The hotel is big, efficient and good. Family room was big. Location is ok but it's only a short taxi from the centre and there is a shuttle bus back and forth. But why, in this day and age would you not give free wifi? It feels a little churlish for a 5 star hotel to try and make a few euros on this. The best hotels don't.
title: Why no free wifi?

review: Ok don't know where to start , location: you are in the middle of a bad slum aerea and not 5 minutes from the center , no cafes and restaurant around .We stayed in a suite for 250 euros per night and I'm telling you that I felt to stay in 90s hotel , very old furniture, bad bed , old linen , no lights on the balcony , the view was a disaster , the acropolis very fare way too , the bathrooms super old no even a soap rest to put your soap.Very noice room with street noice too. The housekeeping they miss the service couple times don't know why . They never replace the coffee and the water in the room .The hotel I think must have at list 400 rooms and when you go to the main and only pool they only have around 30 beds , we went back to our room few times because no beds and no towels . Let's talk now about Food and Beverage, we checked in around 10pm the first night and my wife and I we are Vegan , so what we did we asked the room service and Vegan menu or at list a vegetarian menu and after 30 minutes they told us that there's not a special menu for Veg but you can check on the IRD menu , the story cut short they had only fruits , steam rice and boiled vegetables , at the end we had few tomatoes salads and hummus with some brown bread. This is was the meals we had for few days before I realize I need to start order some delivery from outside . We ordered few delivers and the hotel they don't allow them to entry the hotel be ready to collect your food outside .They have only one menu between the room service , cafe in the lobby and pool bar. If you fancy fresh juices by the pool they only offer orange juice ( not even in the season now ) maybe a water melon juice ??? I don't know seriously what the FB director is doing there .I don't want to talk about the prices ( 1 veg pasta and 1 dakos salad with no cheese be ready to pay 35 euros ) . Crazy expensive.I used the laundry to dry clean 3 shirts for 33 euros and they shredded one shirt too , we tried to tell during our check out and they totally ignore us saying we need to see shirt.The message to the full hotel is guys you need to learn hospitality first and then you can run a hotel . I have many few more points but I don't want to go in more details .Intercontinental do something with this property Good luck
title: Probably the worst hotel ever

review: Lovely place to stay. Very nice interior, very central with great breakfasts. Room was a little small, but that is probably typical of Athens. Staff were very friendly and helpful and gave good suggestions as to where to eat.
title: Great place to stay

review: Perfect location in the heart of Plaka. Close to everything, shops , restaurants, and transportation. Great staff,so helpful with directions. Rooftop bar and restaurant with amazing view of the Acropolis. Delicious food. Syntagma square just a couple blocks away.
title: Beautiful view of Acroplis

review: The location was brilliant, you were almost everywhere within a short 15min walk. Rooms are tiny! The lift was the smallest I've seen in my life and the wifi barely worked in the room. The staff however were all so helpful, from the front desk to the breakfast team. The rooftop bar was always full but we could find a spot to get a few pictures of the acropolis which was stunning.
title: Average stay but great location

review: My title to this review sums up my stay for this hotel in Athens. My only critical aspects of this review has more to do with the room we stayed in. The room was not overly spacious and the mattresses were firm to hard.The cleanliness of the room was excellent.The staff at the front desk were very professional and helpful, the cafeteria staff was also top notch as was the staff at the roof terrace bar. The view from the roof terrace bar was spectacular and I would definitely book this hotel again in the future.
title: Hotel, Staff, Location, Excellent!

review: I think Americans need to temper their expectations when they travel to Europe. Was the room small? Absolutely. Athens is a city that is literally thousands of years old and this hotel is in the heart of it. We walked through the Plaka and had a fabulous dinner. There's a rooftop hot tub and restaurant at the hotel too. The breakfast was amazing. It had anything you could think of. The staff spoke English.Pros: You can basically walk anywhere from here. We took the subway from the airport and walked from Sygmata square here. Maybe 10 minutes? We had giant luggage and managed just fine. The hotel is air and that worked really well.Cons: Yes. It is a small room.
title: Can't beat the location, Staff was friendly, breakfast was great

review: You know what they say: location,location,location. This is the Central hotel in one word. It is the perfect location to explore all Plaka has to offer: street restaurants, shops, Acropolis, Temple of Zeus., Museums. And yes the roof top bar is all its cracked up to be. Cool view, cool cocktails, cool service. You can also sit inside the bar with aC and still get the great view. The elevator ....oh the elevator. I can live with the smallness, 3 people max load, What had me pulling my hair out was the pace....Sooooooo Slow.... Rooms were modern and had a recent update which included: marble shower, wood floors,and new deco. Cool little hotel in an awesome locaTION.
title: Great location,

review: We stayed here on our last night before we flew back home from vacation and honestly weren't expecting much. This is a very average hotel - nothing special. It's located between Monistiraki Square and Syntagma Square. The room is average but it's important to note that the bed is absolutely horrendous..probably the most uncomfortable bed we've been in throughout greece. It was two twin beds put together. The wifi at the hotel is pitiful. Shows full strength but will take forever, if at all, to bring up a single webpage or anything else. The breakfast is ok but shouldn't really expect much wherever you are in Greece unless you go out. The rooftop terrace is amazing. Perfect view of the Acropolis and has a very nice feel up there. If you're looking for a hotel with this type of rooftop then maybe stay here. If you're looking for the whole package then probably look elsewhere.
title: Beautiful rooftop patio

review: I am not sure how this hotel is getting anything over 2 star reviews here. The location? Yes, it's great. The hotel...not so much. The bed was so hard we could hardly sleep & the room was so tiny that we couldn't even move our luggage into the room. The wifi worked as fast as a slug walking backwards at best. We had been so excited to stay here based on reviews we had read, but were unfortunately disappointed with our stay. Pros: Staff & locationCons: just about everything else
title: What are we missing?

review: I really liked this hotel. I was only here one night but the entire staff was very helpful and accommodating. The street looks a little rough with graffiti and a homeless man sleeping in the street but I can attest that it is really a easy location to everything!! A lot of Athens can seem a little rough but this hotel is a nice little spot for a great stay.
title: Great Location in Athens

review: Not near anything famous and soft beds are the minor complaints. Charging guests for Wi-Fi felt really cheap. I expected to be able to stay online during my stay without being charged extra to do it.On the plus side, the breakfast was fascistic and the customer service was impressive. The staff was very polite and helpful when we asked a question or needed some advice.
title: Probably better choices out there

review: -nice view - the parthenon - from our room-good variety of breakfast -spacious clean room-shuttle bus from hotel to syntagma square is very useful -wi-fi for free since I am an IHG member-overall I had a good stay :)
title: Spacious clean room

review: I have been here before so my obvious choice was this hotel inside the cityThe rooms are very immaculately maintained and the shower is amazing here.The breakfast was one of the most lavish ones i have seen in europe and i enjoyed it each morning. Only dissapointing factor was the spa. The message was very dissapointing for the price which they charged. Do not use their Spa it is a waste of good moneyApart from this the hotel is fantastic. Will come again
title: Good hotel in Athens

review: Me and my son spent two wonderful nights at this hotel/We had accomodation at club lounge and it was great.Delicious breakfast, great choice of starters all he day.My son sometimes have problems to eat smth...but not at this place.He always find something for him.And specialy l want to mark the comfortable matrasses and pillows.You can fell like in a clouds ...Room was cleaned twice per day,like all hotels of this class.Never mind that is not in the center,it takes 7-10 min to go there by comfortable tram without any problem/They also have free shutle from hotel for the center
title: Two perfect nights

review: Pay the additional charge for a view of the Parthenon on the Acropolis from your room. Each night, when I rolled over, I could see lights on the Parthenon.... It looked like a painting, but it was actually my hotel window. Worth every penny! Hmmm..... the rest of the hotel: a little dated, but they do a good job keeping it clean and modern. Bathroom was luxurious, with thick towels and strong water pressure. Breakfast buffet was delicious.
title: View of Acropolis from your Room

review: We spent one night in Athens and the hotel location was great. The room was a good size and nicely furnished. The bathroom was not well laid out and difficult to manoeuvre the shower was located in the narrow bath and it was extremely slippery and only had a shower curtain which constantly stuck to you. The room was not very soundproof and every time someone left their room you could hear every noise. Breakfast was pleasant with the usual yoghurt, scrambled eggs, assorted cakes and pastries.The hotel reception smells of cigarette smoke.The view from the rooftop bar is fantastic!
title: Great location

review: My husband and I recently spent 3 nights at Central Athens Hotel. We are very pleased with our decision to stay in this hotel. The rooms are spacious (by European standards), clean, and modern. The staff is very friendly and were helpful with any of our questions about the city or traveling in the area. The rooftop bar was excellent! We made a point to have at least one drink there every evening of our trip, and we were never disappointed by the drinks or the view. In addition, we very pleased with the complimentary breakfast buffet. You get a wide variety of choices including those that are tourist-friendly and more authentic Greek dishes. Central Athens will even pack you a breakfast if you must depart before the buffet opens, as was the case with our last day.We found the location to be fine. It is an easy walk (5 minutes) from the Syntagma metro station which is a major stop for most modes of transit to and from the airport. It is also less than a 10 minute walk to the major flea market area of Athens, which we loved! The walk to the Acropolis was a bit longer, but it could not have been more than 15 minutes. Evidently Athens is currently (Summer, 2017) experiencing some domestic unrest, but we never felt unsafe during our stay.The only problem that we have with the Central Athens Hotel is the spottiness of their wifi. It is free, but it is also incredibly unreliable. Just be aware.
title: Beautiful Rooftop View & Great Breakfast!

review: As the saying goes , it's all about the location, location, location. This hotel is within walking distance to ALL sites. You can even walk to kolonaki and then head straight up to lycavitos. (wear comfortable shoes). In addition to having a centralized location, it's views of the acropolis ate breathtaking, especially at night. Rooms are small but clean and equipped with wifi and strong air conditioning. Breakfast is always included and the array of Delicious food will leave you amazingly stuffed. Check out my pictures. Front desk always professional, cheerful, and willing to help. ADVICE: Have the front desk call you a taxi any time needed. Never hail a taxi on your own. Most cab drivers are crooks.
title: Perfect Location

review: We found the Central to be a very pleasant surprise.Well located (walking distance to the Plaka and Monistriaka areas, 5 minutes walk from Syntagma Square where the airport bus operates from) and lots of restaurants nearby.Very clean and modern stylings in the hotel.Our room was compact but comfortable. Bathroom is well done.The big feature that we loved was the rooftop terrace bar/restaurant. The view to the Acropolis is fantastic and a great place to relax at night. Food prices are good for their limited menu, but after each long day's tourist tramping, we loved it. Staff are exceptionally and genuinely friendly.We'd give it a 5-star rating except for one thing.We lodged a minor maintenance request at reception on day one and it still was not attended to when we left three days later!Anyway, we would definitely stay there again if we return to Athens.
title: Central & with a great view

review: We stayed at the Central Athens Hotel for 5 nights at the end of March. The hotel was in a great location, perfect for sightseeing. We booked bed and breakfast and requested a Acropolis view. The room was really nice not huge but perfectly adequate for what we wanted. The room was lovely and clean with clean towels daily. The breakfast was lovely with a really good choice of hot and cold food.The reception desk staff were really helpful and knowledgable.
title: Beautiful Athens

review: We didn’t really know what we were getting when we reserved rooms at this hotel but we were soon to be very happy.The information said the hotel had a view and it sure does.The elevator holds three bags and a thin woman but the stairs are convenient.The rooms are small but nice and the air conditioner works.The workers were helpful and friendly, especially Katarina.The terrace on the 5th floor could use some umbrellas and other items to make it more comfortable, we still enjoyed beer on the terrace with a great view of the Acropolis, met some other travelers from other countries, sat next to the pool, had decent breakfasts, and could walk any and everywhere we needed, including to the Acropolis. There is plenty of shopping, eating and site seeing within walking distance. I would stay at this hotel again without hesitation.
title: A place I will come back to.

review: We stayed for two nights (a couple and a child) and we enjoyed our stay there. We had a single bed in our room for our child and the room still felt spacious enough--even though most properties in the area are matchbox-size. The breakfast buffet was really good too.The hotel is not super centrally located, but with a cab, it's only a few euros to the city center.
title: Enjoyed our stay there!

review: Great a little out of the centre however a cab ride costs 6 euros. We stayed at this hotel due to an absolute nightmare apartment Appolonos ( no power, no curtains dreadfull avoid at all cost)Staff found us 2 rooms at the last minute they were really helpful, breakfast was great, even cooked me an egg white only omelet.Would highly recommend.
title: Great last minute saving grace stay

review: i was lucky they upgrade my room to suite and it was perfect the breakfast was very good . It is a very good hotel clean and near the city center The service also was very good the staff was very polite
title: very GOOD HOTEL

review: Booked the Divani Caravel for one night as a stopover on the way to somewhere else, and have to say it was great. Hotel was clean and well-appointed, staff were (very) friendly, helpful and efficient. Location was great (try Oroscopo restaurant round the corner) and the kids loved the roof top pool. Hotel offers valet parking for 21 euro
title: Very good, very friendly, very professional

review: Good location and service, however for the price it was not up to scratch.All services are mentioned ie pool, gym spa etc.However only the pool is free for use. The gymnasium they want Eu15 to use which i thought was very expensive considering what I paid for the room.would avoid in the future.
title: Adequate

review: Hotel looks nice, pool has great views, but customer service sucks and it reaks of cigarettes. Our first room was nice, clean and updated, however the hall and our room filled with cigarette smoke from our neighbors. We called the front desk to complain since the entire hotel was non smoking. They sent a bell boy up, he claimed he couldnt smell anything, but admitted he was a heavy smoker. Im not one to complain just to complain, this was A LOT OF SMOKE. It was 11pm at night, you could hear our neighbors awake partying and it was clear the smoke was coming from their room. The bell man said he couldnt knock on their door because it was too late at night, and also he couldnt prove it was them smoking since he didnt smell it!! He did recommend that we could switch rooms. We said "Yes please!" Silly me expected them to arrange the room switch for us and help with our bags. Instead the bell man walked away and we stood there with no direction. We called back down to the front desk and they said If we wanted to switch we would have to come down to the front desk to do so! Its now 11:30pm, switching rooms was YOUR suggestion, and now I have to pack my things and go down to the lobby to get assigned a new room. I was less then thrilled. To make matter worse they down graded us to a very old room that looked as if it hadnt been updated since 2000. Also dont plan to get any spa services done, there is only one person who runs the entire thing. My husband and I wanted to get massages after a long 7 days sailing the med, we could only do the service back to back since the person who gives the massages, facials, manicures, pedicures, ect, also works the front desk. We went through with it any way, very disappointing massage, not worth 100 euro.
title: Unhelpful staff, full of smoke, but a beautiful looking hotel in a good location

review: Rude staff from the very beginning- was told off as I was the third person to ask for 2 beds when given a queen bed- hardly appropriate to share with my 16 year old son! Was then ungraciously switched to a smoking room and when she acknowledged it was indeed a smoking room then tried to blame her colleague for giving me the wrong room to start with. Couldn't be bother to move a fourth time but room was on a noisy street.. 'shuttle bus ' to town is a ridiculously infrequent service at stupid times... Gym was denied my 16 year old as he needed parental supervision ( not to mention the 12 euros extra when already paying a reasonable sum for an average room. Then after room was serviced no bath towels were in the room and it took a phone call and several attempts before they finally materialized ( and then only one at a time) and with bad grace ... I would never stay here again and would certainly not recommend anything about this hotel apart from the rooftop pool ( but make sure it's before 9 pm! because then the staff come and almost pull the deck chair out from under you...)
title: Dreadful soulless hotel with unhelpful staff with attitude...

review: Stayed here for 2 nights and would definitely recommend it! The staff would really helpful and friendly. Spent a relaxing afternoon sunbathing by the rooftop pool while having drinks served to our sun loungers from the pool bar. The room was spacious and came with bath robes and slippers .... felt quite luxurious! My only negative comment is that breakfast was charged at €29 per person which is crazily expensive and not worth it so we just booked a room without the breakfast included.
title: Good experience!

review: We stayed at Divani Caravel during our stay in Athens. This is a 5 star hotel and had all the amenities you would expect from a 5 star hotel. The customer service was great. They helped us with all of our requests. The hotel is a 10 minute walk to metro. Also, there are lots of cabs parked outside the hotel. Mount Lycabetus is an 8 minute drive from the hotel and the Acropolis is 3 metro stops away. We didn't try the food at the restaurants so I can't comment on that.
title: Nice hotel

review: It gives me great pleasure to review the stunning Divani Caravel Hotel, Athens. Last week my family and I had the pleasure to call the property home whilst visiting the beautiful capital city of Greece. Upon our arrival we were professionally and promptly greeted by concierge and reception staff. Our suite was that of above and beyond expectation and quality, that was comfortable, and spacious. We could unwind within the suite with ease; it contained 2 flat screen televisions, a dining and lounge area including a very spacious bathroom. The property is beautifully maintained, spotless throughout- and reception is grand- it's a breathtaking enormous grandeur space with high ceilings and a stunning chandelier that captures your attention upon entry. Kudos to the management and staff in entirety for your hospitality and services offered to us, whilst we stayed with you. Everybody from check in, through to house keeping, food and beverage services were brilliant, and executed excellent and above and beyond customer service. You all made us feel right at home. Our experience was indeed sublime. The roof top pool is very memorable for our family- and the food, cocktails, and stunning uninterrupted view of Athens and the Parthenon unforgettable, breath taking. Breakfast was delicious, and the complimentary bedside slippers for us all, including the chocolates and turning down service every evening was a wonderful addition to our stay. Perfectly located in Athens, lots of cafes and restaurants located right next to the property- but do yourself favor and savor the Divani Caravel's Club Sandwich by the pool- absolutely delicious! Furthermore, the hotel is only minutes walk away to Evangelismos Subway Station- that takes you to the famous Athens Flea Markets (Monastiraki) and Ermou Shopping etc.- only 2 stops away. Excellent link to get you there. Based on our experience and based of the above mentioned qualities, it gives me much pleasure in highly recommending the Divani Caravel Hotel Athens to anybody wishing to appreciate quality accommodation whist visiting Athens. A quintessential property that has class and sophistication- a comfortable destination who's staff provide warm and professional hospitality and services. Congratulations to the Divani Caravel Hotel Athens. We sincerely look forward to coming 'back home' to you when we next travel to Athens. Our sincere thanks and appreciation.
title: A Quintessential Destination

review: We were two families of four with some of us staying 4 nights and other 3 nights. Overall we were very happy with the Divani Caravel. The rooms were very good sized, although we had expected that the triple rooms would have had a true bed for the 3rd person, not a sleeper sofa.The breakfast, as mentioned is overpriced for what you get if you pay out of pocket, but was actually very reasonable when you booked the room with it included.The roof-top pool was very nice, although we were a bit surprised at the cooler temperature of the pool (especially given how hot it had been in Athens the two weeks before we arrived).Customer service was excellent and they were very helpful in the one area where we ended up having some disappointment/confusion. Because the people in our party had been in Europe from 1-2 weeks already, we had specifically looked for someplace with laundry. Ultimately this is more of an Expedia issue than a Divani one, but arrival we learned that they have a rather expensive external laundry service, not the self-service laundry facility we were expecting. However, the front desk was very helpful in finding a small local laundry shop that we ended up using and being very happy with.Our first night there we were quite tired and ate dinner at the hotel restaurant. Overall I would say it was good. Nothing special, but it certainly hit the spot and let us get to bed earlier than if we went somewhere else.As for food options there are several very good places literally around the corner from the hotel, several of which we did end up eating at.Overall we had a very nice stay at the Divani Caravel.
title: Very nice hotel

review: Other reviews say this hotel looks like an 80's palace. The vibe I got was more the 1960s: somewhat mod decor and lots of smoking. The location is a bit out of the way; it is not really within walking distance of what you want to see in Athens (the Acropolis or the Plaka district). The room had a hard bed and a narrow tub, and we were surprised by how easily we could hear our daughters talking in their room when we were knocking on their door. The staff did not seem all that interested in making our stay enjoyable. Thankfully, our breakfast was included; I can't see paying what they ask (close to $30/person) for it. We won't be staying here again.
title: If you like Mad Men, you'll like this hotel

review: We had a nice experience and enjoyed the family suite. No real complaints. The views are incredible on the rooftop pool, the location is central, staff was nice. Decor is grand and over the top, maybe a bit too old school. But you're paying for an inflated brand name. Everything is at a premium. Drinks and breakfast is ridiculously priced. Nothing special to account for these prices. For a 5 star hotel you would think that they would regularly pick up dirty dishes that lay in the hallways!Some cute little cafés and restaurants in the area.
title: Good experience but way too expensive for no reason

review: I am staying at the hotel as I right this review. I originally picked this place as the internet is offered for free. I have not been able to stay connected to the internet for any length of time. My iPhone and iPad will not stay connected. I called the operator and she stated it was due to high usage. In our bathroom I can easily hear the people in the next room. Over all the rooms are clean. We have a boombox in our room for some reason. Little odd smell when we walk in but after that we can't smell anything. There are some great places to eat just outside so that is a plus.
title: Poor internet and sound proofing

review: Just a rather ridiculous place - stupidly over-priced for everything (€20 just to park in the hotel car park, €29 each for breakfast and €8 for a small glass of milk for our toddler)! & just somewhat up itself with no obvious reason & absolutely no charm. The pool was poor, the obligatory bag carrying felt agressive, the staff were pompous & there was a weird thing where someone came in to put a piece of paper on the floor beside the bed. Not sure what that was about, but it made me feel our room was not private. The room was cramped,the bathroom big but badly designed. All in all - go somewhere else!
title: Tacky

review: To be fair, I want to say that we only stayed here for 7 hours because we had to leave early for the airport the next day. My spouse and I checked in easily, but when I asked for the WIFI password, I was told that it normally costs. The lady was nice enough to give it to us because she noticed that it was our anniversary. When we made it to our executive room, I noticed that it was a SMOKING room, which was a surprise to me. We had a view of what seemed to be a medical hospital, and the shower was part bath and not very spacious. I did like the width of the bed, that there was a safe in the room, and the night service folded back the sheets and set out the slippers next to the bed. I cannot attest to the gym, lounge area or breakfast, as we didn't experience any of those in our time there. I just wasn't impressed considering it was a 5 star hotel, and I probably wouldn't stay here again.
title: Average Room-Full of Smoke & Bad View

review: We stayed here for 2 nights and the room was excellent - very spacious, very clean and comfortable with a queen bed. The staff are very helpful and accommodating as well. Unfortunately the only issue we had was the noise. Room doors have no soundproofing at all and the walls between rooms are good but noise still comes through. This meant that on our first night when the hotel was busy due to a conference we hardly got much sleep as we could hear the people walking down the corridor or talking in the corridor, the elevator ping when opening/closing, doors opening/closing etc. Our neighbouring room also had noise (music and people talking) which wasn't exceptionally loud but due to the poor soundproofing it still kept us up and ear plugs didn't particularly help. We called reception and they did talk to them after which point it was better but it still wasn't great due to the other noises. The second night when most people from the conference had left we managed to sleep better but the noise still travels through the room doors so I don't think I will be staying there again soon, I like my sleep too much!
title: Great hotel but noisy!

review: Stayed for a business conference. Property is good but rooms are very small & just Ok. Cant rate as a 5 star property.Breakfast spread out was great but there was no Live egg counter. Omlettes & eggs were laid out in buffet & were hence cold. First time no live egg counter not seen in a 5 star hotel.Funniest thing I experienced the cups & saucers from the room were taken away the next morning by housekeeping. When requested them for the same were told to request the room service. Same thing happened the next day as well. What a wierd service. Aren't cups & saucers meant for guests in the room ?Only saving grace were the reception staff who were very cooperative & helpful in organising our sightseeing tour.Can find better hotels at similar rates
title: Not a 5 Star Hotel

review: Stayed here 4 nights. Thank goodness Athens is amazing because the hotel was not. The hotel looks like on 80's palace and certainly not been updated since. The room was very basic with poor quality linens. My biggest complaint would be the smell of smoke everywhere. Guess Athens is still a smokers paradise but you'd think in a '5' star hotel there would be non smoking areas. At times it stank on our non smoking floor ...Avoid the ludicrous 27 per person euro breakfast. There are 3 nice cafes next to the hotel.
title: Not a 5 star. Smokers paradise

review: There's nothing unique about this place,neither something standing out above average...its fine for a short stay...the buffet breakfast is good and the rooms are spacious but the view from the windows isn't great and also the people at the reception weren't friendly...wouldn't hurt if they welcomed with a smile :)
title: Not bad

review: We stayed with family for 2 nights back in Oct 2016. Hotel location is quite convenient, only 10-15 min by foot from main attractions, in the quiet area. If you are lucky to stay on top floors (as we did) you will have picturesque views of Athens including even Acropolis. Being Leaders club members we were upgraded to Suite on top floor - with big living room, nice separate bedroom and huge terrace overlooking Athens. We did have a king bed which however was not extremely comfortable. Other than this all the amenities you would expect form 5 star hotel were in place. WiFi was free and of good quality. Breakfast was sumptuous, while just ordinary good breakfast, nothing exceptional. We also did use the rooftop swimming which was nice with very interesting feature - if you go outside and down 1/2 floor you can see people swimming through several big window in the pool - very nice touch. Views from rooftop pool are unbeatable - you have 360 panorama of whole Athens. Service was at all times friendly and staff was always trying to be helpful. All in all we did have very nice experience.
title: Very good experience in Athens

review: Before I booked this hotel I researched and read all the reviews good and bad. I figured I will take a chance since I was going to be in Athens for three days. From the piraeus port to the hotel the Taxi ride cost 28 Euro. Upon arriving to the hotel the bell hop greeted up and took our bags, the checkin was simple and easy.. breakfast ia 29 Euro's per person. I stayed on the 6 floor the view was terrible. My room faced the back of buildings. The was clean and everything was in place. The hotel provide shuttle service to the city center(The driver was extremely helpful and very informative, I wish I remember his name) the times are perfect starting at 8pm and the last pick up is 7:30. The shuttle service has two stop. The first stop is at the McDonalds where you can shop at H&M, Zara and other fine store the second stop is close to the Acropolis museum. The hotel is located in a area where plenty of restaurants are around in walking distance. One of favoriterestaurant was the Tavern second restaurant on your right. The food was amazing the vegetables soup is everything. Simply burgers was also a nice place to eat for under 10 erous. All in all my stay at the hotel was okay I made the best of it. They can extend your check out time if you ask in advance. In Athens.. plenty of walking, drink coffee and eat spinach pie.Ps.. the swimming pool comes in handy after a long day of touring Athens. The pool close at 9m. Drinks are a bit expensive.
title: Just Okay.

review: very nice hotel with nice room and very good service from the staff. nice breakfast. the wifi is good ( no top ) but good . it is a good idea for the : value for money. i recomendeed it to all of you .
title: very good

review: Friendly and reliable staff.Great food, Great shower the kind we are use to in the states!ATM machine in hotel which is quite rare for hotels in Greece. Family owned for years and for a Greek -American that ravels to Greece every year and has stayed at many hotels in Athens this is going to be your best bet for the price.Roof top pool small but at least they have one.Great view of the city.
title: Great Hotel for price

review: Really enjoyed time at this hotel last week - friendly staff always there to help out and recommended local restaurants and places to go. We always used the free shuttle bus to go into centre (runs from outside the hotel and drops in Syntagma square) but only a 20 minute walk so hotel is in brilliant location. The hotel offers free wifi and has great rooftop pool with amazing view over to Acropolis and 360 degree views over the city. It is a little small and the pool bar is very expensive though. The breakfast was 25+ euros so we didn't have this. Great stay .. Recommended.
title: Enjoyable stay for few nights in Athens

review: Hotel has an 80's look and feel, despite some rooms being renovated. Rooms and facilities were clean and sufficient but nothing special. Pool area has nice views but limited sun-beds capacity for hotel size. Service was slow and not very friendly compared to other five star hotels in Athens.
title: Average

review: My sister and I stayed at this beautiful hotel during our stay in Athens. This is by far the best hotel in Euope that we stayed at (comparable prices to 3 or 4 star hotels) so far. It is located in a quiet area outside the hustle and bustle of the city. There are not too many eating options at the hotel and is it quiet pricey (breakfast buffet is 25 euros per person). However there are a lot of great restaurants and cafes near by. There are also kiosks directly across the street that sell snacks and beverages at reasonable prices. The level of service from the front desk to room service staff was top notch. The room we were given was bright, clean, and a lot bigger than any other hotel we had in other cities in Europe. The bathroom was bright, roomy and had a variety of quality towels and two bath robes. The toiletries were really nice and also included a shaving kit, dental kit, vanity set, shower and sewing kit. The shower was also enjoyable with a lot of hot water and great water pressure. The hotel did not stop there to impress. There is a pillow menu that offers three different options to your preference and comfort level. After returning to your room in the evening, your bedding is turned down for you with a chocolate on your pillow and hotel bedroom slippers on the side of each bed. The hotel also offers a free shuttle service into the city centre which we used on both days. Our driver John was both very professional and efficient. The most memorable part of our stay has to be the roof top pool and lounge area. The 360 view of the city is amazing especially at sunset. What a great way to wind down after the end of a busy day. I would definitely return and recommend this hotel anyone travelling to Athens.
title: Amazin hotel with a relaxing vibe

review: Stayed here for one night (was supposed to be 2 but flight was delayed) in July - Mixed reviews for Royal OlympicThe Good:- Location was fantastic- Service was good- Rooftop garden and restaurant was nice- Pool- Lobby and entrance was great The Bad:- Rooms were tiny and very outdated- AC was not strong enough- Wish we could get partial refund for the night we missed due to 8 hour flight delay- Pool chair collapsed (not due to obesity)Not sure I'd stay again, the hotel was very "meh"
title: Some Good, Some Bad

review: I stayed at this hotel for two nights. There were no complaints however the room was incredibly small. There was a lovely rooftop restaurant with outstanding views and good service (except for one dinner, where it was extremely crowded and we ended up staying an hour longer because of the service). A pretty good hotel overall.
title: A pretty good hotel

review: Stayed here just the one night. We were not by anyone outside the hotel, and not only had to carry our own luggage up the stairs to reception, but also were asked to take our own luggage up to our room. (Certainly no issue doing this usually...just not at a 5 star hotel when we are paying 5 star rates!)Our room was large and clean. Bed was pretty good, but had to ask for extra pillows to be delivered to the room as we were only given 2 very thin pillows to begin with. We went upstairs to the rooftop bar for a drink. The view was awesome! The service was really poor. The staff were very arrogant. Breakfast was good. service was fast and there was a wide range of food. The scrambled eggs looked like bricks which were clearly overcooked. The fried eggs were much better though. Good coffee and juice.There are hardly any lifts in this building, and they are tiny! The lift that takes customers up the the rooftop bar can fit about 6 people in it. I'm not sure how many customers stay in the building, but the wait for the lift at certain times told me that they need a bigger lift!Great location which is close to all the main attractions.
title: Not a 5 star hotel

review: A lovely and convenient hotel close to all the must visit destinations in Athens.Enjoyed the pool, the common areas in the hotel are lovely and the in house restaurant a special treat.The rooms were small as were the bathrooms but very convenient.Breakfast was super.
title: A city break

review: Big hotel I know, but you can't beat the location, cleanliness or the swimming pool when it's 35 degrees plus! Bonus is the roof top bar and restaurant, views amazing...good value for money and made our Athens stay a treat!
title: Perfect Athens Location

review: We stayed in this hotel for a scientific meeting in Athens. The rooms are spacious and well decorated and the breakfast is served in the roofgarden with view to Acropolis. It is situated in the center so a lot of interesting places could be visited on foot. It is not expensive, so it is one of the best value hotel in Athens.
title: A worthy hotel to stay in Athens.

review: The location of the hotel is an excellent one, it is walking distance from everything you want to see in Athens. A very luxurious hotel and rooms. The staff are very friendly and always smiling. We booked the panoramic room with an amazing view to the temple of Zeus. The food is delicious and the rooms are clean and spacious. I would recommend this hotel to any couple specially if traveling for the honeymoon. Great experience!
title: One of the best choices in Athens!

review: This is a great hotel. All the staff are amazingly helpful and friendly. They go out of there way to ensure a good stay. The hotel itself is very pretty and spotlessly clean. A very substantial and delicious breakfast is served at the rooftop restaurant which overlooks The Temple of Zeus and has a terrific view of the Acropolis. Terrific value.
title: Highly recommend The Royal Olympic

review: We stayed here as part of our Air Transat honeymoon trip to Greece and its islands (2 nights upon arrival and 1 before departure to Canada). Upon arrival at the Athens airport, we were greeted by the Air Transat rep. Along with 2 other couples, we were eventually taken to our hotel stopping along the way for the other couple’s drop-offs in a large coach-style bus (no bathroom on-board). I would strongly suggest having transfers to your hotel pre-booked, but it’s not necessary as there are many taxis which will cost you around 35-50 euros to get downtown.Disregarding star-rating, this hotel is appointed nicely with a clean appearance and decor. The lobby is open, cooled and pleasant despite the 40C weather outside. Our check-in upon arrival was handled swiftly and efficiently with the staff having a good grasp of English. Our room was on the second floor, right near the stairs. There are 3 different sets of 2 elevators, but each one is not very large. Since there are 3 different sections of the hotel, this makes sense. Wifi is offered free and the username and password are given upon check-in but if you’re early (as we were when going back to Canada), you can get that and use while you wait.Our room was a standard double room that contained one king-size bed, a bathroom and a mini-bar. Unfortunately, I did not get any photos of the room, which is unusual for me but rest assured, the room was sufficient and we found the king sized bed very comfortable giving us a good sleep. Make sure to leave one of your security cards in the holder (near the door) if you go out as all power is shut off if you take it out (this is the same all over Greece)….including the air conditioning (controlled by a thermostat).The hotel contains a gym (which is unusually placed - I have a video, but can't upload. You enter the gym from the back of the hotel, kinda weird), an outdoor pool in the middle of the hotel with a window for food, towels and general service, a restaurant (opens at 7pm for dinner) that also hosts the excellent buffet breakfast and an indoor bar which sits next to the pool. Prices in this hotel for drinks are somewhat costly, so maybe get your own….as others have said, the restaurant terrace on the 7th floor gives an awesome view of the Acropolis….along with this, the breakfast buffet is also extremely good providing a wide variety of meats, dairy, breads, and fruits – definitely worth getting up for!This hotel is close to the Acropolis and Plaka which are major tourist attractions. Walking there takes 5 minutes. Among these attractions are many restaurants and shops which can provide hours of time wasting! Overall, we had an excellent experience in Athens and in particular, this hotel. Just make sure to use common sense when roaming around….keep your money, cards and phones close and concealed and you will not have anything to worry about.
title: Great view of Acropolis and close to Plaka

review: We come to Athens every summer on our way home from the islands. We have always stayed at the Divani and have loved it but this year decided to try the Royal Olympic due to its proximity to Plaka.The reception on arrival was offhand and snooty - we were told we had an " internal room" and to our horror it had no windows and seemed to be over a light shaft. We decided not to complain bc we were only staying over night but nonetheless were very shocked as had booked in January- when I mentioned this the gentleman made a very disparaging comment about having booked through Booking.com!!The bathroom was filthy- frayed soap and shampoo basket with toothpaste spittle splattered on it, taps with soap stains, basin with toothpaste from last guests, surfaces dirty. The sign " please service my room" was still hanging on the outer door handle when we arrived at 8pm!!Towels, although good sizes, were yellowed and worn.We tried to have a drink in the hotel bar before dinner at 8:50pm but were told that the bar closed at 9pm...in an inner city 5 star hotel we found this rather odd.We stayed in for a meal and it was amazing service with a very professional and pleasant waitress. Food was in general good but far from exceptional. It was very expensive. The view is magnificent to say the least and we were five a fantastic table on the balcony.The cherry on the cake was ringing reception at 11:30 to ask for 2 extra pillows from housekeeping as we only had one each. I was told by reception that there were no maids ( really???!!!!) and that he would look himself and bring them up. No pillows came to us, no one phoned us back- for a 5 star hotel this is appalling. We hardly slept as were very uncomfortable as a result.All in all a very disappointing experience. We were not even asked on check out if we had a nice stay.... I guess they knew the answer! We certainly will not be returning to this establishment! This is the only time I have ever had a negative experience from an Athens hotel and this made a very sad end to our month in Greece.
title: Disappointment

review: The room was pleasant, bright, and spacious. The pool was lovely, the staff were excellent, the decor was elegant, and the rooftop bar/dining space was spectacular. Pleasantly surprised by the value. Location is perfect for tourism.
title: Great value and location

review: The Royal Olympic is a lovely, comfortable hotel that is located in easy walking distance to the many of the major sites in Athens. Its most outstanding features include an excellent rooftop restaurant, which I shall review separately, with breathtaking panoramic views that include the Acropolis and the Lycabettus Hill. The rooms were comfortable, good-sized, and well maintained, although not ultra-luxurious. We stayed at the hotel and both the beginning and the end of our trip. Both rooms had a small balcony that looked upon the inner courtyard and pool, although our second room had only a stall shower, but no bathtub as had been in the first. The swimming pool was another welcome feature. Though not very large, it was clean, temperate and enough for swimming short laps. There were sunbeds (which were apparently not there when another recent reviewer stayed at the hotel) as well at patio chairs and tables. The staff was uniformly courteous and helpful. And finally, the price which included a sumptuous breakfast buffet at the rooftop restaurant was quite reasonable. Though perhaps not the five-star institution that it purports to be, the Royal Olympic is certainly a comfortable place to stay when visiting Athens.
title: A Lovely Hotel in the Heart of Athens

review: when I booked the hotel, it was not what the pictures for the room showed. The room was like stepping back into the 80's. Small boxed TV in the corner with probably the most uncomfortable beds I have ever slept in. The walls looked like they needed painted and the bathroom was very small. The people were kind and the services they offered were very good. The location is close to the Acropolis and within walking distance to the museum. Overall would not stay there again. Deceptive pictures online concerning the rooms we purchased.
title: not what was advertised

review: We booked 7 nights at this hotel as my '70th birthday treat'. We booked an executive room and I emailed the hotel to see if we could be upgraded as it was a special occasion. I received a response to say the reception staff had the authority to do this. On arrival the hotel was "full". This was the least of our problems!The hotel website advises on the ways of getting from the airport to the hotel:Taxi at 60 euros (On our return to the airport we were quoted 40 euros by hotel staff which we booked).MetroBusWe decided to take the Metro as we thought 60 euros rather expensive. The Metro was crowded and our travel paperwork and my husband's passport were stolen from my handbag. This resulted in a dash to the police station followed by a visit to the British Embassy the following morning to report it and a return later to collect an emergency replacement. Day 1 ruined and a nasty taste in the mouth regarding the city. Apparently this is a very regular occurrence and the passports are sold on to immigrants within hours.Our executive room was nothing like executive. The bath was very narrow and if you turned the bath tap fully on the overhead shower came on as well. Therefore the taps had to be turned only slightly on to fill the bath. I reported this but the engineer could make no difference.Toiletries were replaced each day although the quality was not great.It is unusual not to have tea/coffee facilities in a 5* hotel room these days. I was also surprised that irons and ironing boards are not supplied.The restaurant was lovely but the evening meal prices extremely high so we ate out.
