We had breakfast at the hotel as part of our package. It was adequate but the same every day. I only had the cooked option once and the eggs were swimming in fat and cold. The swimming pool was small with no room for enough chairs and loungers round it. The main issue for me as a 5 ft non swimmer was the depth. 1.5m to 3.5m in a very short distance. Therefore I could not go further into the pool than the first 3 steps. I realise there is nothing to be done about this but some floatation aids would help. The hotel is immaculately kept in the public areas and the staff were very pleasant and friendly. Athens is sadly showing its economic situation and graffiti is absolutely everywhere. It is a very different city to the one we last visited in 1971.The hotel is extremely well situated within easy walking distance of the Plaka area with Restaurants and tourist shops and the Archeological sites. Try the Arcadia restaurant - lovely food and Management.
title: Very Good but some drawbacks

review: For our second family one-night stay at the Royal Olympic, the impressions were the same and have even worsened. This hotel is a bit deceiving for a 5-stars, but with a perfect location in the city center of Athens.The rooms are comfortable, clean, quiet and spacious. The wifi is working correctly. Only our air conditioning was too cold and difficult to understand, despite the easy in-wall control system. This wasn't much of a problem for one night, but it would have become unpleasant should we have stayed longer.My main criticism concerns the overall service impressions in the hotel, beginning with the reception hall. Arriving at the Royal Olympic doesn't feel like arriving at a 5-stars. We arrived an hour early so we were asked to wait for our room to be ready. Nobody offered us any welcome drinks nor suggested any waiting options such as the lounge of the hotel or the pool during the waiting time. Similarly, the staff at the bar was not cheerful neither and we waited one hour for our in-room snacks to come a bit later on. I also want to mention that one of the two rooms we were assigned to was not the booked suite we expected. This was corrected only after we noticed it.It is a very good thing indeed that the hotel has a pool, but it is too small for summer holiday when there is a lot of clients staying in.What saves this hotel is definitely its perfect location near the Acropolis and the city center. There is plenty of bars and restaurants nearby, you just have to walk 5 minutes to reach the athenian-style summer atmosphere, a beautiful experience especially at night.I would suggest staying at the Royal Olympic for one night before heading to the beautiful paradise of the greek islands.
title: One night for the location

review: My family stayed at the Royal Olympic Hotel for 5 nights during our vacation. The hotel is beautiful and walking distance to many sights, attractions and restaurants. We had a suite which was nice at the end of the day to have space for the family to hang out. After sight seeing in the morning we loved returning to the hotel and enjoying the pool in the afternoon. The pool serves food and drinks, and was very relaxing. The food we had pool side was very good. We ate several evening dinners at the Roof Garden Restaurant, which has an amazing view of the Parthenon and Athens. The food was delicious. The morning breakfast was also delicious. Staff was very professional, nice and helpful.
title: Beautiful Hotel, Great Location

review: We stayed in Greece 2 weeks. Our first stop was Athens - Royal Olympic. We were given a beautiful room!!! We weee very happy. We stayed 2 days then left for Santorini and Mykonos. We returned to Athens to the RoyalOlympic to finish our trip. We were exhausted. We expected the same beautiful accommodations. No. This room had FLIES AND A STINK like something died in it. I checked the bathroom,garbage nothing. I called the desk. They said I must have opened the window No! Ok They'll send someone to spray. I went downstairs to the desk. The concierge came up with me. I said I want another room. He understood. He said he would call if they had a room and if I wanted to move. Of course! He called we went to the lobby. HE went up to get us... the other manager CLAPPED and shooed us away. Go back up he said he's waiting with the key to the new room. The bell hop said to me "are you getting your bags?" No!!! I just left a stinky room with flies. And was clapped at! The other mgr gave me a key to the new room. Our luggage was in the stinky one. We had the keys. We went back to the old room gave the concierge the key he said do you want your luggage? No! Have it sent to my new room and the bell hop wanted to get tipped again!!! We had been travelling 8 hrs at this point and hadn't sat down. And then they charged us 2.90 Eurostar for the bottle of water we drank in the room. Their people skills suck except for maybe 1 behind the desk with the glasses and the doorman outside. Proximity is their plus. The restaurant is way overpriced.
title: From Beautiful to Stinky literally

review: Let’s start with the positive parts: The location is great, the pool area is wonderful, the view from the rooftop is breathtaking and the reception is professional and service minded. Beside this, it’s hard to say much more positive: Our rooms were smelly, a bit runned down and not properly cleaned (the sides of the bathtub were dirty and there were hair in the corners of the bathroom). The elevators are small and slow, the staff at the breakfast were rude, and the client computers were old and outdated. Could be that the hotel has been renovated in 2009, but nothing seems to have been improved and/or changed since then.
title: Not even close to 5 star!

review: Our stay here was underwhelming. We booked a weekend break here, 3 days, 2 nights due to the reputation and found the hotel fell short. On arrival the baggage handler was very friendly but the desk staff couldn't process us quickly enough to get us out the way due to a queue of people waiting to check in, they were not very welcoming. The view from the room is exquisite but let down by the fact the bed is two individual beds, separately made, and pushed together with a blanket over the top to give the illusion it is one bed. We requested an iron due to creased clothing, as they have been in suitcases, to be advised that there is not one available but you can pay for someone to come up and take the item away to be pressed. Not ideal. The pool is far too small for a hotel of its size. There are perhaps 30-40 sun-loungers for a hotel with 500+ rooms.Our final day, the roof garden was also unavailable due to a wedding ceremony with no alternative advertised and the downstairs bar does not have an adequate capacity. We checked out at 10:30am; in the afternoon we had to go to a neighbouring hotel to await pick up from outside the Royal Olympic. Overall we were not all that impressed with our stay or the service we received from the staff.
title: Underwhelmed and disappointed

review: We stayed here overnight the end of July on our way to Mykonos. Was very pleased on arrival. Lovely lobby area. I was disappointed with the pool area. While it was clean there was a complete lack of sun beds. It was disappointing after a long journey to have to lie on the ground on a towel, particularly as there was lots of room to have more sunbeds. Dinner that night was delicious and we ate it in the rooftop restaurant over looking the acropolis.Overall staff were good and friendly, however there was a particular waitress who was very rude at breakfast the morning which was disappointing after the experiences we had previously. The rooms very clean, they had mini bars but not a 5 star room. Very dated. Overall this is a nice clean hotel in a good location, but I would rate as a 4 star not 5 star!
title: Nice hotel, lovely 4 star. Not 5 star

review: The hotel was very nice and posh with lavish buffet breakfast on the rooftop with amazing view of the Acropois and the temple of Zeus. Very well located 10-15 minutes walk to many places like Syntangma square, Plaka, Acropolis, stadium etc.The staff was very helpful. Only drawback no electric kettle available which is the basic of any hotel.
title: Very good location

review: This hotel has not only has a great location with view's of Zeus's House and the Parthenon. It has great customer service. You will pay more than other hotels, but you will be paying for an experience. The dining on the roof was relaxing and the food was solid. I would come back.
title: Great experience

review: This hotel was nice and the restaurant on the roof is incredible but I would not call it a 5 star hotel. The rooms were outdated and the beds are pretty uncomfortable. The pool area is nice but small and the staff seemed annoyed at all the tourists more than they were helpful. Not worth the money
title: Not that great

review: This is a great hotel for many reasons: its five minutes from the Acropolis and Museum; its right beside the best street dining in Athens; the pool is very special ; if you get the right room you will face Ancient Greece from your window; and except for one totally rude head wine waiter, the roof top bar and restaurant is extraordinary.
title: Dining below the Acropolis

review: We stayed here with a tour after a cruise, so we did not pick the hotel. The location was good, short walk to Plaka, Acropolis and transport. It overlooks the park and the Temple of Zeus ruins, which is striking. The view from the restaurant/bar on the roof (partially covered) is quite stunning, especially at night. The buffet breakfast is served there and is very good, as is the service. The pool area is posh and the rooms are lovely as well. We had a small balcony overlooking the pool (I think most do). The lobby sitting areas are large and well-appointed, including a very inviting, cozy "library" area a few steps up, overlooking the park and front entrance. If there weren't so much to see and do in Athens I would have enjoyed sitting there reading a book--or guidebook--for a few hours there. Or at the pool. The front desk staff was also pleasant and courteous, although they did not let us know of a transit strike the day we left! If you want to be close to the Plaka and Acropolis but want a more upscale hotel, then this is a good choice.
title: Adequate upscale hotel

review: The start of a fantastic vacation began at the Royal Olympic, we stayed in the same room we were in two years ago but stayed longer this time. We had a view and balcony overlooking the Temple of Zeus just across the street and a view of the Acropolis up the hill. The old town of Athens was just a minute walk from the hotel, and close to everything else.We traveled with friends who all stayed here and everyone was happy. We found the prices cheap compared to most places we stay but the quality and service equal, I don't think we would stay anywhere else while in Athens.
title: Our second stay in a wonderful hotel

review: My wife and I stayed here as part of a group tour with Gate 1 Travel. This property is located near the Plaka District and very convenient to the Parliament building and other areas of downtown. The rooms were very nice and somewhat large. There is a roof top restaurant where your included breakfast is served with views of the Acropolis and the Temple of Zeus which were amazing. The breakfast was extensive and very good. They also serve dinner and drinks in the evening.There is a very nice pool area and bar where you can get lunch or snacks. The staff were very personable and accommodating. I would recommend staying at this hotel to family and friends.
title: Very Nice Hotel with Great Views

review: I had dinner in the Royal Olympic this past Sunday with a big group of relatives visiting from the US. I knew the view of the hotel was amazing since my brother had his wedding party there so i took them in Royal Olympic believing that they would be impressed. of course there are views of Acropolis and lycabetus and So everybody enjoyed that. But apart from that everybody was pretty disappointed with the rest in the restaurant. The service was extremely slow. We sat in our table at 8;30 and only after an hour they came to take our order. Then the waiting for the food it took so long and we got served finally around 23:00!!! After 2 and half hours!! In the group were young children that had fallen asleep because of the very long waiting. in addition after the food arrived it was nothing special and worth the hight price of the dishes. For example i ordered risotto with some sea food. And it was just rice with only a single shrimp. And the taste was nothing special I would definitely recommend this place to come and have a drink and enjoy the view but as a restaurant is not worth it.
title: Very slow service and no worth the price for dinning

review: The Royal Olympic Hotel is in a great location close to the Acropolis and the Plaka district. The reception and bar areas are bright and spacious, and the rooftop restaurant / bar where breakfast is served has the most fabulous view. The breakfast has a good selection but the staff seemed to struggle to replenish the food.The pool area is small but clean and great to have in any city hotel, but website photos would suggest that the pool area is open in the evening for meals or drinks but in fact it closes at 8pm, and access doors are locked. We were given the executive room which was small with a very small balcony. The room was tired looking with old doors and fittings. It didn't have the pool access which we had expected because of website photos, and in fact I couldn't find any bedrooms which are poolside. Our room did have a small separate bedroom with just a single bed and small bedside cabinet but was perfect for our teenage daughter. Overall this hotel was just ok and if I return to Athens I would look for a different hotel in the same location.
title: Good location

review: We stayed just a night but were impressed with service and availability of the staff.The roof top restaurant was excellent for food and the view on the city.Bedroom was large and pleasant but bathroom was a bit old and would need to be refreshed.Next morning we were going to Piraeus to take a Ferry and the hotel told us that we need 20 Minutes by taxi.It took us 60 minutes to get to our boat and almost missed it. Our taxi drivers did miracles.Be careful when you plan your taxi drive to port.
title: One night stay

review: The hotel lobby is very nicely decorated and the staff is very serviceminded and pleasent.The Rooms are oki, nothing super fancy but nicely decorated. The wardrobes could have been better though and the tv was a joke. 5 star hotel and no flatscreen is kind of dul.The Breakfast was amazingly good and the staff was extremly helpfull and nice. the view if you sit outside when having breakfast was very pleasent.The pool area is kind of cousy aswell but the service is not 5 star at the pool area, Was hard getting served.The hotels placing in Aten is great. You can easely walk to everything from here.But we loved this hotel anyway and was very pleased with our stay. Strongly recomended.
title: A very nice hotell

review: The hotel is located next to the Plaka, 5 minutes to the Acropolis and museums and shopping and cafes. The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful. Spacious rooms and gorgeous swimming pool area.The breakfast is served at the restaurant on the top floor terrace restaurant overlooking the Acropolis and Parthenon. It would take too long to describe the breakfast so I will just say marvelous!I highly recommend the restaurant for a memorable dinner. While not iunexpensive it is reasonable for a 5 star gourmet experience. Try to reserve while the sun is setting over the Acropolis.
title: Perfect location great hotel

review: My boyfriend and I had a comfortable and enjoyable stay here. Certain aspects were really impressive and felt 5*, namely the huge and beautiful lobby and the breakfast (both the view and the food).I'd say it was let down by small touches, such as the fact that they don't provide free bottled water in the rooms and that the hallways were very run down (such a contrast to other public areas). The pool area was also far too small for the amount of guests, but I suppose there isn't much they can do about that now!I would definitely stay here again though. They area was good and it was good value for money, plus the rooms were pretty large and always clean.
title: Overall a great hotel

review: The exterior, lobby, roof top restaurant and pool area are all 5 star. Sadly the rooms are 3 star at best.Old, outdated, dark and dingy rooms were very disappointing. This hotel could be one of the best in Athens if it the rooms were renovated and if staff were a little friendlier. Adding a few special touches is all it would take and I would gladly pay a little more to stay.
title: Has so much potential buts falls short

review: Our second time back at the Royal, and enjoyed it once again. Staff are helpful, view of the acropolis over breakfast is sensational, and the breakfast itself is great. Only a short walk to the Plaka district, and in a great spot.
title: Great stay

review: OK, we were a little concerned with this hotel given some of the recent online reviews, but what the heck, this hotel was just fantastic Super service, super breakfast with a WOW view. The room that has all you need. Really comfy bed and great air conditioning. The pool is great (deep) and well serviced with staff. Very central location to all of the big city sites. Seriously cant fault the Royal Olympic Hotel !!  .
title: ALL CLASS !!!!!!

review: This hotel charges 5 star prices, and does have 5 star aspects.The location is great (for the tourists) right near all attractions you'd want/need to tick off.The staff are friendly and helpful. Full marks there. The lobby and surrounding areas are impeccably clean and kept. Again full marks. The pool was nice, although was too deep. The rooftop bar/restaurant had fantastic views and the food on offer in the breakfast buffet was great.The only reason this hotel lost a point with me was due to the inconsistency in the rooms. The deluxe room which we stayed in, was nice, and reasonably spacious, but it's just too much of a down grade from the more expensive rooms. The bed was just 2 joined together, and not made together, two beds, made separately, but joined together with a king cover over the top. The bathroom was in need of an update also. This can be seen from other customers photos.But overall it was a great stay. Would I stay here again, probably not, but I probably wouldn't stay in the same neighborhood of Athens either again. So is not really the hotels fault that I wouldn't stay there again.
title: It's close

review: Very nice hotel. great location. unbelievable view from the rooftop to the achropolis and zeus ruis. Pretty good quality the restaurant. The rooftop is worth every second of the stay. Do not miss it!!!
title: 2 days stay

review: This is not a 5 star hotel, however i do not think you will find much better in Athens. It is very expensive for what it is. It is very well located for tourists though and serves an excellent breakfast with a stunning view. However the hotel is dated and while the staff are friendly the expectations of a "5 star" means you will be disappointed when you get here. It is a 3.5 star at best.
title: Ok Stay

review: The hotel interior is very luxurious however the rooms did not meet the standards one would expect for such a hotel. Our first room had problems with air conditioning fine if you like sleeping in a sauna, when mentioning this to the staff they did not seem surprised which makes me think they new it was faulty. The second room was smarter but not exceptional. Our reservation included breakfast, the restaurant was so small, there was not enough room to accommodate the guests which meant long queues, they then informed many people in the line that breakfast was not included?? By this time we decided to leave and have breakfast in the city centre. Would not stay there again.
title: Weekend break

review: This hotel exceeded my expectations. After having read some not so great reviews before my trip, I really can't understand them now that I have stayed here. This hotel is beautiful and the decor is true Athenian style. If you're looking for an ultra modern hotel then it is not for you but it is not without its modern amenities. We stayed in an internal room and although we had no window, the room did not feel claustrophobic because of the beautiful stained glass window that you were able to light up in an evening. The air con is really cold which is great after walking miles in the hot Athens summer. Staff are extremely helpful and polite and make sure the hotel runs smoothly. Nothing is too much to ask here. The breakfast is lovely, but gets busy around 9 as it would in a hotel of this size. The pool is great and beds are comfortable. Often it can be hard to get a sunbed in the afternoon but this is to be expected! We had one evening meal here and although it was pricey it was one of the nicest meals I have ever had and really you pay for the view of the Acropolis! We loved this hotel and would definitely return during out next trip to Athens!
title: Great hotel in a wonderful city

review: Location is pretty good, right next to Plaka and within walking distance of Monasteriki. This is an older hotel with small rooms, especially if you're used to hotels in the US. The people at the front desk were helpful but not particularly friendly. There's a rooftop bar with a nice view of the Akropolis, the waiter there was very nice but the guy behind the bar was extremely rude and the reason I didn't go back. Overall a nice hotel but I'd suggest finding a newer hotel in the area.
title: Good location, just OK

review: As the title says, the entrance to the hotel is very nice and worthy of a five star rating. The room however left much to be desired. Travelling as a couple we were provided with a room that featured two single beds pushed together. The decor was incredibly dated, the bathroom cramped and the space not cleaned to the standards that would be expected. The location is good and most of the main sights are within walking distance from the hotel. We would not stay at this hotel again unless the room provided was of the expected standard. We would recommend dining at the rooftop restaurant. The food was exceptional as was the view which provided a panorama over the Temple of Zeus and the Acropolis.
title: 5-Star Lobby, 2-Star Room

review: I selected this hotel as it had a pool and thought it would offer some relief after sightseeing. I wasn't expecting much from the reviews however we were so pleasently surprised by our lovely comfortable room, friendly helpful staff, sensational breakfast and AMAZING view day and night of the Acropolis and Temple of Zeus. Location was fantastic also. A little away from the crowds but in less then 5 mins you are in Plaka and the Acropolis.
title: We will return!

review: Well comunicate hotel. Clean rooms. Good breakfast. Friendly staff. I would recomended this hotel to other people. The staff speaks spanish, this is difficult in Athems. Wonderful roof sights. Romantic place to have a dinner
title: Great balance quality - price

review: Three generations on holiday together for the first time. But memories made in a wonderful city and the hotel and staff made the stay relaxing. Extremely helpful and friendly from the moment we arrived until our very last minute. Nothing was too much trouble
title: Family celebration

review: 4 day break for my birthday and we couldn't have picked a better hotel. Within walking distance of everything we needed to do in Athens and we booked a room with an outside patio area with an amazing view of the Acropolis. This hotel is well decorated, clean with fantastic staff who couldn't do enough for us. Would definitely recommend and would return In a heartbeat.
title: A little gem

review: I stayed in this hotel during May 2017 .The hotel is nicely located. It is possible to reach the hotel from Athens airport by metro and a great saving on taxi charges. There is a metro station close to the hotel (Megaro Mussikis) and it will take only 5 minutes to reach hotel , that too the way to the hotel is rather very quiet and not crowded. Hence it is possible walk with luggage without any difficulty. The hotel staff were extremely cordial and was available in seconds after making a tel call. I felt so homely at this hotel. The room was also very good with fine view to the road and the greenery. Closeby to the hotel there are lot of small restaurants, shops and eateries. The breakfast in this hotel was also upto my expectation. I had spent 4 nights in this hotel and and it was a nice experience.
title: Excellent location

review: We went to Athens for a wedding and decided to stay somewhere that was quiet but with good access to the metro to get to the center of town. Golden Age is only a 5 minute walk from the train station and it is in a safe residential neighbourhood. The service is excellent, we had a problem with our room and they immediately took care of it. The breakfast is fine. Would stay here again.
title: Great location, great service

review: I was very impressed to take my family to such a nice hotel. We ordered a 2 bedroom apartment which was very clean and modern. Beds were very comfortable, and facilities in great condition. We ordered room service as we had just left a full day tour and were very tired. The meals were very reasonably priced and very tasty. Hotel was also in a quiet location and we all had a good nights rest. Breakfast buffet was included and offered a wealth of options. Thank you for your hospitality!
title: Very pleased!

review: We stayed here for 3 nights before going to naxos. We were given a warm welcome by the receptionist. Room was nice and clean, bed comfterable. Staff very helpful, serviceminded and polite. Room cleaned every day and new towels/soap provided. Good breakfast. Close to the metro so easy coming from the airport. Would go again.
title: Nice hotel, helpfull staff

review: Top place and close to all touristy sightseeing spots, staff were well versed with both English and Greek and were happy to show us plenty of spots to go and visit and were able to help on getting some bargains.
title: Top place and close to all touristy sightseeing spots

review: Staff is top professional and helpful. The room is very clean, nice bathroom. We the beds comfortable. Most of all great breakfast! We manage to walk around the acropolis in a sense that our hotel is very close to points of interest. Our stay was comfortable.
title: Great place and close to everything!

review: After weeks of intense we decided to splurge a little on some comfort and we were not disappointed. Golden Age Hotel had all the necessary amenities. They had great food available through room service. The Greek salad and chicken fillets were oily, but tasty. The hotel wasn't above and beyond but it was very well equipped and staffed and what was needed for rest and comfort. There were some instances that we had issues with the WiFi but the front desk was quick to assist however possible, successfully. The hotel is about a 45 minute walk from all the major attractions such as the Acropolis, museum etc. or a 3euro/10 minute Uber ride away. During the time we were there we found Uber to be much more affordable than the local taxis. Using an Uber to travel to the airport (or just outside -- Uber's "shouldn't" be driving directly into the airport) will save you some cash.In addition, the hotel staff member, Olympia, who came to clean our room was incredibly friendly! She had the most vibrant personality and was always happy to help teach us Greek and make us feel welcomed. Kostas at the front desk was also incredibly kind. Overall, a very positive experience.
title: Nice, Clean, Wonderful Staff!

review: This small boutique style hotel was very clean and conveniently located. The breakfast buffet was very good. The staff at the hotel was friendly. The rooftop bar gave you views if the Acropolis at night
title: Great hotel

review: This is a real gem of a hotel - small in size and large in service & comfort. Breakfast buffet was very nice & fresh with all the amenities. Staff was very friendly, helpful & accommodating. The location was fantastic as it was far enough away from the hustle and bustle, but only a few short blocks from the Acropolis & Museum and Plaka.
title: Quaint hotel in a great location

review: This hotel is a bit over a mile away from Plaka. It is walkable. The archeological museum is under ten minutes away. Staff was helpful with certain things. I stayed here in three different nights and had requested city views and never got them. They do have a beautiful terrace that I recommend having a drink or eating in the evening to see the city at night. Also a beautiful pool in the terrace.
title: Exploring Greece

review: the hotel offers delicious food!!!.....the breakfast was great, huge variety, and the staff was also very helpful too .....on the 8th floor there is also a restaurant with a great view of the acropolis, my wife also agrees with me, our experience in your hotel was great, for sure we'll be back
title: A great Radisson hotel

review: Very nice decoration but expensive food.. and location is not perfect as it is not very close to the shopping centers. We went for shopping by taxi which took 30 min to the center. The weather was bad and we could't benefit from the swimming pool in May.. the nice thing is that there is a view in the roof floor which allow to see a very beautiful view of Athens.
title: Nice experience

review: We have just spent a few nights at Radisson Blu Park Hotel and it was an amazing experience.Very helpful staff,informative and friendly.all through our stay,everyone made us feel very special and welcome.Our room was well designed,spacious,with comfortable beds and excellent bathroom facilities.There was great internet covering all over the premices.We enjoyed very much the breakfast buffet,which was generous,with all kinds of options,from light to heavy and everything in between.The best part of the hotel was the pool area,with great drinks and stunning views of the city,where we also had a delicious dinner!the food and the service were both at the highest levels!!Overall,everything was fantastic and we could not have been more pleased with our entire stay!!Thank you Radisson Blu Athens!!!till next time!!!
title: Amazing experience

review: If you are looking into a good option for hotel while staying in Athens, the Radisson Blue is worth considering. Very good rooms, friendly staff, and a very good A/C system in the summer time (very important in my opinion). Good return from your money. The only issue is that there are not that many restaurants within 5 minutes. Overall, very good experience.
title: Good hotel and friendly staff

review: I can literally see the Pantheon from my room. The rooftop is perfection, the view is definitely worth a cheeky wine upstairs at night. Hotel is walking distance to so many attractions, restaurants & shopping. Staff are very helpful & friendly. Spacious room & comfortable bed!
title: Total Bargin!

review: The view of Parthenon was nice, though no one informs the guest that when the cafe at the ground floor is closed there is no way in or out of the hotel !!! During the night I needed to go out of the hotel and I realized that I was LOCKED. Honestly, that wasn't a nice experiences
title: Locked inside the building during the night

review: The best of many good things about this hotel was the terrace on the top floor - plenty of chairs and tables from which to survey the spectacular view: the Acropolis to the north, and the city and the mountains beyond it to the east and south. We took our breakfast up there on a tray - no problem going from ground floor to fifth with a lift - every morning, and our coffee or wine every evening: it was a spectacular way to start and end each day.It was also well placed: not only was the next road on the sightseeing tour bus routes, but the junction with that road was opposite a shady little path that led to the main footpath to the Acropolis. So instead of joining the gathering throng in the scorching, crowded and noisy coach park a walk up the road to our left, we padded our way between ancient trees and shrubs, on a path worn by feet ancient and modern over thousands of years, and joined them a little further up (only a little, but it was more magical!). The hotel staff were extremely helpful and pleasant at all times, whether we needed to know about museums, restaurants, bus routes, etc. They telephoned Hertz for us when our lack of Greek and the Hertz office's busy times made it difficult for us to sort out a problem with times for picking up our hire car - and then one of the staff parked it for us when fitting it into a small space outside the hotel proved rather stressful for guests operating a left-hand drive for the very first time!I had wanted to see Greece for over 40 years - especially Athens, Epidaurus and Mycenae - since I fell in love with the ancient Romans and Greeks at school. Sometimes when you go somewhere after all that time it's a disappointment; this was not. That first view from the terrace (we could even see part of the Acropolis from our balcony as well, by the way) was better than I'd dared even dream, and it didn't pall with repeated visits. My husband and I have a game called "Fantasy Squillions", i.e. what would you do if money were no object? On this holiday we chose our fantasy holiday home: mine was a rooftop apartment opposite the Acropolis. But I've just thought: I could stay in the Acropolis View hotel whenever I wanted instead! (And I'm not saying you need squillions to stay there - for a major city with that viewing terrace and an excellent breakfast, the hotel was not expensive - I'm just playing the game!)
title: Worth the 40-year wait!

review: Great location the reception staff are awesome always smiling and ready to help I stayed for 5 nights and on way back from santorini for another night on the second leg there was a mix up in their reservations and they acknowledged it ,were very hospitable and adjusted me in a presidential suite I forgot the gentleman' name who marshalled it all but it was great . Their breakfast is good by European standards and the fact we eat only halal.Its very near everything shops, food outlets Indian food etc great view of Acropolis from top and right next to parliament house. However they SERIOUSLY need to improve their AIR-CONDITIONING , the AC control does not work from the room so no change can be brought about by the guest and it's very hot in summer.The mattresses are lumpy and uncomfortable and no water bottles provided by house keeping all are charged difficult to fathom that. It's an old establishment and needs to work on their shortcomings. Would love to stay again if rooms are cool and beds provide a good sleep . By the way I loved visiting Athens.
title: Great location and staff

review: It's an old hotel well maintained but a good 15-20 mins walk to any monument. I made a reservation at this hotel thinking they had a rooftop bar like they advertised as we were here only for half day. But they don't have any rooftop bar overlooking Acropolis. Call & ask the hotel before you reserve, It's misguiding looking at pictures of hotels on booking sites in Athens.
title: They don't have rooftop bar the way they show in picture

review: Wanted to like it more than 3 but the facility won't let me. Desk staff, bell staff are very pleasant. Restaurant mostly... some rough spots in service, to be expected in Europe. But the room -- AC would not be below 75 in room, paint was chipped, mildew on shower curtain, missing towel hanger and TP hanger, no fan in bathroom, weird big closets, only 1 chair in the entire room, decor as if Aristotle Onassis' decorator was in charge. Wifi sucked-- cut out every 45 minutes.
title: Nice staff, tired hotel

review: A very comfortable stay we had there. Nice specious room, look for their suite rooms, good location, warm staff, they packed our entire groups breakfast since we were leaving early morning, that I thought was a sweet gesture.
title: very comfortable hotel

review: I decided to spend my last week in Athens in luxury and style. Probably the most affordable, to someone like me, of what I consider the " holy trinity " of luxury hotels in Syntagma square. I was so excited on my arrival I tipped the bellboy when he brought my luggage to my room. What a room!!!! Location, Location, Location and View, View, View. Wow!!! A Deluxe room on the 4th floor. I could see the changing of the guards in front of the Greek parliament and the Parthenon from my balcony. Big, spacious and clean room, with air conditioning that was a blessing every time I returned from the scorching Athens heat. Comfortable bed, crisp clean and fresh linen, big bathroom with quality toiletries, nice touch. My room did not come with breakfast, but I had the option to take breakfast for €20, but I opted to walk across the road and for €3:40 had a freshly squeezed orange juice and a spanakopita instead, perfect. Yes, this place was/is expensive, but as a treat to myself, was well worth it. It's easily accessible with the metro and airport bus on 1-2minutes walk. I loved my stay.
title: Location Location Location.

review: Fantastic experience in a very large room with Acropolis view at the best location in Athens! Cannot beat that!The amenities are great, the service excellent, the breakfast rich in a beautiful room.The hotel is next to KIng George and Grande Bretagne on Syntagma square. It has been built as a luxury hotel to compete with its neighbors (with large rooms, big marble bathrooms),and it does that but at more affordable rates.I am staying here every time I come to Athens on business and feel pampered.
title: Grand hotel at the heart of Athens and, surprisingly, affordable!

review: We stayed at this very central hotel for a friend's birthday bash. It's a very 'old Athens' kinda hotel which suggests its elegance of the good days... The hotel itself needs very little sprucing up - minor details, yet would make a great change! Other than that, it's perfectly clean, quiet, comfortable and extremely convenient for everything one needs to do in athens. Situated minutes away from Suntagma sq metro station means you won't have to walk a lot in the heat! The staff are nice and they gave me the quiet room I asked for. My experience wasn't demanding but I still felt very welcome. Word of advice for hoteliers and housekeeping. Renew and replenish toiletries even if your guest is there for the weekend. It makes them feel thought of! Thank you NJV Plaza.
title: Birthday bash

review: My wife and I stayed here the first three nights of our honeymoon and the location can't be beat when visiting Athens! We were able to walk to lunch, dinner and the shops around town in 10-15min. Breakfast was included with our booking and I would highly recommend it. There is a great selection and a lot to pick from, including mimosas! The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our only reason to not give it a perfect 5 was because of the misleading photos of the views. They show pictures on their website of a view of Acropolis from the hotel, but we were unable to find out exactly where that view came from, don't think it was this hotel. Again though, the location is perfect, high recommend this hotel!
title: Perfect location, great breakfast and great staff!

review: The hotel has an excellent location. It's within walking distance to all tourist sites and there is high end shopping area just behind the hotel. The hotel does feel dated but the room is comfortable. It's a business hotel and I couldn't feel anything luxury about this hotel. The wifi was really bad. We could only receive internet at certain spots of the room and it was slow!
title: Might be 5 stars in the old days

review: Stayed one night - all very lovely. Perfect location and a really nice room. A bit disappointing we booked 3 months in advance and ended up with two single beds instead of the double bed we requested.
title: Beautiful Spacious Rooms, Twin Singles Though :(

review: NJV Athens combines luxury with history in addition to great location in the middle of down town with walking distance to shopping and dining places. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Staff are helpful and friendly. Breakfast was yummy with variety to satisfy all tastes. All in all it was a nice stay.

Great hotel, ideally located at Syntagma square, in walking distance from the historic center of Athens. Clean spacious room, big bathroom, all the amenities available, friendly staff. We were here on business but I would highly recommend it for leisure as well.
title: Athens Plaza

review: I'd stay in this hotel again, because of the great location. There was nothing really great nor nothing really bad, it was just "meh". The room was adequate, fairy clean and spacious. We had problems with keeping the room cool enough, but, to be fair, it was over 100 degrees when we visited. We had a breakfast included type of reservation, and the breakfast food and presentation was very nice. However, the service during the breakfast, which was minimally needed since it was a buffet, was lacking. The servers seemed overwhelmed and stressed, and did not go out of their way to greet us or ask if we needed anything. On one occasion, I asked if they had a take away cup for my coffee (what is it with Europe! it's so weird that they do not have take away coffee!!! ) and got a huffy eye roll stomp off attitude. I mean, a simple "no, I'm sorry, we don't" would have been much better. But, that little incident aside, our over all experience was pleasant, sufficient to meet all our needs, and we would consider staying here again just because of the convenient location.
title: centally located for historic athens

review: Stayed July 2017 Hotel is located right in the heart of Constitution Square. Rooms are very clean and the staff is EXCEPTIONAL!!! . The breakfast buffet is very good . This hotel is within walking distance from a lot of restaurants , coffee shops, and shopping. there is also high end shopping within walking distance with the road closed off , so you can walk in the streets.
title: Great Location !!!

review: This hotel was very nice. The rooms were spacious. The staff were friendly. The only drawback was the room stunk of cigarettes even though it was supposed to be a nonsmoking floor. The breakfast was great. It's right on Syntagma, so the location was perfect. There are many nearby shops and restaurants and the area is well lit and safe.
title: Great location

review: Hotel is dated but well maintained. In the center of tourism; just across from Greek Parliament. Good nightly rates. This said, clerk talks of breakfast, at checkin, as though it's included. Likely it's not so ask prior to taking your breakfast otherwise you might get a surprise at the end. All-in-all a good 3 star hotel with character and close to it all.
title: Dated But Nice

review: Sure there may be newer hotelrooms in Athens - but I may not use a calory to find it out. Best location in the city, excellent service, spacious comfortable rooms, very good breakfast buffet and helpful staff. I come back here each time in Athens...
title: Location - Service - Comfort ...and a smile or three

review: We stayed here for 2 nights. The room is very dated, including all appliances and bathroom. It's also hot and stuffy and the air conditioner takes about an hour to properly work. We were jetlagged so we wanted to watch TV, but it seems that they only have news channels. About 20 of them and only one is in English.If you want to watch a movie, be prepared to pay a hefty price. Our coffee station was dirty when we arrived, probably from the previous people staying and when I called reception about it they didn't help me in restocking it. The staff at the front are helpful in getting a taxi to the airport, but don't trust the price they give you, the taxi driver will change it. It's in a good location and is a good place to stay for a night stopover. All in all, this hotel is not 5 star and is merely pushing 2.
title: Not a 5 star hotel

review: Positives are - the hotel is very close to the Acropolis and the new Acropolis Museum, a 15+ minute walk will also take you to the Temple of Zeus and the Stadium. The Plaka is a 7-10 min stroll where you can find a range of restaurants and the typical tourist type shops in the oldest part of Athens. At the end if the Plaka you will find the Ancient Agora. The Acropolis metro is only a 5 min walk that will take you to other parts of Athens. The beds are comfortable and the rooms have air conditioning which is a must with the temps that can get to 45 deg - we had this for three days!! There is a small fridge situated in the bottom of the wardrobe, but no facilities to make a cup of tea or coffee. You have to go downstairs to the breakfast room in order to do so. Breakfast is rather disappointing- tinned fruit that has been open too long and kept in a warm environment- now fermenting! The fresh fruit on offer was too ripe and spoiled and not enough choice. Coffee was via a Nescafé vending machine - tea is via tea bags and there are three types to choose from. At least you can juice your own oranges with an electric juicer. Ask for a room that faces the inner courtyard otherwise you won't get a good night's rest - the hotel is situated on a corner of one if the busiest roads in Athens. You might want to take a sleeping mask as the curtains don't fully block out the light from the street lights and early morning sunrise. The staff are helpful enough, but seem a tad tired and at times bored with the whole affair.
title: Room for improvement

review: We stayed for the second time in six years in this lovley, cozy and comfortable hotel located close to the the Acropolis museum and some lovely restaurants.Room was clean and beautifuly decorated.Breakfast was great. Will definitely be back!
title: Excellent hotel

review: Stayed here for one night after our island hopping tour. Rooms were spacious and were all we could ask for. Staff were very friendly and helpful especially Donna, wonderful. Close to the plaka area and the acropolis.
title: Great stay!

review: We immediately felt welcomed. Most staff speak at least some English, but make it a point to learn some Greek before you go. They seemed pleasantly surprised when I said something in Greek! Room was clean and comfortable. Rooftop dining amazing! Breakfast was always delicious with many healthy options.
title: Friendly Staff

review: The staff were wonderfully understanding and accommodating. The breakfast was truly incredible and everything was delicious. We had a spectacular view of the Acropolis from our room! Our room was clean and comfortable too.
title: Excellent!

review: The hotel is centrally located which makes it easier to the tourist sights. the beds are nice and comfortable. The highlight of this hotel is the typical Greek breakfast. I just loved it. Very polite and helpful staff. House keeping people were just amazing. Reception people were just so helpful on my first day in Athens.
title: Holiday in Athens

review: Loved our suite with view of acropolis. Room was big, spacious, clean, comfortable as was the rest of the hotel. Food was good at the roof top restaurant. And we enjoyed breakfast, although nothing out of the ordinary.
title: Great hotel

review: We have stayed at the Grand Polis twice. The first visit was 2 nights. We were in a tiny room with a tiny shower. It was a little difficult to even get through the front door. We enjoyed our stay as the bed was comfortable and the room was well ventilated but it did not really seem like a 4 star experience. The breakfast was great we enjoyed the buffet and would highly recommend. Our second stay we were some how given a much larger room on the top floor. We were much more comfortable. The staff was friendly on both visits and we enjoyed the views from the rooftop bar and even had lunch at the Cafe Downstairs. We visited during the heat wave which made the location seem much further from local attractions than it actually is.
title: 2 Different Stays...2 Different Experiences

review: Nice hotel! Very good situation, professional and kind staff (specially Vangelis and Vasilios). Very good breakfast, included Greek coffee. Spectacular views to the Parthenon from the restaurant. Maybe only a very small issues: “small elevators” in busy times, internet sometimes does not work good, views doesn´t be nice from room (4th floor). Anyway, nothing relevant. Very good hotel.
title: I would repeat

review: The staff at The Polis Grand was extremely friendly, knowledgeable and professional. The hotel was centrally located so we were able to walk and explore the city. The room, though small, was clean and comfortable. It made our trip very enjoyable.
title: Greek Vacation

review: Loved our trip to Greece and staying at the Grand Polis hotel. We didn't get to eat at the rooftop restaurant, but wish we had. The rooms were tidy and clean and the staff was so friendly and helpful when we needed tips on how to get around. The hotel is centrally located to so many things and not to far from the Acropolis. I hope you enjoy it as we did!
title: Groupon Greek getaway

review: I only stayed for two nights. The Hotel is not in a nice Neighborhood with a few deserted surrounding buildings but inside it is nice and clean with great roof terrace. The rooms are clean. Only remark is that, like unfortunately in most hotels, when you leave the room, the air cooling device switches off and when you come back the room is hot. The breakfast is excellent. Walking distance possible to the center and Acropolis.
title: Polis Hotel Athens

review: Very small elevator. Average rooms. No coffee maker. Bad and small washrooms. rude unfriendly staff. Called for room service the response for coffee maker was very rude. With sprain on foot, the receptionist and the lady at the cafe don't let me sit with my leg raised when it was hurting very bad as we had checked out and our flight was in few hours.
title: Horrible

review: We stayed here for 3 days last week. Centrally located in the heart of Rome. Nice rooms with soft beds and great a.c. The breakfast buffet is top notch with a great variety of fruit, cereal, fresh bread and a host of other items. The desk was very friendly and helpful with our stay and getting cabs. Thanks for making our stay enjoyable.
title: Good hotel

review: Conveniently located - but watch your wallets at Omonia station - pickpockets are in full force and many, including us were robbed. Beds were very comfortable, AC worked great, and bathroom was very spacious. Yes the included breakfast is as good as everyone says - salads, eggs, meats, tomatoes, mushrooms, bread of every variety, veggies, 5-6 types of cakes, coffee, yogurt station, fresh fruit, make your own greek coffee in sand, amazing fresh flavored waters, greek pies, and more! laundry service is sent out and was 12 Euros for a large bag. Staff was helpful and efficient. Great view of Acropolis from rooftop bar.
title: Convenient Location, Comfortable and The Breakfast!

review: PROS - The staff was extremely polite, friendly and helpful. The breakfast had the best display of all the hotels we stayed at during our trip. Rooms were clean, but a bit small. We just chalked it up to being European :). First stay had the small shower, but at the end of the trip, we scored a room with a normal size shower.CONS: Location is a bit shady. Hotel itself is nice -- area surrounding hotel, not so much. Area seemed a bit shady. We DID walk around the city, but only during the day and took cabs back after dark. Definitely watch purses and wallets, etc. as you do get approached for handouts. We really didn't have any major problems and found most people helpful. Elevators, although adorable, are VERY small. 2 people with a suitcase small :), but quaint.
title: Nice Hotel, Very Helpful, Friendy Staff

review: Traveling through Greece stayed here with my husband and another couple, we reserved 2 rooms and our experience as a whole was decent. We stayed 3 nights, let me provide a summary of what to expect. The Good:GREAT breakfast, elegant display with an array of options, freshly squeezed orange juice, desserts, jams, cheeses, salads, hot food items and drinks. Comfortable beds. AC worked great. Close location to metro and 2 stops to the Acropolis.The NOT so Good:Shady Neighborhood. As everyone else mentioned before, we heard from a local to watch our purses and wallets. We arrived at around 0100 and noticed the graffiti all around, a bit scary! My sister's bathroom was very small and her shower was tiny, kept bumping her arms on the wall. Rooms are small too, but not a huge deal. Noisy mornings, the walls seemed thin, the bathrooms had windows that opened up to areas with connecting rooms.Overall, decent hotel, really enjoyed the breakfast and proximity to the Acropolis.
title: Bad Neighborhood, Decent Hotel

review: Clean hotel with good price-service-value. Central acres to all areas. Friendly staff, excellent breakfast buffet. The roof top bar is one of highlights with view over the city. The room is small, but sufficient for 2 persons.
title: Central hotel

review: My fiancée and I stayed three nights at the Polis Grand in May. The room was fantastic, the staff at the check-in were helpful, and the hotel itself is within a reasonable distance from the major attractions surrounding the Plaka district. Best of all, the outstanding array of cuisine to wake up to in the morning!
title: Excellent value for the money ... make sure to upgrade for the breakfast!

review: The hotel is a decent size building, very clean and well presented. The staff are unbelievably helpful, nothing was any trouble. All the staff went above and beyond, but Vassilis was a standout for us (there were 11 of us in total) My family from America were unlucky enough to have a suitcase go missing from the airport, but the hotel staff were non stop in trying to locate it for us.The hotel is very well placed for the Acropolis and Syntagma Square etc, and most attractions were within walking distance. The rooftop bar/restaurant has a real wow factor when you first walk in there at night, but the service seemed a bit slow for drinks, As has been mentioned in previous reviews, the breakfast is really good. Lots of variety to cater for all tastes, from fruit, various breads, drinks etc, it was a very nice experience. The bedrooms were a little small, but about right for a city hotel. Why only 4 stars? The lifts were very small, hot and slow, and there were only two in operation. The kids were happy to use the stairs, but it was a little frustrating sometimes waiting for the lifts. All in all, a very easy going and positive experience, which I would recommend to anyone. Next time we are in Athens I will certainly return.Thank you for looking after us
title: Very friendly hotel, well located

review: Room is clean and pretty!!!The restaurant on the rooftop is absolutely delicious and the view is just amazing!!!Staff of the hotel is all smile, helpful and polite!!!Location is just perfect! We can walk to the Acropole! Amazing!We recommend that hotel to everybody!
title: Wow!

review: The hotel is very good located in a central point where you can easy access every part of the city. The breakfast menu is so wide and it is very good the hotel staf are friendly and provide help. One comment though the cleaning of the room should occur more often in my 3 days stay it was cleaned only once.
title: Very Good

review: The staff on reception were very friendly and helpful especially when my husband had his phone stolen on the metro. The breakfast was very good value for money and differed each day. We loved the view of the Acropolis from restaurant balcony. Would recommend. We travelled to Athens for a family baptism and the hotel was very well sited for using public transport.
title: Excellent friendly professional staff

review: The hotel is beautiful and very close to great restaurants and not a very far walk from the acropolis (20 minutes). The thing that sets this hotel aside from others is the staff. They are very accommodating and have great advice on restaurants. You know th advice is good when you run into staff members at the restaurants they refer you to. Not to mention the breakfast was delicious. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
title: Great hotel with wonderful staff

review: I cannot rate the Polis Grand high enough. From the moment we walked in to the moment we left the people there could not have been more helpful.We arrived in the early evening and the night receptionist gave us a warm welcome and helped us with some basic but very useful local information. The hotel is located 5 minutes walk from Omonia Square where there is a metro station and tour bus pick up. There is a bakery and supermarket located nearby. The main tourist section with access to the Acropolis and other attractions, such as numerous bars and cafes is 20 minutes straight line walk from the hotel.Our room was typical of a 4 star European hotel. Included was a safe, TV, fridge and balcony. The aircon actually worked and was adjustable remotely, which is unusual from my experience! The bed was amazingly comfortable and the room, although located next to a busy road was very quiet. The hotel said they had spent a lot of money on soundproofing.Breakfast was typical European fare. The usual array of pastries, cold cuts, bacon, sausages, fruit, cereals etc. All being refreshed constantly. Vasilis, the catering manager showed me how to make Greek coffee in hot sand. I enjoyed it, surprisingly. Linda thought it was disgusting.We had dinner on the rooftop one night with our son and his fiance. There was a nice view of the Acropolis and the meal was very enjoyable. Total bill was £86 which was not too bad for 4 people.I have no problem in encouraging you to stay at this hotel. I'm sure you won't be disappointed.I'd like to extend my thanks to all the staff who made our stay very enjoyable.
title: Polis Grand Hotel, Athens, Greece

review: ###June 25-26:We arrived at our hotel Polis Grand in Athens, and were completely exhausted from the flight, plus a 7 hour time zone difference. The Hotel is a 3.5/5 in my opinion. The hotel itself is clean, but like many European Hotels – the room is very small, as is the bathroom. However; the daily breakfast on the second floor is very well equipped and well worth it. They put out a lot of hot and cold dishes, plus all the small things you would like to see in a breakfast (too many things to list, including the drinks). Overall, this hotel is nice and the service is friendly, and is good for a quick 2 day stopover, on your way to see other part of Greece (ie…The Greek Isles). While I am here, I will take this opportunity to mention our 2 day stay in Athens…When we got to our hotel at 10:30am from the Airport, they told us that check in time was 3:00pm and after. So we sat around and went for a walk down the streets of Athens and eventually wound up at the Monastiraki square. We had a Gyros, and went back to our hotel to take a nap. We woke up a little later, and went back to eat dinner at Monastiraki in the evening. This is a very lively place, full of lights, music, shops, street vendors, and live bands. It was entertaining. As far as the food goes, it was good, but unfortunately being from Toronto, I cannot in all honesty state the food in some of the Athens places we had; was better than some of the Greek restaurants we have in Toronto. We are truly spoiled in Toronto with the authenticity of the various ethnic foods which are available. That’s not to say the food in Athens is bad; however it is more to commend the authenticity of the food in Toronto. From the Tzatziki to the Souvlaki to the Gyros to the Greek Salad. They all taste just as good in Toronto, if not better. Btw - the feta cheese in these Greek salads are a 3"x4" block of feta they put right on top of the salad (Personally I prefer a lot of Sprinkled Feta in my Greek Salad – but to each his own). The salad is huge, and the tomatoes taste very different from a North American tomato from the grocery store, which tells me the tomatoes in Greece were very fresh organic tomatoes they were using.  ###June 27:This was our second full day in Athens, and we walked around on some of the Athens streets to some highend boutique stores, and found the purses to be better priced in Athens, even with the Conversion Rate: TRAVEL TIP: If you are looking for a high end purse, you should buy it while you are travelling in Europe, because you are refunded the tax (VAT), which ultimately decreases the overall price of the purchase. The only caveat is that you have to mail the proof of purchase to have your CC eventually credited. We also did a sightseeing tour to the Museum, and of course the Acropolis. Since we went at the end of June, it was extremely hot, and furthermore, we were experiencing a Heat wave at that time also. It was Very Very Hot. And since you have to climb up the Hill to get to the Acropolis, it got very hot and very tiring.  TRAVEL TIP: Make sure you have a big Thermos or 2 in your knapsack to keep your water cold, else the water will get warm very quickly. And believe me; you will need the cold water, during the Hot Season. TRAVEL TIP: The Travel company tour for 65 EURO pp from the hotel was way overpriced. Not required. Alternative is to get a taxi and go to the acropolis yourself. This bus tour took you on a sightseeing tour of some of the things to see in Athens, but you remained on the bus until you got to the Acropolis (with one stop in between at a small Soccer stadium). After which, we went to the old Greek Plaka area in the evening, which is a nice long strip of Patios and Restaurants, and had some delicious Eggplant appetizer (sort of like Baba Ghanoush) and some Greek beer on one of the Patios.After 2 days in Athens; we went to the Athens port to board the Jet ferry to Mykonos.....Which is a different post you should read. :-)
title: 2 Stay Stopover @ Polis Grand in Athens, prior to Mykonos....

review: My friend and i stayed there for 7 nights. The staff members were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean. The breakfast had a wide variety. The location was good, in walking distance to most touristic places and about 30 minutes to the Acropolis by foot. However, the hotel's location isn't the safest if you're returning late alone.
title: Very neat rooms and friendly staff

review: There is a good convenient transport with metro downstairs. There is a 24 hours open bread shop 'bread factory's and the hotel pool can have a great view of the Arcopolis and the breakfast is buffet style and provides ALOT of choices.
title: Amazing

review: We stayed at Wyndham Grand Athens in our lasts days of our honeymoon trip through Greece.We took a taxi from the airport straight to the hotel, and we were a little bit shocked when we arrived, since the area in which this hotel is has this "heavy" atmosphere. You can feel that this is not the right place for a tourist to be.Good thing is that there is a subway station really close, and is easy to get a taxi from the hotel entrance, so you don't really need to walk too much around this not so good areaOther than that the hotel was really nice, specially the rooftop bar/restaurant from which you can see the Parthenon all lighten up at night.Rooms are really nice, so is the bathroom. We never understood the shower. There is this really nice rain shower but there is no shower plate, so the water floods the whole bathroom after you shower.This might sound exotic, but when you go to the bathroom in the middle of the night is rather a slippery, cold and wet experience.Hotel staff were mixed. Either they were really helpful or did ignored us, or talked to us even without looking us at the face. So I guess it depends on your luck when you visit the counter.
title: Nice hotel in a not so good area

review: I want to point out and say unequivocally that this is the best massage I have ever had in my life. Perfect pampering for the body A once in a lifetime experience and I want to mention Aspa and Faye. The two girls who do are just perfect
title: A perfect massage

review: I can't compare the Wyndham with any other Athens hotels because this is the only one we stayed at, but this is a great hotel. Modern, clean, great breakfast buffet and very nice (although quite small for the size of hotel) swimming pool/sunbathing area on the roof. Great view of the Acropolis from the rooftop bar. Our room was spacious and bright.The location isn't great as far as restaurants, tavernas and bars are concerned (there is one right outside called Alexander the Great, which we didn't get round to trying), but there is a Metro station (Metaxourghio) right across the street, from which you can easily (and cheaply) reach anywhere in the city (including the airport). If and when in Athens again, I would probably stay here now we're familiar with it. Tip - I traveled back to the airport separately from my wife and son. They were told by reception that a) there would be plenty of taxis available in the street and b) the flat fare back to the airport is €44 (compared with the fare in of €38). She couldn't find a cab and was charged the €44. I made the same journey the next day, found a row of cabs in front of the nearby metro station and only paid €38. The fare is clearly stated on the cab's dashboard as €38 for airport to center and reverse journey. Don't be reticent to point that out to the driver if he tries to overcharge.
title: Top hotel

review: We booked this hotel as we were looking for a place to stay in Athens with a swimming pool to beat the summer heat. We were not disappointed, it was really great, the view is breathtaking on the city and the Acropolis, particularly for sunset.The hotel is really perfect, the rooftop pool is very small but refreshing. All the staff is really nice, although really slow on the rooftop bar. The only downside is the scary neighborhood, you can't really walk at night (even at day...) Always take a taxi to get there or leave but price quality is a really good value.
title: Great hotel but scary neighborhood

review: I stayed in this hotel during my business trip. The hotel is centrally located with good access to public transport. The premises are renovated,clean and spacious. The room was comfortable. The restaurant had an excellent view to the Acropolis. Housekeeping was up to a good standard. Breakfast had adequate variety. The pool is small for the size of the hotel. Reception was friendly ,especially stefania was very professional and helpful. I will stay there again.
title: Nice hotel / spooky neighborhood

review: Convenient location, comfortable rooms, clean and excellent service. I love the rooftop bar. It has beautiful 180 view of the city. The room is nice, new, and big but they only offer complimentary water on your check-in day. Breakfast buffet is nice with great choices but the hot food comes out a little too late, i think it starts at 7 or 8 which was too late if you have an a full day tour where you have to leave the hotel early.
title: Beautiful Rooftop, Friendly Staff, Spacious Room

review: We booked this hotel as we were looking for a place to stay in Athens with a swimming pool for a week. We were not disappointed, it was really great, the view is breathtaking on the city and the Acropolis, particularly for sunset.The hotel is really perfect, the rooftop pool is very small but refreshing. Pool bar a little bit expensive.Breakfast, er it had a good variety - just no omelette/egg station....i have stayed less nicer hotels than this one with better breakfast options....coffee was standard.The only downside is the neighborhood, you can't really walk at night. Im usually okay with the rough neighborhood but yeah be safe...this area had predominantly Asian & Middle Eastern people, i was actually surprised to find alot of Halal food for choice behind the hotel within 5min walking distance.You can walk to the main sq in 10-15min.Tube station is right out side the hotel, so is the bakery on the corner....great choices of food and pasty to choose from.
title: Decent Hotel, not really that impressed with the Breakfast.

review: I went home yesterday from 8 lovely days in Athens and i stayed at Wyndham hotel for this day and right now I am very happy that i choosed this hotel. A new hotel in the town I think they open in the last days in 2016. In that moment i order this hotel its was long down on the ranking list on trip advisor but before i travel then running up hundreds of places. I like to know what other people means about the hotel and everything around it like neighbourhood and whats include and what you can do also on the hotel. I choosed this after short thinking because of they could give me what I wanted I am only in a small contact with hotel before i choose where to stay and Maria was answering my mails very fast. I am not a very difficult person for the hotels I only have a few wishes and they promise me them. Hotel is located in Metaxourghio. Not the most central place but for me I dont have problem for jumping on the metro who was 5 minutes away. The hotel have a lot taxi outside and they bring You to central places for around 5 euro. I took metro blue line from airport to Syntagma station and then changed line to red line for next step. I guess I used around 1 hour i didnt look at clock the metro price i 8 euro since its the airport line. Taxi cost around 45-50 euro and taking 30-35 minutes. Before I went here I read that the neighbourhood was scaring in my head I didnt have the same feeling I was feeling very safe there. Not so much to see around hotel but there are nice cafe and small shops for buying drinks and a bakery thats like a heaven for people who like to enjoy the life. Ok lets speak about the hotel. In check was super quick and I could choose room for very good sleeping quality or having room with good view. In that situation after long travel and very tired I didnt know what i wanted but after a little talk the lady in reception upgrade my room for free and i choosed to stay in 8 etage a good choose since I only had 9 floor over me with swimming pool and bar/restaurant. In my etage was the spa area I didnt try it.Swimming pool is not big but I was there in the opening hour and catch a sun bed and i got sun a couple of days and cooling down my body in swimming pool I like that very much. The view from the top etage is fantastic at some area You see direct on target nr 1 Acropolis. I was taking some beer in the evening and sitting straight to Akropolis You a evening in the dark for the memory book.About restaurant for breakfast and dinner I cant say anything since I dont use it when I travel. Room was big I guess 30 m2. Bathroom fantastic with big big shower. Room was clean and fixed every day even I didnt hang out the fix room sign when i leaved the hotel. Sleeping quality super I slept like a kid. Big television i didnt use it. Some possibility to make coffee and tea free for some days then some small paying I dont drink this things. Minibar with a lot too choose in drinking or small eating product where the prices was very high. Example a box of coke 5 euro and 1 minute outside hotel its 1 euro. Safe. Good big cabinet for placing your clothes. Good body product on the bathroom with sandals. Bathrope. A lot of towels. In swimming pool You get towels in the bar for using there. 4 lift for taking You up and down so never waiting time. Reception very professional when I had question about typical tourist things to see and honestly in the heat 32-38 degrees around where to go everywhere and what could be a kind of hard. I like that at all. A very little minus they didnt have stamps for my postcard but maybe me who is old fashion and sending that in the year of 2017. The first day I was waked up early because of there was no not disturb sign there and i missed a little moment the miss of bath tub so I wrote that to Maria. She answer almost before i sent the mail. I am the mail man not a phone guy. And she wrote take contact with reception before You leaving hotel today the manager want to speak with You. Then i felt a little stupid but I took contact and he want to know if there was more they could do for me. Change room or all other wishes I choosed in a second to say everything is good I dont need bath tube and sign for not disturb I had fixed already with contact with housekeeping. There is now noise from the room closed to You, you cant hear nothing. I like the part with music in the ? Hallways 24 hours super nice relaxing music when You come to room or leaving it. There are all kind of service to get food to your room I think 24 hours of the day. They have sales of tickets for hop on hop of and one stop is 2 minutes walk from hotel. If I not stop now I will write 200 pages. So what shall i say is it a 5 stars hotel ? I havent stayed on one before with so many stars I am a easy guy and in my head right now the day after – YES it is. Everything was perfect and if I one day go back to Athens I will stay here. I got super law prices since I using some other pages for ordering and I got a kind of one day offer in half price. I recommend this hotel. Thank You for everything all at Wyndham Hotel Athens. Only comment is after goodbye is that the question under is a kind of difficult. Non smoking yes on the room but at top bar No. I dont like this question under here i dont have 100 control. OK enough from me.
title: 8 Lovely days at Wyndham

review: The hotel wasn't as we expected. The service was slow. The reception wasn't active we should ask many times the same things. The housekeeping wasn't good. The room we booked like city view it was totally something else!
title: Hääpäivä

review: It's okay..not great. At first glance the hotel is nice. It's modern and clean...but there are some things that need major improvement. The pool area is way too small -- and there are only about 10 chairs! This is completely inadequate considering the size of the hotel and the number of guests it has on a daily basis. Also, although officially there is "no smoking" allowed - my room smelled like smoke the entire time I was there. And there were times when it was so bad that it smelled like someone was actually blowing smoke into my room. I had read the reviews beforehand and I agree with those who say it isn't the safest area to walk around. I probably wouldn't stay here again--although, this might be more because I wouldn't visit Athens again and not necessarily just because I wouldn't stay in this specific hotel again.
title: It's okay...not great

review: Used to be the Imperial Hotel.The hotel is beautifulAnd serves a wonderful buffet breakfast included with the mail.The rumors are very clean and modern with plenty of room.The roof top bar ,restaurant, swim pool are excellent. Some say the viewI'of the Acropolis from here is unbeatable.The bar and restauraunt are expensive but very nice. The neighborhood is improving but not close to major attractions.
title: Excellent Room. Superb rooftop bar and restauraunt with a killer view!

review: First time staying in a Wyndham, have a generally good stay as expected from its reputation and was particularly impressed by the breakfast choices. However, had trouble with the front desk almost every time I tried to just get a quick information - never got greeted nor the staff initiated or asked, just kept doing their own thing, although I did get the info when asked after waiting for what seemed to be a long while. The location is good, some very good, or so-so, restaurants in the walking distance and subway station right across the roundabout on the other side.
title: Good breakfast but busy front desk

review: A great hotel. Convenient location, comfortable rooms, clean and excellent service. Friendly staff and very rich breakfast. A special thanks to Stephania who made our stay as comfortable as possible. Will defiantly stay there again and I highly recommend it.
title: Excellent hotel

review: Hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. We had several issues with our first room including an ugly view of the apartments next door, where we could see the tenants sitting outside their balcony and inside their apartment. We asked to change our room. They ended up changing our room from Atrium view to an Executive City view. This room was much more spacious including the bathroom and had a beautiful city view. Plus we ended up on the 8th floor instead of the 6th floor. The higher up the better the view. Also I recommend a visit to the rooftop for a wonderful view of the Acropolis, either day or night. On our check out day we had to leave at 6am to catch our flight, which meant no breakfast for us, since it opens until 6:30am. Anyway, my husband asked Demetrios (bell boy) if there was anyway we could get some breakfast to go. He was so helpful and managed to get us two bags with various breakfast items, like a continental breakfast. That helped start our day. Thank you to everyone at Wyndham Grand Athens! Special thanks to Ms. Sofia Rigopoulou (reservations), Constantinos (front desk), Demetrios (bell boy) and everyone else at Wyndham! Next time we visit Athen we will definitely stay at the Wyndham.
title: Vacation - Athens, Greece at Wyndham Grand Athens

review: So far i booked 6 times in this hotel and i will continue to book there because of , quality/price , good location (metro-bakery-restaurant) very clean rooms , and the most important , very nice friendly staff , everyone is smiling and so helpful . The spa is really small but so cosy and worm by the wonderful team they have , the manager Fay and the therapists Aspa , Maria , Joana and Marina , they are all so nice and wonderful . A special thanks for Mr. Panos , Front office manager for his care everytime i come there .
title: Excellent and friendly

review: We arrived in Athens and stayed here for 3 nights. The rooms were very spacious and ideal for 3 of us staying together. The location of the hotel is excellent, well placed for all the main attractions and nightlife a short taxi ride away. The tour bus (highly recommended) stops just outside the hotel. Would definitely recommend staying here and would go back the next time we're in Athens.
title: Excellent location, lovely rooftop bar and very friendly staff

review: The hotel itself is beautiful. The staff is very helpful and kind. The rooftop bar - my friends and I had ordered some food and drinks. It wasn't until asking several times for our drinks that they finally came. Everyone had already finished their meals. The presentation for the meals is excellent. The restaurant wasn't even busy the night we came and we waited a long time for any service.
title: Rooftop bar

review: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in July. We booked an Acropolis View junior suite due to the extra space it would provide for our son (basically an extra room). The room was great, very spacious with an amazing view of the Acropolis. Loved the free toiletries! More expensive Greek brand than Korres which I hadn't seen before.
