The downside was a lack of drawer capacity to put clothes in (really lacking here despite a good size wardrobe space) and the rather strange huge showerhead which was so large it felt as if you were drowning whilst showering. Very odd indeed. We also had a bit of an issue with the daily maid service, as although very good, if you weren't out of your room by around 10am a note was put through the door saying our room wouldn't be cleaned today. We had to ask at reception for it to be serviced on 2 occasions. This has never happened before to us in a hotel.Breakfast was fine but quite chaotic which often seems to be the case at large hotels in Europe.The pool area is nice, the pool itself was larger than I expected given what some people have said in their reviews but the area itself is tiny- the hotel could have made this larger and forsaken bar/ restaurant space. We were lucky enough to be able to get a sun lounger for an hour or so at the end of the day after sight seeing but had to wait. Couple of gripes though- the music is terrible and very very loud- no idea why the staff feel this is a good thing. And the pool is FREEZING. Again no idea why given its size and the heat in Athens.The service/ staff were mixed. Wherever you seem to go in Europe when staying at large 4/5 star hotels staff are often snooty and at times not helpful (is this a requirement?) but this isn't the case in smaller family run hotels (see my review of our stay in Spetes- Nissia Residences). For example I asked for 3 towels by the pool, not only was I told to wait by the guy (not sure what he was doing as he was just stood there) but he questioned why 3 when there was my son and I (husband was on his way) and was reluctant to hand over a third.The location of the hotel was as expected as per other reviews. But you know this when booking so no point in complaining about it. The metro is a few minutes walk so getting around is quick and easy. The restaurant acoss from the hotel (Alexander the Great) was a godsend for us as we arrived late at night and needed somewhere closeby to eat. We weren't sure what it would be like but the food was lovely, good sizes and staff very nice. We ended up eating here twice during the 4 nights and then came back on our last night in Greece 2 weeks later.Overall despite a few issues we did like this hotel, one of the main reasons we chose to stay was for the pool area, as I have said this could have been better.
title: Good hotel, fab views of Acropolis

review: We stayed here for a week during our visit to Athens. We had a car and valet service was good (just drop the car off at the entrance of the carpark and the valet guy will park it for you). The location of the hotel is okay, there's a train station across the road, but you would have to be fit for 51 steps down into the station and up when you return to the hotel. There is a bread shop opposite the hotel (24 hours) in case you need some breakfast/supper. There is a swimming pool in the rooftop area but it's always crowded. We can see acropolis from the rooftop bar. Facilities in the rooms were good - you get a coffee maker (2 free capsules only) and the usual - fridge, ironing board etc, the usual. Beds were big and comfortable as well.
title: Great hotel stay

review: We spent 3 nights this July at Wyndham and my 13-year-old likes it so much that he thinks the hotel is the nightlight of his first ever trip to Greece. The staff are very friendly and attentative. The buffet breakfast is very good, with plenty of choices. The crown Jewell of this hotel is the rooftop bar/restaurant, which offers a million dollar view of Acropolis, both day and night. We've enjoyed lovely ice cream with the fab view every night there, and it only costs 3 Euro each, and the staff couldn't be nicer. We didn't eat meals there as it is quite pricey. However, just opposite the hotel entrance, there is this lovely family run restaurant called Alexander the Great, which offers delicious grilled dishes, fried zucchni, Greek salad and Mousaka for very reasonable price. We ended up eating dinner twice there.The hotel is located in the middle of the metro lines between the airport and the Port, which suits us very well, as we were taking a Med cruise from Athens. The metro stop is only 2 minutes walk away.Just be aware that not much air conditioning at metro stops, and in peak summers, it gets really hot in Athens 35 a 47 degree!) and so it can be uncomfortable. A Metro day ticket for unlimited rides only costs 4.50 Euro, and so it's a cheap way to get around.
title: Excellent hotel with a fabulous rooftop bar/restaurant offering amazing views of Acropolis

review: I booked this Wyndham Grand for the quality of hotel & facilities. I was not disappointed. The rooms and hotel at 5 star: we booked a Junior Suite with city view for my husband, myself and 13 year old daughter for 4 nights.Room was very spacious, enough privacy for sharing with a self conscious teenager. Bathroom was very spacious also and plenty towels & toiletries.Staff were super helpful with info on Athens, hotel and booking taxis etc for onwards journey and ordered driver for pick up at airport. Breakfast - excellent - lots to choose from and relaxed.Excellent views of the Acropolis from bar and the bar is itself a great place to hang out later in afternoon or in evening. However, I've given a 4 star rating as service is very poor on rooftop. There were times we waited 20 mins from ordering at bar when supposed to be table service.On a couple of occasions we had to wait a while on pool towels being delivered to bar area - this is the only place the hotel is let down. Location: it's not the nicest - however, the tourist buses stop across the road, the underground station is across the road and taxis sit outside are very cheap!! Would definitely return to this hotel if visiting Athens again, I'd highly recommend!
title: Highly recommended for families

review: Most of the other 4 star reviews state the exact reason I gave it a 4 instead of a 5 so I won't rehash all of them. In short... The good:Nice spacious rooms.Nice view of the AcropolisClean common areas.Good tasting breakfast with choices.The bad:The breakfast area is absolutely chaotic and staff/management do nothing to make it smoother.The pool area is tiny. Long waits to get a place to sit.The prices at the bar are absolutely crazy. That's why almost no one is in there.A generally unhelpful staff. Not unfriendly.I would stay again.
title: Nice hotel

review: We stayed at the Wyndham during our stay in Athens and found it to be a very comfortable hotel. It has the feel of a large chain hotel and all the services and facilities that you would expect to find in a 5 star hotel. The lobby is a generous size with a big seating area where you can wait. The rooms are modern and very spacious with excellent bathroom amenities. The bed was a great size and very comfortable. We found the room to be mostly clean and the facilities in the room were sufficient i.e. coffee machine and strong wifi connection.The rooftop pool/bar is great and you can sit up there with amazing views of the city of Athens.The problem with this hotel is the location - it is close to the main square and is only about a ten minute walk at best, however to get there you do need to walk through some ghetto like areas which can be frightening. However you can get a taxi from the hotel for a very cheap rate which will help avoid the surrounding streets.T
title: A very comfortable stay in not a very good location

review: Renovated 9 floor building situated in a area without interest. The staff is friendly in a professional way but nothing more. Most people stay two or three days and move on. Many groups. Rooms are modern, clean. Bathroom is convenient. Breakfast is quite standard with everything precooked(scrambled eggs, fried eggs). Lots of cakes and cookies. Fruits without much taste. The absolute top is the rooftops terrace because of its great view on the Acropolis. Staff over there is ok. Cocktails are expensive and quite average( one mint leaf in mojito!) swimming pool is mall and always busy.
title: Good City Hotel

review: A highly recommended hotel.Clean, comfortable rooms with a very good service. Staff very friendly and professional. A very big THANK YOU to Stefania who made us feel very welcomed and made us feel like we were at home .For sure we will revisit.Thank you also to Fay and Sissy.Thank you again ladies.Liza Aristotelous
title: Impressed

review: This modern hotel has large rooms, a small gym and spa and the highlight...its rooftop bar, restaurant and pool. There are uninterrupted views of the city and its landmarks. This a "high end" Wyndham. We also dined on the rooftop here. We had an amazing cod with miso and a goats cheese salad.There is no doubt the hotel is busy, but manager Panagiotis Intzidis and his team were very attentive.
title: Modern hotel, fantastic rooftop pool and bar

review: Definitely accommodating for Americans traveling, I felt very comfortable and my room had great AC and lots of space. The real gem is the rooftop pool, bar and restaurant which has spectacular views and a very relaxing vibe. The bartenders are very nice and I felt overall the hotel was very service oriented. I used Uber the whole time and they were definitely better than taxis, who only take cash and may take you for a ride. I will stay here again when I go back to Athens.
title: Very comfortable place

review: The rooms were decent size compared to city centre hotels we have seen in other cosmopolitan cities. Upon entry there was some smell of damp / locked in but it was readily auctioned upon as a cleaner was sent. There was a strong smell from bathroom drain which we also told the staff about. The location is very central for acropolis and most of the sites, lots of places to eat nearby, room service is very reasonable priced. All the receptionists and porters were very very friendly A ramp would have been really helpful as we had to lift the buggy over the steps ( only 4 though) every time Can Book again if available at sensible price whenever we go again
title: Central location friendly staff

review: My husband and I spent 4 nights at this hotel. We arrived from Mykonos around 3 pm and had our room ready. We upgraded during booking so we could have a room with a terrace. We were on the 5th floor overlooking Makri street. The room was dated. The shower could have used a good scrub. We had to put a 10 euro deposit down for a key to the safe. They gave us a complimentary bottle of wine and a fruit platter, which was nice. We had breakfast included in our package, they had a nice spread of pastries, eggs, meats, yogurts, fruit, coffee, juices, etc. The hotel is located right in Plaka. You walk up the block and you're in a square and about a 5 minute walk to the Acropolis museum. You're walking distance from all the major ruins sites as well. The location is unbeatable. It was a quiet street too, we didn't have any problems with outside noises. One thing to note is, if you book a car through the hotel to the airport, they say its 38 euros flat. It's not. We had to pay the driver 45 euros. When you book through the hotel you have to pay all of these hidden fees like a "call fee". So I recommend just hailing a taxi outside.
title: Dated hotel but in a good location

review: It was our second time staying at the Hotel Parthenon and it may have been even better than the first!. The staff was extremely helpful from my planning months ago to when we arrived on site. They helped us with drivers to and from the airport and Piraeus port. Rooms were fresh and clean, good wifi, nice bathrooms, abundant free breakfast every morning. Excellent location just steps from Plaka. Would highly recommend.
title: Lovely stay

review: Stayed one night pre cruise. Ideally situated for Acropolis, Parthenon etc. Room clean but bathroom a bit dated. However, it suited our needs. Room overlooked the front Makri Street which is very narrow and one way so traffic didn't bother us. Plenty of choice for breakfast, however, dining room does not have table for 2 only tables for 6 or 8!Didn't have dinner but had a drink in the bar which runs a Happy Hour from 4pm to 8pm - buy one drink get another free. This actually means that as we bought a drink each it would have been our second round which would have been free not a BOGOFF deal whichI thought it would be. Perhaps I was tired having been up since 2am in order to catch an army morning flight from LHR and misunderstood the terms!
title: Good city centre hotel

review: 1 minute walk from the Acropolis and the Parthenon which every one needs to see in Athens. 2 minutes walk from La Plaka which is very worth it, alot of very good restaurants.The rooms are okay and the staff is very friendly!The breakfast was excellent!The hotel doesn't have a pool or a gym.I would still recommend it!
title: Very nicely located hotel

review: A surprising find in the attractive area of Plaka. The room was plain and a bit disappointing on entry. However, everything else more than compensated . Super friendly greeting on arrival plenty of helpful information , terrific breakfast and the very enjoyable four hour happy hour (buy one get one free at reasonable prices). Easy walking distance to ancient attractions. A handy Super Market at the end of the street. There are plenty of places to eat in the Plaka and we particularly enjoyed the Gyros at the takeaway directly opposite our street. This hotel could make itself even better by paying attention to a few easy to fix details in the room. For example having two coffee mugs when two people are staying, instructions on using the safe, ensuring the TV is tuned and working and extra pillows in the room. These were quickly fixed when raised but I feel I should not have had to ask.
title: Holiday in Athens

review: Stayed just one night in Airotel Parthenon. Hotel room was simple but was clean and had the essentials. However, what stood out was the phenomenal service by the hotel staff from the moment we alighted from the cab. Velisarios and Giota were the most friendly and welcoming hotel staff I've ever met. They did not hesitate to assist us in any queries regarding the hotel amenities, the places of interest to visit whilst in Athens and even recommended food options nearby. As our flight was at midnight, they willingly offered us to place our luggage in the concierge once we checked out so that we could tour the city and come back later in the evening to collect our luggage. They are such an asset to the hotel and I would not have felt more welcomed and enjoyed our stay in this hotel if not for them. The free breakfast provided was great and had a good variety. Would definitely come back to stay at this hotel because of the impeccable service from the hotel staff and the convenient location.
title: Conveniently located and top notch customer service

review: Wow. The location couldn't be better. Right near the acropolis. About 200m from the entrance. Lots of restaurants and shops around. The hotel itself is suit old and dated and could do with a refurbish Bieber it is clean and adequate. The staff are what make it. They are so friendly and helpful and nothing is s problem. We also were able to store our luggage there whilst visiting the islands The breakfast was amazing.
title: Location simply Awesome

review: This hotel is a perfect location for seeing Athens, on the edge of the start of Plaka,and everything it and Athens has to offer. It is very touristy, right next to the Acropolis Museum and 2 minutes from the Acropolis itself. Five minutes the other way and you are at the Temple of Zeus, once you pass Hadrian's Arch.Lots of restaurants and music and drinking in the area directly. I was on the top floor, and my view was the Parthenon. It was amazing. Marble balcony, a couple of chairs and a small table, and I was so happy. The elevator is a tiny thing, and you wont fit more than you and a piece of luggage in there. But they make it work. It's great!!!The bathrooms are clean and modern, the bed was very comfy, and the breakfast was not bad. I always had hot water. The staff speak English very well, and I was always greeted with a smile!The TV was great for watching news but no one comes to Greece to watch TV. And the internet was fast!
title: What a view...

review: This is a really great hotel in an awesome location! It is walking distance to several shops, restaurants, and the museum. Worth way more than the price. The rooms are on the small side (as all other European rooms are) but, super clean and the beds are really comfy. The staff is super helpful as well when needing to book taxis or when looking for places to go/eat.
title: Great hotel!

review: Excellent location. Very comfortable beds and room. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The view of the Acropolis and city were stunning from the roof terrace. Very close to Plaka so plenty of nightlife nearby. Lots of restaurants and short walk away. I would highly recommend this hotel and will let stay here again
title: Great!!!!

review: First, it located in rough neighborhood (I had my jaw drop moment) but It's clean budget hotel with free wi-fi, working aircon and bonus of great view of Acropolis from cafe/breakfast area at 7th floor and friendly staff.It's walk away from all Athens high light, but we do taxi mostly due to the neighborhood and heat.Breakfast are ok.
title: Convenience location

review: We loved Evripides for many reasons especially for the family and lovely staff.Incredibly friendly and helpful and full of laughs.The room itself was huge with the very wide opening French doors to a big balcony with beach view.Big comfortable bed and lovely linen. Bathroom roomy and well equipped.We recommend Evripides very highly.
title: Great hotel in beautiful seafront position.

review: Stayed there a couple of times when I am in town. Polite and helpful staff, clean rooms and excellent breakfast. It's in a really central location for those that enjoy walking around the city but also really close to 2 metro stations that can take anywhere!
title: Nice place in the heart of Athens

review: This hotel have really big rooms most of them are very big . The restaurant on the top floor it is perfect and you should try it the breakfast also is very good , Rooms are clean and the room service is good
title: very big rooms

review: Stayed for 3 nights at this cosy and warm hotel well located in the city centre close to shopping areas and the historical part of the city. Very nice and spacious rooms overlooking the green park "Pedio Areos" across the Avenue. The breakfast, rich and tasty. The staff always attentive to our needs and always with a big smile. Fantastic roof top with great view over the city of Athens (you think you can touch the Acropolis!). Dinner we had around the swimming pool was simply magical and service impeccable...Really an excellent value for money.
title: Excellent value for money

review: We have stayed in many radisson blu properties till date. However this scored the least so far on rooms, location, amenities relative to others. Not sure if it's just how it is in Athens now, but I don't think so. Athens is quite vibrant and the national archeological museum is just brilliant (5 min walk from the hotel).What I must say is, there are better alternatives. The most positive part of the staff for us were the reception staff and the taxi outside the hotel - both ensured our holiday remained memorable.
title: Good hospitality, decent rooms, good view of acropolis

review: Good location within walking distance to acropolis. Rooms are spacious, tea / coffee available as well as good bathroom amenities and bathrobes/slippers. Quality of pillows and mattresses is not the best but breakfast was very good with plenty of choice and attentive personnel. Worse to go to the roof top where swimming pool with stunning view over Athens is. You can get free water from the bar there. Overall decent quality hotel.
title: Good place for short city break

review: I had a wonderful, pleasant stay at Radisson Blu, early in June. Arriving to the hotel by taxi, arranged from the hotel since they don't have any shuttle service, I met a nice lobby area with discreet lighting, leading to the front desk. At the front desk the very polite and professional staff proceeded to the check in and I was in a clean spacious room in no time. High speed internet connection let me work without any problems. I also had the chance to experience the fast and polite service of the roof top restaurant staff, not to mention the jaw dropping Acropolis view at night. An overall great, Radisson standard stay, and a highly recommended hotel!!
title: What a stay!

review: Considering I paid additional for a business class room upgrade, I'm disappointed by the overall quality of the room. The room is desperately in need of renovation.The wallpaper is coming off and shows signs of water damage, the bathtub is chipped/cracked, the tile floor in the bathroom is stained, the furniture/upholstery is ripped/scratched, the bed headboard is dinged up, the safe box is not bolted to anything and the room door doesn't have a inside safety lock. The room is generally in poor condition.The desk agent said this is their best room, which is pretty sad. I would not recommend staying at this property.
title: Poor stay

review: An excellent hotel from all aspects.The roof top pool and bar are fantastic and the panoramic view of the city cannot be beat. We had a good time with very helpful reception. Definitely will stay there next time.
title: Beautiful hotel

review: Great stay at the Radisson, as usual. The hotel is located in a fantastic location, about 30/40 minutes walk from the Acropolis, as a reference point. This means that taxis will be very cheap (tip: use Uber, a lot).As soon as we arrived at the hotel (late, at night, exhausted), we were greeted with a room upgrade, which had a beautiful view of the Acropolis, right in front. The hotel is very clean, neat and well-organised. Breakfast was delicious and the staff was generally pleasant.I would absolutely recommend this hotel. Great value for money.
title: Simply Radisson

review: The location isn't as close to the city center as some would like, but we are walkers and didn't mind. We were given an accessible room for some reason so the bathroom ended up soaking wet after each shower. Beds were comfortable, breakfast was fantastic, WiFi was excellent. The fitness room looked well-equipped although we didn't have time to use it. The rooftop restaurant has wonderful views of the city and was a relaxing spot to enjoy a drink.
title: Great!

review: Everything was fantastic. A staff always with a big smile and everyone was there to help you. Congratulations to the Manager!The restaurant was stunning, good quality of food was served in combination with the amazing view of Acropolis. Highly recommended!!
title: What a beautiful stay! Unforgettable!

review: Nice hotel close to the city center ,about 5-10 min by taxi(5 euro only) to syntagma square.Very polite ,helpfull,profesionall and smilling staff.Lobby very cozy ,nice decorated also breakfast room very nice decorated,breakfast is fantastic with a big variety of hot and cold choices, and with a superfood corner.The room facing the green park(pedio tou areos) need renovation immediately was the only drawback.Roof top pool very nice i loved it especially the kids with amazing views of acropolis and lycabettus.We really enjoyed our stay at Radisson blu park.
title: Nice hotel close to city center

review: Stay two nights in this central Athens Hotel. The staff are friendly and very helpful. The hotel is kept clean. Our stay included the breakfast buffet. Great food with good selection. I am told if not included this is 22€ a head. Not it is worth that amount.
title: Nice hotel poor location

review: The motel is unique in many ways. Service was top notch. Little pricey including the roof top bar. Pool was refreshing on a hot day! Rooms could use a little work, but beds were comfortable with extra pillows! I would look around before staying here again, but we were happy with our stay! The breakfast was excellent and many fresh choices!
title: Good location, Great service by staff. Breakfast included

review: Very nice hotel at the city center with a unique environment at the lobby and great rooms with park view. There is a pool restaurant with great food and Acropolis view and very friendly staff. I would definitely return there.
title: Very nice city hotel

review: Arrived after midnight with my family, and they welcomed us with a big smile.The hotel's rooms are clean and tidy with a lot of amenities..Amazing breakfast with a huge variety and tasteful dinner on the 8th floor with great acropolis view. The personnel were very helpful, professional and well-trained (congrats to the Managers).We are coming back next year!!!
title: An excellent choice-value for money stay!

review: Want to spend some time seeing the sites in Athens? Check this place out. We like to stay at the higher end hotels. This really fits the bill. We've stayed here before, checked out a few other spots this time and decided this was the best hotel for us. It's a 10 min walk to the metro which takes you to the key sites in 15 min. The gym is a serious gym for those that exercise. Get breakfast included, it's wonderful,good selection. The room and washroom are getting a little tired but generally very good.I highly recommend this hotel.
title: Friendly staff, great location, good value

review: Good location, great breakfast, nice pool, very competent staff, decor a bit dated and tired, but the rooms were very clean, good bathroom, quiet and peaceful sleeping, nice pool and restaurant. The only criticism was the very ordinary food from room service.
title: Very good experience.

review: We stayed at this hotel 2 nights , the room was very clean and has a beautiful design! The staff was helpful and friendly,they always ask if u need anything! The view from the rooftop was amazing.We would definitely stay here again!
title: Weekend in Athens

review: We stayed here for a night, our room was massive with great views out the huge windows. bed was so comfy and shower was brilliant. We stayed in a suite.not such a great location though we went out for a wonder round and found ourselves surrounded by armed riot police and masked men protesting about an anti government protest. we was so scared !Unfortunatly it rained when we was there so didnt get to go in the pool but we went to look at it and the view from up there was breathtaking! Breakfast was included it was very nice lots of quality food and a great variety loved the freshly squeezed orange juice!
title: Perfect one night stay in Athens

review: We had a great short stay in Athens!We really enjoyed our stay at Radisson Blu Park hotel Athens!Great location very close to city center, walking distance from the Archeological museum and Victoria metro stationWe had a room with balcony with amazing view to Acropolis!Fantastic roof top with panorama view to Athens ! We had very nice snacks and cocktails at the deck bar.In the morning we enjoyed the swimming pool.The staff is very friedly and helpful!I strongly suggest for a short sray in Athens!
title: Wonderful stay!

review: I have visited Radisson Blu Park several times and I have always had an excellent experience. Clean hotel in the centre of the city, close to public means of transport, polite professionals, very nice decoration. Also, well organized events. I'd recommend it.
title: Nice & polite

review: We really loved the view! Excellent breakfast, the personnel was super helpful and polite. The hotel has an excellent location and you can walk the distance to reach public transportation! We had an overall fantastic stay!
title: excellent location!

review: Excellent hotel was very clean all staff very polite and smiling , direct service we will visit again!!!The food and the pool bar is incredibly sure worth visiting even without having to stay..Is located in the center of Athens with easy access to subway & train station so you can easily move.
title: Brillantes estrellas en Atenas

review: - great location- safe neighbourhood - close to museum , acropolis, shops and restaurants- clean and spacious in bedroom - friendly staff - bathroom little small and awkward to shower without wetting everything
title: Thank you AS

review: This hotel was ideally located for venturing out and around Athens. We could get to the Acropolis easily and over to the Plaka district for snooping and dining. The hotel itself was just OK as far as accommodations go. One thing that really bothered me was that our rooms reeked of cigarettes. Clearly they do not have rooms that are designated smoke free. The AC was also struggling to keep things cool (in fairness we were there during a heat wave.) They did provide a really nice plate of fresh fruit (pears, apples, oranges, peaches) and the staff was quite nice. The breakfast was also very good in the mornings. Overall, the rooms were a bit stale and needing an update, which is why I can't rate this with 5 stars. Everything else was great, and they made us wonderful dinner reservations, so if they would give the hotel a refresh, put in stronger AC units and make some rooms designated non-smoking, I would think they'd be a wonderful choice.
title: Great Location, Just OK Hotel

review: My daughter and I spent 5 days in Athens. The hotel is wonderfully situated in the Makrigianni district behind the Acropolis. The room was spacious with a balcony and air conditioning, which was a must due to the heatwave of up to 111 degrees. It stayed at 100 the whole visit. The breakfast was delicious with many choices and lots of fresh fruit. The staff was incredibly helpful checking on church times and suggesting a nearby taverno for dinner. The most remarkable experience of all was the staff member who contacted our taxi driver after we had left for the airport. I had lost my camera and I felt it had dropped in the taxi. The driver returned the camera to my hotel and they mailed it overnight to my next location on the island of Corfu. Incredible in a city of 4 1/2 million people. Kudos to the taxi driver and the hotel staff.
title: Great location and incredible staff

review: The hotel offers really good value for money. Clean and modern with an amazing rooftop bar/restaurant/pool with Acropolis view. Our dinner was amazing.Personally, I felt the breakfast room felt like a cafeteria at a hospital. The breakfast was ok but not great. The location is ok, its in a bit of a dodgy area but walking distance to major sights.
title: Amazing Rooftop😊

review: I stayed here 2 years ago and was impressed then by the style and atmosphere of this hotel. Located in the market district means you are away from the tourist hoardes but still close to restaurants and everything. Nice stylish rooms and the pool deck is wonderful for a hot afternoon or sunset drinks.
title: Great location and pool deck

review: This hotel is supposed to be a 4 star hotel, but I wouldn't give it more than 2-2.5 stars. It's owned by SPG, but it's worse than any SPG hotel I have ever stayed at. The location is close to the Acropolis and its centrally located, but the area is filled with homeless, drunk people and you wouldn't feel safe walking at night. Couple of the staff were nice and friendly, but some were not. The rooms were really small and there was no space for suitcases. We made a mistake of booking this hotel before going to the islands and after coming back. I wouldn't go back to Athens again, but if I were to go back, I wouldn't stay at this hotel again.
title: Bad area

review: We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. The room was clean and comfortable, the breakfast had a good variety, the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. They recommended us the best places to visit in Athens, some amazing restaurants, they ensured we are all comfortable and nothing is missing. Very nice.
title: Very nice

review: My husband and I loved this hotel. It's modern and attractive with a bar and swimming pool on the roof. Our room was a good size and the service was excellent. We had to leave early in the morning to catch a ferry, and at checkout, without our having requested it, we were handed a breakfast to go (nothing fancy - just a sandwich and an apple - but a thoughtful touch). As for the neighborhood, it certainly isn't a fancy one, but we always felt safe at night and during the day there are some really great discount stores! (I bought a pair of Italian leather sandals for E 10). It's just a fifteen or twenty minute walk in one direction to the Plaka and the Acropolis and the same in the other direction to the National Archeology Museum. I highly recommend it!.
title: Great modern hotel in convenient neighborhood of Athens

review: Location is good, about a 10/15 min walk to Plaka...which would've been fine had it not been 44 degrees :) The checkin was easy and helpful. My room was big, clean and simple but nice. Due to the weather we were almost bound to the hotel....which proved to be fine! We sat by the pool (with views to the acropolis) and the meals at the rooftop bar were devine. My fav was the meatballs. Has a gym which was a good size. My only let down was the kids on my floor making a racket every morning, afternoon and night.Great hotel at a good price.
title: Loved it!

review: Amazing experience ! Excellent service, very clean, modern decoration, so romantic ! The breakfast had many options, the terrace offered the most amazing view. I would definitely recommend it ! The only problem is that its a little far from the city centre but you can take the metro or a taxi and you get there in 10 mins.
title: Perfect !

review: This was a well located hotel with stylish decor and friendly staff. Good breakfast. Would recommend this hotel. Rooftop pool was small and water very cold but nice view of the Acropolis. Would strongly recommend a visit to the stunning Acropolis museum
title: Good location

review: Loved everything about this hotel. Modern, clean room. Nice breakfast buffet. Friendly staff. The main attraction for me though was the rooftop area where I spent most of my time in Athens. It has a view of the Acropolis, a small pool with some sunloungers, bar and restaurant. Perfect for just spending the day in the sun, or to refresh before or after sightseeing in town. Everything we had to eat or drink there was nice, and not too pricey. As for the area around the hotel - yes, it looks a little dodgy. However, the only area I think one should really avoid at night is the Omonia square a few blocks to the north. Other than a few offers to buy certain substances I didn't experience anything out of the ordinary in the immediate area around the hotel.
title: Surely the best hotel I´ve stayed at

review: Stayed due to conference business. Very nice staff, nice bar and perfect reception! The place is cozy, clean and in a good location for sightseeing. Would go back although there are as well many nice places around.
title: Nice place

review: I stayed at Fresh hotel for five nights in july.Rooms: fresh and clean. Everything looked new, including the bathrooms. Rooms were made every day. Breakfast: perfect! Good quality food. I could hardly have asked for more (but why do they boil the bacon?). Nice staff.Reception: nice and helpful staff.Roof top restaurant/pool: I loved it. It was almost 40 degrees during our stay in Athens, so we spent daytime by the pool on the roof top. Usually no problem finding a sunbed if you go up before 11. Bar/restaurant a bit expensive, but if you want to save money, you could easily find cheap gyros 100 m from the hotel for less than 4 euros.The immediate area around the hotel looks a bit run down, but hotel and location is great with just 7 minute walk to Monastiraki metro station. My friends were also very happy we chose this hotel.I will stay at this hotel next time i visit Athens.
title: Perfect!

review: My family and I stayed at this hotel for a few days while visiting the archeological sites. This hotel is close to proximity to many sites and has a great view of the acropolis from the roof top. The area of the city is so so, but we felt perfectly safe. I would not get the rooms with the balcony, our view was of worn out buildings, and there were no seats to even sit out there. Save your money and get the basic room. The hotel serves a wonderful breakfast and they are very accommodating to your needs. Beware though at checkout, the clerk told us we'd save money if we used our card to convert to US dollar, instead there was a 3.9% fee. Over all it is a very nice hotel, and the price is very reasonable!
title: Great views!

review: We stayed here 5 nights and definitely enjoyed our stay. Small cozy hotel with very friendly and helpful staff, our room was modern, comfortable and efficient. Breakfast buffet was awesome. We walked to all the historic sites, shopping, and plenty of great dining within 10 minutes walk. Will stay there again!
title: Modern, friendly and convenient location

review: Walking distance to the Agora, Hadrian's library, Ermou street, Monastikari and the (well-organized, clean) subway bringing you in less than 10 minutes to the entrance of the Acropolis. Some of the streets immediately around the hotel are less attractive, but as it goes with all large cities, Athens' appearance can change in a 100 metres walk. Very friendly reception. Well airco-ed throughout the building. Rather expensive and (when we visited) busy rooftop bar, with a small but refreshing pool and a nice view of the acropolis. Breakfast was top. Very good beds. All very clean. Recommended.
title: Well-located friendly design hotel

review: The fresh hotel was a good hotel to stay very clean and friendly the only thing we found very expensive was the restaurant on the roof top these prices were way more expensive than your local restaurants in the area and at the Plaka,Bit of a shame really with such a good spot on the rooftop.The area is a bit run down but safe and easy walking distance to the square for markets.20 min walk to Plaka easy walking.
title: Stay at The Fresh Hotel Athens

review: Rooms are modern, clean and have balconies. Excellent value for Athens. Staff is very helpful and friendly. They have a outstanding roof top pool, restaurant and bar area that you can escape the afternoon heat of Athens while sipping on a nice glass of wine, ice cold draft of Mythos or cocktail of choice. Breakfast (included on our room rate) was top notch and a full buffet. Fresh Hotel is located about 1 block off of Athena Ave. (main drag to the Plaka district) making many sites accessible by foot. The Central Market is about 1 1/2 blocks away, Plaka is about a 8 block walk - lots of restaurants and shops in the area and more as you approach the Plaka. For the rate, quality and freshness of this hotel makes it a great place to stay while taking in the sites and flavors of Athens.
title: Location, quality and price make this a great stay in Athens

review: Room was clean. Breakfast was good, but average.Staff were ok. Design would need an update. I think if they want to be design hotel they need to to changes to the rooms. Really liked the rooftop with the view to the city and Acropolis.
title: Rooftop was great!

review: We enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The rooms were well air conditioned (it was over 40 degrees outside...) and the hotel staff was friendly. The room itself was clean and adequate, though not large. The hotel is a walking distance to most sites and attraction (10 to 30 minute walk everywhere), although, during the VERY hot summer months it can be a tough walk. The Hop-On-Hop-Off bus is very close by, though. The only disappointment I had was that the neighborhood surrounding the hotel was quite ugly where many walls and stores were covered with ugly graffiti.
title: Nice Hotel - Mediocre Neighborhood

review: Design Excellence! Perfect stop over on the way to the Greek Islands. Traveling with friends, requested a room change which was granted immediately due to the room being twin singles instead of King bed. Front Desk really helpfull, stunning roof top pool & lounge, lovely room comfortable bed. Excellent breakfast. If you are into design hotels with great customer service & quiet rooms look no further! Excellent value will definitely return.
title: Highly Recommend

review: This hotel is great. He is perfectly located, the bed is "extra" comfortable, the room is quiet. The bathroom is renovated, everything is very clean. The check-in was very fast. The staff is very concerned about our satisfaction.Renald, Montreal, Canada
title: Excellent hotel

review: Very nice hotel. Large rooms. Great terrace at the top. Friendly staff. I would recommend. large variety for breakfast. ideal to take a drink at the roof bar with view of Akropolis. ideally located for sightseeing. everything can be done by walking.
title: Perfect hotel for sightseeing

review: This hotel is a great base from where all the main tourist attractions are within walking distance, and located down a quite side street next to the city's main food market ( a must visit!!). The rooms are comfortable BUT those facing the front of the hotel are nicer, brighter and seemed to be larger than those facing the inner courtyard which were quite dark and smaller. We had an inner room, but to be honest one does not plan to spend much time in a hotel room when visiting Athens. The public areas are lovely and the roof terrace has wonderful views over the city and is very chilled and relaxed The staff were always friendly and helpful. The breakfast was exactly what to expect of a hotel of this standard ...fresh juice, good coffee and a good food selection. I would stay at this hotel again.
title: Comfortable base

review: This is a very modern hotel, with a lot of accommodation and services. Best features: location : walking distance from many major attractions (Acropole for instance) and shopping. Service: people over there just want to make your stay memorable. They are proactively looking to help you in any manner. Finally: the roof-top restaurant offers a breathtaking view of the Acropole. Gorgious when illuminated during evening time... with a glass of local, fresh, white wine, nothing can beats that.
title: Enjoy your stay

review: I highly recommend the Fresh Hotel. The location is excellent. The breakfast is outstanding. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff are very helpful. Be sure to check out the rooftop restaurant and bar. Excellent food and the view! We stayed for three nights.
title: We would stay here again!

review: Since my arrival at the hotel until my departure I had problems in this terrible place. The receptionist who did my chek in was extremely cold, rude and unfriendly. He said that there was duplicity of reservation and that it was for me to choose which one I would use. Surprised I said that I had not made two reservations and that I would only use the one I had made from boooking.com. I asked him to cancel the other reservation which was in duplicity. Without thinking he said it would not be possible. I found it absurd because I had made no other reservation! I asked to speak to the manager and he did not want to talk to me. The manager asked the receptionist to tell me that he could not do anything and that I would be charged for two rooms even using only one. What????I found this attitude of a hotel manager extremely reckless. He definitely has no profile to be a manager. What arrogance and lack of common sense!Due to my fatigue of the trip, I decided to go to my room and then I would solve this. When I got to my room it was another disappointment. The room was super small, hard bed, unventilated bathroom, broken light fixture, And the worst, I had paid for a room overlooking Acropolis and the only thing I saw was the work of the neighboring front building. I ended up i decided to staying just one night and it was the worst night of my entire trip. The next day I asked again to speak to the manager and he came back at the front desk extremely angry, unfriendly saying that he would not change his decision not to cancel the other supposed reservation. I decided not to argue any more and I decided to leave so as not to ruin my trip.I left with a single certainty about this place, this hotel does not have a serious, competent management and the owners should be aware of all this in order not to lose more customers. I will never go back to that hotel and recommend everyone NOT TO STAY IN THIS HOTEL.
title: Do not be fooled, stay at another hotel! Very disappointing! Não fique neste hotel !!!!

review: We stayed four nights at Fresh Hotel, and loved the location, which was close enough to everything, but out of the heart of the tourist zone, which we loved. We felt totally safe on the streets, even late at night, because everything happens after 9pm in Athens. The breakfast was excellent, with a huge selection, including fresh squeezed orange juice. We enjoyed the rooftop deck, and ate at the restaurant for sunset one night, and had cocktails and snacks several times in the lounge area, where the food and drinks were fine, but not memorable. Service was slow. Our room was very simple - leaning towards basic, rather than Starck minimalist. Thank you to the reception staff who contacted me several days after we had left, to let me know that we may have left something in the room. I was able to claim it and pick it up before we left Greece, and hadn't even realized that I had lost it. We would definitely stay here again.
title: Great location for exploring Athens.

review: Wife and I stayed here on the back end of our Athens trip and we loved it. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the room was nice and clean. Killer views from the roof pool and bar, and the bar is a nice place to sip a few! The bartender made a new drink for me called a Sweet Summer and it was boozey watermelon delicious. Kid and family friendly place, so just keep that in mind. Also had some bar snacks and they were tasty. Would definitely stay again!
title: Great spot in Athens.

review: After much thought, my daughter and I decided to meet in Athens Greece for our first European vacation . My daughter lives in South Korea and I live in New Jersey. We thought it would be the perfect vacation. We planned it for months, and decided after much investigation to stay in the Melia in Athens, Greece. Our flight, transfers and all of our plans went perfectly. Except for our choice of hotel. There were many issues with this Hotel . The internet did not work well , the room was not very clean, the shower was moldy, the blow dryer didn't work and when it was replaced we couldn't use it in the bathroom, we had to use it over the vanity and it did not have a cord long enough to reach over the vanity to use it. But that was nothing in comparison to the security issue that we experienced. An electrician from the hotel entered our room without any notice to fix the internet (that what the management at the hotel said). This worker proceeded to leave our room with the door propped open, he said he had to check something n the basement, this left our belongings exposed to anyone and everyone who passed by, for more than five minutes. I happened to return to the room to find that situation. When I went to the management at the hotel, they tried to tell me that the room wasn't unattended when clearly it was. The man who left it open came down and apologized for leaving the room open and unattended for that period of time.I was left feeling violated and untrusting of this Hotel. The managements response was to offer us a free drink or a dinner for the troubles! REALLY! I spoke to three different mangers and not one of them felt that this was a real problem , shame on them.I would never stay in this hotel again and I suggest that others think twice before they do.There are many clean and beautiful hotels in Athens that will appreciate your business.
title: TOTALLY DISAPPOINTED!

review: the hotel is well linked with metro. The service level is comply with the stars while the menu of the sky loung restaurant could be improved. The panorama on the acropoli is amazing,even if the area is not so attractive i will come back for sure.
title: Nice accomodation

review: The pros; it is inexpensive and connected to the Metro. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the bathrooms are nice. The service was great at the pool and upon check in and check out the desk clerks were helpful. We had a 10 hour flight and the room was ready when we arrived so we could rest for a little while. The cons; the neighborhood is not great. The wi-fi is horrible so plan for that. The air conditioning was not great and it was very hot. The pool is fantastic but there are not enough lounge chairs and they close at 6:30 PM which was disappointing. This hotel is good enough for a day or two at the most.
title: Great location in Athens

review: We stayed here for five nights. The room we were put in was 103. It was very noisy and the air conditioning was not cooling. I brought it to their attention and they said they checked but nothing was done. Finally on the last night we were offered a fan. I spoke with the manager on duty today and she said she will check it tomorrow a little to late for us.Please read before you book
title: Will not stay here again

review: We got to the hotel after 12 hours of travelling, when we tried to check in they wanted me to produce the credit card I booked the hotel with which I no longer had as it expired a couple of months before. They then wanted an online statement etc to show it was linked to my account which I couldn't do as my banks website was down for service in the end I had to pay again and the funds would be credited to me, this took an extra hour so have your card with you!!!! Rooms are nice and spacious however ours was two single beds pushed together and separately dressed! Food on the rooftop was quite good and the views are cool.
title: Honeymoon Stopover

review: The only downside to this WONDERFUL Hotel was location. The surrounding buildings were full of spray paint graffiti. But once you step inside that was easily forgotten, and at no time did we feel unsafe despite the appearance of the area. No vagrants. Parking is also at a minimum but a nearby parking garage is available with a discount. Public transportation was near by.The view of the Parthenon from the roof/pool was beautiful.
title: Great Hotel

review: Bad location, the pool close at 19:00, the area is dead about that time, the check in tooks us too long, our boys were adked to sign the check in document, the receipients were unfriendly the rooms are good
title: Bad location the pool close at 19:00, good rooms

review: The highlight of the Melia is the rooftop swimming pool / restaurant. We ate dinner there overlooking the Acropolis, and went swimming the next morning as well.The room was very well appointed and comfortable. The air conditioning unit made some very loud noises in the middle of the night, but we were given a fan to keep cool.
title: Great hotel with amazing view

review: A few times earlier we have stayed at the Melia Hotel in Barcelona and wanted to try Melia in Athens. I think Athens gives better value than Melia in Barca. I must praise the welcome from Alexandros - what a wonderful man. He made us feel special - wonderfully welcome. The rest of the reception staff are great. Thanks. At the same time, the service is lousy from the cool guys in the Sky bar. Unfortunately, the rating needs to be a little bit down. Sorry Alexandros - you were amazing. The hotel is a bit tired, but the rooms work well with all the amenities. I have a feeling you get decent value for money with breakfast included. BUT 1: the internet is so bad that it surprise me in 2017. BUT 2: The food in Sky Bar you have to steer away, (sad quality) but the drinks are incredibly good even though they cost 10-15 euros. Same price as in Norway - so for us this is natural. But the view of the Acropolis from the Sky Bar is worth the entire stay. If you get a good price I would recommend this hotel - although bad internet, lousy food in the Sky Bar, poor service from the bar, because the vibe is quite ok and the location is perfect. I wonder of how little it is for this hotel to be really good. Thanks anyway.
title: The good, bad and the ugly

review: Stayed here with our family of 4 for 3 nights. We needed 2 rooms and the Melia was able to provide connecting rooms for us, which was a comfort as we didn't want our children on their own. The staff was very friendly. Service at the café was slow, but the food was good. The pool area is small but lovely, and very welcome after a hot day of touring. Pool is only open from 1030am-630pm so you have to time it properly. Rooms were a good size for Europe and very clean. Not quite North American 5* standards, but definitely a solid 4*. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again. Recommendation if you are touring Athens, such as the Acropolis. There is a red hop-on-hop-off tour bus stop by the Melia. If you buy tickets for the day you can take the bus directly to the tourist attractions and save yourself the cab fare. If you want to go back out in the evening you could take the bus again and get off near the Plaka for dinner. Room "03" connects to "02" or "04" and you must book supreme room category or higher to be given an adjoining / connecting room. Ask at check-in that the porter unlock the adjoining doors to save time later.
title: Perfect place as our base in Athens

review: Stayed for one day/ night and enjoyed hotel. Lovely staff and room, great rooftop pool and bar with view across Athens towards Acropolis. Close to metro stop although we strolled to centre in late afternoon. Immediate area looks gritty but typical of busy working area of metropolis, we felt safe walking nearby. Not unlike Union Square / Delaney in NYC. Took taxi to hotel after evening out - inexpensive about 7 euro from Outdoor Cinema nearAcropolis.
title: Perfect Stopover

review: Good hotel close to Acropolis (2 miles) with gym, Roof top pool that closes at 6:30 pm, which is a shame as in the Summer months you would like the pool to be open until 9 pm. Felt like we just came in to the pool and were kindly hurried out to be set up for roof top dining.Decent spread in Breakfast, charges you up for sightseeing. Rooms come with Jacuzzi which is a bonus after a long hard hot day. A slight niggle was that the pillows were too big and can cause neck pain. I found two smaller pillows in the wardrobe. There were no Kettle provided for Tea/Coffee Hope they look into sorting out these two issues. Towels were changed everyday and good quality of toiletries. Overall good experience and stay.
title: Good hotel

review: Beautiful hotel, very pleasant staff which were very helpful when asked for anything. They have a cafe adjoining the hotel which is very convenient but also quite expensive. Roof top bar (where swimming pool located) is set overlooking picturesque Athens. A must for at least one of your evening. Not the cheapest place to stay or the nearest to Athens city centre but you wont be disappointed if you do stay there.
title: Hotel Melia

review: First time to Athens and chose Melia Athens (Omonia) as my base and shuttle to Santorini, Mykonos, Zakynthos and Kalambaka.Great choice as even though the area is old part of Athens (Omonia was first public square in Athens) but accessible was key with Metro only 3 blocks down. From there everywhere was just so convenient with all the sights and things to do.Service was super friendly and professional in check in, to luggage, directions and arranging transport.
title: Great start to Athens

review: We stayed here for 3 nights prior to flying onto Crete for a further week. Our room was nicely proportioned for a city hotel and the bathroom was really good, walk in shower, spa bath for 2 and plenty of room.We had breakfast only once as a discount was offered when we checked in and it was fine, although the service was not great and I had to go and look for someone to request tea.The crowning glory is their roof top bar and restaurant, although we did not eat here we did have a couple of drinks whilst admiring the view of the lit up Acropolis.We had read reviews prior to arriving that the hotel was not very central, however we did not find this to be true, it is a couple of minutes walk from 2 hop on hop off bus stops, 5 minutes from the Archaeological museum and about 10 minutes from the Monastiraki square and flea market, Hercules Library and the Ancient Agora.
title: Great views from the roof top bar and restaurant

review: We stayed at other Melias and were quite happy, so we booked this hotel. This turned out to be a mistake. To start off with, we found the people at the reception to be quite rude and unhelpful (this became a rather common theme in Athens, a bit surprising for a country that depends on tourism). This is not a casual observation as one of our children got quite sick and yet the staff was not particularly helpful. This was also the case with trying to arrange tours. That said, I should point out the concierge (?) called Yannis, who was the only person on the staff. The location is in a seedy neighborhood, though convenient to get to both the Acropolis as well as the National Archaeological Museum. The rooms themselves were fine too. Still, if you have other alternatives, take them.
title: If you have other alternatives, take them

review: Food services need more choices. Location, location, location, This is a horrible location and scary!! The staff was friendly and helpful. I wish i would of received more for what I paid. I've stayed in the Melia in P.R. and that was breathtaking and outstanding in every way. So disappointed with Melia Athens. I feel i was shafted.
title: I expected better

review: We stayed at Melia Athens for 1 night before flying out the next morning. Right from check in we were made to feel comfortable and welcomed. The hotel was immaculate and very luxurious. We were upgraded to a room with a jacuzzi, the beds were extremely comfortable, the curtains were completely block-out (its the small things), the shower head had great water pressure and the shower base didn't leak even in the slightest, the rooftop pool and bar were very cool and to top it all off breakfast was AMAZING!
title: What a place!

review: Our first trip to Athens was very exciting and we had been looking forward to this for a long time. We hose this hotel because we thought we needed a hotel near the Parthenon, but if you have the Hop off Hop On Bus, it is not necessary to stay in this very busy downtown area. Beach area very beautiful and would hose next time
title: Our first experience in Athens

review: Great hotel in the heart of Athens, we could see the parliament building from our balcony, hotel was very clean, there is a bar on the ground floor that serves food and drink, breakfast is served on the first floor, there is no formal restaurant, all the staff were lovely, we were allowed to use facilities at the sister hotel round the corner
title: City Break

review: Very nice 4 star hotel along shopping street Ermoj. My single room was small but had a good bed. I was so glad when I discovered that I am allowed to use swimming pools of sister hotels, great advantage in terrible hot weather 45 degrees. Also breakfast was really good, lots of variety.
title: Nice hotel at the very center of Athens

review: It was our third time in Athens and we needed two nights hotel (our flight arrived late night and we had a ferry in the next day). Becasue we wanted to spend the only day in Athens in shopping, we searched for hotel near Ermou's street. This hotel is right at the beginning of the street (near syntagma square), so for our purpose, the location was great. The hotel is good, Nothing bad to right about it, although we order a room with a baby cot and when we arrived, the room was without baby cot. Maybe a mistake that not connected to the hotel. We ordered from hotels.com. The staff arrange the missing bad very quickly. I think it's good value for money hotel.We stayed in diffrent vactions at two other hotels: New hotel and Electra Palace hotel and if your budget can allow you, consider them insteded.
title: Good location in Ermou, Athen's main shopping street.

review: The hotel is aged and lacking funds, as is Athens and Greece. However the staff and location make it a wonderful base to see and shop. Walk towards the Acropolis and you'll find an intoxicating mix of rooftop food, wine and views to build upon the days adventures!
title: Location

review: I have stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. I booked a room for single person.- the room was unexpected! you cannot imagine how small it is!! with no view!- the breakfast was under the average ... limited selection- swimming pool + gym ... located in different hotel! so if you wish to use them you've to walk- poor wifithe best thing,hotel at the centre exactly is the shopping district so, everything is walkable no need to take transportationalso metro close to the hotel ... about 7 mins to reach
title: at the center!

review: I stayed at the hotel earlier this month as it was in a great location for visiting Athens - it is very close to the train station at Syntagma Square. I realised on train back to the airport that I had left my ring somewhere in the room. I rang the Hotel and the Receptionist (Christina) said she would have House Keeping Check, she called me back within 15 minutes to say they had found it under the bed - they obviously had to have a good look since I wasn't sure where in the room it could have been. The Hotel arranged to have the ring shipped to me providing me with a couple of options on how I wanted it sent - I chose tracked postal option, the ring arrived safely in Dublin yesterday:) Thank you Electra Hotel.
title: Great Service - Lost Ring!

review: The Electra hotel was a well priced and comfortable stay in Athens. The food was very good as well, breakfast was included with the room, close to many of the sights in Athens. The service was really great with the staff taking care of every request we had. To top it off the use of any of the services offered at the other Electra hotels was available to us.
title: Well priced in the city

review: We stayed one night here, mainly for proximity to Syntagma Square and the metro to the airport. The location is indeed excellent. We were pleasantly surprised by the room quality - everything is very good, but was let down a little by noise from buskers and even passers by on the busy and even (more disconcertingly) from neighbouring rooms. If they could deal with that, this place would get a 5, particularly for value for money.
title: Good hotel, but a little noise problem

hotelLocation: 72 Poseidonos Avenue, Paleo Faliro, Athens 175 62, Greece
review: I'm a picky Sydney sider on a budget, and was very impressed by the service, view and location of this hotel. Beautiful and friendly staff, beautiful view from our room, and rooftop pool. Delicious and wide variety buffet breakfast.
title: Highly recommend

hotelLocation: 72 Poseidonos Avenue, Paleo Faliro, Athens 175 62, Greece
review: We visited for 2 days. Perfect location across from beach. Roof top pool and restaurant. Stunning view. Friendly staff and delicious breakfast. Air conditioned rooms made it so comfortable. Must stay.
title: Great hotel

hotelName: Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
review: We arrived in the evening and welcomed a placed to unwind. Our room was on a quiet side of the hotel and the room was well balanced and spacious. The front desk was accommodating (not friendly but polite) as we had problems with the phone working, we needed towels plus the bathroom floors needed to be cleaned. The main and only reason I am giving this hotel a three rating is because of the bathroom. The bathroom never felt or smelled clean. There was a great amount of the mold in the bath/shower plus the floors always seemed dirty even after housekeeping cleaned it. The hotel is not in the City Centre but close to the metro and walking distance to shopping and good restaurants. City Centre is two stops away by metro.
title: Just Good

hotelName: Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
review: Arrived to a friendly and efficient welcome. Room had two double beds nicely made up. The room wasn't really clean, found a hat under the bed. Room needs a good going over with a vacuum cleaner. Bathroom had mould around the bathroom and it did not smell clean, it had a damp smell. Ok place as a base to explore Athens.
title: Family stay in July, friendly staff

hotelName: Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
review: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights two weeks ago. The hotel is very nice, the public areas are well maintained and the staff is very helpful. Breakfast was very good. The room was nice and clean but the bathroom was not very clean and needs some improvements. I have to say that we didn't complain,I guess that if we did talk to someonethey would have done something about it.The hotel is not really in the city center if you are a tourist. To get to the main attractions you need a taxi or a train.
title: Good and comfortable hotel, not really city center

hotelName: Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
review: First thing that struck me was the large red and black lobby and how quiet it was. Staff were friendly, the rooms were good. Quiet and spacious. My view was over an apartment block but not so close that it seemed overlooked. Aircon worked well. Breakfast starts nice and early which is sadly necessary to often and had s great view to ho with it. 5 min walk to loads of restaurants and bars. Necessary as the bar closed at 10:30
title: Not too bad.

hotelName: Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
review: Can highly recommend this hotel for the business person or tourist. Well appointed with stunning rooftop pool and bar location. Staff super friendly and helpful & excellent service.. Taxis always available outside. Would definitely stay here again.
title: Excellent hotel & very well situated

hotelName: Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
review: I stayed at Crowne Plaza for 2 nights early July (business travelling) and I have to say the overall experience wasn’t up to the expectations. The hotel is in a good location, common areas are well maintained, the rooms are well sized, modern and soundproof. Some of the stuff was very attentive, breakfast was great. I would like to point out the things that in my opinion really distinguish a good hotel from a great one. As soon as I arrived for my check in around 12pm on a Sunday afternoon, there was only one employee at the reception and was busy with an airlines crew that was checking in before me. I was standing there, waiting for my turn and for approx. 15’ the receptionist didn’t raise her eyes from the computer screen and the documents in front of her. A simple nod of the head or an eye check would have been enough but she didn’t even notice me. The same day I also noticed that some food trays remained outside the rooms in the hotel aisles for quite a few hours. Maybe the hotel was understaffed that day.The thing that really put me off though and made me write this review is the following. A few hours after I checked out, I realized I had forgotten in the mini bar fridge an envelope with my name on it, which contained some medical treatment I was using at the moment. I called the reception and they connected me with the lost and found department. I informed them about this incident and they told me they’d look into it and I should call them back in a while. When I dialed again, I was told that unfortunately the maid had thrown the envelope away. The lady on the phone was very kind and apologetic and she advised me to call the hotel manager to report it, mentioning his name. I called again at the reception, asking to talk to the manager but because he was unavailable at the moment I was transferred to another manager or something (don’t remember names or roles). I was quite upset at the moment but I calmly described to him the incident, which he was already aware of. The purpose of the call was just to report what had happened, so they can try and improve in that area. However, the person on the other side of the phone in an arrogant way replied “what do you want now, we can’t compensate you for this, people leave things back all the time and we throw away a lot of stuff everyday”. I replied that I’m not seeking any compensation, I just deemed necessary to report this to the hotel management so they can train their stuff or do whatever they think is necessary to improve (I work in the customer service industry and feedback is always welcome to me). Quickly he realized that he shouldn’t have responded like that and he apologized for the incident. However, damage had been made. This is something that you don’t expect from a 5 star hotel. Should he had responded with something like “sorry for that, next time you stay with us you will receive a complimentary drink/dinner/night/anything” they would have won me. With this attitude though, I don’t think I’d stay there again.
title: Not up to the expectations

hotelName: Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
review: We are currently staying at this hotel.. it is a very nice property and we are on the club level.. Internet is pretty stable but slow.. The staff here at the hotel are friendly and helpful with good multi-lingual skills which helps with global travelers. We are staying on the club level which includes snacks and drinks throughout the day in addition to private lounge, computers etc. Definitely the way to go if staying here.. well worth the extra money. They have a good morning breakfast buffet on the 7th floor rooftop restaurant by the pool. The only major drawback to this hotel is its a bit distant from the typical tourist locations that we wanted to visit while in Athens. We made good use of the local transit system though leveraging trains, taxis and buses with the locals.
title: Crowne Plaza Club Level

hotelName: Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
review: Pros :The hotel is situated near a metro so access to all sights is possible. The restaurant has great food and the restaurant staff is wonderful.The wifi signal is strong and the beds are very comfortable. Cons: I was very surprised to see mold in the shower. This removal of bathroom mold should be a priority for a hotel. The carpets should be removed since they are stained (we stayed twice on separate occasions in two different rooms). In addition, we made a last minute decision to go to the beach because of the heat wave in Athens. We requested additional towels from the front desk for that reason and was told that they only have enough for the rooms. The front desk said they would still ask the housekeeping but they never even followed up with us. This response is VERY unprofessional. Firstly, chain hotels have 2-3 times the amount of towels necessary and towels are cleaned thoroughly so all stains can be dissolved. This was the only hotel during our three week stay that answered this way in all the islands and mainland properties we visited. I am a Club Member and am disappointed.
title: Needs upkeep

review: What a great hotel, central for everything and great views from the roof top bar. Very friendly and helpful staff. Its easy if you going to the airport. Come out of Monastiraki square metro station and turn left up Athinas street and the hotel is 5 mins walk on the left. Breakfast was good,then it was easy getting the metro for the airport home.
title: Great stay in central Athens

review: Spent 4 nights in Athens after our Mediterranean cruise at this centrally located hotel two blocks from Monastiraki Square, a metro station, the Plaka district and within walking distance to many sites. Even though the area was depressed with almost every building front covered in graffiti, and many homeless or those seeking money for trinkets, the view of the acropolis from the hotel, the convenient location and the friendly and hospitable staff made the stay worth while. While I was concerned about pick pockets, I never felt unsafe. Our room was basic but clean and had great AC which was needed after a long day in the heat. Sitting out on the balcony at night looking at the lit up acropolis was magical. There are plenty of shops and eateries around the area so we did not utilized the breakfast option. I would recommend this hotel.
title: Great View of the Acropolis from Room Balcony and Roof Top Bar

review: Great location 2 min walk from metro that goes straight to the airport. Close to just about everything and in a perfect spot for cheeky wee bars and eateries. Room facing street was still quiet. Spacious for a city room with nice bathroom. Good quiet aircon - it was 42' outside. Staff were delightful and full of helpful hints.Rooftop bar with acropolis view was awesome. Didnt do breakfast but heard it was good.Highly recommended
title: Brilliant

review: Did a 1 nighter here before heading out to the islands. Arrived really late , aound 3am so basically headed off to sleep. The hotel is super central and you can walk to plaka and the all sights if you need. Clean and had a really good nights sleep. Good price , very polite reception
title: Central , value for money

review: If you are looking for a clean, safe, modern, charming, and well-staffed hotel in Athens, this is it!!! I come for business and vacation and have stayed here over 10 times. The breakfast is excellent, the staff of amazing, and the location is great.I highly recommend it!!!
title: Excellent hotel!!!

review: We booked a room and try to cancel due to medical situation, they asked us to provide medical papers which we had and still they wont cancel the charge. Expedia couldn't get to reply why?!Wrong attitude bad experience I DO NOT recommend to book a room at the New Hotel
title: Horrible service!

review: We booked a room and try to cancel due to Medical situation, they asked us to provide with medical papers which we had, and still they won't cancel the charge. Expedia couldn't get the managers to reply why?!Wrong attitude bad experience I do not recommend to book here.
title: Worst treatment ever bad attitude not recommended

review: Very nice small boutique hotel in Athens, close to everything. Very good service from the staff who made us feel very welcome. Some good Tavernas just around the corner, great location for shopping and sightseeing.
title: Nice little hotel with good service

review: We got to this hotel very late and were exhausted! We were greeted at this hotel by a very friendly reception, water and snacks! The hotel is very clean and had the best shower of the entire trip! It is also located in a great location - close to all tourist sites.
title: Customer service is unparalleled!

review: We stayed at the O&B Athens Boutique Hotel for 2 nights while seeing the main sights of the city. Everything is walkable from the hotel and the furthest sight (Panathalenic stadium) was maybe 1.4 miles. The front desk is fantastic and helped us set up taxis to pick us up from the airport and also drop us off for an early morning flight - they even packed us a breakfast on the morning we left as we were up before the breakfast buffet opened. The A/C was incredible and we slept great. We highly recommend this hotel and stay here again if in Athens.
title: Great hotel walkable to attractions

review: Lovely hotel, clean and nice rooms. The staff was really helpful, went the extra mile to check us in early. Also helped arrange airport pickup and drop off. The street is a little run down and the rooms don't have much of a view but that's generally how downtown Athens looks like these days. It was safe and writhing walking distance to everything interesting that we wanted to see. I recommend this place highly.
title: Loved this place

review: A very cosy nice hotel. Breakfast nice and satisfying. You can sort get to may of the key sites in Athens from this hotel. The staff were helpful especially helping with how to get around around town and excellent recommendation on local restaurants.
title: Excellent location to stay in Athens - easy to get around to key sites

review: Stayed there for 1 night and it was awesome.It is well located, service is friendly and smooth, we parked a car nearly right in front.The views from the suite are wonderful, Kifissia is a busy and lively place to get around.Warmly recommended!
title: Lovely and comfortable place

review: Thrilled to find this gem in an Athens tree lined neighborhood. It was located near great shopping, lounges, and cafes. It cost only 18 Euros to catch a cab to the town center to see the Acropolis . Most importantly, the rooms were very comfortable and clean. Customer service was wonderful and the staff even prepared breakfast for my family for a 3:30 am departure. They went above and beyond!
title: Highly recommend

review: Great location close to the major sights and on the edge of the Plaka district with its vibrant atmosphere.The studio balcony room was very pleasing as regards the interior design, high quality standard of fixtures and fittings, super rainshower and a very comfortable bed. Being in the heart of Athens, you can expect some street noise as we experienced, with garbage trucks at night. However, it was short lived.The rooftop bar is pleasant for a drink or two whilst viewing the skyline, and breakfast has a good variety of choices. As regards constructive feedback, I would ask that reception are trained to be more welcoming and friendly. The nicest and most helpful staff members seemed to be those at the door and the junior staff working at the rooftop restaurant/bar. Otherwise, the overwhelming impression was rather standoffish and arrogant. Not what one expects or should accept as a guest.
title: Location, location, location

review: My son's go to hotel in Athens. The bed is very comfortable, shower, toilet, sink, and closet area is tight. Still, for a quick stay, the hotel is clean, and no pun intended, new! We had a delicious Ceasar salad for lunch on the roof terrace from which you can see the Acropolis. The Plaka is just a few blocks away, as is Syntagma Square, so the location is truly exceptional. The breakfast room off the small lobby was packed for breakfast, so we had coffee and a bite to eat across the street with the busy Greeks hurrying off to work. The decorations in the lobby and in the rooms are trying to hard to be trendy, and in the end, just come off tacky. But all the staff were lovely and helpful. The clientele tends to be on the young side.
title: Contemporary hotel with an unbeatable location!

review: Beautiful and modern rooms within walking distance of The Acropolis, Monasteraki and Plaka. Katerina, the GM (she speaks perfect English) was sweet, knowledgeable and extremely accommodating in everything we needed. If you are accustomed to luxury & convenience, this is a terrific little hotel.
title: Great Hidden Gem in Athens

review: It was just a one very hot day and we were lucky to have a room from this excellent hotel. In this case it was paradise for us.
